review: 87 hours so far in 2 weeks.Firstly I can't reccomend this game enough It stands out in its genre because in all honestly You have as muhc of a chance at winning as a fresh starter as you do having sunk 80 something hours into it.The game works remarkably well. Its not perfect and Crashes are somewhat commen (most are memory related) but its not enough to deter me Nor any of the people I have reccomended it too.The pre game lobby and the All chat are honestly 2 of the most hysterical things I have ever hear.Pregame lobby can either be "normal" or turn into a miniture rave with such artists as "Backstreet Boys" and "that one guy who shredded on a guitar enough to have an encore demanded"Allchat is worth it to hear someone scream in panic whilst hiding in a bathroom because They saw you coming.I've laughed enough in this game to make my sides hurt and I've only got a handful of wins.It's better with freinds You might not survive longer but its well worth the money Edit november 2018 The playerbase has dropped It's still fun but the "fix PUBG" campaign has been a mixed success.

review: To begin with my specs I5 4690 3.5ghzGeforce GTX 960 2GB8GB DDR35400rpm HDDAfter initially loading into a lobby I instantly noticed framerate issues sound and player model lag. PUBG recommended I put my graphics towards the medium/low end of the spectrum which is fair as my computer specs lean towards the minimum side of things. Instantly when all the players were loaded into the plane the framerate dropped below 30. My game froze for a solid 15 seconds before I realised I had ejected out of the plane and was plummeting towards the Earth. When I landed my game continued to freeze as the textures loaded from potato quality to the actual quality I expected. A very disappointing result which was further backed up by continuous frame drops and even the game crashed when I attempted to open my inventory. Fast forward three games I still had the same issues of textures not loading and continuous framerate drops.It is important to understand that this game is poorly optimised for low end PC's. A game should not freeze for + 2 minutes while waiting for textures to load while constantly getting "Network lag". Pretty poor performance and very annoyed but an enjoyable game when it decides to work. Aside from my technical issues the gameplay itself is sound. I thoroughly enjoyed one game making it to top 10 when I got two tapped with a pistol outside of the zone and died by the gas. While there were a variety of guns and various items I certainly noticed a lack of attachments for weapons. This is probably just my bad luck ha ha ha (It cost me a game). Regardless of my issues PUBG is a very exciting and thrilling game well worth the full price of 30USD. 22/10/18still a buggy and poorly optimized game. kinda fun lol

review: Extremely good game in many many interesting ways. The core concept is simply clever and addictive but it's the implementation of that concept (survival/Running Man/Hunger Games/Deathmatching) that really does the trick. The game's use of a closing circle of death that kicks in after a set amount of time on a regular basis growing smaller and smaller which kills anything outside of it over time is ingenious. It drives player movement and prevents camping (I'm not against camping per se as it can make a lot of sense to sit tight in a shooter) but this helps prevent someone from holing up and never moving. This "Death circle" creates many interesting decision points and all the greatest of games know how to create these. Another keen game design aspect is the initial player drop from the C 130 plane choosing where to go can make a life or death difference.Mix in the looting aspects with tight shooting and moving controls and you have the components for a very fun type of game. Add in Supply Crate drops (that generate even more decision making and which also helps to drive player movement) along with localized random bomb raids that force players inside for periods of time and you have a simple game concept made FAR more interesting due to the myriad of choices available to players.Do you loot a bit longer gambling that you'll be able to make it inside the closing death circle? Or do you rush your way towards where you think the game's final circles might be in order to be set up and get ready ahead of time? Considering that the final circles close in concentrically yet somewhat randomly in a region no one can be too sure where they should try to end up.It's a one life style of game where if you die you have to jump back into a new game BUT because you can quickly do so it's not really frustrating. My (and other players I game with) main complaint is simply that the damage modeling in terms of TTK (Time to Kill) is somewhat wimpy feeling at times. The classic headshot is always heavy hitting but if you miss that you can sometimes run into a situation where you're seeing blood spray and know you've hit someone multiple times only for them to (against all odds) survive somehow.Overall performance isn't perfect (yet) as the game is still in Early Access but the designers are clearly plugging away with regular and appreciated abandon to patch bugs balance things out and even add tweaks and such. My final thoughts are that this is already an amazing game and it's only in Early Access. I give it a very very high recommendation. )

review: In the 88.5 hours I have as Im writing this that is in the first few hours i had the game i had come to the realization that this game is somewhat souly based on in game rng but as i advance and play more and more games I find that its really just how you play it. If you are constantly rushing enemies you put yourself in the position to have a very high risk for a high reward type situation you have a higher chance of getting that chicken dinner but at a higher cost/risk. If you camp in a sh*t shack the whole game then you probably wont have the highest probability of bringing home that chicken dinner but you still have that chance as long as you play it smart. So if you like a fast paced game play H1 if you like something slower and have to put more thought into your actions while playing a battlefield game then this is the game for you!

review: Could be good. Isn't. Player movement is like a robot ice skating simulator. FPS mechanics (aim shoot peak etc) are all very poorly executed. Feels like a game from the 90's. This may well be the best battle royale game out there. Still doesn't mean it's a good game. On top of everything else they still haven't done anything about the cheaters. Gotta luv getting one tapped by a dude with a pistol while alone inside a room with the door closed and no windows..... Just played a round where I had full health a fresh lvl 3 helmet and had just taken 2 energy drinks. Got into a sniper battle with another player we both had Kar98's. I shoot him right in the face (lvl 2 helmet) he doesn't die. He shoots me in the head (lvl 3 helmet no damage) I die instantly. this game.If you haven't bought this game yet don't. Wait until Bluehole shows that they can deal with the cheaters and make the game run halfway decently before you give them any money.Update (Jun18) Been playing the war game event mode. Closest thing to fun I've had with this game. Still utter crap combat though. Just walked up behind a dude and gave him both barrels of my sawed off right in center of mass. Not only did he not die he had time to fire his K98 switch to his 1911 and empty the clip at me then switch to melee and one punch me to death all before I could reload the TWO ing shells in the sawed off...... I'm done. Probably for good. Only thing that would bring me back would be a total overhaul of the combat and movement mechanics not bloody likely.Update (Jan 2019) Got bored and tried PUBG again. New maps new weapons a crap tonne of cosmetics but the same old terrible gameplay. Why are so many people still playing this???? I'm done. RIP PUBG uninstalled Jan 15 2019. So much potential such terrible execution.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TL DR (When this Game First Came out it was great. These guys turned it into FORTNITE with it s MicroTrans).This game is great for you if you wanna deck out your avatar like fortnite and CSGO(Edited) I slightly Recommend this game. This game is (Edited out "a lot") of fun. These recent Beta Tester games have left a sour taste in my mouth ie DayZ. *Although "Squad" is great.* Quite simply This game (Used to) have similar heart racing combat as DayZ. PlyrUnk allows you to gear up (Sometimes) hastily and (Sometimes) not run around like an imbecile bambi DayZ/Rust. It seems the Devs of PlyrUnk took their time to read and assess gamer's gripes and praise on similar games in this genre. (Then decided to hump the IG Dream of Hoes and Money And Drugs And Sell OUT) PlyrUnk takes into consideration all of the pros/cons of each similar game in this genre and Made this raw 100 player force on force combat game. (To bait OG players into the game and then flush them out with micro transactions) This game has the feel that the developers of this game actually played video games and used that hands on knowledge to put in their work to produce this game. (UNTIL Micro transactions fed their money hungry lifestyles) The following are clever ways to get this game to stand out... 1) I appreciate how clever they implement the sky diving (To pick a spot on map to spawn TO rather than ON) 2) The random artillery Zones to keep goons from loafing around. 3) YOU CAN SPAWN TOGETHERISH WITH FRIENDS TO PLAY AS A UNIT 4) The ever contracting force field To pressure people to engage in combat rather than prop a bolt action out of a 2nd story windowOther considerations.... (Used to) go from nude to loot within seconds of landing. There are SOME vehicles (In their entirety!*) as a form of quick transportation... they're noisey and a good way to attract attention which can be capitalized on Firefighting is smooth and fluid and not sluggish or clunky. These blokes really did well! (But caved into the disgusting land of micro transactions)

review: This game is extremely fun and riveting with friends. However business practices from Blue Hole make me feel the need to have to leave a negative review here is why.Stream Sniping There is plenty of ways for Streamers to prevent this from happening. If there is proof of someone cheating watching someone's stream to gain an unfair advantage then sure ban them. From what I hear however these streamers are able to get anyone banned for "Stream Sniping" EVEN WHEN THEY ARE NOT REPORTED. You would think the dev's wouldn't waste their resources screening games to ban people when they're too lazy to even report them with the button at the bottom of the screen? Lol. For the record I have not been banned but who knows I may accidentally kill a streamer and be banned for it.Claiming to take action against Fortnight The game is a cartoon and is different from PUBG. It's a battle royale game sure but there's no basis for taking any form of legal action. If they do I'm not sure why H1Z1 doesn't sue PUBG. It's almost the same game even more so then PUBG and Fortnight. practice is all I'm saying.tl dr The game is fun dev's banning people because streamers crying when they weren't cheating is utter stupidity. Bluehole trying to sue a game very different from itself interesting...

review: EDIT 6/25/2017 I finally won a game and felt like a ing badass doing so! I can quit this game happily now lol. JK it's flipping addicting!REMINDER!!! THIS GAME IS IN EARLY ACCESS! PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is my favorite most addicting battle royale game I have ever played! Pros Combat is fair and balanced IMO . A short learning curve easy to learn (watch YT videos or streamers to get better tips). Very easy to get addicted. Plenty of weapons and vehicles. Team spectating at launch. Can be played very tactically or "run n gun" Plenty of players and servers to just hop on whenever you want so low wait time. Feels like a good mix of DayZ H1Z1 KotK and ArmA The devs actually listen to the players and what they want also great feedback from the devs. Plenty of players to kill! Cons A bit buggy Don't forget it's in Beta/Early Access . Sounds are a bit off (devs are working on that). Server and graphic optimization isn't too great (devs are also working on that READ THEIR PATCH NOTES PLEASE! ). Some players are annoying (or quite a bit depending on what players are on your server). In my opinion it's a great game I fully support this dev team and their project. Playing this game has probably given me the most fun I've had in a while with a video game. Even though it is a bit buggy the devs are working on it and IMO I believe they are going to fix as much as they can because they have already done so much already. Please read the patch notes as well it'll give you an insight of what has been going on.I hope everyone has a great day and I'll see you on the BATTLEGROUNDS!

review: I predict this game will mimic dayz and h1z1 landing somewhere in the middle of having a forever buggy and broken game that is filled to the brim with cosmetics that you can buy or get as part of some event.This developer spends SO much more time deleting negative forum posts and banning people having doubts about the game in an attempt to hide all the t thats going on like horrible servers bad tickrate bad hitdetection and all sorts of other t.If they only spent half that time improving the game or AT LEAST work on improving the game to a state where its not every single game you have horrible lag or desync or hit detection problems before they spread out to other platforms hold competitions or make twitch prime exclusive skins the game would be in a much much better state and it would have a future.This game has been getting worse and worse since closed beta back then it was a great game to play the problems werent as many and it wasnt every game that was tormented by bugs and problems.As of now it seems theyre trying to grab as much money as possible from as many platforms as possible all while postponing every single patch from every single deadline they set themselves.On top of that to cement how badly their PR team are doing their jobs.To find patch notes or upcoming stuff. You need to frequent their website their twitter their forums and the steam forums.Theres not a single one of those places that has all the information their website has blog posts regarding patches but theyre around 3 4 weeks behind at the time of typing this their forums are almost updated but steam forums seem to be up2date atm. On twitter you can get an idea that theyre actually working on stuff if you dont use twitter youre outta luck since they NEVER update anything at all beside the random placed patch notes.This is a game with great potential and everything to lose. Unfortunately the actions of the devs really really tell me that theyre going to drop the game and break it and not have the skills to fix it again.

review: Lots of fun but the lag is horrendous. There's a lot of rng in this game and shooting should not be included in that... The developers told us a couple of weeks ago that the unreal engine had ddos protection and that due to that 90% of the packets were being dropped causing all the desync and lag issues. They fixed it promptly but then had to roll that patch back due to issues that arose from fixing that. That was about two weeks ago and until it gets fixed I cannot recommend that others buy this game. The dev's have said it will be fixed but until then just hold off.

review: Great Game!At the beginning trying to learn the game and it's meta was frustrating and infuriating. Running up to everybody and trying to kill them just didn't work and after an hour of game time I was ready to quit. The next game I played I shot a couple of people and hid in a box. Made it to 3rd and I fell in love with the game. This game is something different to H1Z1 and Last Man Standing. This takes strategy and stealth to win (or insane gunplay). Whilst solo is enjoyable. Duos and Squads are better. Playing with your friends can bring you closer or drive you apart. Both have happened so far ). It adds a new level of teamwork. Overall Really enjoyable game and I could play it all day long.

review: I played this game a bit. I know it's not much but in all this time my worries of getting into a server filled with hackers weren't confirmed. Many reviews for this game were about Hackers and Cheaters (I think thats the same) but I can't confirm it yet. In all this time I haven't seen anything that was too suspicious. Now to the gameplay... I love this game. This is maybe the best game I have in my entire library and every Euro I have spent on this game was worth it. It's fun and addicting and I played it almost every day for a bit because I enjoyed it so much. The best moment was when I opened this pioneer box thing and it gave me a jacket that was worth 16 bucks... so if it goes on like this I will get my money back by selling my clothes in the game.overall rating 9/11 because of the fps drops.. but I'm downloading the patch right now and they promised to fix those performance issues in this patch so maybe I will fix my rating later.

The Server performance is bad. You get fps drops where drops shouldn't be. The amount of vehicles weapons and ammo is bad distributed. Well the list of negative stuff is long.Playerunknow is still a fun game to play if you can't find anything else fun to play. As soon as an AAA game dev team starts developing a similar game PUBG will die out quickly because of the slow and negative development.Hope to have helped you with my review.

review: I bought this game Today 18/06/17 and I already LOVE it it is just such an intense game I love the vibe where you have to be prepared. This game may be in early access and not configured very well but it is still amazing. This game has a few bugs and is hard to run for budget pcs. But after it seems like a really fun game the game was in my mind for a while while I thought whether I should get it or not till one day I said F*** it I asked for it and begged and got it. To get the most out of this game you need to have a squad of people preferably 4 or so on then you have a chance of domination but as a pair me and my friend Siloh tried our best and made it to third before being utterly destroyed. I haven't played this game for 2 hours and I'm writing this review I absolutely love this game it's just brilliant. Hands down the best game of 2017.I further played this gameafter I had resolved my issue with the game and I was welcomed back in I truly love this game in the time I didn't play I had purchased H1Z1 and had tried it out I quite liked it but battlegrounds just seems like a better option. I have a certain thing wrong with certain things that battlegrounds does.Attachments a wide variety of attachments are spread around the map and are quite common but the one of the rarest items n the game is a suppresor for sniper rifles I love how in depth it goes with the attachments such as you can only put an assault rifle suppressor on an assault rifle and little things like that.Variety guns in particular have a wide variety with there being different machine guns different sniper rifles and all sorts wih different rates and spawns you will rarely find some guns and you may have to work hard to get some such as from an airdrop where you can sneak in a bush and snipe or just rush and blow them down.

review: Game is actually fun and entertaining. Unfortunately as all ES the game as quite a few bugs. Most of all hit/damage registration is completely faulty and inconsistent. Considering that the core of the game is shooting (it's an FPS) I strongly advise to stay away from this game until they fix the current issues.Edit (1) Be very careful with this game. If you of a streamer (who basically fuels and brings immense visibility to the game) you might get banned for stream sniping. It's the very first game where this happens and I strongly suggest you to read between the lines and realize how your privacy and rights might very well be trumpled by Bluehole.Edit(2) DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!! It's the purest form of money grab and scam!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm updating this older review most problems are still there. Ultimately just don't buy this game. older review below As fun as this game is (sometimes) you really shouldn't buy this garbage because it isn't a decent game yet. It has so many problems ranging from terrible programing to balancing issues. This is the game where a literal frying pan gives you more protection than military grade armor. This is the game where you might be playing it with no problems while your friend is sitting out in the open unable to move because the game did not render the buildings for him yet.Developers seem to care more about fluff and planning to release their &gt UNFINISHED GAME&lt on other platforms than actually taking care of these problems that have been in the game for months. You shouldn't need 16GB of RAM and a mid/high end graphics card to run a game on low settings without having too many issues how do they expect this game to run on a Xbox?As fun as this is to play with friends most of the time you will be frustrated because the game won't let someone play either because of the issues listed above or because the game just crashes on loading screens sometimes.Wait for the final product.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: No more hackers this game is good right...? Absolutely not. I came back to play after taking a break for a few months in the hopes of the common bugs being fixed and lets see how it went. Got in the plane in my first few games to have the plane stutter the whole ride. Jumped out of the plane to people being able to pull chute alot later than me (even at 234km/hr dive.) Parachuting still is horrendous still takes control of your chute every other game. Shooting has improved if you can pick up a gun the first time you hit a button. Overall bluehole they made their money they still dont care about their playerbase its a wonder why people play fortnite instead of this heaping pile of

review: Will come back when China isnt #1................................Ping LockWe are looking into implementing a ping lock for our servers. We have no ETA on when this will be added just yet as we have limited resources and at the moment server performance and stability is our highest priority. We also don t want to restrict the ability for friends in different regions to play together but we understand how frustrating it can be playing against high ping players and take this very seriously. title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Truly a great concept mired under many issues. Tried really hard to like the game but overall it leaves you feeling dissapointed. Reminds me alot of payday just a awesome concept that fails to deliver.Love the flight over and drop in via plane instead of randnom spawn great idea! Immersion is AWESOME one of the few games you can almost feel like you are there.Cons 1. Random crashes seem to be about 25% hit rate on reloads or intial spawn good news is it hasn't happened mid game. Running in window mode and mutli tasking seem to make it much worse.2. Performance holy un optmized run about 30 40fps with a 1080TI running on mostly low settings. Geesh. 3. Movement and physics is more like GTA and less like Call of Duty be prepared to get stuck on fences accidental falls. Guns get fully blocked by stupid things like a open fence. Spread and hit register is awful safest bet use a shotgun or uzi and small area. 4. By FAR the number 1 issue de sync and lag switchers/software laggers. Combinaiton of hackers and just buggy net code cause some horrfic deaths at end game. Last 3 or 4 games I made to last 10 I get killed by somone 100% invisible driving a car. No sound or anything then death and car appears all of sudden. Some research looks like the hack community has software lag switches now reminds me of the destiny crap with laggers. 5. Grendades oh sweet hell 100% useless most of the time. Slow impossible to aim and they bounce all over the place. Most cases you end up nuking yourself instead of the baddie.6. The bubble that keeps you moving into circle it kills the immmersion alot. The concept is great the visible bubble barrier is not. Maybe changed to radation or something that doesnt look arcade'y in a game with so much realism.7. No player list spec or kill stats after death you die and its just how many people you killed. After clawing your way to top 10 for 30 mins it feels very unsatisfying to just drop and not know the results. Very least they could tell you how many HP your oppoenet walked away with and a deathcam.

review: Product received for free. Unplayable in its current state for me. I received it as a gift copy from a friend who has been enjoying this game immensly but whenever I join a server the game freezes within' 8 seconds of getting into the beginning lobby. Windows task manager shows that the game is using upwards of 3k+ MB of memory. This is a huge game breaking crash/memory leak and adding to the pain is the fact that I can't even end the process it requires a whole hard reboot to regain functionality of my computer.I would steer clear of buying this game until the game developers fix some of the harsher problems of that plague it for the time being. Or at least until it gets out of what is basically alpha. Running on Windows 10 64BAMD FX 8350AMD Radeon HD 797016G RAM Update April 27/28 there was a hotfix that was supposed to help some people with a crash I had little hope it was in anyway directed at my problem. Now I can't even get into the server for the 8 seconds and it crashes on loading in. Update May 25th Huge update. Still crashes. Beginning to think it is a sort of memory leak when loading in textures of the game. Either way still doesn't work.

review: knees weak palm sweaty something something mom spaghetti I launched the PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUND destined to be number 1 I trained days for today and today I am ready I parachuted out of the plane and landed in a small village trying to seek for a weapon after minutes of searching I finally found it. A small revolver tucked in the corner of a attic in a house I clutched the revolver with my hand and pointed it at the attic opening. I was ready. (Narrator Voice) 10 mins later I was watching Youtube cus I got bored of waiting for people to come up. *BANG Gunshots rained around me Playarea shrinking down bodies pileing up. I knew it was time.......... I ran out guns blazing holding on to the only thing keeping me alive...... my dreams (And mostly my revolver) The second I got out the door bullets sprayed towards me and I decided to do the only tactic that would save me Running away screaming "plz don't kill me" "plz don't kill me" and I survived. I was safe for now. I found a humvee on the way to the Playarea. I was relived and I drove it in circles around the playarea Bullets starting flying everywhere again. I was immune to the bullets. I am GOD. crashes into a tree barely alive I took my limping body to the nearest tree and hid behind it. It left me and him 1v1 I knew I couldn't win him in combat. But I could wait it out. So I harnessed all the power within me my dreams my hopes. I became the tree. I felt as if my legs became roots and arms became branches. I was one with the tree. The only way to win in the Cullin.... I mean PLAYERSUNKNOWN BATTLEGROUND. *dink* I opened my eyes "OH ....... My only weakness..... grenades Instantly dies and dreams crushed I told my friends about this and they told me to git gud.Final Verdict 10/10 would become a tree again. Tree Simulator 2017

review: This recommendation comes with a cautionary statement This game needs a better server infrastucture. If you are playing in Eastern Canada you will almost certainly get one of or some of the following issues hitching bad server side rubberbanding teleporting players and bad hit feedback. If you intend on playing competitively or tend to take these games seriously you might not be in for a good time. I've reached out to Bluehole about possibly fixing or addressing the problems but they haven't gotten back to me and honestly I don't expect them to.That being said when I'm playing with a friend or just have some time to kill to play a fast game and play aggressively/stupid I always seem to find my fun. I'm hoping they continue supporting the game (more so than H1Z1 has seen support) and keeping my fingers crossed that this game becomes something special.

review: PUBG also known as PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is a world where you are fighting for you or your party's survival in a last man(s) standing brawl full of explosions and gunplay. Overall the gameplay is smooth(er) but the gunplay and emersion is by far its best qualities. On the other hand there is a blatant slap in the face of the player and a total emersion killer. The exhaust sounds of the vehicles are completly and noticably wrong. There is no way that a car stuck in a post human interaction era could possibly have the sound of a well maintained machine. It seems that there is an abnormal amount of care for an "abandoned island" forcing you to question as to if you're truly alone. Random rust and weather (when its in the game) would cause random wear on said exhaust causing different sounds from each vehicle. So spending the better half of a game collecting duplicate vehicles to test the fortitude of the hypothesis SMOOSH my head is ripped apart by a scilenced AWM.Air tire pressure is also under review.Good skydiving sim 102.56/103.45
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: What with the new "Fix PUBG" campaign coming to fruition I'm going to change my review originally I was apprehensive towards Bluehole but lately they've really been shaping up. The hacker problem has been almost completely nixed optimization is smooth (I have a budget rig and can play the game fine albiet on low) and the loot crates are being phased out. Definitely gotta give props to Bluehole for finally listening to the playerbase.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Other than the performance imperfections and untenable gunshot sounds I'm only curious and slightly concerned about how quickly Battlegrounds might age. Although it's a prettier grittier and more deliberate game than King of the Kill those who've already put a ton of time into battle royale might eventually feel like Battlegrounds is a better fitting set of pants. The Early Access offering is shallow a map essentially one mode and the mildly satisfying lure of sick trenchcoats awaiting you in the loot system. It'll be interesting to see if the devs can keep pace with the game's burgeoning community.Overall Battlegrounds' approach to simplifying simulation style systems and mechanics is successful. Many of my gaming friends who bounced off of Arma because they perceived it as too unwieldy are diving in and those who haven't yet have been asking me enthusiastically about whether they should. I'm glad to have a short form gateway game to sell them on the fun of FPS fidelity.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great early access game with consistent and constant improvements and great communication from the devs. There is a lot of negative reviews regarding 'micro transactions' and 'crate and key' for cosmetics. You know you don't have to have cosmetics right?Edit since logging in I feel that I should clarify the crate system.There is 3 crates all of which can be 'bought' using in game points which are earned from playing. Only one of these requires a key to open. If you don't want to open the crate you can sell on the steam market. So you can make back some money on this game. It's a shame that the majority of negative reviews are purely reactive to either misinformation or lack of information or on the basis that some people don't like to continue to invest money into a game. And whilst everyone is entitled to an opinion the decision to play a game should not rest solely on an optional feature which has no impact on gameplay.I recommend this game.

review: Early acces review so things might be fixed already!Player unknown's battlegrounds has in my eyes the potential to become the best battle royale game around but at the moment there are some game breaking glitches. Like I cant even cancel matching which is really annoying when another friend wants to join. Also in game there are game breaking glitches nades getting stuck in a wall which kills us all and there is also no way to control a car mid air. which is really annoying when you suddenly fly into the air for absolutely no reason.Another problem is the lack of content that you are getting for 30 Euro's all that you are getting is a battle royale gamemode I would love to get some more gamemodes soon. My conclusion if you wait a couple weeks the game will probably be fixed in terms of bugs and I would recommend it.

review: This game could be very good. Mechanics are not refined.We need more than just a punch your character needs morefluidity. The cheating is the biggest annoyance. Nothing likeworking your butt off looting and being stealthy just to havesomeone know exactly where you are even in cover and walkto you. Then they have the instant head shot ability. I ran intoone player who I hit over and over and they were immortal.Cheats Available ESP(puts your outline on the map) Player Radar(Shows everyone's location on the map) Shoot through walls and other solid objects Invisibility Easy loot(Can see all items in a building without entering) Auto Loot(Loots every good item automatically equips add ons) Aimbot(Instant headshot from any distance you can imagine)After all that I dont have any performance issues just a basic luck match with cheaters.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: What is Pubg?Pubg is a Third person or first person shooter that is about surviving by collecting loot &amp guns to survive in an 8x8km map. 100 people are spawned in a plane and they can choose when and to jump out. once the player lands they begin collecting loot &amp guns. once you drop you will be vulnerable to all players so you have to loot fast. the game also has a white and blue barrier that closes in. the white barrier is a safe spot where you can not die from being outside the playzone the blue barrier closes in on you and you cannot out run it but you can drive away from it with a vehicle if you are lucky enough to find one. once the barrier gets small enough you will encounter a lot of players and the game will get tense because the worry of dying to the playzone and the worry that a player will shoot you from the back adds up. once it is in the top 5 the circle is basically a death arena and the winner gets a chicken dinner.(yes. you do get a chicken dinner). If you are in a duo or a squad if you lose your first health bar your friend has a limited time to pick you up that is if you dont get killed before you can crawl to your team.Why I like the gameIt's very exhilarating and can bring you and your friends hours of funPubg isn't an easy game to play and will be tough if your starting out but once you learn a few tips and tricks the game gets fun (especially when you are one of the top 10 surviors.

review: I do not play FPS or TPS. I don't play shooters at ALL. But a friend at work kept hassling me to play. So I did.MAN am I glad I did. This game has CRAZY good gunplay. The environmental collisions with body/vehicles still need a LOT of work. But even the way it is (clunky for EVERYONE) it's still a very balanced game. I think the range on the guns is too high but I'd imagine balance issues are a daily concern.I've played some 2 and 4 person squads and I've found it's more fun to watch highly skilled players play than to play myself. I'm a noob and often the first to die in the squads but my team mates have pulled off some impressive feats. We've captured TONS of wild video of crazy frying pan miracle firefights. I watch the last player on our squad nearly succumb to the suppression fire of 2 full squads (8 players) and with his trusty frying pan keeping bullets out of his lower back he managed to down TWO ENTIRE SQUADS solo after nearly dying. It was without a doubt the most insane multiplayer experience I've ever witnessed and I've been playing MMO's since the 90's. GET THIS GAME and squad up. Solo play is OK but finding a squad is much more fun.

review: While this game has promise I cannot in good conscience recommend it at this time as I do not agree with many of the business decisions the company has made in the past few months. Despite having a smash hit on their hands they have decided to push the eSports scene and introduce microtransactions before the game is fully developed. I am willing to accept an unpolished EA game but not when they are trying to milk every last penny out of the game before putting out something that doesn't play like buggy garbage half the time. It's a major red flag that tells me they might not be all too interested in moving out of the EA phase when the game is selling this well. Similar titles like Fortnite have put out comparable (if not better) gameplay without reneging on consumer promises or compromising the integrity of the game for immediate cash grabs. So I may return to PUBG when they put out a better product but for now I'm walking away.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Unoptimized bugs/gltiches a plenty cheaters no region lock so we have laggy chinese players on NA server loot placement is abysmal and is a glorified looting simulator. Their focus is releasing more content not on fixing and optimizing the game. Game devs are confused They ignore the problems and are just milking PUBG right now. In comparison Fortnite follows and looks at the community and changes things according to what they deem to be beneficial for the game. They released Orange justice for free for season 4 they've removed guided missles after the the community complained about them. They've got the forumala with the least amount of things wrong with them and are running the gaming industry. This game is slowly following H1Z1 steps and will be a shadow of it's former self when the chinese players leave. TL DR Just don't buy into the hype especially it being the most expensive BR game out there right now. The game has potential and could've been something great but they've have shown themselves to be untrustworthy and not willing to change the game for the better.

review: HEADERI've been playing since the Early Access program. What can I say about this game?TL DRIt has a lot a potencial but lack fixes and features. EDIT It had a lot of fixes since NVIDIA is helping in the development of the game!LONG VERSIONWhat I mean by all of this is that while the game is really fun to play with friends it has few to offer when you're not with them. It has only one mode which is its selling point a survival game. Around 100 people jump from an airplane and fight each other in TPS/FPS styles until one survives (or a party of 2 4 players) or everyone kills each other (a drawn is possible in this game). Now it has two scenarios which the Mexican desert is quite hard to survive since it way too open..... So... well it's has more failures than that.It has PK feature to your partners. It's quite unfair to play this with too many cheaters! It has some bugs that really unsatisfy me especially concerning fallings and driving vehicles. And the best one it gets tiring quickly. As I said the selling point is the fact that it's a survival game so it has no respawn. However as it has only one mode available the charm of this game gets old so quickly a lot when you're just killed by headshots all the time then I think it must have other kinds of modes such as fewer people on the survival game or maybe even bigger teams with hunter mode or something like that (like CS GO with terrorists vs anti terrorists). The most concerning fact about this game for the community however is the fact that it's not so well optimitized so it needs more processment power from CPU and GPU than it really would need it the development of the game regarded about optimizing PUBG. In theory you'd need to have a really powerful PC. On the other hand NVIDIA is investing in this field opmitizing PUBG in each update so if you have a NVIDIA GPU you're lucky. If it's from AMD or other obscure developer I'm sorry but it will have delays and other problems in rendering.Well it has another good selling point updates. It's fairly updated by the developers. Each update expands the game or correct some bugs but I can see that they're really caring about this game. So if you're quite frightened by these many bad things I've just said don't worry the developers may know all of this and are solving this problems... Maybe.CONCLUSIONBesides all that it's still a fun game to play occasionally with friends especially if you can chat with them by VoIP. I had many hours of fun chatting with them while playing PUBG so I think you can also have it with them! Also I believe that this game has a lot of potential to develop through its updates and expansions.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hi I just got into Pc gaming about five days ago. I'm new to this very new. I basically just suck at this point. I bought the Trace 930 specifically with the hopes of playing this game. After I got my pc up and running you better believe my first purchase was this game. For months I've been watching with my brothers YouTube's fighting it out. Funny moments epic moments. I was like.. Yeah. I want that. Instead what I got is fights where I'm in a room searching I hear footsteps ext away. So I stop and listen to see where they are going. O no. They went into the building I'm in. O no.. they came in the room in in? Looking right at me a kill me before I can kill them. I'm just like how the hell did this guy know where I was? Then I've had others where I'm behind cover fighting someone. I get shot through the wall? Im thinking hm. That's odd. Then.. weird stuff like that happens again.. again.. again... and then i read the reviews and was like.. o... wow. That's a shame. So I would recommend not getting this as long as (hackers cheaters) are prevailing against the quotation marks.. anti cheat system.

It's excellent gunplay and suspenseful final duels are marred only by the fact you are constantly running towards a safe zone which in my experience almost exclusively spawns on an island with the military base. I have lots of fun while playing but please fix the safe zone balance there needs to be better methods of crossing (boats are coffins).

review: the game is not complete but its more of a game then h1z1 is for sure. the game does have bugs but the dev team is doing a great job of fixing things. the game has lag in certain points but the devs have fixed alot of the fps drops in high population areas. i love that they add new content every month and hope that we will see more maps and modes. as of right now the game is okay it may not be worth $30 but i really think it will be in the near future maybe within the next month. guns are constantly being balanced and tweaked however its hard to get used how hard it is to deck a gun you like out. bottom line if you want a game that plays like h1z1 mixed with arma get this game. if your looking for a fun shot'em up move on. if you want a fast paced game this game has its moments but its mostly a tactical shooter where being in the right place in the right time makes surviving more easy. this game is about picking which fights to take not about running in and killing everyone.

review: Probably the best Battle Royale game out there+ Solid battle royale gameplay. Drop from a plane collect loot kill players get pushed in closer and closer try to be the last man standing. The gun play is pretty realistic and it's always fun to get into an intense firefight.+ Great fun with friends+ Very High Replayability+ First Person and Third Person modes.+ Vehicles + Depening on how well you do you earn battle points. You can use these to get crates which you can sell on the market for profit OR open them for a cosmetic item. More of a personal note When playing in a squad it's very common for one of your friends to get knocked down and within a second they get killed with no chance of reviving them. This causes you to either leave the game or your friends have to sit there in boredom watching you play the remainder of the game. Can be frustratingly repetitive. Example Spending 20minutes looting / looking for players and then suddenly getting sniped across the map. Not enough map variety (there are only two maps currently) Lots of bugs... from randomly flipping off a bike taking heavy damage parachuting from the plane glitching inside loading buildings etc.

review: Here comes my Review from a guy who only wants to like this game and loves the core Gameplay of it.Positives I love the Gameplay of Pubg when everything works right(which still is like 90% of the time in a round i would say).I like the models of the Guns how the Guns feel and how it feels to hit a fat dab on the Haters.The fights in this game are really interesting and Unique to this type of game as long as youre playing in Squad Gameplay.The first few Wins in this game gave me a feeling of exhilaration I rarely ever felt in any other game if any other gamer at all.You really do feel good when playing and hitting shots.Negativ The state of the Game got increasingly worse and worse after 1.0.Right now there are huge Latency Problems with the Servers. For example I myself got Headshot multiple times while being behind a solid Object for a second or two already without any Line of Sight to the Person shooting me. This has happened to me on multiple Occasions and on every Map thats in the game. There were and sometimes still are a stupendous amount of Bugs and glitches that sometimes move in and out of the game from Patch to Patch.There is probably a lot missing that I havent actively thought of since its minor or forgotten about/gotten used to.Overall you can see that the Developers are Passionate about most Parts of the Game but you can also see that they either dont Focus on the Important Stuff or manage to Eff the Important Stuff up again and again.Of course I wouldnt know how involved the Developement of this game is but at the End of the Day for a Consumer the Product matters and not really the Process of making the Product.

review: PUBG is the most brutally unforgiving game I've ever played. And yet despite dying over and over again it is also the most satisfying game I've ever played.When you first start you die easy but you can also learn to last until the end. You'll still die but you'll have fun learning the terrain and how to stealth and how to find items.As you get better you'll start engaging other players. You'll die some more. But eventually you'll kill a few.Then as you start to get good you might start killing a lot of players and diving straight into the action without hesitation.This learning curve takes at least a month. You'll play third person first person in a duo or in a squad. You might even play in a squad on your own. Nobody talks about the significance of small decisions like this but they're in your hands and they can make each game a very different experience.This is the BEST multiplayer game I have ever played. It's compelling and keeps you coming back. Every day I have a bunch of new stories and no two games are the same.In an unusual twist the skills you can develop in this game may serve you in real life as well. This isn't a survival game as much as it is a free for all combat game but somehow it's the game that will teach you about moving through terrain and surviving.PUBG is the best addiction you could possibly develop.

review: ADDICTIVE and FUN.The game had issues with optimisation when it first came out as do a lot of early access games. This was solved relatively quickly and I can now run a smooth FPS on my AMD FX 8 Processor and 120+FPS on my Ryzen 1700X using a Nvidia 970GTX.GameplayIf you're into ranking system this game can get seriously addictive just be careful not to let it ruin the fun!I find this came most enjoyable in 3/4 team mates where can run around loot stuff and mess around with the occassional voice chat interaction with other teams which have made for some of the best moments.Player base Not really had an issue with any players or hackers in this game so far and have a fair few hours. Waiting Lobbies can be really good fun if you can get everyone singing or dancing or other ridiculous acts.Advice if you buy They are just starting to release new crates save your points you get from games for when they release a lot of crates so you have a higher chance of a better value for money my friends have about 20 white tshirts where as I held 30K and got some good items when the latest pack came out.

review: I had heard about this game before the hype train launched PUBG to the top of the Steam playerc ounts and Twitch view counts and I really liked the premise of this game. I've played similar games before and they've always been good fun. I looked forward to this game and when I finally got to play it I didn't enjoy it very much.It's very poorly optimised which causes it to run like even on the lowest settings (yes my build is more than capable of running this according to the recommended system requirements). So I managed to get into a few games with everything looking like a game from the 1990s with a barely playable framerate and the other supposedely strong points of PUBG fell flat on their face in my opinion. The gunplay was nothing spectacular and the shrinking arena was nothing new to me either. Melee weapons have awful hit detection and the game is pretty buggy all round. Please note that I only had &lt 2 hours playtime with PUBG as I claimed a refund as 26.99 is a steep asking price for a game that doesn't really do much for me. Perhaps it was the hypetrain that raised my expectations or maybe my first experiences were a coincidence and not indicative of the true PUBG experience. If the game ever reduces in price (hasn't been on sale yet) then I suggest you give it a try but for the price being asked I suggest you buy with caution and remember to exercise your right to a refund if you don't like it. I will likely buy the game again after some time when the hype dies down and the price has gone down a bit. When that happens I'll update this review and will hopefully be able to recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TL DR&gt Looks like bootleg ghost recon wildlands. &gt FPS like my dad (inconsistent and absent)&gt Plays like asset flipFull review Today I recieved an update 10/17/2017 and update of 1gb it fixed a frying pan glitch fixed ui glitch for spectator mode fire animation for plane in start and some spawns. Bluehole is a sh t company I didn't expect much from this game considering I was basically forced to get it by friends it was made by the guy from DayZ who wasn't expecting to get burned? They've made hundreds of millions of dollars and they can't have a game that run well. This game has so many fu king problems. How it runs/plays Optimization is garbage and that's probably the nicest way to put it top reviews being marked as fixes to the game shouldn't exist. It's early access but they're not focusing on making the game run well they're focusing on adding vaulting or a another map... who even cares about these features when the game can't run for sh t on many systems? Lot's of people with good systems have to lower their settings to very low to even play let alone that you get an advantage at low settings. The game doesn't really run that well like it feels off I don't know how else to describe it other than muted? A lot of games have very different ways to make you feel like you're part of the experience small nuanced ways but until I'm surrounded by people near the end It generally feels just muted and takes me out. Doesn't help that you spend a majority of your time looking at the floor with a bland boring map with bland boring buildings with small land marks here and there. The entire thing feels very uninspired and that "oh it's apocolyptic" is a garbage excuse because you can make inspirational landscapes with dreary settings. It's been done. This god awful net code combined with the blues clues building textures is worthy of a dumpster fire.Asia A lot of people don't like the fact that asians go onto the american servers and call for region locks. When there's much bigger problems with the whole Asia scenario how do the game developers think it's rightful to charge more money to have people from a different region play the game correctly instead of setting up their sh tty a s servers near there? It's fu king disgusting and disgraceful. Putting ads in the game. You awful beings what's wrong with you?! Who does that?! You do that. Bluehole what in actual fu k. Hackers BattleEye is garbage you're banning people unrightfully so because your game runs poorly and it crashes and some people get banned for that. Your "average of 6k" is terrible when you take into account the amount of sales of this game and the fact that a lot of people get banned unrightfully so. Doesn't help that hackers get by anyway. Streamers Whiny people with popularity banning regular players who used their hard earned cash without a lick of evidence other than word of mouth. Not much to say here other than that this is filthy.Team Killing If you find yourself in a lobby full of people who don't speak your language get ready to get shot and if you try and defend yourself by shooting back get ready to get banned. Cosmetics I can't tell what's worse the fact that they added micro transactions in a early access or the fact that theres camo in the game in lootboxes (god fu k lootboxes) which you can pay for the camo stuff don't worry if you wanted a pay to win mechanic in a pay to play game this is the one stop shop for all your degenerate needs. Misc They added a button to fix the UI because the UI breaks so often. This alone.Conclusion This is the worst part because at the end of the day there's been complaints for quite of few of the issues listed above for a while now. And nothing has been done and there's a key reason for that they already got their money. It's too late. They made hundreds of millions. It's Day Z part two. It's sad. Can't refund millions of dollars can we? Can we?Update Game released games still sh t. Most of these issues if none of them have still not been fixed. Oh and in the desert map in the small island there's 2 buildings clipping into eachother that's right in a $30 game with 2 maps and one game mode (non selectable maps) they couldn't be bothered to make 2 buildings not clip. Tried my best to give this game a shot uninstall

review: Product received for free. It's not like your typical Call of Duty where you constantly die and respawn in a tiny map. This map is huge even for a 100 player match. You dont have a clue where everyone is. You start off with nothing at the beginning of every match but you have to run to find a building and quickly gather weapons armor medkits and clothing. No time to run around as the circle of bounds gets smaller and smaller as the match goes on till all the players are eventually all close together in one spot. The only thing yet to be improved is optimisation for smoother performance. 7.5/10 for me.Pros Huge MapLots of players (Up to 100)Wide assortment of weapons and gear.Cons Not yet optimised (Low FPS with drops)Not much to spend your BP (Currency) onHard to generate BP (Currency)

review: To balance all the negative reviews here's a positive one. I'll try to go by the main negative points one by one and why you SHOULD buy the game since it's actually a really good game despite what everyone keeps shouting in the reviews. AdsThe thing about ads is pretty badly handled I agree. HOWEVER! It is ONLY in the CHINESE region. Any other region has no ads so no reason not to buy the game if you live literally anywhere else. Banned for streamsnipingThis is something that has been blown out of proportions by the internet. Yes people have been banned for streamsniping but this has barely happened. Just the few that have or the 1 in 2.000.000 that has been banned on accident gets all the attention. MicrotransactionsHonestly it's all fashion wise. You want a yellow jacket? Maybe u'll get lucky by opening a crate FOR FREE but if you wanna buy it straight from the market you can for a price. Honestly I think this is a plus. I've made the games money back from selling crates I get by earning In Game currency. Another reason to buy it Bad performance/optimizationI agree this is an annoying point. However since it's still early acces and they will be optimizing the game. It should be playable on all medium rigs tho as long as you put the graphics all on the lowest. Still don't think it's a reason not to buy the game. HackersAgain not as bad as most people say and mostly on the Chinese server. Bluehole is actively banning hackers and it's not really an issue. In my 50 hours of playing I have not seen a single hacker. RNG for weapons low actionThis is all about how you play. People who make this claim are dropping in low loot areas with little players. Of COURSE you're getting little action if you drop away from everyone. Drop in the middle and there will be 10 others ready to fight you. It's all risk vs rewardThe truth is PUBG is a GREAT game that deserves better reviews. There is a reason it's been getting the most players online on steam to any other game.Chicken dinner
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While the game could have been enjoyable I could not play it. I am very dissapointed as I was really excited for this game and I am currently trying to get a refund.

review: By far the best game I have played. With the test servers showing off the valting mechanics is proves that the developers arent't here to suck money out of the community. The ENTIRE map has different movement mechanics all dependent on the position of the player The speed moving and the wall or fence you are navigating through just shows that this game is well placed as Game Of The Year 2017. Then again Post Malone Playes the game. So something must be right here. Only issue is optimization. I have two 750ti's and a core i5 4690k with 16gb of ram and I only run 40 60fps on all low settings So deffently some room for the developers to optimize some! Other than that best AAA game i've played!

review: while yes the devs are updating the game there are still plenty of bugs and problems like hackers that seem to be ignored. I die from someone who is blantly cheating like every 5 or 6 matches and it is pretty annoying. The game is at it's best when you're screwing around with friends. Instead of fixing the game they come out with new maps and "fix" things that don't need to be "fixed". Luckily I have a 1080 and it runs perfectly at 120+ FPS with no issues. But on lesser graphics card like a 970 the game runs at less than 60 FPS which is not okay. Another example of poor dev decisions is the god aweful loot crate system they have. I don't mind if it's cosmetic only but when you have to charge 2 or 3 bucks to get a key that's where I draw the line. I have to earn the stupid BP and why can't I open it for free? while yes i realize some crates can open for free it's not enough. I really find it amusing how the devs at PUBG sued the devs at epic for "copying PUBG" then PUBG decides to blantly rip off Fortnite with the battlepass system. Like what the hell is that about.Core gameplay itself is alright when it's working properly. But I can't recommend it at this stage. Needs serious fixing.

review: I have a lot of hours on this game let me tell you this game is still as fun as it was when I first started. They still need to make tweeks but its cool that the Dev's are actually making progress and reporting what is coming next. Which is something I think is awesome. If you are new to this game the learning curve isn't bad at all. Quite easy I think if you have played other FPS games or even TPS. Now this is a good game with a few bad things. My number one gripe with this game are cheaters. There seems to be more then a few in TPP but almost none in FPP. My 2nd gripe in this game is there is nothing that this game rewards you for. I have over 800+ hours in this game and nothing to show for it. The BP boxes are kind of a scam because you don't really get that much BP back as it is. If you buy the boxes with cash it is a waste of money. I have witnessed a buddy buy $50 bucks in boxes and not even get a rare item. Even with the negatives though this game's positives out weigh the negatives and think this game is still a must get for PC.

review: The game was fun I have to say and finding a match was so fast I mean I've play so much multiplayer on Cod Overwatch and other titles that finding the next match blow me away. After playing the game for a few hour I have to say that the game need more work to be done. Example 1 Find gears and weapon was taking more time to find than players. Example 2 Understanding the keyboard was tricky and pretty hard too. Example 3 The map was bigger than I was excepting you will run so much just to get to the kill circle or you just died outside of the circle. Overall great game for those who have patience time and know who to take down enemies faster than me. I would still recommended this game to the player who like this kind of multiplayer.

review: Finally got to play!I purchased Battlegrounds when it was first released. I was super excited! My friends purchased the game and everyone was playing and when I first started the game...major freezing 0 10 fps bad lag stuck loading etc...This did not deter me. I patiently waited for the first big monthly patch. 2 days prior to the update they released a test server to test said update.I started the game to familiar freezing at the start up screen. A little worried I continued. The menu loaded and I quickly turned my graphics settings down to medium (my computer specs are at the bottom). Once I created my character I started a solo game. THe initial load took forever which concerned me but as soon as the starting arena appeared there was 0 lag! No crazy fps drops! I was actually playing! The plane popped up no lag I jumped out the plane no lag. I played 2 games no lag or fps drops!The 2 games I did play were amazing enough for me to go ahead and write a review.Almost every moment is intense. Looting listening watching the clock..Yes their are bugs. Yes is still needs optimization. Yes they are working on making it a perfect game.So I finally got to start playing and I can easily recommend Battlegrounds to anybody considering it.Specs i5 4670k 3.4ghz8gb ddr3 ramGTX 960 2gb

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a just okay experience. I'm choosing to leave a not recomended rating because I think that you can probably find more fun elsewhere while the 100 man survival mode can be compelling it's also grueling and not always fun esspecially given that most of the time there's no action going on. PUBG has modes that aleviate this war is my favorite and playing in squads usually ends up more interesting than the 30 minuite sneak sessions that are solo. However special modes only appear during event times servers can't be made by anyone except a select few and the core game is so drawn out that sometimes it's a relief to die and start over.

review: The game is conceptually simple 100 people fighting for loot on a huge island. There are a plethora of towns military locations and farms that loot can be found in (albeit with varying levels) which gives you hundreds of strategies to take when you first parachute out onto the island. One of the main reasons people are getting banned for "no reason" is due to stream sniping where people find lobbies with streamers and intentionally annoy and harass them. It's a pathetic way to play this game which is hence the reason so many people are complaining about being banned for no reason. PUBG in itself is surprisingly addictive however and encourages you to try new strategies fail then learn from failed strategies to devise better plans.(EDIT structure and spelling)

review: Horrible game. To start everyone is on a loading screen and 75 of the 100 people there are 12 years old shouting N*g*er this and N*g*er that. Then you all get stuck in a c130 where voice chat is even more noticable and everyone who is 12 is shouting jump N*g*er Anyone who is 15 is pretending to be Chinese and anyone who has not turned down the volume by now is telling everyone else they are the fire commander and order you to jump... n*g*er...So now you jumped and are droping to the ground with 100 other people. Your parachute opens and you float down to what is the worst parachute landing animation ever god help you if someone saw you and managed to get a gun from the house you were floating towards. So now you've picked yourself up and are hauling as much as you can to the house of your choice in hopes there is loot in there an not another player.Lets say you managed to loot the house and are still alive you run out of the house trying to keep ahead of the giant blue circle that is enclosing around the play field you must stay ahead of it or you lose health for every few seconds your on the backside of the blue. If you are lucky enough to have guessed where the middle of the play field is and can stay camped up with your looted weapons you might have a chance. If you are unlucky and find yourself running along the wilderness and sudden pops and snaps are happening around you consider your self spotted and said player is hot on your tail BUT you can't determine which direction the shots came from EVEN with high dollar headphones on cause its not possible to discern in this game. One other reason I do not recommend this is there is already a community of hackers deeply invested in it and where can it go from there but to the toilet. Do a simple google search for "Playerunknown hacks". You will find surveys for codes for in game points to buy more gear you will find hack groups already charging for undetectable hacks... the list goes on.Thanks but no thanks. I rage enough at Battlefield 4 cheats and hacks.

review: It's a fun game but too many hackers ruining the game. It's a game about stealth and precision. When people are running around with ESP and aimbots it has a much bigger effect on the game than for a normal FPS. While sometimes you're just unlucky sometimes it's clear what's happening. For example I'm sitting in a house in the middle of a city. Squad drives up in a car straight to my house. They come up the stairs ignoring all the other closed doors open the one I'm in and shoot me.Another example. Just now I was in the top 4. I was holed up in a house and had been for a while. Some guy runs up and he's scurrying around outside looking in windows I guess. I'm on the second floor and I crawl around a bit trying to get a look at him using 3rd person camera. Whatever side of the house I crawl to he follows me outside. Finally I crawl out on a balcony and lay flat so he can't see me from the ground. He immediately comes around the house and stands *under* the balcony like he knows where I am exactly. I jump down behind him dump an Uzi clip into him and he one shots me at point blank range with an 8x scoped sniper rifle. Seriously WTF. Now I'm not saying everyone cheats. I play a good bit and I make the top 10 60% of the time. But there is almost always one guy in the top 10 who's hacking and either has and aimbot ESP or can shoot through walls and trees. It makes winning almost impossible. I have a 60% top 10 rate in solo and 4 man squad and like a 1% win rate in both. It makes zero sense.Unless they fix the game I wouldn't buy it. It's got potential but it's no fun playing with hackers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If there was an ambivalent/leaning no option I would select it. But on a strict binary I cannot recommend this game in good faith.I really enjoyed this game when it came out and when it was a fresh game and idea it had so much promise and potential. Almost half a year after 'release ' this game is still in extended early access.It is not at all optimized and runs very poorly/sluggishly unless you have a god tier machine it's full of bugs has many many unfinished and bizarre texture issues the skin economy is worse than cancer and adds absolutely nothing to the game (there's absolutely no point to running any skin since they're all really poorly mapped and designed and look terrible you're better off just selling the crates to some Chinese dude to recoup the money you're wasting on this game) and cheating remains a rampant issue in the game which Bluehole has yet to attempt to address despite numerous and repeated promises to do so.The cheating problem in this game is well documented and well known and if you choose to play be prepared to die questionably and repeatedly in gunfights you have no possible way of winning. The overwhelming majority of the hackers in this game (something like 99%) are all from China. Be prepared to be teamed aimbotted or simply teamkilled for your loot by Chinese players they are a scourge on the US and EU servers that Bluehole refuses to address and will continue to plague it until they region lock (which is doubtful at this point).On the plus side and to Bluehole's credit they have recently released a slight ballistics and damage rework that I feel has significantly improved the gunplay and made more weapons viable to get kills with and have finally fixed some issues with the abysmal boring 2nd map (Mirarmar) by adding more cover more loot and a new vehicle but it's really too little too late.When this game works and you have a cheater free game it is extremely enjoyable especially if you like a (somewhat) more realistic battle royale experience than a game like Fortnite or H1Z1. However where this game falters is exactly where the aforementioned titles shine the action pacing and kills per game are all in need of work for this to become a truly decent game.If you insist on buying this game I would strongly recommend having above the minimum specs to run this game at a decent framerate even at the lowest settings otherwise it will run at about 35 50 FPS tops.

review: I've literally bought this game for 2 of my friends to play with me because this is so fun.You have nothing you are naked and afraid...until you have a gun then you're on a mission.... to get that chicken dinner.PUBG aka Naked and Afraid with guns is the best battle royale I've ever played. I'm normally not a fan of these kind of games but this one is really unique. The 'crafting' of building up your guns with attachments is nice (Please fix iron sights holy hell they're disgusting my only negative). The gist of the story is this 1) You're in a plane you're watching how many fools eject at the very first second of the game...you wait until you're over a decent area nobody else is then you drop..2) You haven't even touched the ground yet 10 out of 100 people are already dead3) You notice someone else is close by you hear their feet pounding on grass and wood looking for a gun....you BOOK IT to the nearest house...you can't find a gun....4) You hear a reloading sound they have a gun...you finally found a gun a shotgun a smile on your face as you load shells.5) You hear footsteps coming towards you he's running for you he's hunting you...you have a plan.6) You crouch down and aim your shotgun at the only entrance to your house the idiot barges in... BOOM chk chk... that's one less survivor and one less person you have to kill.7) You look outside there's no car you go back to loot the body of the fallen take the nice assault rifle he generously brought you and its ammunition...and begin your trek.8) You watch the survivor count slowly dwindle the crack of gunshots in the distance...and yet you know the most deadly sound of all when there's only 20 left?Silence

review: Really good concept Really pretty map with a lot of intricacies angles it is neat. Runs absolutely horrific for me. Network Lag abounds... I had to return it as no way is something that runs that bad is going to sit there in my library staring at me... Playing it was pure frustration.... lag so bad it was giving me flashbacks to 1997. Even though I am not a fan of 3rd person perspective in games... this was good enough for me to look past the duel visual modes. The horrid network lag was not.Reading some of the forum posts pointing out issues has guys in there like "OMG Brah git gud!" or my favorite "Go get a 1080 GTX"...It might help to have a $700 video card.... but if your game needs that to run... might want to hold off making it until those bleeding edge cards become standard performance cards. I cannot reccomend this game at this time. I hope they fix it and I will revist it this when I hear they have.

review: This is probably the worst game I've ever played. It does so much right as a battle royal but does so much more wrong as it too. You will land and probably take 20 minutes (if you don't die yet) just to find a pistol. If you're lucky you have 2 amazing choices to put into your inventory an AK and an M16. Every other gun practically doesn't exist btw ammo not included.Next the death cam is a great feature to see how your enemy hacked I mean out played you. Same thing. The death cam will either show you that you were exposaed even though you were clearly behind cover and it'll also show you how an enemy can have the aim of Helen Keller with a wii remote and still somehow clean you up. Even better it'll show 7 out 12 times how an enemy will instant snap to you (1 out of the 7 will be legit). I can't wait till a proper vac secure system will finally be mentioned at HQ.Third I'd like to point out I absolutely detest the sand map I think it shouldn't have ever been thought of. I personally prefer the grassy map because I can actually find cover and die less often. I think to sort this out for player like me there should've been an option from day 1 of sand map to choose to queue up for either one or a random playlist. I think that the corporation should've taken this into account.Fourth I'd like to say what makes this game so good yet so terribly ing awful is its community. Streamers like Shroud and Dr. Disrespect will show you how fun it can be and how its like to be good. However its the top tier that prevents players from having fun. Because when you die in every gun fight to someone better how can you improve? The players will sometimes go out of their way just to make sure you have a miserable time that match. I think a way to overcome skill gaps is to incorporate a form of training game mode so players can practice aim and/or maneuverability. This should've been predicted and implemented long ago.What really pisses me off about this game is that the developers refuse to offer anything that can make this game better and I enjoy it sometimes even though I've yet to win on PC I can still find some fun at times. I however think for now this game is a dissapointment and should be given some redux before anyone new thinks about purchasing it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well err PUBG where do i start this game is very frustrating at times it is one of the many battle royale shooters probably the biggest of them all so lets get on with the reviewGameplay 8/10 The long range combat is amazing but the close range combat is annoying and theres loads of people who will just sit in houses and wait for you and third person peak you round corners.Story it has no storyFun 9/10 This game is extremely fun but it can be boring as you can go 20 minutes without seeing one person. i would recommend playing with friends for maximum fun.Performance 6.5/10 this game is extremely demanding on specs i have a 1080ti and on ultra in some cases can dip below 60 i wouldnt recommend playing on ultra as its better to keep some setting low for visibility. i know its an early acces game but it just feels like game developers are just slapping a early acces sticker on to use as an excuse for poor performance a bit like DayZ. There is also loads of bugs like textures not loading in resulting in people being able ot drive and walk through walls.Playtime 9/10 ive put nearly 200 hours in as of this review and every game still feels fresh even though its the same map everytime. Bluehole are adding a new map meaning another excuse for me to put hundreds more hours into this game.Overall 8.5/10 Pick it up now it is worth it.

review: Bring Back The 1AM Neighbourhood waking Screams of Shock and Awe.Without a doubt One of the best games of 2017 Showing the world the Potential of the Battle Royale Genre. Unfortunetly Bluehole/Pubg corp Have decided to defecate all over their amazing creation and riddled it with Micro Transactions and ******** in the hands that feed them. This game unlike Fortnite Player Unknown has a better Hardcore element and Raw Aim skill and tactic element Compared to Fortnite(Build Build Build luck luck luck). I'm going to get it out of the way and say I personally think Fortnite is trash that is overhyped by the younger generation and casual playerbase. Nothing like camping in a tower 3rd personing over a wall you built in the middle of a circle.I Think what annoys the Passionate Fans of PubG and myself is the fact that this game has so Much more to offer and so much Potential that was sqandered by the plague of greed that is currently sweeping the Moguls of Gaming Companies. The fact is that if Bluehole actually LISTENED to their fan base they would definitely still be the King of Battle Royale. But like H1Z1 They riddled it with micro transactions and the satisfaction that only a spare few could get of getting that sweet sweet "Winner Winner Chicken Dinner" but even then so what. Personally i enjoy the Stupid and Idiotic Moments of Pubg.(Running up to a Squad with a Primed Nade).&gt Winning.Whether it's too late for BlueHole to turn it around and Listen to the Creative Community of PubG or continue on the Path of Destruction of what could of been a better but still an Amazing Legacy Burnt into the Gaming History Books is up to the heads of Pubg Corp. But for some reason i don't think it'll happen anytime soon. It seems the board of Pubg Corp is headed by Pathetic Children that are more consumed on the idea that Fortnite has Ripped off their game and are suing instead of fixing. I can only hope Someone with a higher Caliber will take over and improve what is the game today PubG.
