review: $30 dollar Battle Arena Survival GameSee people complaining about optional cash shop for cosmetic gamblingSee people complaining about something that in no way changes the game aside "Pay to be pretty"Do you people hear yourselves? You get what you pay for here. This isn't a $60 AAA title. It's a $30 Arena Survival Shooter.You start by skydiving onto a massive island from a random direction while forced to pay attention to your surroundings at all times all the while looking for a means to survive as well as win. You can go the stealthy route and make it a massive deadly game of Hide and Seek or strap on your boots and git gud charging head first into the fray with only your fists.There are so many different and creative ways I've seen people play this game both alone and in groups and I have to say it's pretty fun when you've got the time to play it.HOWEVERThe biggest motion of discontent seems to be with the Pay to be Pretty model they're about to introduce. Get over yourselves.It's not like you're paying 15.00 for a reusable SCAR L with attachments on drop or paying for an airdrop to get extra loot to your location. It's completely goddamn optional to go spend money on loot crates on the off chance you'll get that sweet Kill Bill outfit or a trenchcoat. If you're THAT up your own about trying to look good in a game where your TTD is roughly 2 5 minutes your priorities are SKEWED. I get it they said "we won't introduce microtransactions" but honestly what massively popular online game have YOU played that sustained itself with just the kind generosity of SOME of it's player base?TL DR The game is fun. If you got pals it's even more fun. Buy it to run/drive around and shoot people/get shot. It's still in development probably will be for a long time. Some bugs here and there (I've had this issue where my first launch of the game gives me a black loading screen but any other launch after that works as intended) but outside of that the numbers speak for themselves.Try it. If you don't like it refund it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Why is this game so popular?Honestly I've been asking myself this question with increasing frequency as of late. I've sunk about 80 hours into the game at this point yet I couldn't honestly tell you with a straight face that I think it's a "good" game. The people I play with on a regular basis all have considerable experience with shooters ranging from above average to semi professional in skill level and the general consensus amongst them is that the gun play is bad. The hit registration is mediocre. The environments have genuinely atrocious hitboxes.On top of this the movement mechanics are also pretty lacklustre it's extremely easy to get stuck on or in objects and your characters ultimate kryptonite is apparently knee high walls. Furthermore the game is not only ugly but incredibly poorly optimised. Unless you're running the sort of rig that wouldn't look out of place on the goddam Starship Enterprise be prepared for some slideshow gaming here and there.So why has it sold 3 million+ copies? Well in my mind it comes down to one major factor there is a huge void in the market for accessible pick up and play co op games especially for those looking to get some sort of PvP fix. I mean what are your alternatives? MOBA's specialize in destroying friendships rather than fortifying them and MMORPGs are about as good for you as a crack habit but PUBG? The games are quick the atmosphere is relaxed and the game is conceptually extremely simple to grasp.If you're one of the twelve people left out there who have not yet purchased PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS I'd honestly tell you to hold onto your money at 30USD a pop the overwhelming technical issues and mediocre gameplay just can't justify the pricetag at this point in time but let's be honest Bluehole Studios have already made more money than God at this point in time so who really gives a toss what I have to say on the matter.

review: PUBG had the potential to be a modern solo team shooter masterpiece. The game keeps you wanting more it's fun ridiculous at times involves a high degree of tactical planning and skill and hosts one of the most diverse player communities i've seen in a game. But here's what it lacks. The game is poorly optimized all over the place. Frame drops are to be expected and can even ruin your efforts in a match at the most random of times. There's a major lack of content when it comes to the world guns vehicles and equiptment/gear. Rather than focus on improving performance issues to maintain stability the devs have been adding PAID content?!?! As if the game hasn't made enough money from it's 5 million steam sales now it has a paid loot system with absolutely NO NECESSITY execpt for MAKING THE DEVS MORE MONEY. Okay so great the devs have gotten more money from PC gamers supporting them this would be great if their focus was to improve the pc version of the game drasstically. But no alas the devs are investing our hard spent money into a console version of the same alpha that we've come to love. ALL game devs like Playeruknown dream of making a wonderfull came that brings both joy and financial profit. But right now Battlegrounds seems to be bringing only the profit as it lets down the gamers who hope to see a this game become a crucial part of the pc gaming shooter community.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Oh Boy where do I start. I honestly can say that I have put enough time in this game to make an honest review. First I feel like I shouldn't need a PC that GOD himself had put together to be able to run this game. I would like to think I have a mid tier PC and its a miracle if I even get 40 frames on pretty much all low settings. I am not the person to put all my money into a machine that is for entertainment purposes. I would also like to say that I can run a game such as SIEGE 60 frames all on high plus that is a pretty game. This looks like cottage cheese someone threw up on a hot sidewalk. Basically it looks like I will give credit where credit is due they are TRYING to update this game but I can already seeing it being another DAYZ stay in early access for years to come just as an excuse. I am also not going to tell you to play H1Z1 either. Overall I enjoy H1 SOOO much more than this POS but that is where I stand. All in All if you like server lag and "updates" that dont seem to do much. You will love this game. But if you are normal and would like to enjoy games that actually WORK I would pass on this one....for now.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Never do reviews but since most of the negative reviews have come from reddit spewing their nonsense I thought I would write one. First yes micro transactions are going to be a thing for cosmetic items not sure why anyone thinks this is an issue since it does not affect the game in anyway. Second the game has been in EA for a bit now and has come leaps and bounds from where it started with weekly patches and major monthly updates which most games would kill for that are in EA. The devs have had a pretty clear direction with some turns that are unexepected but that is going to happen during development.With the release of 1st Person servers this even give more people an oppurtunity to enjoy the game with no 3rd person advantage from corners. With even more good things on the way like vaulting im not sure why people are upset at the game. Yes there are still bugs that are actively being worked on and being fixed along the way but its an EA game still.100% recommend the game if you like shooters in general and like a competetive nature of a shooter. If you are waiting for full release I would also totally understand but still not a reason to dislike the game because of the bugs currently in EA.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ignore those people saying do not buy this game cuz they broke a promise. As I have read they will use those money to fund the Gamescom event prize pool and charity. So what now? They will just use their own money to produce the whole event?Back to the game I really recommend it. Tho the game is in early access and you will experience how to be stuck on a door sounds not accurate etc. But we can actively see that the devs are trying their best to keep up with the issues with weekly fixes monthly updates etc.In this game you will become a true hunter that leaves no mark of your existence.You will become a bear mauling your pans on the face of the enemies.You will become a horse and tirelessly run across the battlefield.You will become a marksman aiming for the heads of those brave ones running on an open wheat field.You will become a rock and wait for that unlucky one to enter your domain.You will become a snek and wiggle your body while on prone to avoid detection.Yeah so far so good. Buy it now and join the ultimate battle royale. See you in game hunter.

review: Runs terribly for how it looks. Probably because the game was made by modders not game developers. RNG based system where skill is rendered almost pointless either be the first one to find a gun or have better loot than your opponents. It doesn't matter how skilled you are chances are you will lose a fight when you have a machete and your opponent has a shotgun. Not to mention how many times you get sniped without even seeing a single person. With randomized loot safe zones bomb drops etc. it makes fun randomized. When I won it took some serious luck. (Great randomized teammate knew what he was doing lucky safe zone that played in my favor loot and guns that played in my favor etc.) If you want to win more play as a coward and camp until the zone pushes you along. Then find another place to camp avoiding all conflict possible. Rinse repeat.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Gutes Spielkonzept. Es würde auch Spaß machen alleine oder mit Freunden wenn die Server nicht von irgendwelchen inkompetenten Japsen in Nordkorea welche für ihre Arbeit mit einer Vergewaltigung bezahlt werden würden. Die Server laufen nämlich wirkloich extrem schlecht. Mit Glück kann man in 1 von 10 Fällen einen Gegner anvisieren bevor er sich aus dem Nichts vor dich teleportiert und dich sofort tötet ohne auch nur irgendein Geräusch. Außerdem gibt es mittlerweile mit der neuen Map Miramar unzählige neue Bugs die das Spiel unspielbar machen. Mein persönlicher Favorit ist dass man einfach aus dem nichts sich nicht mehr bewegen kann die einzige Option die man dann noch hat ist zu quitten (10/10 Gameplay). Dementsprechend kann ich nur sehr von einem Kauf abraten solange sich keiner um diese Server kümmert btw E sports ready.LG ein nur teilweise getriggeter Spieler

review: This is the most well made bug free game i have ever experienced. Very realistic graphics and gameplay but don't try and play it in 4k or it will break your monitor from the number of screen tearing and resolution stutter. The game is very balanced. I once shot a kid with no helmet 4 times in the head with a sniper rifle and he did not die as you would expect the kid ended up dying to a pistol from 300m away in about 3 4 shots minutes later. You just can't find any other game with that kind of realism. The sounds in the game are like no other as u can be getting shot from the east but hear it in the west just as u would if u were being shot at in real life. Sometimes when you're running you can hear the sound of a buggy constantly ringing in your ear as if u are about to take a tire up the but then u turn around and realize it was of a buggy 2000m away on a hill. The game truly begins to reach its full potential once u get on a raining server. The game intensifies by 10x due to the fact that u can't hear footsteps vehicles airdrops or gunshots. Just the ever so present sound of rain and wind ing your ear drums. The game has 2 main servers NA and Asia. If u want a real challenge asian servers are key. Your ping lowers by about 85% and you won't understand anything anyone is saying in the pregame chat which i find to personally be the best part of the game. If a bunch of chinese noodle slurpers hyped up on soy sauce playing a highly competitive battle royale game in 15 fps doesn't scare you i'm not sure what will.The game can be very slow to start but makes sure to pick up the pace rapidly as u are constantly being chased by a giant blue electric field readying to bend u over and closing u into a smaller zone of players. In most cases you'll only have a UMP and if ur lucky a crossbow going up against three M249s and a korean kid with an AWM ghillie suit and a $200 mouse. Seems like a bad situation right? wrong. The crossbow shoots a bolt that does more damage than the .50 magnum rounds shot from the awp. Not to mention it's completely silent. Most developers would make airdrop items valuable and most powerful but PUBG has found a creative way to make the UMP the best gun in the game and spawn it in 2 rooms of every house making for a very balanced multiplayer experienced. As its in early access you'd expect some bugs and glitches right? wrong again. PUBG is the only game i have ever played to not contain any bugs or glitches. PUBG can guarantee you that you will never spawn in without the vision of buildings and structures or fall through the floor on a rainy but NOT LAGGY server. Once i was climbing a 1000m 90 degree sea cliff in the middle of a thunderstorm as the game allows and i reached the top only to get stuck on one tree and a rock in a field and instantly die to falling damage while having two ARs an AR suppressor and a SR suppressor. After raging for what i thought was a bug i found on the PUBG forum that it was not a bug but a fundamental part of the game. This was implemented because in real life when u jump on a rock next to a tree u have the possibility of falling off the rock into the tree and splitting your head open. This game effect is rare but triples its chances in rain. As you can tell the game is very optimized and well past its time compared to other FP shooters. A game filled with looting gunfights parachutes diversely cultured pregame lobbies but never swimming. After my long and fun filled experience with PUBG i feel it is my job to you to recommend this game to any and all fellow steamers. It will be the best $30 youve ever and will ever spend. Unless u play 3rd person.This review is not sponsored by PUBG or Nike.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After 1000 hours I think I have come to the following conclusion This game definately needs the time and money from developers to make for a better performance on the servers. If you do not have a very good pc (Processor and graphics card) it may not always be fun to play. Lag rubberbanding and d sync are problems you will run into. But let's all face it. The hate this game receives is simply due to the fact that everyone wants to play this but many people want it to run smooth af. It is exciting competetive infuriating satisfying and well in short an emotional rollercoaster everyone wants a piece off. And understandably this game gets the nomination for game of the year. Buy this If you can get past the problems that arise every now and then (just make sure you have a high end pc). It will give you many many hours of awesome gameplay that will make your heart pounce and your hands shake. So even with all the problems that still need fixing this game is for sure worth the 30 euros you need to cough up if you want to buy it. Have fun! And for all you warriors that will buy the game I will see you on the battlegrounds just before I put a 7.62 round through your head!

review: Do you enjoy multiplayer games with the worst latency and hit registration possible? Do you enjoy being forced to play games online with no one who speaks your language? Do you enjoy being forced to play in servers that are an astronomical distance from you? Do you enjoy talent and skill being replaced by a random dice roll chance when it comes to weapons and equipment? Do you enjoy playing games with no incentive to keep playing regardless of the fact that it is 2018 and performanced based unlocks have been a thing for well over a decade? Is your computer capable of playing every other triple A title flawlessly but you'd like a DirectX 9 looking potato to completely brick it it back down to an inconsistant 40 FPS at 1080?The only incentive to playing this game is loot crates with cosmetic items. The majority of which require $2.50 just to open and you'll just get common gray duplicates. I've finally stopped being stupid enough to give these idiots more money. The hackers farm the BP points and sell the skins for redicoulous amounts of money. After over 500 hours cut between the THREE... yes THREE versions of this game (Main Test Server and Test Test Server) I've received one item that is rated higher than common and hundreds of duplicates. It's obvious that developers are giving themselves these items and selling them on steam market place. Look at the user names who purchase them! There is ZERO incentive to winning the matches when reaching Top 10 has the same exact pay out. In order to climb the leader boards into the top 1% you just have to make Top 10 in every match. EASY. Hit registration is a joke! You can litterally watch your bullet go right through someone's head and hit the objects behind them! It's not rare it's the ing norm! CQB is a joke with this kind of latency. You can drop on the same house every single game and never get the same loot. Sounds good right? No.. it's not. You spend almost 5 min just trying to get into a game only to land and spend a few minutes franticly running around looking for a weapon only to be gunned down by dude who rolled a lucky number and ended up in a house with a full kit. Now you're back at the home screen waiting for it to connect to a server waiting for it to fill up waiting for the air plane to take all ing day to fly across the map. I'm not even going to get started in the t of landing in an area with no vehicle and being killed by the zone because you where forced to walk a map that is stupid big for no reason outside of just wanting to be large. What's funny is how easy all of these problems should be to fix for anyone who has realistic game development exsperence. The developers are amature at best or this game would have made some actual progress over the past year. It still feels exactly the same as it did when I first purchased it.It's like they watched DayZ unfold with no burned people where by it and said "Hold my beer and watch this" *released PUBG and announces Xbox port* STOP GIVING THESE PEOPLE YOUR MONEY FOR NOTHING IN RETURN.

review: Addictive tense and above all fun to play. The game is in alpha so there are a few optimisation issues glitches and bugs but these are generally few and far between. Some are having server issues but the EU servers tend to be stable and relatively lag free.The concept is solid building on earlier Arma 3 mods and similar game types and is essentially a 100 person 'King of the Hill' set in large open world map reminiscent of late 1980s Soviet Block states. Parachute in grab some loot tool up and fight it out in an ever reducing area until only one person is left. What's not to like?The execution is also solid despite being in alpha. Of course there are going to be issues... that's the point of alpha. Some of the weapons need balancing some of the gear looks a bit a few more maps would be nice but the game itself look good and plays well and doesn t really feel like its still in alpha. Playing with a friend or group of friends in a team is definitely the most rewarding and entertaining experience.Its the first game I've played for a while that really gets the palms sweating and heart racing where each decision can make or break you... when you're down to just three players and you're hanging on my the skin of your teeth inside a tiny circle. That's when you know you're getting your moneys worth. Ultimately the response of the devs to the feedback from this early access testing will make or break this game on final release. The issues some are experiencing especially server issues in China are pretty poor and there needs to be a bit more variety to ensure longevity.Definitely recommend at the moment maybe over a nice single malt (something light like a Dalwhinnie or Strathisla) and with friends. 8/10

review: When I got this game I wasn't sure what to expect. There was a lot of Early access games that had already disappointed me beyond belief such as Dayz H1Z1 The culling just to name a few but after I got this game all my expectations were met. The developers actually talk to the player base the game is fairly balance and it gets you on edge from the second you drop off the plane. Sure it has flaws lots of them for what it s worth such as immense lag at the beginning of games the poor optimization of the game (Bad frames in a lot of cities) and it has a fair share of hackers on the game but to be honest if this dropped as a completed game and with full price I would still be satisfied with what I ve got. The game is on early access and for the first time in a while I actually think the developers will come through with the problems that the game already has and then repair and keep adding new stuff. I will keep supporting the development of the game and I m sure the final product will be even more worth the money that it cost.

review: The rules are simple 100 poor human beings scared to death are dropped into a confined area with random lethal weapons scattered around and only the one last survivor is allowed to leave alive. (Use your imagination to figure out what happens next. No you bakka! They will NOT happily live together in peaceful harmony until they die of old age!)The game is fun as hell despite only 1% probability of winning. You're dying almost all the time but you still want to try it again and again. You can take lots of potentially rewarding but at the same time potentially deadly risks. (Should I hide in a small house and sit still or should I run around and search for weapons but risk being killed? Thould I walk slowly and carefully or should I take a fast car but risk being heared and... uuum... killed?) You are always forced to make decisions and never have time to think. The gameplay is kinda addictive due to the tension and paranoia you have to feel all the time since you can suddenly be killed at any moment. You're very vulnerable and even with the best armor it takes only "two seconds instead of the regular one second" to kill you. Everybody is your enemy and wants you to be dead ASAP. It's Counter Strike on steroids.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Invested 500 hours into game since purchased in July. The updates and growth of chinese player base in the last few months spoiled what was a unique battle royal. Ping lock is needed but the developers insist on not implementing it. No system of muting or seeing other player names in lobby. It would be nice to know how many hackers with random number names are in the lobby. No firing range or custom games for average players to test new content and learn the map. Map layout has many areas to get trapped or glitched into.

review: Bug Unknown Glitchgrounds is another clone of Day Z. If you had your doubts about the latter steer away from this.This is supposed to be a survival shooter and the shooting aspect of it is the most underwhelming. Controlling your character feels like riding an elephant floaty and laggy lacking any precision and snappiness. This glitches and poor aiming makes firefights a russian roulette of who's going to glitch out the most.At this stage it's just a shell of a game and I doubt we'll see any radical improvements as final release hits. I'd love to be proven wrong though.

It's very disingenuous of a publisher to say it's a one time thing to pay for a competition and they need the money when a small team has made over 100M gross. Say no to microtransactions from the start otherwise every aspect of the game will be monetised. We start with cosmetic skins for a one time event in summer 2017 summer 2018 we'll have paid drops which only contain top tier weapons and specials.Say no to monetisation and microtransactions from the start. Do not support this game.

review: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds.... Gotta say this game has its moments.Some games i want to punch a hole through my screen Some games i nearly die laughing to Some games make me want to celebrate something and party.Overall this game is a slow paced rage inducing nightmare where 100 people go onto an island and plan to murder eachother.I'm not an experienced reviewer as i know nothing about writing them but as a regular player that has sunken 100+ hours into this game i think it's worthy for a good review. Active Developers who are trying to make this game a lot better than it already is yes there are some bugs.. But they seem to get rid of them at a moderate speed. (hell of a lot faster than AAA titles)I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys massive battle arena type games yes it's slow paced if you don't land near people yes it may take a lot of running (just hit " ") but when you actually find people to play with it can be a lot of fun with lots of laughs. Good luck and go get yourself some Chicken Dinner's.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Before you buy beware of these huge issues

review: Been playing for about a week now and I am very impressed so far. Dont waste anymore time reading reviews just buy it. This game is such a simple idea but keeps you very entertained. First game I have ever played where I dont care if I get 1st or 99th place. Its just fun to mess around. Best way to descibe the game is its the hunger games with guns. My only complaint is the red zone that forces players to move closer together moves to fast. I mean this in two ways it litterally moves to fast to where it is hard to out run it. The other way I mean is the time between zone changes is way to short in my opinion. It doesnt give enough time to loot and get dug in for some sweet camping kills. I get it that some people want a fast pace game that only takes 15min per match but I say if you want that go play CoD. It should take time and strategy to kill 99 other players.

review: Product received for free. Not worth 30 USD in its current state. Once out of alpha and moves onto full release (if it ever does that is) I'd say sure. It's a high maybe.Pros Love how you can quickly enter new games after previous one ends so quickly. Almost no waiting. Squad setup system is wonderful and easy to use and perfect for friends. Basic rules and understanding of game mode. Visually pleasing and right on with sound(mostly) and "realism"Cons The lag and rubber band along with the constant crashes really kills the game. Getting stuck in the parachute upon landing and hovering inchs off grouind has happened to many times. Makes getting to high targeted areas almost impossible due to getting shot at when you havent even landed. Low section of weapons water and background sounds glitch and create a deafening noise only 1 game mode as far as non custom games go.Point is I know the game is in alpha but to charge so much for a game that is 2/3 missing is awful. It has great potential and I hope to see it grow however it seems the trend for most games is to bank as much off "alpha" builds before the company bails.

review: This game was good for its release but with every update the game just got exponentially worse. The game was praised at first but when any company that releases an early access game and gets that amount of money in weeks god knows that the game was already done for.We were promised many things but all we got was micro transactions when Bluehole literally said there will not be any transactions at all. Any money invested in this game is pointless now since they'll only invest into the most useless things such as esports and crates so they can make extra money. Anything that was anounced beforehand will probably not come out until a year after since their top priority is money.Feelsbad when an early access game starts off strong but failed to accomodate to any of the consumer's needs. Just don't buy this game until it's either fixed or on sale but niether of those will happen even when you see every game on steam on sale this game won't be.

review: PUBG is the best Battle Royale game out there by far measured by gameplay alone. This review is being left on the final day of Early Access. After putting over 700 in game hours into PUBG I can 100% recommend it to people as long as they know what they're getting into. Battle Royale games can have a big learning curve but once you get over that curve there's a damn fine game waiting for you. PUBG's Art Style gunplay and playerbase make this the best Battle Royale out there today. I plan on putting hundreds of more hours into this game going forward.

review: The game was actually a lot of fun when Battle Royale was a whole new concept and I got back to playing it when they added the new map (December 2017). Since then it's been a downhill ride of cheaters Server Problems desync etc. and Bluehole decided not to invest their resources into fixing their ing game not into adding new content (as in guns or maps they did add like 2 new guns and announced a new map finally after a 6 month drought) they did not expand their staff with the mountains of cash this game generated they chose to add more ing LOOTBOXES (they even added some that need keys to make you pay twice for that 0.0000001% chance to get a rare item) and SKINS and EMOTES which not a single person even asked for.That's leaving aside the performance issues other people experienced (I have a i5 8600K 6x4.8GHz and a GTX1080 that could handle it in 2k at 90 140 FPS which is playable with GSync) and which always seemed to come back to the game with each new patch.Paying 30 bucks for it was maybe worth it back in the beginning but honestly? If you want a Battle Royale to have fun with for 100hrs and then uninstall it play Fortnite. This s free so you can't get scammed by the Devs at least.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pubg has done something that many games have not done in the recent years. Gaming has always been about feeling something and thats why people love gaming so much. Not only is gaming an escape from real world problems...but its something that can bring great joy. But I think many games today have lost some of there joy because they never properly punish you for your mistakes. For example games like call of duty star wars battlefront ect. These games don't punish you for dying if you die in them you can instantly respawn. If you die there is hardly any pain in that death. Which means there is hardly any joy when you get a kill. "When you give up pain...you inevitably give up joy". It would be like deciding to not buy a puppy because you know you will out live it and will half to witness its death. NO!(that is not how the world works). Even though you know you will watch its death...you still buy the puppy. Because you know the years before its death will bring great joy and will outway the pain of its death. Call of duty and games like it are the equivalent of not buying the puppy. And this is why I think pubg has exploded onto the scene like it has. Pubg does BUY THE PUPPY! You will have many deaths that will bring pain because when you do die it has real world consequences. But when you finally do win it brings great joy because there has been many struggles before it. When you win you feel something that you have been longing for. It brings a great adrenaline rush. Personaly for me it has been very a refreshing expierense. If you want to talk about the technacle side of the game I really enjoy how the long to mid range combat feels. My biggest complaint is that the close range compat feels abit lacking. And if you are a concidering buying either h1z1 or pubg(being a person that owns both games) I would consider h1z1 being more like a "Marvel" movie where it feels more arcadic because it doesn't take itself super serious. It's like a marvel movie has its intense moments but it also cracks a joke here and then. On the other hand I would consider pubg to be a "DC Commics" movie where it takes itself more serious.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Everyone sees the obvious appeal that this game offers one way or another whether it be through obvious platforms like Twitch or Youtube or if they were just legitimately curious because they looked at the Steam page. Regardless of what provoked people to buy the game I can say that it is in no way shape or form worth that bulky $30 price tag. The idea of a fun game is there but the execution leaves a lot to be desired. With problems ranging from unstable servers unoptimized game performance dull gameplay and the questionable behavior of the devs PUBG is an incomplete game and will most likely stay that way for a long while. There are other games out there that provide a better experience and more unique gameplay for way lower prices sometimes even being available for FREE. Unfortunately by the time I realized all the previously mentioned issues I had too much game time invested to refund this. If you're on the fence about this game don't get it. Go look at other games with this concept that are handled way better and can deliver more bang for your buck. $30 effectively wasted.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Development seems promising with regular patches and good communication from the Development Team. PUBG seems to have taken lessons from it's predecessors and is setting a new standard for "Battle Royal" survival type games. If you're looking for a solo or multiplayer game with low commitment (no grind / no pay2win / no "leveling up") high intensity gameplay that will have you riding the elation and disgruntled regret rollar coaster with every game session.. this is the game for you.

Spot guy to my right killed in seconds. Spots another guy right infront of me. Switch gun to full auto and let loose. Get first Solo Chicken Dinner Rip Car 2017 2017 you will be missed. 10/10 Best Driving Simulator I own.

review: TL DRIs the game worth buying? YesDoes it have replayability? YesHow much? I've played this game nearly every day. It can be just a one match kind of night or multiple matches.PUBG has been one of the if not the early access title I've ever played. I've purchased this game for two of my friends who were reluctant in playing early access games and battle royale type games. They can't put the game down.I have never come across another game that has given a more exhilirating heart pounding ending when it comes down to the top 10 players of the match. There is a lot of RNG in the game but there are definitely ways to mitigate the damage that the RNG can bring.I highly recommend playing the game regardless of the outside "debacles" that Bluehole/PLAYERUNKNOWN has been a part of recently. If you like shooters you'll love this game.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have to say at least as is I just can not recommend this game. I understand I haven't exactly played a lot of it and I'v only had the game a few hours but here's why I can't recommend it Good features Nice engine graphical looks etc. Feels realistic... if it doesn't lag Nice movement and vehicle system though driving is a tad sensitive Nice options menu something which seems to be rare in early access games Bad features Lags like hell seriously this game randomly lags all the time no matter how good or bad your framerate is. It really destroys the experience esepcially when you're killing someone and a second later you're on the ground dead without the ability to do anything about it. Optimization is quite horrific two people could have the same graphics card and RAM but one will get 60FPS and the other wil be lucky to get out with 40. Had this happen to me and a friend just moments ago. Combat is... alright but could be improved especially accuracy of melee wepons (fists and frying pans especially) Steam friends/party system is pretty bad I could only invite 2 of the 4 friends I know who have it and the two of them were said to be offline even thoughthey weren't. They had to send invitations to me because the game on my side said they were offline and wouldn't let me invite people. A ton of little things such as the fact that you can't pick up ammo while being shot at that really get on your nerves especially in combat. It's a big mess. Cheating is a big big BIG problem with this game. People cheat their maps clothing and even weapons to death. While yes the developers are getting on top of a couple of the issues they haven't really solved much. I have been closely monitoring this game for a couple months now and the cheating problem is better but not by much. Overall PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds isn't necessarily a bad game. The big problem is just certain Early Access issues I guess. However with this game being out for as long as it has I expected a lot better optimization and a lot better qualiy of life in the game. Unfortunately this is not the case and I am sad to report I will be requesting my first game refund. I may pick this game back up later but not until at least a majority of these issues are addressed and the game itself is officially out of Early Access.

review: I have a decent rig.i7 7700kGTX 107016 GB Ram1080p very low 48 fps average. The game is hardly playable on my laptop with a gtx 1060 with lag spikes. This is my first game to have a problem on either of my machines. Nice game but negative review until they optimize it. For the people wondering I've tried all the tricks out there launch options ultra low mods and so on. With lowspecgamers (never thought my rig would be considered "low spec" but anyway.) recent mod I get an average of 75 fps but seriously? Do I really need to do that? Might change in the future.EDIT 1 New update boosted my fps to around 60 at medium high 720p with dips to only 48 50 when things get intense or I'm looking at a vast field or something. But I still expect my 1070 to play every modern game at atleast 1080p. If my 1070 can't keep up I pity the people with cards not as powerful. Until I can run it properly on my 1060 laptop it's a negative review.EDIT 2 After the 1.0 update Nvidia 388.71 drivers and using an SSD I'm getting very playable framerates (always 60+) on both my PC and Laptop ) I recommend this game!

review: Great game overall. Optimization in the Asia Server is widely received(Players from NA/EU are playing in the Asia Server too) Great DEVs for listening to the community with constant patches greatly improving gameplay each time mehAn In depth review for gamers still undecided. Special thanks to http //steamcommunity.com/id/aps97 for a well constructed detailed review.IntroductionPLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG) is a battle royale 100 players open world MMOFPS/TPS set on a massive 8x8km land. The game supports solo duo and squad (3 4 ppl) play. Gameplay is very straightforward you hop off a plane loot weapons armors and equipments from buildings and survive the thrilling PvP bloodbath.PUBG is obviously not the first massive battle royale game out there yet it stands on the pinnacle of its genre. As you may have known PUBG has had a highly successful launch securing a place on Steam's Top Seller game. If you're looking for a good battle royale PvP look no further. You've struck the gold.My claim is not without reason. The following is PUBG's pros and cons in my opinion Pros1. Extremely active and communicative developers. This is vital for an early access game. PUBG is being constantly updated every month. I would speculate that this is one of the major factors in PUBG's success. Other battle royale PvP games are mostly in Early Alpha for years and their devs are too focused on gathering as much money as they can from the current players without making any real development progress on the game PUBG is exactly the opposite.2. Great gameplay concept. No pay to win and no grind to win. Apparels are only cosmetics. The only thing you keep from playing PUBG is your skill. The PvP is thrilling and definitely fun to play with your friends.3. Non toxic community. Simply because there is no chat function. Switch your voice channel to team only and you're good to go. I wouldn't recommend teaming up with strangers because of obvious reasons.4. Highly demanding on teamwork and strategy. You can't just hop off the plane and recklessly run around the map no scoping bozos. A learning curve definitely exists not too steep and not too lean. 5. A shooting game that applies semi realistic weapon recoil and bullet drop is always appreciated.6. Various vehicles weapons weapon mods clothings and equipments are scattered all over the battleground to aid you in your quest of survival. The weapon stats variety amps up the gameplay It can be quite a challenge to engage in a firefight when you got the wrong weapon for the situation.7. Although FPS is not recommended due to limited POV the game supports both FPS and TPS.Cons1. Currently very performance demanding. The game isn't optimized that well yet and runs on very low fps even on high end rigs. The minimum 6 gigs of RAM is an absolute minimum virtual RAMs can't help your 4 gigs RAM PC. In terms of GPU one of my friends that is using a GTX980 is suffering from &lt 30fps and extremely slow loading progress. Another friend with a GTX1060 suffers from fps drops during rain/smoke. I also suffer from extreme fps spikes with my GTX1080.As a response to comments' feedback for my 1st cons list The game is still playable on all those mentioned GPUs. I just want you to know that the game is not optimized well. FPS drops crashes and screen freeze will sometimes happen even on high end rigs. It happens randomly I don't measure the frequency.2. Server is lagging badly due to high player base. I would speculate devs didn't expect a huge sale boom and didn't have the resources to support all the players. As an example you were running to cover when under enemy fire. You already reached the cover but 2 seconds later blood spurts out of your chest you fell down to the ground gasping for air as your vision starts to blur. You scream for your squadmate to magically heal your bullet wound by rubbing the grass around you but then...okay you get my point3. Gameplay is monotonous. Similar to CSGO and Dota 2 you only have one type of game. The unique experience relies on various encounters with the squad/enemy in game.4. Melee weapons are terribly inaccurate. Aiming also can be a bit off sometimes. Possibly caused by the server lag.5. Controls are terribly not reactive. It takes some miliseconds for the game to recognize LMB/RMB/'Use' command. Or even failing to recognize the commands at all. It can take three four RMBs to activate the scope. It's kind of annoying when the weapon refuses to shoot when I press LMB because of the input recognition lag. This is a vital issue for a PvP game devs better fix this quickly.As a response to the comments' feedback I have to add that my statement about the terrible control is a rare occasion. Generally 1 or 2 key inputs would be recognized. I would say having to press twice is much more common than 3/4 times like I said. But it does often take some miliseconds for the inputs to be recognized. My point is still valid The controls are NOT reactive horrible for a PvP game.6. Vehicles flips too easily and difficult/too unrealistic to driveConclusionDon't lose all hopes because of my cons list remember that this is an early access game. I know some of the cons can be too much to handle and disturbs the gameplay but devs are very active in updating the game. I dare to conclude that PUBG is currently the best battle royale MMOFPS/TPS PvP game out there. The current state of the game is more than playable. Definitely worth purchasing even when it's not on sale.Well that's all I have to say about PUBG. Hope it can be of help to potential buyers!P.S I already addressed my low playtime hours issue in the comments section. Please kindly read all the comments if you believe my playtime hours is insufficient to write a review.UPDATE Never expected my review would go up top on Most Helpful for this game. So I've decided to not take down this review after having more playtime hours. I'll update it if there're any significant changes.

review: Big performance issues with occasional crashes and not really interesting gameplay for solo play. Spawn in plane listen to insane noises you didnt thought humans can produce while they think they are being funny. Jump. Run around roll the dice for what gods of internetz spawned for your starting equipment relocate closer to circle. If you lucky kill a guy who wasnt expecting you. Run closer to circle. Die to a random person who happened to be at his "camp and look around" state when you run out of cover not expecting him or sneak inside building as silent as you can and die to a random person with shotgun camping in the corner waiting for you. Repeat.Listen to weird noises. Deactivate voice chat. Jump. Land near a random guy with machine gun. Punch him run after him laughing for the sillyness of it (the lag and performance issues made my running and jumping around to hard for him to hit me). Kill him with your fists get his machine gun. Take some more equipment laying nearby. Run closer to circle. Die to a sniper fire from 2 directions. Repea game crashed. Game blocking the view of task manager. Log out windows user. Repeat.Spawn jump search run kill unsuspecting guy die. Think why you are even playing this game. Ask for refund.

review: 7/10 I'd rate it. The game is good but the downside is that being an North Americaner there are a lot of people of Asian descent you end up playing with which makes the cultural and language barrier hard when you're trying to team up with them. They really should region lock this game... of the entire time I've been playing I've only been paired up once with an american.Another downside is that the game has one primary game mode which is a fast paced "Hunger Games" style. It would be nice to see something that requires more time and strategy to win or just an open survivor game to where you could bleed others slowly and make it more of a chase rather than a 15 minute rush round.

review: Played for over 200 hours and alpha/beta tested this early access game. I enjoyed it quite thoroughly. Ultimately the developer sold out to microsoft for xbox exclusive and patches slowed down to a crawl. My largest gripe with this developer and game is that they went on record saying that the use of Autohotkey for button mapping like crouch jump or mousewheel to fire were not bannable. Proof https //i.imgur.com/kjYmwlY.pngI was just recently banned for what I assume was the crouch jumping and using mwheel to shoot they won't tell you why. At minimum they should have made an in game announcement that all .ini tweaks and macro programs running in the background were going to be prohibited. They did no such thing. First Don't buy this game based on the ethics and practices of the developer. 2nd don't buy it for lack of developer updates.

review: I'll give PUBG a positive rating overall albeit there is a bit to be desired still.The game can be pretty punishing in solo queue if you don't know what you're doing. Otherwise if you can generally survive until there are only about 20 people remaining the game can become super intense in a good way... or at least until you get sniped by someone across the map. But getting to BE that person who snipes another and take out all their progress up to that point if in my opinion worth those times you're the one being shot at. Getting kills in the game is satisfying and frustrating at the same time. The game tries to put on a face of realism in some ways but does the opposite in others. As an example healing in the game is ultimately dependant on the type of healing items you have with you and bandages are pretty useless in the grand scheme of things because of the high amount of time they take to use and the little amount of healing they accomplish.The gun variety is ok in a mediocre sense. Honestly once you find an assault rifle and/or a sniper the handguns shotguns and smgs basically become worthless by the end game. And I don't know if anyone else has this problem but the shotguns seem wildly sporadic with their accuracy which is peculiar for such a powerful close range weapon.Overall the game is more enjoyable to play with friends but can still be enjoyed if you're willing to put in the time and effort to git gud.On a side note with the most recent update apparently the devs of the game decided to break their promise on what they were going to do while in early access but I'm not as bugged by it as others even if it was pretty bad to lie outright to your playerbase like that. Hopefully this doesn't prove to be a signal for the future as the game has a lot of potential for future content.

review: I'm back for more! I'm editing my review to be more specific and less whiny. Hopefully you all fnd this helpful. Quick summary would not recommend unless you are playing with friends. I'll point out some specific gripes I have with this game now.Cons Cars and bikes with sometimes flip over the smallest rocks or ridges leading to damage or death. Not a fun way to go in my opinion especially when it's out of your control. I seem to have a lot of trouble with the server and lag in this game something I don't have trouble with (except very infrequently) in my other games. This is a constant every game occurence and has been responsible for my death multiple times. A more personal con is that this game doesn't seem to balance excitement very well. By this I mean that I can go 99% of the game without seeing anyone and then get shot and killed by someone I never see. Or get into a very brief firefight and have the game be over. It just seems to me that you spend almost the entire game gearing up for a big fight only to die rather quickly. It's not a waste of time but it definitely feels like I could have spent my time better. Don't get me wrong its a fun concept and it is early access which is why I'm still playing it. I've decided to give it until a little past release and if the devs fix the issues then I'll keep playing. If not I'll put the game down and most likely won't miss it much.All in all would not recommend for someone unless they are playing with close friends or are willing to take a gamble on the devs fixing quite a few issues.Editing to state that in my past few games I have had extensive periods of network lag leading to myself and my partner being unable to play. In my last game it was a total of 9 minutes with the longest period being two minutes. Incredibly frustrating to say the least.

review: You know there's a lot of games that get a lot of hype. Some of those games really just don't live up to expectations and others well others go above and beyond. PUBG is definitely a game that soars above expectations and really delivers an amazing multiplayer experience. PUBG really puts a new twist on shooter combat and creates an intense drive for players to survive down to the last man. And yes before you ask there are single duo and 4 player queues available. PUBG doesn't force you to play with random strangers if you don't WANT to play with random strangers they even let you choose to only hear your squad's voicechat if you so wish! There's also a ranking system but instead of making the game more stressful it only drives the player to succeed. You can approach the game with stealthy slow tactics or just run in willy nilly and try to take all the enemies down with you. This game offers a genuinely enjoyable multiplayer experience whether you enjoy tactics or chaos playing on your own or working on a team FPS combat or third person shooter combat playing casually or hardcore.

review: Edit#2 Few months later. Same old thing. Hackers / lag switches insane. It's still a fun game. But its only fun 2 out of 3 games. I have video proof of a Headshot Punch from across a field lol. And that's just the start. Just keep'n it real. Edit)) Game is so flooded with hackers its insane lol. Even for a Pc game. 10 out of 10 stars. Its gone down hill fast... SadThe game itself is fun enough. Good concept decent controlls ect. The problem with this game is the poor security. A large number of players use what is called a "lagg switch" to kill you when you can not see or attack them. And what seems like an even larger number flat out hack the game with a "radar" to locate all players on the map. I have video proof of those of thees types of players many times over. I have tried to post them on the Pubg Forum But they keep getting removed. That alone would be enough for me to give this game a poor review. But It is afterall still in "beta" But when I found out that the game developers are removing all proof of hackers and cheaters from their face book and forum I lost it. That's straight up deception lol. If they don't want every one to know the game is full of hackers in its current state why not fix the game ? rather than just delete all posts pertaining to the problem ? lol ? ((as of 9/20/2017 ZERO out of TEN stars))3/3/2018 HACKERS HACKERS HACKERSHACKERS HACKERS HACKERSHACKERS HACKERS HACKERSHACKERS HACKERS HACKERSHACKERS HACKERS HACKERSHACKERS HACKERS HACKERSHACKERS HACKERS HACKERSHACKERS HACKERS HACKERSHACKERS HACKERS HACKERS7/22/2018 Some things never change...

review: Product received for free. Honestly I cant reccomend this game to anyone at this stage of develpment. There are so many issues with this game that should have been fixed by now. I understand that this game is a early access but these issues should have been fixed before the game even came out. If I were to pick between PUBG and H1Z1 H1Z1 would get my vote as of right now. I really want to like this game but there are too many small issues that push me away. Also what is this whole thing with the streamers calling anyone who kills them a stream sniper? Like get a grip you got killed fairly. Suck it up and dont go cry to the devs. Save your $30 and use it on a better game where the devs dont side with all the crying streamers. I am willing to change my review when things get better but it seems unlikely.

review: Lets put it this way if you don't have time to dedicate to this game go home. Not that you need time to be amazing at it once you know the items and which attactments goes to what guns you get a grip on where to land depending on your playstyle and tweak the graphics settings so you don't get twitchy frame rate drops you're basically set to have fun. There in lies the time commitment though once you've got a grasp on how to be good then it's a race to the top. At least for myself that is I prefer the survival type of gaming not only because i'm not the best sniper as of yet but your kill rank contributes only 20% to your overall ranking so staying alive no matter what is more important in order to climb in rank and if you're good at that then 20 25 minutes per game is standard. And this game always leaves you wanting more.For those of you who are in it for the gun play and long range kills maybe this game isn't as gratifying since you don't get the tension of tracking every sound around you and the prep it takes to camp a location and strategize leaving a camp to acquire another but for myself this game allows you to have fun or be super seerious and still have a good time.There's also the play with friends aspect but that's more for fun in my book I prefer the solo grind and knowing my placement depends on my own personal decisions. The last thing to mention is this game is already great yea there may be some few things to whine about but in general it's made up for. AND IT'S ONLY GETTING BETTER three months into the alpha release and the Devs have shown that they actively listen to the community but also manage to suprise us with each patch whether it be new weapons operating optimizations that are noticable or as simple as making the circle less predictable.In the end if you have a PC that can run this game buy it now. If you plan on upgrading your PC in the next six months to the point of being able to play this game buy it because when this game drops for real if it isn't $59.99 I'll a brick thirty bucks is cheap for this level of content and remember it's always getting better new maps being hinted at more guns better mechanics this is a must have game.#IDon'tEvenPlayShooters #Top5kNASolo

review: Very poor game. Most servers will have over 100 ping. They say it's because of growing population but without a ping that's at least as good as 60fps there's no reason to even play. There is huge bullet delay almost no hit detection and yeah I'd say over half the players who play are cheating. This game isn't worth the money and is a ier and probably the same as H1Z1 except this one doesn't function at all. The rewards in this game are very paultry and are just wearing clothing that you literally get as the process of the game. In the same manner as H1Z1 they want you to buy those boxes with money as each box becomes harder than the last to get. For example if you lose every game expect around 22 points if you didn't hit anyone. This will happen to you alot due to cheaters or due to the fact that most allies will not speak your language unless you are Chinese or playing on EU. The first box is 700 next is 1400 next is 2800.The game is trying to be a survival/tactical battlegrounds but item drops are more than random. Go to a warehouse while someone else is nearby? Search the entire warehouse? Find a pistol! They found an automatic weapon with armor and a helmet and because they are cheating they also know exactly where you are. Enjoy.Doesn't matter what server you play on if https //pubg.disquse.ru/ registers as over 100 ms there is no point. Not worth buying this game on sale even if it was functioning as long as there are so many cheaters that the game actually announces it as a badge of honor. 1.5 Million cheaters out of 3 million concurrent players is absurd. This game is rubbish and is most likely H1Z1 recycled and dumbed down to unplayable standards with a different name.

review: Gameplay 11/10 AmazingPerformance 0/10 ExcruciatingServers 10/10 Spawns of Satan sent to torture mankindDevs 9/10 OK Game itself is great (Weapons Rules Fighting etc.) but i hardly scratch above 60 FPS with my GTX 960 and 16GB RAM. Game is still buggy as . Cant even count the amount of times i died because of t. Car flips for no godamn reason Glitches Serverside lags Car gets stuck in a wall and explodes etc. The cars are made of rubber and weigh as much as a feather making driving a sweat draining experience. The smallest incline will send you to the moon Shotguns don't consistently kill close range (someone right next to you) and sometimes kill people over 20m away.Which is fun Some attachments seem to be useless (e.g. compensator on Sniper Rifles) PUBG Servers are worse than most Ubisoft servers. There's no report system and yes there are Cheaters i have encountered 3 of them. one had aimbot one could shoot through walls and one was able to fly yes really(I did hear that Cheaters get banned how im not sure) But i like the developers they have been shoving out updates with new stuff every month and this is still the Alpha Stage I'm confident they will adress the current issues within the next few months.I just wish they would focus on the stuff thats ed up right now (Performance and Servers) instead of adding more ed up stuff e.g. Motorcycle which has a 10% chance to glitch all over the map when it falls over

Then you will die instantly to someone you never saw.Sometimes you will see someone that doesn't see you and then you will kill them instantly.3/10 Funny at times but ham handed and childish.Ideas to make this a game that is actually fun Increase max health to prolong periods of combat and action Increase effect of gear so that it is actually useful Add direction indicators to aid a player under fire in having a fighting chance (Cause you know some people are deaf or deaf in one ear. Some people don't want to play with headphones.) Increase vehicle amount to allow players to mobilize across the map early game Decrease military grade SMG and AR weapon spawn (why grab a pistol when a UMP and AK are 30 feet away in any direction?) PUBG gives meaningful weight to our choices and not just in a dialogue tree but within the gameplay itself.However I can't honestly recommend it right now because the game is filled with technical issues. review: Can't decide whether this game is a really fun experience or just a bland piece of In a way it's pretty fun knowing each match is gonna be different and there is a very distinct and unique form of tension and caution with every action that you take. The fear that time is running low that eventually you will run into another player and it will only go one of two ways. You will either kill or be killed.However Game is buggy and glitchy with each patch seeming to do little. (Except from the launch patch which improved game performance and graphics but still didn't run completely smooth.)Vehicles can kill you if you don't come to a stop before you try get out.Maps are big but it ain't great when there's not much to do.Two maps which are both boring.Microtransactions added during early access with plans for many more.Streamers get automatic VIP status and are allowed to be absolute Cheaters are prevalent with little apparently being done by the devs.The creator seems to think that he pioneered the Battle Royale genre and gets y when other people copy the success claiming they're all copying his 'creation'.Even though I gave it a bad review I'd say it's still an interesting and fun game with some friends.Just don't expect it to be the raved up masterpiece that everyone claims it is.(Also I know it happened indirectly but this seems to be the cause of the new cancer that is sweeping the video game industry where every game feels it deserves a 'battle royale' mode. GET TO !)

review: PLAYERUNKOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is one of the most fun games I have played in a while. By no means will it win any awards on graphics story content or originallity but it is however an all round joy to play. Considering this game is in early access Im surprised on how great it already is. This game is great to play with a group of friends and you will undoubetdly get an adrenaline rush playing. Especially when it comes to the last 10 players. There is a nice variety of weapons and loot at the moment and Im sure as the game is updated more will be added. It is however poorly optimised as I find my FPS can dramatically drop even at low settings. The servers can also be extremly laggy and Ive also experienced the entire game crashing on me. However do take into account that this is early access and Im sure as they update it these problems will be fixed. I highly recommend this game to anyone looking to play a fun survival/battle royal style game whether thats on your own or with a group of friends.

review: At this stage in EA PUBG is such a mess tech wise. Constantly dropping to 1fps while jumping out of the plane and for seemingly random other reasons. But not the reason I don't recommend it.This is based only on solo queue not squads or duos.My main gripe with this game is in fact the core gameplay. After 30 hours. Almost every single time I have died (99/100) before the very last circle is do to someone I did not see. This is a huge problem in solo queue. There is no way to retaliate and no sense of progression or accomplishment the last 10 min you spent running around was just a waste of time because you didn't find a level 3 helmet and took a headshot while you were running or driving. Each match is on a scale of pretty fun &gt complete BS. I find that I'm either jumping into an area with 2 10 ppl and somehow I end up in the 1 house without a single gun or I jump to BFE and don't see anyone till the last 20 survivors. Every single game I have to loot anywhere from 5 20 structures to feel ready for the last circle.When you're not getting shot out of nowhere or when you don't die in the first minute or so there is just this huge time gap in most games where nothing is happening and I just run around collecting gear for 10 mins and play about 2 mins of endgame. It gets repetitive Start New Game Collect Gear................................. Die collecting gear. GOTO 1 Travel to safe zone....................... Wait............................................. Win or Die. GOTO 1Also there are so many little annoying things that make the game frustrating a hell. The main thing... how the action button (F) works. Hit F to open a door... nope sorry that didn't work try again oops you hit it twice and it slammed in your face. Jump in a vehicle quick... nope... go ahead and stand there for 2 seconds before you can do anything. And just the collision detection of the game and jump mechanics. I'm sure all this little stuff will be fixed though.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'll start with the cons as they can vastly ruin your experience if you're used to smooth gameplay.Cons Bad servers &amp High latency as a result players often teleport around at the beginning yourself sometimes spend up to 2 sec to open a *** door or loot an object on the ground. Numerous bugs for example you get stuck sometimes while switching weapons and are unable to select your weapon for a good 15 sec which equals death when under fire. For a survival game this can get really frustrating very quickly. Very vad optimization runs like garbage. I have an i7 5820K &amp 1080 both overclocked and still hit 40 fps in towns on lowest settings. Gunplay is slow switching weapons is slow. Bullets dispersion is too high at close range unless standing still which added to 3rd person cam highly favors camping vs active gunplay. Very narrow field of view &amp no setting to adjust it (for now). Pros Looks good on highest settings (but unplayable). Map well designed. Weapons balanced even with a handgun you can take out a geared enemy at close range if you go for headshots. Gun customization varied &amp usefull attachements. Teamplay is a blast (if slighty unforgivable but that's the nature of the game). To sum up fixing server issues &amp bugs should be a super high priority as it can really kill the mood when playing. I'm aware this is early access but EA should be about less content while still having a game run smoothly.I don't recommend it for now while those issues still remain and will of course change my review when the game is fixed. Early access games often tend to promise and not deliver (and why would they when they have already sold to most clients anyway).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Fantastic game. Had its ups and downs during Early Access.In the current state 1.0 patch #12 it has been amazing. Lots of new additions and changes to the games. Quality of life fixes. UPDATE Now on Patch #14 it had some server changes and client changes. Better FPS stability across the board. Servers now push up to 60hz (tick) though not stable. There are still issues with Early game Latency between Server and Client BUT the latency in late game is much better than it was before.It still has its bugs every now and then but that is maybe 1 out of 10 games for me personally and nothing game breaking.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Microtransactions announced to come before the game is releasedRidiculous and irrational enforcing of the rules of the game (TK bans for defending yourself served with insults on twitter to the player...)poor performanceear blasting sound designEarly Access resources spent on making xbox exclusive console versionEarly Access resources spent on making zombie modesPUBG is a great early access title. Unfortunately the developper is making all the mistake you were hoping he wouldn't do. The classic money grabbing P2W gambling addiction promoting stupid you've seen ruin plenty of other games are coming.This game is in the process of becoming a money grab even after having sold millions of copy and being more flush with cash than they ever had any right to hope for.It's a great game. Tons of fun. I've sunkover 100 hours in it and loved all of it. But the devs are showing themselves to be just as greedy as EA. You've been warned it's all downhill from here.

review: Okay so I reviewed this game a few months ago in a salty fit of frustration babbling on about the game's several glitches and bugs rather than reviewing the game for what it is. Pubg is everything KOTK wanted to be but ten times better. This game has so much replay value and everygame is different. This game gets a lot of flak from the community for its issues and people rarely praise Bluehole for the amazing job they've done. This game has came so far in the past months in terms of bug fixes (sure it's not perfect!) BUT it is well worth the buy. Despite the fact that Brendan Greene (PLAYERUNKNOWN) is kinf of a cuck. GG bluehole!

You _CANT_ sell a lagging FPS is it really that hard to set up a bloody god ed server? Somehow I smell Photon or an another SaaS t behind...For 30 I expected that server fees have to be covered but it rather looks like a hamster is powering the RAM instead of a CPU... come one..!Once they manage to fix their bloody ed up client server communications (and also dcs n stuff) the game will be a great investion but not before!

review: tl drThoroughly enjoying the game so far makes some good improvements over previous iterations of the battle royale scenario. There are some issues but (for me) nothing game breaking. If you're interested in the game but don't have much money/decent system or you expect perfection from all your games then I'd hold off a month or two then reevaluate.HistoryPLAYERUNKNOWN has been a staple name in the battle royale game mode for the past few years. I had some good times playing Battle Royale in Arma 2 and then again in Arma 3. IIRC he won an award in the Make Arma Not War competition in 2015(?). This guy knows what he's doing. Unlike some other early access games from relatively unknown devs Brendan Greene has a good track record with this exact thing. He then worked with the H1Z1 team for a while as a consultant I believe on their KOTK mode before going out on his own.Pro'sRelatively easy on new playersSatisfying afFairly quick pacingModding and custom game modes on the roadmapUE4 engine gives plenty of opportunity in terms of reliability and ease of use (esp. for modding in the future)Decent variety of weapons and customisation alreadyCon'sIMO map is okay but I'd like to see another perhaps smaller map with some more opportunitiesNot a huge variation in terms of buildingsColours look a little washed out overallEARLY ACCESS SPECIFIC CON'SOptimisation is incoming (Part 1 ETA April)Limited range of servers currently (AU servers within a week probably SA and maybe NA East/West EU East/West)Main menu takes ages to load after every game???Can be laggy at timesSound could be improvedOverall polish neededI may add more above when I think of new things!OtherI can see with the BP system and the containers that there is likely to be microtransactions and/or Steam Marketplace to buy (hopefully just) cosmetic items. This should in theory be fine servers cost money to run after all but I hope that nothing will give real benefits in games. I honestly doubt this would happen but the possibility is there. The same goes for DLC. I hope any potential DLC doesn't fracture the player base as it could make finding games frustrating and boring.RE Performance I have a 3770K 16GB RAM and a 1070. I currently run it on high and comfortably hit 60 fps outside the larger towns.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Good lord this game is fun. Summary High intensity loot gathering shooter based 40+ Free for all.Goal Survive by any means necessary! Gather loot and hide? Find a shotty and set a trap for another player take their loot? It's entirely upto how you want to play it.Gameplay Now its early access but I can run it reasonably smooth on my 4yo laptop so its quite playable! Hit reg is reasonably good feels a little clunky (probably lag based with 150ping). Otherwise this game feels like you want it to fast smooth and utterly unforgiving.Comments It's packed with "how did I just survive that?" and "wait they were here the whole time?" moments. It's stressful but also light hearted. Easily playable by casual gamers and hardcore gamers alike. However don't expect a totally bug free product yet there are still steps to be taken before this product is "finished".Over all Solid game and I expect it will improve with time aswell.Rating 8/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The developers time with arma 2 and H1Z1 shows and in this instance thats a blessing. They have managed to put together all of the best parts of these games. Weapon/Damage models loot tables varied areas and arrangements of structures good mechanics and exhiliration at the end of the round. There is already a massive amount of content for this game and Im hopeful it will continue to be added to. There are very few bugs involved in a normal game most being relegated to driving and jumping. Have not played with a team yet but I am hearing that it is great fun. So far this is the most fun I have had in a survival type game in a long while.

review: A great Battle Royale game you can play Solo Duos or Squads. Voice chat is available text is not don t really need text chat. I recommend a headset with a mic. Also is demand game on your computer check requirements.So basically you start at a spawn island before the match you fill up with 90 100ish players. Then the game puts you in a plane and can parachute out to different spots on a bigger or small island playable arena. Now you have to fight to be the last player alive hands if need be. Pick up loot backpacks (you need one) guns attachments melee weapons meds armor different clothes if you want. Blue Zones push players closer together they get smaller and increasing damage each round first round moves quick but slow damage. Fourth round also moves quick. There are Red/Bombing Zones that randomly dump bombs which will damage or kill you sometime you have risk it and move through them. There are high loot places/buildings (Warehouses being one such building) also more likely to encountering more players at those locations. There are low loot places. You parachute farther from the plane path and you are less likely to encounter players early on. Commonly dropped locations are School/Apartments Po i and Military Base. There are vehicles (cars SUVs Motorcycles Boats) to help you move along with gas cans. You can also run players over. If you playing Duos/Squads a player that is normally killed will be knocked out and a teammate can revive them the revived player has little health and generally needs to heal to survive. Also different weather effects beside the common normal day sunset (my favorite) rain and fog. (night/other options are rumored for the future). Yes the game is still in early access server issues at times lag desync some bugs cheaters (mostly using aims bots you will notice a name with a bunch of numbers/letter kill people on the kill feed on the lower left of your screen) but I think they will fix most of the issues and they have been fairly good about some fixes could have come quicker. But the game has over 2 million active users and they have been banning cheaters in great numbers regularly.They plan on adding additional maps (a desert themed one is next) weather effects/conditions more loot/guns vaulting climbing and other possible changes as the game evolves (more destructible environment.

Will wait for its arrival on PS4 then maybe give it a go again as it does look fun but for a game that's sold 5 million copies and is still in the development stage so poorly optimized it doesn't bode well for the future. 4/10

review: Product received for free. This game is on point. I haven't been truly addicted to a game since the original COD and Dayz Mod for Arma 2. I'm fully engulfed and love every aspect of it. Sure for an Early Access game it has its few bugs but nothing is gamebreaking. The dev team is fully committed to the community and ongoing development of this game. Great things are on the horizon for optimisation patches as well. I've read that some say the game is too slow paced. Simply NOT TRUE. You choose how fast it is. If you want straight firefights and heavy PvP action jump into a large town/city and you get it straight away. You can jump further out and float to a further destination for a more relaxed situation and gear up then move to the PvP. Really all in your playstyle. Game is worth every penny and will be enjoyable for years to come!

review: PUBG has finnaly left early access and I can now give this game a proper review. PUBG's pace is unlike any other shooter or like any other game. The nervous chills as you land the jump scare of turning around into an enemy's barrell. No game has immersed me like PUBG ever. After finnaly fixing various bugs glitches lag spikes performance issues (thought that still needs more improvemenet) I think I can call this one of the BEST GAMES EVER. Pros $30 Price tag and constant updating2 Huge maps with endless contentA Gnere like none otherA blast with friendsCustom games (needs tweaking)Microtransactions that will not affect gameplayLots of OMG momentsGood graphics (if you can handle it)Few to no hackers from my experinceCons Perfomance Issues3rd Person needs workOverall Rating 9/10 "A Must Play!"

review: Ok so this game has caused me so much pain (emotional and physical) that any reasonable human being would have walked away from it months ago. But........I just could'nt ok i mean its like being a junky but without the fun of having a pet unicorn. This behemoth is the most addictive thing ive ever played and despite its game breaking soul destroying and down right rediculous bugs and problems i still cant wait to get home and jump in. I have met a whole group of friends who i speak to litterally hourly throughout the day ive laughed so hard that ive cried for nearly an hour and ive been so annoyed at myself at times that ill say to the squad for one more game that turns into an 8 hour try hard session. I cant promise youll love it hell i cant even say youll like it but find a server make some friends and trust me when i say that youll never have a better gaming experience.
