review: I truly love this game but I am recommending people do not buy this game until BlueHole reverses their descision on microtransactions. They promised there would be no microtransactions until the game left early acces. "Cosmetics Skins &amp Character CustomizationAre there going to be microtransactions?Yes but only for purely cosmetic items and only after Early Access." PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds FAQThey also claim this is to raise money to fund a Gamescom tournament however a conservative estimate places the income BlueHole has made from this game between 50 100 million USD. For a small team that build the majority of the game we currently have in the course of a year that is more than enough to fund your Gamescom tournament.Don't let BlueHole pull the same things other early access devs have. Even though this game is wonderful and has the potential to be a staple in PC gaming we have to let them know we won't accept these practices.

review: So after putting already 12 hours in this game after a few days I mostly know the up and downs of this game. Yes the servers get poopy sometimes. Yes the optimalization is bad. Yes there are some sound bugs. But the core gameplay is really good. If you have to compare this game to any other game H1Z1 is the one to come up in your mind. The basics are the same. You get dropped on an island and the goal is to survive and win. The biggest difference is that everything is up to you. You decide when to jump out of the plane you decide what to loot where to go. The most fun I got so far is just 4 man squad ( with friends ofcourse ). You experience so much together. Funny moments intense moments. You can find attachments for your guns ( which is a big + over H1Z1 ). The voice chat is very good. We had a 3 man squad and had 1 random with us. It almost felt like he was in the discord with us. If you look for a BR that drops you on an island with 99 other people. A BR that gives you joy excitement. Buy this game. it's not cheap. But it's worth it. ( All the "issues" currently mentioned are things that are known and being worked on by the dev's. )TLDREA GameMultiple Issues ( Known and being fixed )Not that cheapBest big BR ( 50+ people in a lobby ) experienceTons of fun with friendsBright FutureWay better then H1Z1

review: This is an awesome game. If you like survival games and enjoy playing with friends then I would definitely recommend picking this game up. There is definitely a learning curve getting used to this game compared to some of the other Battle Royal games out there right now. It seems to find a good balance between H1Z1 and DayZ kind of gameplay. There are currently a lot of issues with the game. There is lag with the audio desync issues etc. However the devs are addressing these issues and this game is only going to get better definitely worth every penny even in its current state.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Havnt played much but from what ive played its a more realistic h1z1 You actually need to spend some time looting to get a good rifle then atachemnts for it. Player skill and knowdlege means more in this game then h1z1 Both games have the same objective but completly different styles This is more realistic slow paced and more satisfying when you get that headshot off and win the game! Winner Winner Chicken Dinner!!!!!!!!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I love survival games even though I am absolutely terrible at them but then again I am terrible at every game I play so keep that in mind as you read this review.The graphics on this game are not really what I would consider great but to me as long as it doesnt look absolutely horrendous I am fine with that also I realize this is early access so not a real big deal for me. The game does get choppy sometimes which can be a real bummer when encountering someone youre about to murder. But this is not a constant problem but does happen in every game I have played thus far. I am hoping this will be addressed in an update at some point but then I remember the game Dayz that was early access and still not finished after like five years so I am not sure.The game despite its flaws is actually pretty fun. I like the whole idea of slowly shrinking the playing field in an attempt to force people to murder each other. Other than that its a pretty typical survival game. Its not terribly difficult to arm yourself get backpacks and medkits. Essentially items are not scarce in this game. I love the fact that you start the game not knowing what weapon you will be using or if you will have multiple weapons to chose from. I like that you can upgrade your weapons and the fact that items arent scarce it makes upgrading them pretty easy. The downside is that the upgrades dont really do anything. I got a scope for my rifle but couldnt zoom in...even though its a freaking scope. The only positive to that is you dont have to worry about snipers at least for now they make actually change this so the upgrades actually have a point to them. I mean yea you can get a bigger clip and hold more rounds or a silencer but nothing else really has a point as far as improving your aim or being able to zoom in.I dont think this is a great game at least yet it definetly has potential. It is fun as it is right now but there does need to be improvements made and I am hoping the development team doesnt slack off like the developers of Dayz did and chose not to finish the game at all. Overall even though I am terrible at this game I still have fun. But the most annoying part of it all is when you get killed your game is pretty much over and you gotta start the whole process of getting into another game again which does take more time than it should. I was hoping for a spectator mode to watch the remaining participants and maybe even learn things I didnt know before to better my game nope dont have that option which really pisses me off. They do however give you ample time to scavenge before limiting the playing field so you dont feel too much pressure to get armed before moving to the playing field. I dont know I dont want to tell you how to spend your money. I like the game but I am not sure its worth the price right now maybe wait for a sale or for them to finish the game itself before buying.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a game where 100 players are dropped from a plane to a 64 square km area full of buildings vehicles guns and equipment. The goal is to kill everyone and be the last person (or a team of 2 to 5 people) standing. The map shrinks throughout the game pushing players closer to each other.Pros and cons PROS Fun gameplay Graphics look nice Active development Map size is goodCONS Minor performance problems even on good rigs Microtransactions were originally not supposed to be in early access but they were added anyway The only way to customize your character is through buying item crates with real and in game money or using community market Currently only one map but new ones are comingShould one buy this game? If you're prepared to face the problems of early access then go ahead. Otherwise wait until launch.Final score W for Why the f*ck are Chinese cheaters invading the servers what the f*ck

review: Don't listen to most bad reviews please(they are mostly coming from cry babies) this game has been going through an amazing evolution and it only requires patience until its gonna be perfect.They've already done plenty of improvement this recent year and I kept feeling much more smoother gameplay with time.One of the things that is annoying for me lately is the cases you bust your bottom off to get BP points and you get cases that cost you $$ to open them I know its just cosmetics but getting 2 free cases out of 8 key cases is stupid and shows how PUBGs thirst for money grew on them.Yes this game got bugs and sometimes you wanna go outside and start a world war 3 but when you stop focusing on the little things and just start looking at the whole game you can see that it can give you lots of elements that are missing in games lately.You get scared sometimes you get lots of andrenaline rush you can use great tactics to outplay your enemy and feel amazing about it and more things that give you that satisfaction you're looking for in videogames.I'd recommend you to play this game with a team of four people you know and are organic together while working on good communication.

I don't want to hear anything about "early access" either. Early access doesn't mean alpha gameplay. These days most early access games are completely playable but missing some features. Buy at your own risk (unless you have an SSD).

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a very fun game. It is a battle royale where you fly down from a plane and grab random loot and shoot everyone you see(other than your friends obviously). There is a circle that closes in on the map and you must always stay inside or you will die slowly. I love this game but there are definitely pros and cons.PROS Fun time wasting. Various guns and shooting types and stuff for your liking. Easy to learnMany more that I can't think of off the top of my head.CONS Server lag Optimizations... Laggy as bro. Guns don't work properly sometimes Hackers hackers are literally everywhere. * Edit Hackers have definitely decreased. Developers dont like to update the game until the last last last LAST second. It's been out for over a half of a year and they aren't fixing it. Vehicles get stuck and you blow up instantly. Falling through map.All though there are so many bugs with the game right now and way more cons than pros I still believe in the game and I know when it first releases it will be smooth and great. If you want to play the game please get it when it releases unless you want to experience cancer. Thanks for reading this and I hope you like this review.

review: I was gifted this game by a friend. ANd i wish i told him to keep his money. Ive played a plethora of FPS games over the years. 2.5k hours in tf2 across 2 account. 2k in bf3 2k in bf4. Never played csgo. and countless time on other games over the years. I mention this to try to stop people from saying "durr hurr youre just salty cause you cant aim" i assure you my aim may not be amazing but its definitely not terrible enough to have the problems im having.First of all the iron sights in this game dont even work properly the focus is on the wrong point of the weapon. Two the servers are frankly lag constantly rubberbanding the works Third and finally they know there servers are so bad you cant check your ping. Ive always refused to play a game if i have above 45 ping no matter what it is. And i cant figure it out in this game cause they know their servers are When they fix the servers+let me check my ping and fix the other plethora of issues with this game ill be more than happy to leave it a positive review. If youre looking for a well polished fun game with solid gameplay with a touch of RNG then this is not the game for you.

review: My first impressions of PU BG The game is amazing so far. As of this review I have only played the game for roughly 8 or so hours. Even if I am not very good at this game I sure do have a ton of fun. Something about looting homes and such just feels so amazing and the satisfaction of getting a kill is amazing. Everyone is always talking about latency and stuff but personally I never have connection issues. The game runs just fine. PROS &gt Fun game&gt Entertaining non repetitive gameplay&gt Community&gt Quick matches&gt Realistic ishCONS &gt Voice chat issues (THE BEGINNING PLANE EAR BLEEDING)&gt Annoying as hell when you get a bunch of good stuff and die instantly due to a camper&gt Not very many gamemodes&gt Border walls come sanic speedOverall I highly recommend this game. Especially if you have a few friends to play with you. The price may seem to change your mind but since the devs are releasing content every so often it's honestly worth buying right now. Can't wait for the game to be released in about a few months DUPDATE oHhhh my god. I now hate this game. Everyone in this game is god. Spawn in? Die. Move wrong? Die. Fail to see gunshots? Die. In the end I'm just bad and salty

review: As a sidenote before I get into the review I just want to say I really like this game. Playing this game with a buddy or 2 is super fun. I really want to see this game go places. With that said do not buy this game in it's current state. I abosolutely hate it when devs release early access games. This game doesn't even feel like its in a beta state. There are some areas where FPS will drop to 10 15 and even when FPS is still good the game is super choppy. There is always a delay when hitting f (the interaction button) when you want to do anything. Whether it be picking up a weapon ammo opening a door or getting in a car. I have problems with hitbox registration sometimes. It feels like I put 15 rounds into someone before they die. Some weapons that have a full auto setting are bugged when you use full auto especially the micro uzi. It will seem like they are only shooting 1 or 2 bullets at a time when in reality they're unloading a full clip into you. I've had many issues with sound bugs in the game. Some examples are when you're in the plane the audio will cut in and out. The sound effect of a reload or bullet casing hitting the floor will almost always play when you switch weapons. I also have problems with the aiming system. When you have any type of scope on any weapon and aim with that weapon a black box will appear in the middle of your screen and pop in and out of view blocking any shot you could have on someone. There are SO many more bugs I can cover but I dont have the patience to type them all out. To make a long story short this game REEKS of an alpha build game and is not even close to being worth 30 bucks in its current state. Wait till it goes down it price or goes on sale to buy it. Also cheaters are ing rampant in this game but that comes with any new and popular game that is released nowadays.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Cons first There is a lot of modding that to me would fall under 'cheating' but its allowed. That said supporting mods isn't a bad thing and and adding a "mods/no mods" mode select down the road would be a nice option. Also you aren't really playing for anything other than cosmetics so this is less of a deal breaker and more of a detractor from the fun.Limited game modes so far (Free for all as solo duo and team and thats it)Pros They took out a lot of what makes survival pvp games infuriating and kept almost all the good stuff. The game requires tactical thinking situational awareness and patience almost as much as good shooting skills. The system of a diminishing play area and a large map help keep the game fresh while the fact you start every game from scratch means you (usually) don't get upset when you die and lose your gear.TL DR I usually hate pvp games and I enjoy this game. If they add more game modes this could easily be a game I play for years.

review: TLDR Wholly addicting. A game purpose built and done as close to perfectly as can be expected.I have fallen in love with this game. Most nights I found myself playing til the sun comes up and by no means am I good at the game. As of writing this I have a 33% win/loss ratio (about 66% top 10 ratio). However the adrenline rush of almost making it is something I have never felt from agame before. I can feel my heart thumping when I get down to 10... 8... 5... 2. I think that' the real addiction. The thrill the rage when you get/miss the final kill. I understand my experience also seems to be the minority. I have no problem pinpointing sounds I have no problem with lag (though net coding seems to be quite an issue but what game isn't it) I have never seen a hacker.Pros The rush like no other Excellent Sound gunfire vehicles footsteps are bit loud but what can you do. Good selection of loot/guns just enough to not be confusing and not too many as to be worthlessly similiar each gun has its purpose. Vehicles Good map design wide range of situations one can find himself.Con Net code I am definitely not the only one who has shot someone in the back 4 5 times (with blood splatters mind you) only to suddenly be killed by the same person because none of my shots connected on their end and they also probably were facing me to start. This happens only every 1/5 games but its immensly frustrating for an otherwise smooth experience.

review: PUBG was a good idea that has been ruined by a company who lacks any foresight when it comes to making decisions. Here we sit almost a year later and all they've managed to do is add two very low effort maps. The servers are still terribly laggy the bullet physics are horrendous and the developers decide to invest their time suing a competitor for "stealing ideas" that have been done long before PUBG ever went for sale. The game is unfinished barely playable and lacks content yet the developers have no problem launching microtransactions and adding a paid DLC. What did you do with all of the money you got from the millions of copies sold? Are you telling me that all you can afford to produce in a year is two terrible maps with little to nothing to them? This game is the next Day Z it's an exit scam. Greedy company with terrible decision making skills. I personally cannot wait for the other battle royales to send this to the grave.

review: Okay I once gave this game a good review because it is a good game. That was when I could run it. But now (ironically enough because of updates meant to better optimize the game) I can't run it. Even at the lowest possible graphics and a resolution lower than the setting will let you go I can't run it. This is probably the least optimized game in the history of gaming. Like people are like "Oh PAYDAY 2's optimization is pretty bad. Oh Rainbow Six doesn't run that smoothly. Oh for a turn based game Civ 6 should run better." Sure those games could be optimized better sure. But this game's optimization is like if a mushroom grew out of your and you ate that mushroom because you were high and then you vomited all over the floor and plugged a toaster in and then electrocuted yourself in your high mushroom barf.

review: Back in PUBG's release in early 2017 it illustrated some very promising aspects to become an outstanding battle royale game and had potential for incredible development. That was before the money and fame got to the developer's head of course.As it's popularity sparked throughout and to the end of 2017 the development of the game was clearly comprised of money and simply lack of care and interest which has ultimately caused it's downward spiral and has resulted in the poor state it's in at the moment.Broken game? Let's release a purchasable battle pass!An early 2017 PUBG saw the developments listening to the playerbase however moreso recently all the decisions regarding the game have just been based on money and microtransactions.Countless bugs have existed and they seem to be in no rush to fix them albeit most of which are game breaking. You can often find yourself blowing up randomly upon entering vehicles shooting through one way fences being in launched in the air in certain vehicles.Updates are also very sloppy and seem to do nothing as they constantly break the game causing it to go into maintance for an indefinite amount of time. Also not sure why every update seems to take up so much storage? Am I re installing the entire game or something?I wish I could recommend PUBG for the potential it showed at one point but the developer's failed to act on that.

review: Cons Seems to be a large number of cheats? Yes. There's no denying that. That being said Bluehole do actually seem to be trying to combat the problem... I personally believe that the popularity of cheating comes hand in hand with the ability to sell digital items for use in the game for real money... Those who are using the cheats to gain a higher balance in their Steam Wallet would be doing it for other games who offer the same thing because thieves like that kind of free money but that's not really the dev's fault... short of stopping the tradability of of ingame items I think the cheaters are here to stay until they get banned and have to start up yet another account...People can whine and moan and carry on all they like but at the end of the day leaving bad reviews for something that is out of the dev's hands... bit childish to say the least... but that's gamers for you..PROS Absolutely love this game. Yes it's early access but unlike some other early access games this one has some solid work continually going into it.This is by far the best (in my opinion) casual basic FPS you will ever come across. You can go solo partner with a mate or squad with 3 mates. Everyone gets dumped on an island find your own protective gear offensive gear and go hunting or sit back and wait in a safe space. You can shoot people you can hit them with a crowbar or machette or even a frying pan hell you can run people over! What's not to like?

review: The following review has been written during a very early early access.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a battle royale third/first person shooter with a semblance of realism behind it. 100 players enter through a plane and only one two or up to four can leave as a winner. That is honestly all you need to know about the game. There is next to no story and even if there is some backstory it is not needed to enjoy the game at all.Lets start with the good stuff The one map that is in the game is fairly large allowing probably even more than just 100 players to get lost in it. The sound system while glitchy is fairly good for a game of this theme. There are some problems but I will explain those in the cons section. Guns sound pretty well explosions are loud and generally the sound is just about right. Movement options are fairly great. Very reminiscent of ARMA 2. The game is really fun with friends. It has potential.Now the bad stuff Gunplay. While semi realistic most of the guns either feel like they lack any punch or they have way too much punch. From my experience there are numerous occasions of shooting someone several times (lets say 12 times with an AKM) and your opponent is still running around as if nothing really happened. And then you have weapons that touch you anywhere and you explode. Feels like the game would be better if it chose either strong weapons but a lot of cover or weak weapons with movement being the most important thing. Right now the weapon you find tends to dictate whether you are gonna have a good time or not. Not your skill. Map design. While I appreciate how large the map is there is a major problem with it. I hope you like to be sniped out of nowhere because that has been about 90% of all of my deaths in this. Players know which weapons need very little to kill you and since the maps are very elevated and scopes are fairly common most of the time you are gonna just shake your head and wish the game had a damage indicator. Shot recognition. While the sound design is generally great being able to tell where you are being shot from (and we are not talking about silencers) is almost impossible. Quite often the sound can be coming from one direction and you are actually being shot from behind. This has been proven by several video makers and streamers with some of the best headsets on the market. Lack of any tactics. Sniper is king in this game. The moment you find a weapon that can take a scope and the aforementioned scope you become the king of the game. This would be ok if you could in some way make sure you gain these. Usually it is entirely 100% random who gets these and if you do not find one in the first 5 6 minutes of the game you might as well disconnect cause that there is game over for you. There are no defensive measures in the game. No mines no traps. Not to mention even the sneakiest movement still makes so much noise that only a deaf person would be caught off guard by you. RNG. If I say that sniper is king in this game then RNG is the queen. The circles are 100% RNG. You may think you have jumped well gained some gear killed some people and then you notice that the circle has moved far away from you and the way towards it is bound to have at least 10 snipers waiting specifically for you. When it happens once you are miffed but its ok. When it happens ten times in a row you really feel like throwing the computer out of the window. Optimalization. As of writing this review the game is barely playable. There are people who can play the game just fine but majority of people with both bad and good RIGs are having trouble playing this game no matter the settings. Again even video makers and streamers with beasts for computers have reported major problems with optimalization. Lets not even mention constant crashes falling through scenery being blocked by invisible walls etc. Lag. As of writing this review majority of people are having major connection issues. Even people with legit really good broadband. For me for instance it is actually better to play on NA server... while I live in Central Europe. Rubber banding will be the death of thee at least a couple of times. Hit recognition is terrible because many times you unload 5 shotgun shots into someone and they kill you with a couple of pistol bullets because on their end you did not hit them and the servers "decides" who was right when it synchronizes. Hackers. Anyone willing to look into the darker corners of the Internet can see the market for the hacking tools for this game bearing major fruit. Why? Because it is an early access game that grew way too quickly for it s own good. Not to mention it is made in an engine that is by my knowledge very easy to hack into. It is sad and all we can hope for is that the developer will find a way how to deal with this menace. Right now it is almost more probable to find a hacker than to find a clean player. Rules. Anyone who puts "These rules are neither final nor exhaustive we reserve the right to suspend disruptive users even if their behaviour doesn t fall under any of the above rules directly."Is a fake person who just wants to power mongrel other people. Basically the devs are saying they can ban you for anything even nothing at all. Stay away.TL DRGame has a lot of potential if the developer decides to fix the major issues balance the game a little and add to it. It is currently in Early Access so it should not be a problem. I cannot recommend the game in it s state though I will continue playing it because even through all of it s problems it is a fun game with friends.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well here we go...PUBG is a fantastic game at its core but most recently it has been plagued with Bugs in game advertisements (holy you make how much money and you have to advertise your own game IN GAME WTF) and overall bad optimization. I personally have a 1950X GTX 1080 Founders Edition 32 Gb of ram etc... and I cant even get 60 FPS on high settings. I know it is not on my end due to other games running completely fine but this one is just crap. Secondly you add in advertisements for your own game in the game itself. You guys have profited at least 1 million dollars and you had to put in graphics in game that say "Watch our ESL game coming up (like anybody cares)". It makes nobody want to watch it and it is just sad that you had to steep this low.Lastly the bugs. Holy the bugs. This game on my computer alone crashes at least 2 3 times per game due to unoptimization and some major bugs Get your together Bluehole and fix this game. Overall I would love to give this game a "Yes" recomendation but with the current problems and ads (in a $30 game that we have to pay for) I have to say no. If these problems are fixed I may as well change the No to a yes but it will stay a no until you do so.Thanks.

review: The game is great and fun as well as the concept visuals and overall gameplay. However this game really needed this huge thumbs down because of the cheaters in this game. You know I can handle chinese ers teaming but what I certainly can't handle is the hackers in this game. Hacks like aimbot wall hack and speed hack to name a few ruins this game soo much and these hacks aren't just used by chinese ers who suck at the game but almost every server will have a pathetic little scripter. Until this game get's a better anti cheat system and permanently ban players who cheat along with their IP this game should never leave early access and is just a waste of money. 2/10 would not buy.It s been a couple of months since I wrote this review and every single word until now stay true. The hacker problem has not change but significantly became worse and not to mention the optimisations sucks. Of course as any devs and company they will add loot boxes which get this they promised they weren t so a big you to that. 1/10 this game sucks it s great and all but the community sucks microtransactions sucks and the devs sucks. If you want to waste money on this go ahead but I would rather suggest investing on games like rainbow six siege where the devs actually care about the community and player base.

review: Okay first of all dont listen to any of the negative comments. These people are ignorant and do not understand the costs and time involved in game development yet they complain about every single thing that happens. While the game is not polished and still has work to be done these developers are extremely cooperative and understanding fixing problems and responding to the player's wishes. First we asked for vaulting they gave us vaulting then we asked for new guns they supplied us with awesome and creative guns then we asked for a new map and more stability on the test client they responded quickly and with excellent results. Many people have now begun complaining about the influx of hackers joining the Australia and Oceania servers but i can assure you that the devs WILL provide answers and a solution as soon as possible. So please dont let anything deter you from buying this game its simply awesome and if you're a fan of GTA Battlefield Arma Dayz or Battle Royale style play then this is the perfect game for you.

review: Game's average score of 60% is quite fu cking generous.Bluehole is the home to some of the worst programmers in gamedev. I chuckle every time game thinks for 2 3 seconds to show me the most basic ss settings window. Or how it reloads the scene to go to main menu... Oh wow. I didn't work with UE in professional capacity yet but coming from other engines i programmed a demo in UE that had better User Experience and much more though out behavior performance in a week. And for network interactions it is clear that they use the basic UE components not even remotely optimized for such use case.And after greeting you with the most shameful use of UE it moves on to the worst jankiest gunplay you can imagine. Every gun feels completely wooden with recoil and spread that doesn't make sense. Animated and aligned to camera so poorly i'd rather shoot out of my cat's And i'm not even talking about (lack of) such nuances as informative sound and overall game balance. They game is too far from it and is unlikely to ever reach that point. And although it says my ping is around 80 100 i usually have around a second(!) of actual lag. Combat goes like that we shoot at each other while shaking and sliding around then someone dies randomly. Aside from bad code predictably it's optimized like Although my 6800k/1080ti tank through it most of the time i still get framedrops.It's nothing different from any other survival game thrown together out of random assets copy pasting scripts to make it barely work by a bunch of 16 year olds. And since it first came out it is in perma early access of course. And of course since they are completely incompetent the game updates(typically for early access crap) at snails pace. And changes that take a normal team hours these duma sses can't(and can't be bothered as well) cobble together in months. All the viralness doesn't make it a tolerable game there's nothing good about it and perma early access doesn't justify such poor quality and overall incompetence. I'd advice to wait for another game in this genre that is actually functional.

review: For now If I could redo my choices I'd have just played Fortnite. Sure PUBG is fun but with the microtransactions for loot boxes and no real reward for winning its just not worth the money. Lack of major bug fixes with some bugs still around from pre alpha even when the game has sold millions of copies. Devs are obviously more interested in milking the cow with sour milk rather then improving the quality of their milk.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. As with many online game these days there are bans discrepancies and the odd bug but you overlook that when judging the game as a whole. PUBG is a great concept and pulls the Battle Royale genre off excellently. No matter if i'm way down the bottom or way up the top of the 100 odd players i still have a lot of fun and i think that's what makes me love this game.Everyone has an equal chance from the drop depending on their skill but that shouldn't put you off.I will continue to enjoy it no matter what position i place....I'm sure they will sort out their difficulties in time and make this game truly worthy. Don't give up hope just yet! (I received this from a giveaway)

review: Product received for free. So this game is great at the very core this game is very well designed. Its exciting stressful terrifying and hilarious... sometimes all 4 at once! ...However.. I do NOT recommend someone purchase the game if haven't done so already. Honestly this game was gifted to me and if buddy hadn't of done that I wouldn't of even bought the game. I've played about 5 hours since gifted along with another 20 or so from before when playing at a friends. Being that its still EA I know that not everthing is gonna be perfect but I think the connectivity issues are too much. Some glitches kinda suck too but I don't need my experience ruined by lag and loss of connection. Game feels clunky still and I feel that the wait for the game would be better for your experience. Also what the developers are doing with this whole crate thing sucks something fierce tsk tsk guys y'all didn't make enough moeny already you want my mommas too? TBH I wouldn't buy the crates anyway... buuuuuut that doesn't take away the fact that its a jerk move to everyone else who payed good money for this EA game. *whispers*(they pay your bills... treat them nicely)

review: This game is not what you think. There is a whole secret code thing going on in this game. Some penguins pretend that they are babies (known as pookies). They sit around and act like a baby (basically typing in baby talk into the chat function) and dress a certain way with a certain color skin. Then then try to get picked up (yes you read that right) by a "mumu" who is a mom figure. The pookie penguins will say things like "Pick mwe!" (that's the baby talk). Then if they get picked up they will go back to her igloo and do whatever the mumu says. Then there are things called "Pookie Contests." You go to a penguin's igloo and all of the pookies dance around and say cute things and try to get picked. There are also all sorts of things going on with this basic storyline including mumus nursing their pookies giving birth to their pookies and sometimes abusing their pookies. And then she may dump the pookie whenever she feels like it. There is more weird stuff going on too that I won't get into. If your child is a new member they will be a pookie. How Disney thinks this game is ok is beyond me. They sure talk up a good game with all of their nonsense about moderation. Then Club Penguin sponsors some cyberbulling education program. What a joke! One day something bad is going to happen because of Club Penguin and they are going to get sued to the gills. This should be a NO GO for all kids under age 16. Parents this is not innocent. Log on with your kids and watch it for yourself.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TL DR Don't get this game if you want an update rich experience with new features weekly. You should have bought this game last year when it was still something new.Imagine a beautiful stunning game. Now imagine that times two with the release of "Miramar" the new desert map. Even though I havent played this game in a bit says a bit about the game itself. Miramar boosted the game a tremendous amount into the more than positive areas of video games but then came Fortnite and lazy developers. Fortnite completely took the world of gaming by surprise and took a good chunk of people interested in this game away from it. A free version of PUBG that has tons of updates rolling out weekly? Whats there to complain about! I for one do not like Fortnite but understand why people chose it over this game. The developers got lazy and took what once was a fun game to play with 3 other friends and rammed it into the floor. I would have recommended this game 4 or so months ago but not now.

review: Shouldn't threaten to sue Fortnite for having their own Battle Royale mode you stole the idea from a Japanese movie/manga that's not right. I'd like to point out what a shame it is when nearly every asset from trash guns and various objects come straight from the UE4 Marketplace and you're gonna do Epic dirty like that. Especially when you're using their engine instead of creating your own from the ground up.One thing that really bugs me is how stupid the devs are to ban people based on the word of a streamer. Me and my buddy were hiding under a bridge when two guys crossed a river while I missed every sniper shot my buddy got picked off by none other than Summit 1G I guess lucky for me I didn't kill him because later he called us stream snipers even though we had no clue who they were before that. It's a slippery slope and impossible to prove most times save for when people drive up in a vehicle and honk which also gets you banned apparently.It's apparent that the devs words mean next to nothing when it was stated they wouldn't be releasing microtransactions until after Early Access. You might be all "It's just cosmetics it's not pay 2 win it's fine!" you'd be right. But Brendan Greene gave his word on no microtransactions until after EA if they can get away with this kind of lie what else?

review: Super smash brothers melee is an instant classic. Nintendos all star lineup of characters hits home once again bringing nostalgia to older gamers as well as fun a new playstyle for the younger generation. It's options for free for all or 2v2 battles creates a never ending array of possibilities on the battle stage. I personally have enjoyed many epic hours with my friends. Its refreshing to see a game in 2017 go back to the classic local multiplayer that my friends and I enjoyed in my youth. Overall I would rate this latest title in Nintendos lineup a perfect 10/10 score. I haven't had this much fun in years.

review: Was waiting for a game like this to coming along ever since the mess of DayZ. The game mostly delivers on what it promises provided you have an at least mid range gaming PC. As usual this is an Early Access title (although they claim they are releasing in 10 weeks from now) so there is a lot to address bug wise performance wise and also feature wise.The core game is great. Most of the negative reviews are from people with sub par gaming rigs/don't understand what Early Access means. Of course there are other issues like hackers (haven't seen any in my 320 hours at time of review) annoying bugs and a China region specific Ad related issue (at time of review).Good bits Fantastic range of weapons which are mostly balanced and all have their uses. Core mechanics work well with major potential for improvement/other modes &amp features. Development team have released a lot of updates. Every game is different. Real world military tactics work well. You can play in your own preferred way (going for kills/wins/fun/sneaky etc) The rush of getting high tier loot from a drop Bad bits While they have optimised the game significantly since EA release the game is still very unoptimised. Sometimes you get killed because of bugs/glitches/major sudden FPS drop. No Region lock. Main Menu UI is a tragedy. Pre game lobby is a mess. Audio has been in need of work for months (levels/clean up/improvement/direction)

review: making a little key thing on the top of the topics if you just want to skip some or just dont care about some.GENERAL INFO Where to start This game has its flaws (hackers bad optimisation bs deaths annoying players badish community ect.) but this game is amazing. hours of fun endless gameplay and a game thats not a "one and done" like game ( because I dont enjoy those games if ur one of those people.) HACKERSFor a person with 200 hours (and counting) i havent really encountered many hackers they are there but i havent really ran into many (dont get mre wrong I hate hackers as much as the last guy but for me they havent been much of a problem).OPTIMAZATION The game does have bad optimazation but if you have a ok computer ( 1060 gc i5 8gb of ram or lower or higher for all the parts you'll be fine). it does lag here and their but it does get better as time goes on.CHINESE The annoying chinese people in this game are like I said ANNOYING but really you only have to listen to them at the begining of the game ( plus if you just dont want to hear them at all just mute game chat). But I do feel like they should region lock china bc most of the hackers are chineseCOMMUNITYThe community really isnt that bad (except for those dang annoying chinese people) people say like "oh nice kill man good luck" but thats not all the time basically 80% of the time people are just quiet.DEATHS I have had my fair share of bs deaths but who tf cares really. END BITS(read)I feel like this needs a chance if your looking for one of these games (dont get fortnite lol) Its in its early stages and is still getting its stuff together. in the future teyll have better anticheat and more content.

review: PUBG is a pretty decent game. It has its bugs which will hopefully be fixed soon but I enjoy playing it with my friends. Anyways I'm getting off topic. I'm really here to share an amazing recipe for some hash cookies that will both taste great and get you high off your a.s.s! Here's what you'll need 1 cup Cannabutter softened 1 cup white sugar 1 cup packed brown sugar 2 eggs 2 teaspoon vanilla extract 3 cups all purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking soda 2 teaspoons hot water 1/2 teaspoon salt 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips 1 cup chopped walnutsOnce you have those ingredients we can get started!1) Preheat oven to 350 F (175 C).2) Cream together the Cannabutter white sugar and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time and then stir in the vanilla. 3) Dissolve baking soda in hot water. Add to batter along with salt. Stir in flour chocolate chips and nuts. Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans.4) Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven or until edges are nicely browned.Enjoy!

review: I love this game. Does it have its problems? Sure. Are they working on it? You bet! Everyone who hates most realize that this game accidentally became a hit. These folks weren't prepared for its immediate success. This is a small development team that is working its butt off to optimize and REWRITE code so that this game will be where it's supposed to be. I'm in for the long haul and am impressed with the updates and changes this far. If you like looney tunes and want to play with your nephew Fortnite is okay. If you're a grown adult who appreciates realism awesome gun play and can put up with occasional hiccups this is the game for you.

review: Shame the game's so buggy. And not just rubberbanding and lagging (which is super prevalent) but sometimes the game won't even launch. Random errors prevent the game from launching since the official release update and requires multiple tries sometimes you'll start a match and all your friends are landing but your screen is stuck in permanent load and never tells you and you close and relaunch to find your stationary character unsurprisingly has been killed by someone who got to actually play the game this round. Fixing the install doesn't solve these issues and the PC is more than capable of running the game smoothly. Tl dr super fun when it decides it wants to work but decides not to work far too many times for a paid full game.

review: Only buy this game if you enjoy endless running around without much contact with others unless you either go hunt them or live long enough to enter the smaller constricting areas. Essentially this game is all about luck at the start. if you jump in or near the first constriction you have plenty of time to loot and gear up. but if you get ed and have to run literally half way around the island... you're kinda screwed.Another great game in theory however execution still needs a LOT of work as does the anti cheat module. over half my deaths were from rejects aimbotting or abusing some bug rendering them invisible or inside solid objects.kinda sad really.I'd as for a refund but steam's ''stick up the ' rules say i can't even only after a few rounds.

review: Despite the fact that there are a few hackers due to them being able to edit source files along with some server instability here and there the game itself is still enjoyable. I for one like complexity in games which is why I enjoy the mechanics in this game over any other Battle Royale type game on the market as of right now. The devs have been putting forward patches that add new weapons and features to the game. Sometimes each patch takes a step back in progress and causes some instability but with every new game that is released that is to be expected. Plus devs are quick to fix any hiccups that patches may cause as well.

review: tl dr version Game runs like a potatoe and the worst part is that performance is actually getting worse and not better. It would be forgivable if it was making improvements. Bluehole is in way over their head. They haven't a clue. Wait for a competitor who actually knows what they are doing to bring you a "battle royal" game. This is by far the worst early access game I have ever played. Not because the gameplay or the content are bad. It's because the performance and optimazation are game breakingly terrible. Unless you have a 3000 dollar computer build be prepared for constant frame drops and lag literally any time you do something more demanding than standing still with no other players around. With a 3k computer you'll still get problems but most of them will come from the terrible servers (assuming you can actually connect to them).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have almost 600 hours in this game and while I love the style and game play I just can't recommend this game at this time. There are FAR too many hackers. I read an article recently that claimed that out of the 4.5 million games sold 1.5 accounts were banned for hacking/cheating. To be honest in my experience that really doesn't even approach the real number. The big failure of this game is its inability or lack of interest to do something about the hackers.So for now while I love the game I just can't recommend it do to the absolute hack fest that has been going on of late.P.S. Oh and they REALLY need to do something about hopping and shooting. It would be very simple to disable a weapon when jumping or hopping just like when climbing BUT again that's something they don't seem to be interested in I guess.P.S.S. They need to region lock the game. The Chinese hackers and laggers have killed any chance of enjoying this game. The developer needs to pay attention to this or very soon the only servers they'll need are in China. If hacking and cheating is cool by the Chinese that's fine but how about we put up a Great Wall around them so they can't come out and play with the adults?

review: To whom it my concern this is the game I've been waiting for my whole life! PUBG is just absolutly perfect for someone like myself that doesn't want some crappy silly slapped together storyline (I can use my immagination for that if desired) as it has no clear storyline and jumps right into competition without much of an intro and basically just one rule be the last one survivng. You can take the game very seriously or just have fun messing around by yourself or with your buddies. The game is very unique and exciting at times it can make your heart stop from excitment I swear! PUBG has very big and immersive maps to play on leaving no two matches being the same. It can seeem very challenging at least I thought so but satisfying when you finally start to feel confidant and perform better. Best game I've Played in many years! Now go on and get yourself a chicken dinner!!!

review: People who have bad internet have an advantage. Instead of them rubberbanding they can shoot you whilst you've been behind a tree for 5 seconds. I can't tell you how many times I've peeked someone then gone back behind cover only to be shot by the same person who can't possibly be able to see/hit me. Poor optimization is another big issue. So many people have a texture bug that makes he game unplayable for the first minute or so of you being on the ground. Instead of fixing that they devs decide it's a better idea to add more broken weapons and micro transactions. These people clearly don't care about their game or fixing it. It might be in early access but you'd think that they would focus on making the game better and more optimized rather than adding things that make them more money. With the texture glitch structures are not solid. If you land at shelter and have this bug you can try to go in and it will put you under the map where you can easily win the game without any items. It's like these devs have no idea what's going on inside their game. They don't care anyway because they're getting paid.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've had almost nothing but fun with this game from it's start as a mere baby Early Access title through to it's maturity and final "launch" as a Microsoft PC and XbOne juggernaut. The combat is rewarding the scavenging is quick enough most games that it doesn't get overly repetitive (this is further mitigated playing in groups as allies can find you gear as well to ease your search.) The gameplay feels tighter than all the BR games out at the time and whiule there were (and are) bugs abound overall the game has been a fun and worthwhile experience....... BUT...Recently the game has been plagued with a plethora of issues. Cheating and "hacking" going on in a HUGE capacity like so many. Seemingly all from Chinese players to boot. Players killing me with cross city headshots using shotgun hipfire getting sniped through the back of the head in a truck that they don't have line of site on the list goes on for cheating alone.Then you get to the server and lag issues the black screen when loading into a game all the way up to ejecting from the airdrop.Also lootboxes... in a paid title it's a bit sad. I was fine with the boxes being gained solely through gameplay but being able to buy them outright through the steam market or through buying their in game currency... But now 50% of the time you'll get a crate that you HAVE to pay to open and the drop rates for ANYTHING good are absolutely atrocious. So atrocious in fact that these items are sold on the marketplace for literally thousands of dollars. It's absurd.In the game's current state I'd advise you not to pick it up. As a game that's supposedly "complete" as in 1.0+ there's way too many bugs but the biggest issue is the developers inaction in regards to the cheating situation. It would be a simple matter to region lock the game so the Chinese players who are statistically doing a majority of the cheating have to play on their own server with each other. There should be 0 problems with this as there's clearly a large enough playerbase in China to warrant thier own server. This would also alleviate lag issues in regards to ping where shots you fire and kills you should get don't register because on their end they hit you before you even fired a round.

review: 20 minutes in fully kitted out from a few battles. Driving a car to the safe zone and the server rubber bands me into a wall full stand still another player easily kills me. I have no chance. 20 minutes well spent? Negative. $30 well spent? Read on... These games are a dime a dozen so while this game happens to be the most enjoyable of the lot none of them have forwarded the genre and fixed the biggest problem the genre has Bugs.When releasing a game so heavily competitive and so incredibly reliant on smooth consistent performance delivery thereafter a game which is *plagued* with said issues is just an offense.Yes the game is early access so hopefully come "launch" (i.e. the time when no one cares about it anymore) it'll be ok. Nevertheless sadly this is one genre that doesn't lend itself to the kind of bugs it is plagued with.It's interesting to note very few other genres which go to early access have similar issues.

review: TL DR For the moment I would not recommend the game. The game has a lot of fun to be had especially if you play with a friend or two. However the fun is overshadowed by the amount of friction the elements of the game create. Wait for some patches to iron out the issues. The price is steep compared to what you get right now.The game on absolute lowest settings makes even high end rigs work harder than they should. It turns my usually quiet gtx980 into a wind tunnel on commission for NASA.All of the games calculations and actions are handled as far as I understand on the server end. That in turn means that anything you do or rather want to do is first sent as a request to the server. The server then handles the request and sends the visual representation back to the client. Depending on how fast the server reacts as well as stability of the connection to the server this can range from something you barely notice to an extreme element of frustration. As an example if you want to open a door you press the interaction button. Then you wait anywhere from 100 milliseconds to 1½ seconds for the server to handle your request. The door is then opened in the game world.Watching your character desperately trying to pick up a first aid kit or the UMP you need to protect yourself for the 5th time in a row is just asinine. The experience is only worsened when you pair it with the intensity of fire fights. Waiting for the server to wake up as you attempt to claw your way into a car while you are being shot at turns the asininity into infuriation.The vehicles all seem rather top heavy as they can easily topple over and land on the roof from a slight bump on the road.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I was on the top right corner of the map.The safe zone was on the other side of the map.I had to run. I didn't have time to collect weapons. I had to find a car bike anything since the blue circle was faster than me. I was about 3 klicks out. The circle was on my six. I was ready to die. I prayed to God "Please help me in my dire need!"All of a sudden a heavily armed man with a bike was zooming past me. I called out "Please help me good sir!" I don't know if he meant to do what he just did on purpose or what but when he jumped off his bike he died giving me all his gear including the bike.I would go on to make the top ten in that match.Thank you based bike man for saving my butt.10/10

review: I have made a review before this one but that review was a while ago and i had more time to play pubg. This is what i think of PUBG.Cons A Lot The game is not optimized at all although yes it is in "Early Access" for a game worth $30 USD its sad. Also blue hole is trying to get pubg into pro league type stuff. The game is still in development and they are already trying to get the game in pro league. Unless the game is basically finished their is no way in hell they should be doing this.The game is dependant on "RNG" which is bad. Why you may ask let's just say their is you and one other person. You go in a building and so does he all you find is a trash pistol but the other guy found a UMP and a helmet. Lets just say it will not end well for you sorry bud.The game is boring admit it. At most if you are like me will only get about 80 to 100 hours. Out of PUBG . Most games you will never see anyone till very late game and when you do you are trash because you have not gotten in a firefight with anyone yet. Or you have games where you will see people everywhere but you will most likely get killed because there are people everywhere. The market it aids. So you are telling me that you are selling a trenchcoat that you can literally find in game and put on for over $500 USD. Kill me and what's worse is the clothing adds more space to the amount of items you can carry so yes PUBG is pay to win or well succeed a lil bit more.Back to the game is not optimized at all at the top of my review i used to get 120 FPS on pubg. I have a GTX 970 but ever since they added the stupid first person only gamemode i most games barely get 60 FPS. On top of that the game is super buggy half the time i can t even load into one single match. But blue hole and the stupid that wanted his name on the ing game are too ing busy with Pro league and a ing desert map. Really you guys have so many problems with you stupid game fix them first we all know how bad you guys first pro league was.Pros surprisingly ..I gotta admit pubg is a new type of battle royale it's not your everyday game that releases every year it's new clean and fresh .Summary In all respects this game could ve been a good review if they fixed all the problems. In my opinion i cannot recommend this game at all maybe if it goes on sale then sure go for it. But till then no unless to fix all the problems and optimize their game don t buy it save the $30 on something good. Oh and i know they are going to make PUBG $60 once it comes out fully.

review: TL DR Gameplay has issues software has a lot of bugs and the development is slow and focuses on things other than gameplay and bugfixes.GAMEPLAY HAS ISSUES Not everyone may agree on this but this has bothered me the most about this game so it is going in my review. The gameplay sucks.The gameplay area is shrinking by a blue circle when you are outside this shrinking circle you die. They do this to drive the players towards each other which is nice. You have to keep moving and often running or die. The problem is that the circle is shrinking WAY too fast for this type of game.The game is slightly realistic in that a few bullets kill you (or one well aimed head shot) which means there is often not much time (if any at all) to shoot back when an opponent shoots you first. This causes the game to be often about stealth. You don't want to be spotted first. To survive you must spot the others before they spot you. But that does not work when you are forced to run. Thus the game is often like this Drop from airplane loot loot loot run run run KRAKAKAA! dead no chance to shoot back.The solution which for me would be acceptable is simple make the blue circle shrink like 3 or 4 times slower. Yes the game will take longer but that's what realism is. Otherwise just give me 4 times more armor so that I have a small chance to shoot back.SOFTWARE HAS BUGS Most reviews will tell you about this too. It often crashes there are graphics and audio bugs in the game and you can get stuck in places. Also the user interface is poor. Typical early access quality but this game is not early access (anymore) so it goes in my review.BOTTOM LINE I like the concept of battle royale. But the way it is implemented in this game is not working very well for me. Also the software needs a LOT of work to be of any decent quality.

review: PlayerUnkown's Battlegrounds' overall rating on Steam is a decent reflection of how well the player experience is. It is a mixed up mess. I am reviewing this from the US so I have not experienced or witnessed accounts of the so called "horror stories" that Chinese players and the like have unfortunately come across with this game. With that said the game is a technical mess. The inconsistent frames the poor optimization the devastating hit detection and the occasional server disconnections create an unfathomable frustration in all queues of the game. I can recall at least five instances of technical issues alone costing my squad and I a win and when the technical issues combine with the problems within the gameplay it almost feels unfair. Do you enjoy constantly running in a videogame for 15 20 minutes while simultaneously dodging incoming fire from multiple squads maintaining a steady stream of healing and looting the houses you pass for anything worth picking up? Well then you are in luck. About half the time I play this game I find myself on the run from the in game death zone that steadily shrinks the map down as the match progresses. If you're lucky you'll find a vehicle that can fit your whole squad and take you to safety. If you're lucky you won't get gunned down by another squad camping inside the edge of the zone as soon as you get there. Basically just get lucky and you will win. The game can hardly get the simple stuff right. I can't vault over a fence or five foot wall or even a rock for that matter the parachutes in the beginning of every match get stuck on everything and take forever to land you on the ground and the response times for in game objects you can interact with (like opening doors and getting in and out of vehicles) is clunkiness at its finest. That is what this game is clunkiness at its finest. The definition of early access trash. And I love it.8/10

review: I decided to get the game becuase of all the hype. First few minutes in and I can tell this game is poorly optimized.I don't think I have a bad rig (I5 4460 r9 270 and 8gbs of ram) it's decent and runs games just fine on medium/high on most games. In pubg I'd be lucky to get 40fps on verylow. In Addition I found it absurd to charge $30 for 1 gamemode.The gamemode isn't even that fun too you can hardly see anyone the game is glitchy as hell and just boring if you're playing alone or nobody on the server as a mic. I do not recommend this game becuase of the absurd pricing performence and frustrating gameplay. The game is trash. If you want to play a battle royal game for free without the performence issues go try fortnite.At least then you can have a chance to see people and not lag all over the place.

review: It's a fantastic shooter.Extremely addicting and takes quite a while to get any good at it which is part of what makes any game good.The major problems come from the servers and from what I understand the engine + netcode the game is built on. The desync can be terrible at times it doesn't matter how good your computer or connection is.You WILL die behind cover many many times (probably the worst thing)You WILL spray someone from point blank and half your bullets won't register causing you to dieYou WILL headshot someone with a sniper only for the bullet to not register because the server thinks they shot first again you'll dieThis doesn't seem to be fixable or I would imagine the devs would have resolved it already.If you can move past this and try to not get too frustrated at these things (I've failed at this many times) the game is great and I would recommend it to anyone who likes FPS.

review: The game is still clunky and chunky and prominent with Chinese hackers. I've been trying to stick to PUBG for a few months now but the quality is just not increasing to meet my demands in all honesty. Graphics even when on Ultra for me appear to be something equivelant to an un modded original Skyrim for console.I just recently played 3 games after a two month hiatus from PUBG only to encounter non stop hackers. (I.E. someone killing 20+ people in about 15 seconds in a Solo game and other games where a floating player is teleporting around and shooting people.) Reporting doesn't seem to be doing much seeing how when I last religiously played PUBG the same hacks were being utilized.Honestly if you want to play a Battle Royale style game then Fortnite is probably my best suggestion to you even though I am not a fan of building your own enviornmnent instead of adapting to what you're already in in FPS style games.

review: Bluehole are slowly sorting out the glitches.... and that's the issue the word 'slowly'. Bluehole try and put the onus on the customer when it comes to a bug/glitch. A common themes from BH 'have you tried this' have you tried doing that'... er how about trying to get a patch out! Battleye..... some of you will know what this means i now do since pubg and it's ruining the game for me. And yet again there doesn't seem to be any urgency to sort this problem and it's a massive problem for a lot of players at the moment (in a nutshell it stops you from playing pubg after a period of time). And before anyone comments yes i have tried (well my mate has tried via Team viewer every suggestion put on the forums but hasn't worked). And i never had an issue with battleye until the end of March 2018. Over 90 hrs played without any issues until battleye reared it's ugly head.And if BH don't sort it very soon this will kill pubg especially that fortnite is the same genre and free!The game itself is easy to play but hard to master with quite a steep learning curve when it comes to tactics and weapon attachments etc. There's only 2 maps and the latest one is quite boring. It doesn't give you the option to only play the original. Why they haven't got day/night cycles where you have to scavenge for night vision goggles glow stick and flare guns i don't know. It would bring a new element to the game. Plus a random weather system would be nice. And occasionally it would be nice that everyone spawns with the same gear i.e. a helemt vest an assault rifle and pistol etc.. that would make it a level playing field for a change.Pubg has so much potential but at the moment the perception is that the devs are only concentrating on money and getting more players (the new mobile version is out which is pretty pointless imo). Get the basics right first BH before trying to branch out!Would i recommend pubg at this time.... no. There's too many glitches and the perception is that the devs aren't doing anything about it. There's a distinct lack of communication from the devs as to when bugs/glitches will be put right. Don't buy for now.

Then heat a large frying pan or wok add the sunflower oil heat it until sizzling and fry the ginger till it's crisp.Step 4 When it's done remove with a slotted spoon. Add the chicken and garlic and stir fry until just browned. Remove the meat using a slotted spoon and set aside.Step 5 Add the red pepper and broccoli and stir fry for around 2 3 minutes until it's just tender. Add the soy sauce mixture bring it to the boil then return the chicken to the pan

review: First of all As a Chinese player who temporarily lives in the United States I want to talk about geographical discrimination. When I saw Blue Hole chose to match Chinese players with Chinese players I feel very angry&amp sad because it chose to push the error to most of Chinese players rather than opting to update their anti hacking mechanism. Many Chinese players who do not cheating have been quitted this game cause by the behavior of blue hole That makes them feel THEY WERE DISCRIMINATED AGAINST Cheating occurs in every game every region and every server. This is a very common thing.You shouldn't blame the Chinese players.Another thing is PUBG's hardware requirements are getting more and more excessive. Minimum configuration as GTX1070 means what? U can even play GTA5 with A High with it remember! PUBG just is a mmogame! U ARE NOT A STAY ALONE GAME!!! The money players will spend on a 1070 can buy 20 PUBG(s).Blue Hole chooses to continuously improve hardware requirements instead of paying a certain cost to optimize the game.This illustrates the company s attitude towards players.If you saw it discounted and wanted to buy and it happened to see my assessment. Listen to me give up this game choose to play rainbow6 battlefield1 or fortnite with me these games are much more fun than f****** PUBG.Could you add me to your steam friend? If you are willing to experience some interesting games with me首先 作为暂时居住在美国的中国玩家 我想谈谈地域歧视问题 当我看到蓝洞选择将中国玩家与中国玩家相匹配时 我感到非常生气和难过 因为它选择将错误推给大多数中国玩家 而不是选择更新他们的反黑客机制 许多不作弊的中国玩家已经因蓝洞的行为而退出了这场比赛 这让他们感到他们受到了歧视 作弊发生在每个游戏 每个地区和每个服务器上 这是一件很平常的事情 蓝洞不应该让中国玩家背锅 另一件很重要的事是 PUBG的硬件要求越来越高 GTX1070的最低配置意味着什么 你甚至 甚至可以用把GTA5开到高配置畅玩 请记住 PUBG只是个多人网游 你不是一个单机游戏 玩家花在GTX1070上的钱甚至可以买20个PUBG蓝洞选择持续改进硬件要求 而不是花费一定的费用来优化游戏 这说明了公司并不重视玩家 只想着捞一笔就跑 如果你看到它打折并想要购买 并恰巧看到了我的评估 听我一句劝 放弃这个游戏吧 跑来找我我玩彩虹六号 战地1或堡垒之夜吧 这些游戏比f ****** PUBG更有趣 如果你愿意和我一起晚些有趣或者奇怪的游戏 就把我添加进你的steam好友列表里面吧

review: I'll keep this short. The game is good. There are of course bugs in the game but nothing really major. This is the first game I've ever played where I could actually feel my heart pumping particularly in the final circles when there are few people left.Unfortunately scriptkiddies are ruining the game. Since the game was published in China the number of hackers has grown so much that I'm seeing at least one scriptkiddy every game. TPP is so plauged with them that the game mode is literally unplayable (just played 3 TPP games died to a hackers in 2 of them). At this stage I can't recommend PUBG. I love the game but the sheer number of hackers results in the game being a frustrating waste of time. Until they take major action (such as a ping cap which prevents players from playing on servers that are physically too far away from them) do not buy the game.PS I have about 60 wins so I'm not just 'trash' at the game (not that I'm a god or anything xD)

review: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds was a game that was created after seeing success of games like it. Like H1Z1 one of its main influencers it's a battle royale game where you collect weapons around a set map and fight to the death with one winner left remaining. Though sounding like a pretty simple concept for designing PUBG Corp formerly named Bluehole has failed to meet the mark like other better games of its same genre. Fortnite to give an example is a free to play game that has a much more polished design than PUBG. What was PUBG Corps response you may ask? They decided it would be a better idea to threaten a lawsuit that to actual fix their own game. That doesn't even get to how poorly they've taken care of cheating.Cheaters of PUBG congrats. You have nothing to worry about. At the time of me writing this review the anticheat put in place doesn't consider any of you a threat. Instead it goes after innocent players instead. Feel free to keep on cheating till PUBG Corp gets their act together. Teach them a lesson.All in all if you want a battle royale experience that will give you a rush I recommend a free to play title. Realm Royale Fortnite of even H1Z1 now are all free and much better than this pile of utter garbage. Until the developers get their act together please don't give these guys any money. For a game this long in the making it feels like a game built off of kickstarter donations. Leave this game to rot until a rework has been created. Thank you

review: Player Unknown's Battle Grounds more commenly known as PUBG is one of the First Battle royale games That blew up. After Brendan Greene started working with the team who created another Battle Royale game Called H1Z1 King Of The Kill he decided he wanted to take is part on the whole Battle royale game and created his own game PUBG. The game gets more hate than it deserves. The cons of it are that there are many hackers Lots of bugs and how unoptimized it is. The Game improved alot since release and has optimised the game. You probably couldnt even run this game on a gt 1030 when the game first came out now you could probably run the game at around 1080p medium settings at 60fps maybe more. People say that he doesnt care about what the consumer wants and only wants to add cosmetics to make more money but its not really true there have been so many problems fixed since launch. Yes the more popular BR Game is Fortnite Battle Royale but player count shouldn't determine which game you should get. I would give this a 8.5/10Edit Most bad reviews are from people with patato pcs or ones who die to bugs alot. dont know if its true because i havent ran into more than 3 bugs in the 30 40 games ive played so far one of them was me getting stuck in the ground and moving very slowly which i fixed by just proning another was trying to pick items up without dragging them into my inventory and the other was just me crashing. if you have a pc over $300 you should be able to play it. hell ive seen it being play with a gt 1030. If people tell you that you cant play it with anything but a $1000 pc dont listen to them. My Laptop has a GTX 1050ti i5 8300h 2.3 ghz multi core processor and 8gb ddr4 ram with a 256gb ssd and the game runs perfectly on high and medium settings. while this is a $800 laptop with taxes included you could probably get the same build in a desktop for around $400 $600

review: About to hit that 700 hour mark sadly. Although not be a large sum I believe it will entitle me to some opinions. Large player base for a game filled with bugs hackers inaccurate hitboxes and a ton of t... When I first started playing PUBG it was refreshing filled with game play experiences never experienced before from any other games. The concept was still new at the time even though Bluehole wasn't the first one to come up with the battle royale mode they had a pretty damn fine Interpretation of it. Learning how to play the game was exciting! Call me old school but I'm the type of person who sticks to one or two games and rarely tries out differnt games. When I when won my first chicken dinner which was about my 100 hour mark it was exhilarating my heart was pumping hands shaking and hungry for more. Been a long time since I felt anything like that but soon as I continued my fruitless attempts at claiming the ever so elusive dub some of the reasons why it was so damn hard to come out on top was because the game itself was never going to let you have the chance to win it in the first place. The game is a walking living breathing bug you look at it the wrong way and it'll come flying at you and kill you in the most random way possible but me being me I didn't let it bother me too much I had faith in the Dev team to fix the issues in time...(Oh how wrong I was) These guys do not care for their consumers as long as 51% of the player base stays content. (Chinese players) Which brings up the next reason why I choose to not recommend this travesty of a game. Hackers are out of control in this game and Bluehole shows no sign of stopping them any time soon. There will be a hacker in your game atleast every two to three games and trust me when you're in that top 10 thinking about that dub and all of a sudden you get a shot to your head out of nowhere only to find out it was a hacker that pisses you off. Again I was naive I trusted the Dev team once more... I was patient forgiving and tolerent. Not a huge baseball fan but like the rule implies three strikes you're out. Where do I draw the line? When Blueballs Entertainment decides to give me a bann when I'm the one who's been killed by hackers the one who plays the game fair. Are you kidding me? Worst part is they don't even give you a reason why they banned you. Thanks Bluehole I think I know why Fornite has a larger player base than you guys. Sorry for the long rant if somebody managed to make it down this far I was looking forward to playing some games this weekend but was pleasantly suprised by the bann message instead. Just PUBG things.

review: PROS Fantastic game for the survival nut and competitive player. Using every advantage you can to survive and come up on top in this post apocalyptic Battle Royal style arena.The gun play is wonderfully satifying and the unreal engine allows for good reactive shooting with very little latency.The game is beautiful if you ever want to be at a disadvantage while playing on ultra but even on low it can be very enjoyable to look at.CONS The resource hunger of this game is insatiable. It want to use all of the system ram then move it into the vram while hitting your CPU like some sort of deranged video encoder. But after the first minute of dropping frames and unreactive doors the game runs smoothly. (Running on a pretty high tier PC)Vehicles need work but I'm not going to harp on about a game that's still in alpha. For an alpha its teathing problems are made alot better by the holy refresh button on the top right.

review: PLAYERUKNOWN'S BATTLEBROUNDS is a fun fps/tps open world survival multiplayer game. For me at least i've experienced very few in game bugs/glitches. Now before you buy or consider buying I feel oblidged to inform you of some things to be aware about. Firstly you should have a microphone as the game has no in game chat like other multiplayer games like CS GO. Despite saying you should have a microphone you don't technically need a microphone as the game doesn't require one in order to be played you can still play the game without one and communicate to an extent with gestures/taunts. But if you plan on doing co op or as the game calls it duos or squads (where randomly assigned 4 player squads are created and fight to the death) or customly created duos and squads communication is of the essence. Secondly you DO NEED a good computer to run this game as I've heard people say the game will just crash if their computer doesn't meet the bare necessities. Now on to the in game review. The player has access to a unique array of various firearms melee weapons vehicles and equipment. This game also features cosmetics yet they are not game changing. Finally my only true official complaint is that the loading time can be painfully long but I have reason to assume this will change over time (I hope at least). All in all PUBG is a pretty fun game that's aimed can work for both casual and hardcore players. Also beware you'll find a few squeakers here and there as well as your the occassional edgy fucc boi/girl who think they're cool by saying things like everyones favorite word and such but these people aren't that big of a problem unless you're easily offended. My overall score for the game 7 8/10 fun game except the GODAMN ING LONG RELOAD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
