review: So in PlayerUnknown Battlegrounds things I've noticed 1.) The textures are nice but need a lot of refinement when you're moving around or going in and out of a scope. 2.) There's a glitch anytime I look upwards where the lower left corner of my screen has 2 black pixely triangles. Happens the most on wooden floor textures. 3.) There's floating books going off the shelves in some of the houses. 4.) Voice chat likes to glitch out and not work along with that there's open mic in the pre game load in as well as before you drop which is really loud and annoying. 5.) It's a bit wonky clicking things to pick them up along with getting in a car. (Use tab to pick up items instead of mashing F) 6.) The cars are a bit awkward to drive compared to other cars. the camera is VERY CLOSE to where the car takes up most of the screen and it's hard to see your surroundings. Realistic but compared to the car mechanics in other games like GTA borderlands H1Z1 KOTK it's weird.7.) DON'T. JUMP. OVER. CHAIRS. I got glitched out over one and did the falling/flailing animation and as far as I know.. You're ing stuck my man. I tried moving around frantically jumping crouching proning shift running ect ect. Nothing works. If you get stuck you might as well just exit the match.8.) The Parachute mechanic leaves a lot to be desired. It's awkward you press the right arrow key it shifts you left and same vise versa. When you're almost on the ground it slows down and takes quite a bit of time to finally be able to walk (Which gives enemies time to get guns and pewpew you.) Overall the game has a lot of potential though. I'm looking forward to the monthly optimization updates. The gun aiming is A LOT better than H1Z1 you can zoom in find scopes the scopes vary (red dot holographic 4x 8x ect) there's A LOT more guns. In the spawn you can play around with the guns too. There's a bit more character design you earn points as you play matches to unlock things (unlike H1Z1 where you only got stuff if you BOUGHT COINS and gambled it.) The plane does go in a straight line but you can decide where you drop. If you're not in the safe zone and you get caught in the blue electro magnetic field you can at least see where you're going (It hurts though a lot more than toxic gas) If you die you can spectate your teammate and If you're "downed" a teammate can get you back up.I give it a 7/10 atm. H1Z1 still feels a bit better than PUGB HOWEVER PUGB JUST came out and has so much room to improve. Lots of potential. &gt I do reccomend buying the game and giving it a try me and my friends had a great time last night. The game is playable atm and you can have a lot of fun. Make sure to watch some streams before going in and reading some of the tips before starting a game. RIP H1Z1 KOTK February 18 2016 March 2017 Early access for life

review: Hey I think this game is pretty great. I don't have as many hours as everyone else but I still want to input my opinion. I have only ran into one cheater so far and he didn't even have a Chinese name. I can understand other players' frustration if they truly encounter these bad apples all the time although I really believe that a majority of people simply jumped on the bandwagon to continually accuse Chinese players. I'm not sure. I have a lot of fun getting to top 10 in solo games and even more so when I am in a squad with my friends. In the end just try not to take the game so seriously.

review: One of the best games I've ever played a really great game overall however some things need fixing.First of all optimization.Probably the worst of all. The game could sometimes just get stuck for a few seconds and you can't do anything about it even if you run it on lowest settings or with a really high end computer.Second clipping issues.I don't know if it's only me but I've noticed quite a few times where the physics are just derpy af.I landed on a roof of a warehouse which had a lot of holes in it (not sure where it is) and I just hovered above the holes. There was an invisible floor/ceiling there. Not sure if intended or not.Third not many pistols and pistols are quite hard to use.Not sure if only me but I can barely use pistols in medium range fights (10 20 meters). Hold ADS is not the best whilst the iron sights are just cancerous and I can't see sh*t with 'em.But overall the game is simply amazing and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who loves BR games or even anyone who likes FPS really.

review: At times it can be really fun when things go your way but when things don't you end up wasting a half hour having no fun to then just get screwed by your loot or your zone spawns or just getting randomly sniped...And you have very little control over that because of how random the game is.The concept of this having tournaments and being a "competitive game" is quite humorous.Banning players who teamkill is pretty iffy. Banning people who are suspected of stream sniping really just feels like it's motivated by the devs appeasing major streamers by banning people to keep them happy since twitch has been a huge source of their popularity. Turns all the streams into lynchmobs whenever the streamer gets shot and doesn't feel like it was fair (surprise it happens to all of us).Some people will like this game a lot sometimes it's enjoyable but I always end up wishing people wanted to play a different game.TLDR unless you're definitely into this type of game save your money...It might get better over time but considering the direction it's going it might just collapse and lose most of its playerbase too.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The only reason I still play this game is for the lobbies and fist fights. Only 16 hours in and I've noticed a severe lack of development as far as gun mechanics go. A friend and I were playing doubles when we snuck up on two guys looting a crate drop thing about 50 meters away. We had plenty of time to line up our AKM's (on single fire) at just their bodies. We opened fire with a full magazine before they even moved and not a single bullet landed (we have both played FPS games our entire lives promise it wasnt potato aim) then they just slowly turned and dropped us both in seconds. The gun mechanics hitboxes bullet accuracy and aiming in this game seem to not be flushed out whatsoever. If anyone has heard this problem before and knows a simple solution to my complaint/problem please let me know. Otherwise don't waste your money on this "finished" game.

review: Absolutely fantastic game. This was my first Battle Royale type game ever and although I was hesitant to try it it turned out to be one of the best gaming choices I made. I discovered it by winning a BETA key in a random stream. Had never heard of it nor its development. Had never cared for BR type games (I had watched friends play H1Z1 and I hated the fast paced arcade style).However when I started playing it it was SO fulfilling. The suspense the joy of finding good loot and especially the satisfaction from getting kills. Although all that stuff is great the biggest thing I love about the game is the SUPPORT from the developers. They constantly update this thing and improve it every. single. time. I had a gripe about the game that I thought would never be addressed then lo and behold they're coming out with a big patch to fix it (the vaulting animations).Whether you have played BR games before or not I would highly recommend PUBG. I truly feel this game is here to stay for a long time to come.

review: Oddly enough this game was better in pre release alpha than it current state as of March 2018. The game has more crashing issues now than it did in alpha. Cheaters are more prevelant and not much has been done to fix 99 percent of the cheaters other than call the playerbase affected by the cheaters Xenophobes. The game is no longer enjoyable and I cant recommend it.Before release the game ran pretty good on my Vega 64/Ryzen system. After release I was barely able to target anyone for a kill. It was like there was some kind of input lag. I ended up upgrading to an 8700k with a 1080 Ti (pretty much to enjoy this game again). Sure enough I was back to getting 1 4 kills per game again until the 1.6gb March patch.After the patch the game wouldn't even launch. I spent days spamming crash reports and googling trying to see if anyone had a fix. I ended up disabling most of my startup programs and it started right up. The next day I forgot to disable the startup programs and it launched fine so I dont know what the issue was. The group of guys I play alongside haven't been so fortunate. One teammate launches and works half the time the other teammate never launches at all so he is no longer playing with us. The game is still broken after a week while bluehole keeps announcing the next great feature and plans they have for PUBG.Cheaters.... you're suppose to be able to watch your killcam and see how your enemy takes you out from his viewpoint. I just left a match where I was gunned down and the killcam was fixed on me (from an over my shoulder viewpoint) didn't even catch a glimpse of my opponent. Unfortunately when you report cheats you only have a dropdown box with a few choice selections. If the cheat or hack is not covered under one of those what is the point. The devs are too busy raking in your cash adding more cosmetic items and announcing the great things they are doing for the game (while there game is crashing and burning) to fix the cheat issue. If 99 percent of the cheaters being banned are from China region locking that country would solve 99 percent of the cheat problem. Tired of this companies lack of fixing issues while pursuing other platform launches and selling licenses to generate more revenue.Quit making and announcing your "great plans' for your game Bluehole and fix it first.They also do server maintenance in primetime hours for the USA...very frequently very annoying.In all I don't recommend the game and it gets a thumbs down until they fix the issues and apologize for the name calling.

review: I have played this game for less than 30 minutes with a decent computer and I was completely impressed with its lack of optimization. My computer normally works at 30 Celsius degrees and when this game started it suddenly jumped to 60 Celsius degrees. The gaming experience does not compensate the amount of stress that your machine is put through to execute this game. Nowadays there are other options which are better and cheaper. PUBG is a hyped game and I don't understand how it managed to get more than a million players with a thousand flaws.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Let's be honest here the game is fun to play. With over 400 hours played on a i7 6700hq and gtx 960m laptop the game had issues and needed to run on 1600x900 with low settings to maintain 40 50 FPS. It was still doable and I was able to still be relatively competable with my friends who have built PC's. I recently built a pc (Ryzen 7 2700x and zotac gtx 1080ti) and it is like playing a different game. I am playing on 1440p resolution and run about 100fps on average with high/ultra settings. I am able to see players at a distance and my performance in up close combat has improved tenfold. On both PC's I have ran into a minimal amount of issues. Before it offically released the issues were more prevalent but after release I rarely run into any issues such as lagging out or game crashes. I am disappointed in the optimization by Bluehole but it does not deter me from playing. The addition of keys for $2.50 to open crates that you buy with ingame rewarded currency is about the dumbest thing. The game lacks motivating factors to play without friends. While I do like the addition of gun skins and different customizable clothing I feel like they need to focus on making the game playable without issue for the majority of players before adding things that do not affect gameplay. I play for the competition. I have played the past 2 seasons of Fortnite after many hours on PUBG. Fortnite's challenges and battle pass idea makes it worth getting on everyday whether I have friends to play with or not. PUBG still feels more competitive but the games can drag on only to be sniped/shot in the back/killed by the blue zone. If you are wondering if you should buy this game with so many bad reviews I say buy it and join the fun. With a proper PC it will be worth it. However if you are on the fence and your PC is on the lower end do not buy it. It will feel like a waste of money. It is like playing on a nintendo 64 while your competition is on a PS4.

review: I resisted buying this for a long time. Far more eliquient people on here have submitted their reviews good and bad and the split of opinion had me hovering over the BUY button. I'm sat firmly in the GOOD side of the fence. Does too many things well. Its tough and full of the sort of people you would prefer to avoid online but damn its a big fat bag of fun. Just lost 90minutes of my life and the game pushed my modest gaming rig to the max. Hot enough to fry an egg but not hot enough for a chicken dinner.Glad I dropped 26 on it? Maybe not when other games are slicker and free. But this is PUBG and its got that salty/sweet balance to keep me coming back for more.I have played a lot on XB1X too by the way. Its night and day. If you want to play this game don't spaff your wedge on the Console. Hand over your hard earned cash to intel/amd &amp the GPU gang.

review: Recently this game is getting downvotes for their paid crates or bans for dumb reasons. Don't not buy this game based on those stupid reviews. It's not even relevant to the gameplay of this game. If this genre of game interests you then buy it if not then don't that's fine too. It's the best game there is out right now for its genre. The developers are hard at work patching bugs weekly and then pushing awesome new content out each month. I've enjoyed the game a lot so far and I'm excited to try out the new features that are yet to come like new maps guns movement mechanics and complete character customization to name a few. Overall the game is great. The downvoting recently this game is getting has frustrated me since it doesn't reflect anything about the gameplay itself. I don't ever spend time to write a review for a game but this time I felt I had to.

review: Where do I start? This game is owned by one of the worse companies I've ever seen. I just got banned for absolutely no reason after a game where I had 0 kills and missed every bullet. The game has always ran like dog crap. To quote a famous review "Fun for you and your computer." My $1 000 PC could roast hotdogs while I play this game. I've been killed by countless cheaters yet I'm getting banned. They had the genius idea of adding loot crates to the game. You get a random crate and IT HAS A CHANCE OR REQUIRING A KEY THAT YOU NEED MONEY TO BUY. I have 21 of them. Most of the customization items I've unlocked are just different color shirts or pants. And not to mention the skins and clothes look like at least it does if you want to win and have your settings on the lowest possible settings so looks more boxy. Lower settings make things like grass and foliage smaller and if you turn your render distance all the way down grass stop loading after 100m or so. It's like they don't play their own game. I've also had this weird issue where the game somehow manages to uninstall itself. It's happened twice and the last time it happened i just left it unistalled for a few months.

review: The game is overrated. If you like tense hide and seek then go ahead. Unfortunately the game requires you to spend long periods of time sneaking around with little actual "playing" of the game. You can and will place well simply by hiding in a corner for the majority of the game. Attempts to move and engage other players will result in getting shot quickly requiring another long wait before the next game then repeat. The game can be interesting but after a few long waits by a stair well while the field whittles down you wonder if there's something better you can do with your time. 2/5 stars tops.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is by far one of the most impressive idea for a game but it lacks the support needed from the Developers.I have a modest amount of time in the game itself and I have to say that I love the ideaBUTYou have to be kidding me when I'm from Singapore and I am playing in South East Asian server and I still experience lag. This is the type of game that shouldn't be having lag problems at all. I died way too many times to other people because I was magically teleported out of my cover.Leaderboards are a great idea to know where you're placed in the region you're playing with but in PUBG you'll only be dragged down to the furthest depths of the sea because of server issues.Seriously? Introducing new weapons and maps won't change the fact that the server is still Sh**. Why not improve server capacity and make sure the lag is reduced and/or eliminated. No I'm not talking about the 10 30 ping issue I'm talking about the constant Server Lag Detected thing you place on screen.

Bog down the server making it laggy for other players and sometimes making it unplayable2. they lag and rubberband on NA players screens making them very hard to kill3. They scream " China #1" 4. Overall ruins the experience of someone who actually is trying to win Another issue i have is with the camera while you are in a car is crazy terrible and often gives me a headache due to it sometimes being very rocky and while ADS the camera wobble is absolutely over exagerated and also causes motion sicknessOverall Idk how to feel about this game I will wait for full launch to see if anything changes but until then i stand sorta in between and until some of the cons are fixed i will side with the negatives.*EDIT*So the chinese situation is worse. Now everytime you get a game there is a hacker I highly do no recommend buying in its current state. Greene and others are against the region lock of China claiming that is banning a whole country. That is utter bs its restricting them to their own servers how is that banning lol. I swear people are stupid. Another isus is this games netcode which has a hard time running at a steady tick. Analysis shows it runs from 2 30 tick usually on the lower end of spectrum around 12 This makes the game quites in terms of bullet detection and even input detection. review: The amount of negative reviews I'm imagining are probably the same vein of kids that drop in the center of the map (school) and die immediately. It take a couple of hours to understand that winning involves AVOIDING people in the beginning. The less resources you waste (including teamates) the better chance you have in the late stages of the match. By all means get a feel of the game and drop into the autistic spots but understand that winning usually means playing away from the planes path and getting to the center of the next circles before anyone else.As for performance I have a 1070 16gb ram and a i5 skylake and i run around 90 100 frames everywhere.

review: First off this game is pretty good. I enjoy all the different weapons which can very from a handgun to a large sniper rifle to a large machine gun. Attatchments for every gun make this game cool different variations on scope zoom's and anything from a suppressor to a compensator to help keep an advantage. Cars are well balance in this game unlike h1z1 where u get a car and you have a great chance to win the game. The pan is something different. The pan is the most overpowerd weapon/armor. Its a level 4 armor which u take 0 damage when shot in the or when shot when u have it in hand. Its also a great weapon many times you can knockout an enemy with a single hit to the head with it. Last but not least backflips. They are just bad to do! 10/10 IGN would play again.

review: PUBG is truly a tactical strategic and skill based battle royale game that no other game can replicate . Battlegrounds wastes no time putting player right in the middle of the action as up to 100 players join a server and pick their moment to jump out of a plane and parachute onto a large 8x8 km islandItem distribution is randomized but players can t count on finding a good gun early keeping player safe . It isn t out of the ordinary for someone with only a pistol to take down someone with a fully loaded SCAR L assault rifle since good gear is only half the battle / the other half is wit As players outsmart each other in deadly games of cat and mouse those still standing are forced into ever closer proximity within the confines of a deadly ever shrinking force field until just one is left alive P/S Victory is an exhilarating reward matched only by the suspense that emerges from the battle to achieve it . But even if you die early jumping into a new game is always quick and easy Rate 7/10

review: Sanhok is a refreshing addition to the map pool compared to the slower pace of Erangel and Miramar. The increased loot drop rates of ARs and DMR/SRs as well as the smaller map size allows for more action and more fun. You could drop at a random set of houses with no names and still be fully geared and encounter a fight in less than 5 minutes. While the devs have added microtransactions they are purely cosmetic and do not forgo gameplay and mechanical updates as seen by the addition of a new map new vehicles new guns new scopes and various balance changes which helped break up the monotony of the M4 meta. PUBG combines great gun gameplay through its mechanics customization and variety. WHile the gun mechanics are not as skill based as counter strike as there is more rng when spraying it still satisfies my desire for fast twitch skilled first person shooters. The bolt action sniper rifles feel sublime to use. That being said PUBG will challenge even the highest end PCs and performance problems are especially noticeable when hotdropping. The thrill of the battle royale gamemode and PUBG's great gun mechanics overshines its performance issues and keeps me coming back time and time again. I think PUBG gets alot of underserved hate its is not a perfect game but it is still an enjoyable experience and the definitive battle royale experience.

The developers have shown that they don't give a at all about all their players. Their wallet might be a 10 digit number but they don't fix the game nor the servers. I have dual OC'd 980Ti (1400MHz) and I'm like 50 55fps this is a ing joke. Not to mention all the cheaters and stuff like that.But crates ? Hell yeah if you want that boy do they got many. Even skins for the parachute so marvellous so useful. So much better than making the game enjoyable.This game has become so ridiculous I wonder how people still play it. And I already knew it was going that way when they introduced crates in the early access stage.Don't buy it.

review: 7.5/10Pros Looting and building your best character as quickly as you can is rather fun. Being in the top 10 is insanely tense. Few games have made me as anxious. Having 2 3 and 4 man squads is awesome. It takes away from the tension sadly but replaces it with a tactical aspect through communication and teamwork.Cons In general an overhyped game run by terrible developers. Some of the news that I've seen come out of this game is atrocious and I won't be supporting these turds in the future. Gun play is quite mediocre. Pretty sad for a game that's based around shooting. Poorly optimized. It plays like a jerkier version of Fallout 3. Gameplay is not smooth at all. Hackers seem more prevalent compared to other games I've played but that may be due to the game's popularity. A decent amount of bugs. I've had to quit twice now just because the game wouldn't let me out of my vehicle.I'd recommend it for fans of shooters stealth and looting games. Unfortunately it's nowhere near as polished as it should be. I would highly suggest not giving any money to this developer in the future unless changes in management and customer feedback/support are enacted.

review: Okay to start of my review I want to say What's with all the negative reviews. "Buuu huu the Devs said that they wouldn't release paid content until full launch.... wahhhhh!!! Bad game uninstall!" is every single review I'm seeing atm. If you don't want to buy a key to open a crate for an event that the game is having well that's your problem let everyone else spend their money on crates with cool costumes inspired from an awesome movie!This game is incredibly well made and stands apart from all it's competitors (H1Z1 KoTK Arma3 PUBG Mod etc.) The physics in this game are much better than other games (even though sometimes they might feel a little weird S ). You can play this game without spending a single cent after you've purchased it because you get apparel and costumes for free ingame currency just for playing the game! So who cares if they're adding 1 crate which costs a little to open the money goes for a good cause and you don't have to open the crate if you don't want to! Oh yea btw they're adding 2 other crates that are free to open alongside this 1 crate! Maybe try your luck on those crates instead of saying "Buuhuu microtransactions!!!!"Final words Great game! Great theme! Great gameplay! Optimization is being worked on every month so even the most low end pc's will manage to play this game at a good framerate!! Only have 42 hours on this game right now but that number is only going to get bigger as I play this great game every day going forward!BUY THIS GAME IF YOU'RE LOOKING TO HAVE A GOOD TIME!!!!!!!

review: Summary PUBG is an amazing game that keeps getting better. With each update comes something new that enhances the game and makes gameplay increasingly more fluid. The guns are all pretty much balanced (there could be some tweaks here and there). The RNG in the game either is heavily in your favor or heavily against you such as when you drop in a town with your friends only to find micro useless's and P92's or if you have to play marathon runner to get to the circle (THIS IS A YUUUGE PROBLEM WITH THE NEW MAP!!!). Vehicles are mostly realistic and have truly come a long way since just this past summer when i started. Overall rating 7/10 but unless you are really picky or you are really bad at the game you won't realize it is anything below 10/10.The BIG issues This game is riddled with hackers specifically from asian countries. These guys join the lobby and instantly start shouting "CHINA NUMBER 1" or some similar chant but with a different country that is basically a key indication that you have some hackers in the lobby. Good thing is that you can usually beat them if you out flank them and don't expose yourself. Most of these hackers can either shoot through walls with hip fire instant head shot destroy gear with single shot use super speed instant death by grenade without cooking or fly. I haven't seen the ones that fly or the ones that run as fast as a vehicle in a couple months. It is very easy to identify hackers now that we have the replay feature so if you think someone is hacking you can record the clip and report the player. I think there is an option for further reporting that you can use the video clip of on the player unkown website. Hackers only really ruin 9 out of 10 games the one game they don't ruin is because they messed up and got out played or the circle killed them. When I first started this game my buddies and I could win a couple games in a row or at least play more than 5 minutes without getting killed by a hacker. Now it seems you get into a game and as soon as you land you'll die from a pistol head shot through a wall from a guy half way across the city hip firing. THE FIX Region lock countries and it will fix most hacking issues for North American players. Most of us just want to play the game with our friends act like badasses or just troll. Most of us our sick of playing with people from another country who yell "F*** America America number 0 China number 1" while hacking to kill us effortlessly and then t bagging our dead bodies. This is what needs to be done if an anti cheat system can't be enabled that solves until there is a solution that solves the problem.FUTURE SUGGESTIONSTo end this I would like to suggest that in the future there be a feature for purchasing/renting or self hosting servers. I think it would be a great addition to the game especially for those in it for the e sport aspects of the game. This would open up a lot more local tournaments. Also please consider adding different options for each map such as larger teams and more players on specific maps. The new map definitely could be a 200 person map. Another suggestion before I wrap this up please add a map that is smaller but made only of cities.Thank you for reading!

review: Didn't find it enjoyable really vast amount of the games is usually camping and hoping you get the jump on someone and the other part is hiking/jogging around and hoping the next building you go check doesn't have a guy with a shotgun in prone position facing the door you're about to open.From a technical stand point the game has some annoying inconsistencies with its hitboxes and the latency can at times freak out causing weird desync. Frame rate is usually solid but has some parts of the map and moment where it can suddenly drop from a smooth 60 fps experience to 30s mixed in with some weird stutters.I picked it up since i saw how crazy popular it was getting and from the videos i saw online it seemed fun even have two friends who go it so i thought I'd give it a shot too but when i went to play it solo and in duo with a friend i simply didn't enjoy it the base gameplay experience is not fun for me. If you enjoy that's great for you and feel free to thumb down me to oblivion. I simply can't find a single element fun in Battleground and regret spending 26 Euros on humble for it.This was my first and last battleroyale experience i now know this genre is not my cup of tea.

review: So despite this game being a very enjoyable experience i cannot recommend it right now. not because of the chinese hackers (i personally haven't come across any) or any of the minor bugs out there. but because there is a bug that absolutely breaks the game that has yet to be addressed despite being around for a long ing time! lemme break this down for any wide eyed traveller perusing this fine review section. basically your game starts loading in...... and there ya go. you get to look at a loading screen.... forever. welcome to loading screen unknown. now of course not everyone is expereincing this but its common enough that no one else should buy this game until such a time that this game breaking bug is dealt with. when the time comes that this bug is fixed i will happily change my review
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hello this is both a review and a public service anouncement.I would like to start by saying that this game CAN be imense fun and very enjoyable with company. However in its current state I can not recomend the game to anyone. It boils down to this the game has a good sense of what it wants to be and has great potential to accomplish the task of being the best in the genre but at this current point in time (being April 21 2017) the state of the servers makes this game nearly unplayable and the combat extreemly inconsistant and will surely begin to frustrate you more and more over time. This is disheartening to me that by mearly upgrading the server and client tick rate (which currently stands at a net average of 33 ticks) the majority of the games mechanics would be quite smooth. (Instead the devs current focus is the leaderboards.)

review: I recommened this game to anyone who enjoys first or third person shooters it its a lot of fun competitive and every time you join a game it feels new and the decissions you make in your strategy matter to whether you survive.Now there are alot of people having issues with the latest up date of the "pade for crate system" but the first thing i want to say is this only affects the cosmetics of your charater. Do not get me wrong i still think its a bad move for an early access game to release payed for stuff.... But again it doesnt affect the over all game.In my opinion i still see it as one of the most ballanced games i have played in terms of that everyone has access to the same stuff in the map (guns and equipment) this firstly means you wont go against someone who has a loadout so that they can just join and dominate. As well as in the game if you take risked there is a chance of you finding good "loot" quicker but in later game i havent seen this give anyone to much of an advantage.The only time you will see my recommendation go to un recommended is if they start adding crucial game elements as payed for content for example this being map packs or guns things that make you pay to experiance the full game "cough" every battlefield ever"cough"And lastly if you dont like the idea of payed for crates dont buy them there are still ones that are unlockable through "grind"

review: Some players have huge issues with the optimization of this game. Lag/Desync hit reg issues. etc. etc.Before reading I want to state that I have no perforance issues with this game Have over 200 Wins 500+ hours at the time of this review. I have played since release. I only play First Person servers since their introduction because 3rd Person is not and will never be a fair competetive playing field and introduces elements of gameplay and advantages that you have no way of adapting to other than adopting a play style of proning behind this cover and looking over it with 3rd person because that's what everyone else does.***NOTICE*** If you optimize a game and then add new content you have to re optimize the game. OVER AND OVER. Optimization comes at the end of the development cycle not at the beginning. I am not listing or focusing on new bugs introduced in patches as they are normally resolved promptly by the developers.***HIT REG LAG / DESYNC***I have looked at dozens of steam profiles of people complaining about these issues and they are either running the game on a third world toaster complaining about performance. Or they are from some country that has ping to the PUBG servers and cause their issues you can't blame the devs when your internet connection is whats causing problems. ***MY OPINION ON THE GAME***Pro's**** Developers have added content and stayed true to their development cycle since the release of the game pushing out constant updates.* With the addition of First Person servers getting shot from that guy that's watching you on the other side of the wall or behind that tree no longer happens. (IF your aim is better than theirs and you are looking around you instead of atthe floor that you are looting you will get gayed very little in FP and die to mistakes you made.)* Added in game feature to report players.* Developers listened to community feedback on key issues and removed looting delay that was added in an update.* The game runs and feels immeasurably better than it did at release. (Any player that has played once or twice a week since release should be able to agree with this.)* Developers have stated that they DO NOT issue bans based solely on reports. But that they review many aspects of the players match history before issueing a ban. ( Players accused of stream sniping have their match history analyzed to find patterns Ex. When a streamer on the server dies they disconnect and re queue to get into the game with that streamer again. ) * Developers released a statement saying that they are going to have less frequent weekly updates so that they have more time to internally test and fix bugs before releasing patches. ( This will only be good for game development as recently some of the new patches have introduced more issues than they fix which renders the game unplayable for hours while the bugs are patched out but usually doesn't take more than a day. ) *** Cons* Banning for using a car Horn near a streamer is not harrassment. This is something that does not warrant a ban or any punitive action. (Kill the guy in the car or get over it if you sit in a building while he's honking stuff it up your and grow up.)* There are random invisible hitboxes in fields and certain places on the map that can stop your car dead in it's tracks. ( Developer has stated that players experiencing this should record this happeneing and post on the forums so that design team can fix but this has happened to me in about a dozen different locations and shouldn't be the responsibility of the player to resolve. ) * There are server issues that cause everyone to receive a network lag detected message this mostly gets resolved after a second or two but sometimes you have to leave the game and queue for a new match.* When banning players the developers should also include a link to a private report that the player can view to see a list of any and all evidence that was used when they were issued the ban. (With the exception of cheat bans which are obvious and easy to detect based on Head shot percentage and other stats.)* Clothing items currently take up a decent amount of spawning space in building with normally 1 3 clothing items per building in some cases. ( Makes the looting process longer because it's taking the place of a gun or other item that could have spawned in its place. ) *** Overall Review ***I would reccommend this game to players that understand that there is a chance that the game will not run as smoothly as they are used to with other titles regardless of their hardware specs. The game is half way through it's development cycle and players with less than high specs should wait until optimization near release at the end of this fall to purchase the game to avoid headaches.If you have issues with 3rd person game's and RNG aspects try first person for a more balanced and fair experience that rewards skill and decision making over abusing 3rd person peaking mechanics.Do not buy the game if you live in a region that is far away from the servers that they have available they have added servers in several countries since going into EA so wait for servers to be added closer to you to avoid lag and desync issues.If none of the above applies to you I would reccomend this game especially if you have friends that are already playing it because it provides a very enjoyable and tense experience that will bring you a lot of enjoyment (And sometimes frustration)

review: Its a good fun game. its just all the combat you love in a survival crafting game without the extremely boring and awful survival and crafting part. Solo is just as fun and faster paced than teams and teams is still fun with friends. However right now the updates seem to be pretty unoptimized. Right now you pretty much need 16gb of RAM . If you dont youll get crazy stuttering and get put at a pretty bad disadvantage. with as much attention as this game is getting I hope and expect these issues to be fixed fairly soon. (I have a 1060 6gb with 16gb RAM and an i5 2500k 3.4ghz CPU and I still get micro stutters and FPS drops on ultra. Before when I had 8gb of RAM If I had google chrome running in the background the models and textures of houses wouldnt load in for up to 2 minutes after landing on the ground PLUS stuttering on ultra. You can imagine that it puts a player at a disadvantage. After I upgraded this issue stopped but I still get FPS drops and micro stuttering)All this said I HIGHLY suggest you completely ignore the community. Its all the internet arguing you could ever want with the awful twitch hivemind to add flavor (and frustration). With little to no mic chatting in the game this is fairly easy to do though. I wont get into the PR of the game and the controversies I have my own opinions on it but thats a discussion for the "Discussion" page and the forums.NOTE I wrote this review before the paid loot crate update and Microtransactions. Hopefully it wont change anything but if it does im sure youll hear about it before I even remember I wrote this review.

review: One of the absolute best and most refined survival of the fittest games I have seen. This title is up for coronation as the king of battle royal.And to no suprise? the person who put the genre on the map (Playerunknown) turned his mod into a beloved gameplay franchise that will shape how survival is played for years to come. Even despite consulting for a competitor this game has knocked daybreak on its ace and has already become one of the best in its class for fast paced survival.This game is as fast paced and brutal as anything seen in The hunger games yet has all the survival elements in place to insure your survival or failiure. Every choice you make from the timing of when you jump out of the plane to what weapons you choose to scavange to where you choose to loot and where you move will decide the fate of the game for you. and your choices must work with the world of chance and risk if you want to take that chicken dinner in the end (Win the game) The game starts everyone on even footing just a parachute and the clothes on your back. and 40 minutes later everything you do from finding healthpacks guns armor vehicles etc will decide if you are the last man standing or one of the 99 corpses in a battlefield that progressivly shrinks in size to insure that in the end everyone must fight to survive. or die.The gunplay is smooth and incredibly well refined as well the movement mechanics. while the server mechanics like picking up stuff and getting into cars is still shaky at times many rolling patches have already made the experience better and better. The hit detection is Favor the shooter but in 30 games i have played so far i have yet to find a scenario where a death was because of the failings of the game.All in all I think this would be a universally stupid decision not to pick up this game if your a survival or a FPS enthusiest you will find that both here and always look forward to the fresh start. Gameplay Mechanic Rating Gunplay 90% Network Stability 90% Survial Mechanics 85% Learning Curve Medium

review: Okay okay. I might not have a lot of hours in this game but there is a reason. The game is just a plain battle royale game. Nothing special really. Will eventually turn in to the next H1Z1. The game is full of bugs like tons of it. The servers are And the developers are really stupid. The cosmetics in this game is very bland. I don't understand the popularity of it. This game just didn't stood up. I didn't want to play this game. Because if i had to choose one word to describe it Plain. The graphics are okay i guess but the game isn't worth the money. Friends actually ruin the game on this one except the ones who just play if for the giggles and laughs. Steals all the good loot sucks so you have to carry them reveals your position. But that isn't the biggest problem. You know a game is good when you play it a lot. I just didn't want to return to this game because it had nothing exciting. Most of your time will be running and looting cuz of the overly large map. The new map is doodoo as well. Im not hating the people who likes this game. Im not hating on the game entirely as well. The developers are a big part of it. The FPS use to be but after the full game release it got better. That's it really. Cheaters and hackers are increasing i have heard. And the optimization is still dog Crashes and more. Use your precious money on a better game. Not PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BUGGROUNDS.

review: Honestly love the game but I've died in some pretty not suspicious ways lately... and when i say not suspicious its because I'm quite sure its cheats... AimBot and Wallhacking its becoming popular. LIKE REALLY POPULAR!!!!!! You guys have to do something about it seriously or soon ppl who actually like and play and spend money in this still EARLY ACCESS game will stop playing. It's getting impossible almost every match I get a cheater in this game (actually its quite easy just look at top players in stats... you will see names like j1092810u716 and n18720162946n in top with 1h and 2h and 2600 rating ... right...I do understand that the dev team have to focus in other things but well for those of us who payed for a Early Access its becoming ridiculous the amount of cheaters we catch in game... For example yesterday late game after noticing during all match a guy killing 4 and 4 and 4 and 4 we get to final ... 3 vs 1 ... we go one from each side and we all died same time basically far away from each other killed by the same guy... so yeah...Apart from that love the game... love the gear building system... cars who actually kill people when you hit them with car (if you play h1 you know what i mean...) and considering its still Early Access its really good. Solo its a bit hmmm meh... boring... specially cause of campers but duos and team its awesome!UPDATEDunno if its just me but usually when i am inside certain houses when i try to overshoot from windows (being close to the window or far from it) doesnt work... from inside to outside cause i do get hitted from outside to inside... so if its possible to get the hit from outside why its not from inside ?! Doesnt make sense... Fix this please!

review: Day 1 of EA already better than H1Z1. Good mix between the very arcade y style of H1Z1 and the harcore realism of Arma. The devs have made an amazing progress up to this point during the betas before going on steam. Unlike most EA releases the game is already in a state worth the price IMO but it has only just launched into beta and will get a lot more features and polishing during EA.The only downside so far is performance but the devs specifically said to first implement features and then start optimization once it has reached EA so they are only starting with it now. I average around 70 80 fps with a 4690k and 970 which is already good enough for me but if you are using either a 144 Hz monitor or are on the lower end of the specs you probably have to wait a month or two until optimizations start to be implemented into the game.I highly recommend this game!Launch Edit Good optimizations new maps and weapons all came during EA. With 3 million concurrent players a day this turns out to be one of the most popular games of the decade. rightfully so.

review: I played over 15 hours of the beta and wow is it a different type of game. I have over 40 hour on h1z1 and this game beats all those 40hours in just 17 hours (2hours on steam). The game is a bit slower but combat is amazing every gun including the crossbow has weight and power. The realism in bullet time/drop is also good not amazin. Im going to list some pros and cons so you all get the jyst of the game. Graphics 8/10For its genre of game the graphics are good but not amazing on ultra settings. I have everything on ultra except for grass and the game still looks pretty damn good. Gameplay 9/10The game runs smooth for me. I have a i74790k and gtx 1060 and for the most part i run it at 50 60 max sometimes drops to 45. But for the most part the game is well optimized and is in a lot better state than many games. Gunplay 8/10Every single gun in this game has weight and power to it. I once made it to 3rd place just with a suppressed revolver because every gun has damage. Bullet time/drop is good and can be improved but is 100x better than h1z1 physics. Animation 7/10 (10/10 for guns)When it comes to guns 10/10. Everthing else from healing to picking up items to drinking and jumping needs to be improved. Animations feel clunky for those sore of things and bunny hopping in this game is a no go because the gunplay is so good. Another thought is the 3rd and first person play its amazing its a mix between arma 3 and TC wildlands. Its not clunky and over using its has a sense that this game should have a single player mode or survival. Sound 8/10Everything has power to it except for melee weapons. The footsteps in this game remind me a lot of seige or escape from tarktov.Overall the game is really good in this state and the developers are consistently updated fixing and adding new things to the game wich makes this game an amazing pick.OVERALL A _______8.5/10_________

review: I can't recommend people to buy this game anymore. The devs don't seem to give much of a to fix the issues after a year and it runs embarrassingly badly on a rig that has a 6700k and 1080 TI. They prioritized adding keys and chests before adding the new map. The new map has been in the "experimental" server for ages but now they come out with this "event pass" that costs $9.99. Nah. The game is decent especially if you don't care too much about bad performance and bugs. The gameplay and gunplay itself is good. But again I can't recommend a purchase in the state the current game is in. I'll change my review back to thumbs up when the bugs that have existed for over a year are fixed. Old review before all the cosmetics and no fixes whatsoever Overall I recommend the game. I have almost 200 hours and I've enjoyed most of them. The initial early access was very rough lots of rubberbanding and hacking but it's come a very long way. I still don't fully believe that "1.0" will solve all of the issues as the test server was kind of crappy too but I think the game will continually be developed and whatnot over time. If you aren't patient and willing to deal with lots of maintenance as well as a ton of little one off issues (like randomly dying when you spawn buildings not loading etc...) on occasion don't buy this game yet. Give it another few months. Pros +Very engaging gameplay for the most part when you die or up it feels on your shoulders and not on your team (contrasting to a MOBA like DotA 2 or LoL)+Gunplay is fantastic when there's no lag+Big variety of guns and attachments+Two maps now! They're both great+Devs seem very engaged with the community can always appreciate thatCons Servers still lag like hell at times Game can be unoptimized on sub $1500 rigs even with a GTX 1080 I still lag on occasion. Still a handful of hackers which can absolutely ruin a game. This is in all games unfortunately. Again overall I'd still buy this. Just be prepared to be patient and deal with some bugs.

review: This game has come leaps and bounds since my first (negative) review. It is a fun shooter that is even more fun when playing with others. Unfortunately for many they have to pair with random other players. It is definitley preferential and beneficial when you can load into a duo or squad lobby with people you are friends with.The issues you will likely run into if you don't have friends as teammates are as follows Player/s will not have a microphone or have chat muted and thus cannot hear call outs for directions of enemies desired movement plans or gear call outs. THIS IS A HUGE DISADVANTAGE.Players will not be matched in skill level since so far there is no skill based matchmaking in this game so you may end up with someone who makes so many rookie FPS mistakes that it seems they are entirely new to shooters that aren't point and spray. Problems/ things I would recommend to be changed to the devs.The BIGGEST problem right now is that the servers aren't region locked. This results in you getting a bunch of teammates that do NOT speak your language typically they are asian in origin and speak no english. They also play drastically different compared to North American players and European players down to their basic tactics and decisions they have a VERY different playstyle which usually does not pair well.Unable to cancel a reload like you can cancel a heal. An example of when you would need this is if you are prone and then realise you are under imminent threat and need to rotate on your cover. When prone and reloading you are completely unable to move and unable to cancel and are at the mercy of your enemy and the time it takes to reload.Bandages taking up a massive amount of space in Inv. considering how little they do for your health regeneration.I and many like minded daily players would love it if there were a change to the level 2 kevlar helmets. Specifically that with Kar98 rifle which shoots the same size round as the AKM is a 1 hit headshot kill when the player is wearing a full health lvl 2 helmet. I would recommend that at the least the lvl 2 helmet should richocet a round off of it and only take some damage. If it is a square and centered hit on the helmet that is different but if it is off the top or sides the round should richocet off and just be a graze as this is EXACTLY what the real life Kevlar helmet is designed to do.

review: Ok before I start im not saying you can't enjoy this game. I see how it can be fun to some people. This game to me is trash the thing that ruins this game for me is how poorly it runs on my pc. I don't have a beast pc but Its still decent I run games like gta v (which is an old game but it still takes a bit to run) farcry and other games like that at around 60 fps this games textures and graphics aren't even good its silly how you can hide in a bush and camp without being seen. this game has the same the same problem with games like cod the player and environment are to similiar. And if you say that I don't like it because im bad is a silly argument. I play tons of games that I suck at that I enjoy. This game is also boring you can go a whole game without seeing someone then die from someone you don't even see. and yes you can go into more populated areas but this game is mostly luck you can go into a house and only find pants and a shotgun and the house next dorr has a ak and level 3 helmet. so if you do land in the more popular areas you have to pray to god you get something decent. Also the bugs this game is buggy to and if you say "thats because its early access" shut the up because early access if just a way to realese a buggy game and make money off of it. Look at ark that game sucked it had similar problems to pubg. It was a buggy game but at least you could have a ton of things to do in it. I don't recommend this game to anyone.

review: The FitnessGram Pacer Test is a multistage aerobic capacity test that progressively gets more difficult as it continues. The 20 meter pacer test will begin in 30 seconds. Line up at the start. The running speed starts slowly but gets faster each minute after you hear this signal. beep A single lap should be completed each time you hear this sound. ding Remember to run in a straight line and run as long as possible. The second time you fail to complete a lap before the sound your test is over. The test will begin on the word start. On your mark get ready start.

review: Good game. Alpha was a little rugged when it first launched and it suffered from many graphical and optimization bugs. For me personally however ever since the 1.0 release I feel it is much better optimization wise. I went from having 22 50fps pre 1.0 launch to 90+ fps post launch. I honestly dont see what all the negative reviews are about. For me personally I have had 0 problems with the game and I think many of the people here complaining are nitpicking things because they dont have the required specs to run the game or they just wanna be hipsters and leave a negative review. I have an i5 4460 and a GTX MSI 970 4Gb. That is LESS than what is actually recommended to play this game and I have 90+fps so unless you have anything less than a 760 I honestly dont see how you would have trouble playing this. Everything that I have seen so far since its full release has been better than the early access. So forgive me If I seem like im putting the people down who leave negative reviews but from my PERSONAL experience the game is WAAAAAAAY better performance wise than it ever was before. Dont let some of the reviews hurt your view of this game. Its worth it 100% Edit For those of you wondering I play the game on high settings with my rig so yes the 970 is very efficient. Also as a side note I've found that by playing this game it doubles as a chinese phonics simulator. There are soooooooo many chinese playing on NA servers it is ridiculous. I have no idea why but be prepared for some mild fustration and communication problems unless you speak fluent mandarin chinese. As for me there is nothing funnier than an angry chinese man screaming gibberish when he goes down or dies. 10/10 would leave to die again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game was very entertaining in the beginning for a couple of games then it seemed to get extroardinarily repetitive. The game although I know is in early access needs a lot of work. The game so far is still really fun for the time if you play with friends. Update I am so glad that they did this update where they added a new map new weapons new vehicles. This certainly helps with the repetitive gameplay and adds a new element to the gameplay as the new map is completely different from the other one. Especially the new feature vauting. Vaulting over walls just makes the game less glitchy rather than trying to constantly trying to jump over the same wall lol.

review: Alright. I waited a little while to put in a review on this game. I don't do many reviews which I'm going to be changing very soon. This game however needs a good somewhat detailed review so that people purchasing it know exactly what they're getting into. So here goes.First lets start with a little explination of the game. This is a battle royale much like others that are out there but done better. The only thing that you start with are the clothes on your back. You drop into a very large map/arena with 99 other people. Everyone then loots buildings and warehouses for weapons armor ammo etc. There's a large white circle that changes every 3 minutes or so and gets smaller and smaller. If you're caught outside the circle as the old circle begins to get smaller you will take damage until you catch up to the new circle. There are vehicles that spawn in various locations that you can use to get closer however be aware that the noise from the vehicle is easily audible by people nearby. There are 2 maps as of this review that are both large and honestly well done. There are a lot of complaints about both maps myself being one that complains frequently about the new one although i wouldn't really change it. The objective is to get as many kills as possible and be the "last man standing" to get the "Winner Winner Chicken Dinner" phrase at the end. There are loot boxes that you open in the lobby that cost BP which are points you earn from dmg kills and wins throughout the match but these boxes are only for asthetics and offer nothing to get an edge over anyone else.This is one of the most balanced pvp games that i've played to date. I personally don't like very many pvp games. I play things like Battlefiend 4 Battlefield 1 Call of Duty Gears of War etc. but I'm not very fond of them because unless you play them constantly most people have advantages because of better scopes and weapons. This game is nothing like that. You drop in with nothing and so does everyone else. This is the third highest game i've put hours into 1st being FFXIV second is GTA V and this one. You'll hear a lot of complaints about this game from people that just suck but it is a skill based game. I'm going to go into con's in a bit so stay with me.There are 3 "modes." You have solo duo and squad. You can play 1 man squad 2 man squad 3 man squad and 4 man squad as well. There is also a perspective lock. You can either play on TPP(Third Person Perspective) or FFP(First Person Perspective) servers. TPP definitely has a camera angle advantage but FPP is a lot of fun as well.Another thing to note on the positive side of this game is how easy it is to make friends. Jumping into a random squad is absolutely toxic as it is in many other games of this nature however you often find yourself grouped with people that are looking for people to play with that are friendly and ready to rock some domes. I personally have met at least 8 people over the course of 3 days just joining random and saying "Hey you seem cool want to join discord?" and viola you have regulars to play with that are usually pretty awesome.Now to the negatives PUBG needs to fix this damn lag. You'll drop into a courtyard and look up at the massive amounts of parachutes raining down on your head and immediatly dash for a weapon. However touching down first will do you no good when the room you're searching is just a wooden room with a pole in the center because all the textures weapons armor chairs tables and anything haven't loaded yet because the server is lagging behind. Also picking up a weapon and all its ammo to reload and wait 10 seconds for the ammunition to load into the weapon finds you dead as well. Another problem with the lag is "rubber banding." This means when you walk 5 steps you're suddenly teleported backward 3 of them and it happens over and over for at least 20 seconds before stopping. You can see how this would be a problem when you've got 2 people on your and there's a beautiful SCAR L sitting on the floor in front of you but you just can't get to it!!!Having massive amounts of people from other countries on your server is awesome for filling rooms but for helping with lag issues. I can't explain how many times i've watched the kill cam and seen myself run around a corner and the person that killed me shoot at air and yet i somehow died. Look at the name!! Its Xioyu or Chiang or Yukaketo. Wonder why the kill is lagging behind? There was supposed to have been a ping lock implemented but its not working. Hopefully that will be fixed. The cross country server implementation also leads to wonderful groups where the person doesn't speak your language at all and with nothing other than a single marker you can lay on the map to communicate with you're not going to have a very well executed plan to run up on another squad. Hopefully we have the choice of a region lock in our near future here.Another issue you'll find yourself breaking keyboards over is the incredible amount of clothing laying all over the ground that serves no purpose other than to better fit your environment. While this might sound exciting at first its not very great when there's a gun sitting under a shirt and someone right on your trying to kill you but you can't get the gun because you keep picking up the stupid f***ing shirt. You don't keep the clothes if you win so there's really no point other than to satisfy the person behind you while they stand there laughing pointing an S12K Saiga shotgun at your back watching you play dress up. There's a bit more to go over but i'll save it for a little while and i'll edit this review later if some changes are made. Plus i have a friend who wants to play right now so i'mma haff to go do that. But all in all i would say that this is one of my favorite games and it pisses my gf off constantly because i'm always on it. So i bought it for her and now we play together. Nothing better than when she's sitting beside you on the laptop overly excited because someone walked up a staircase as she stared down it with a shotgun and blew their helmet clean out the window. It's a great game amazing when played with friends and can be one of the most frustrating experiences you'll have but it does battle royale better than any other and I say 30 dollars is cheap for the amount of heart pounding exhileration you'll get when there's less than 10 people left alive and you're stacked on armor and ammo waiting for the finale of murder and chaos.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's actually a pretty good battle royal game. Fun and Challenging for both your self and your PC. Matches usually last 30 mins but new players can last for a couple of minutes or so. That's understandable because it IS battle royal. You might need to pump a few hours into the game before you get the grips of it.There are plenty of tips and tricks videos on YouTube that I suggest watching before you even buy the game as it does require skill and technique to enjoy it. At the time of writing this I am still a newbie with only 60 hours of gameplay in and still my average rank per match is on the lines of 15 10th place because of making tactics before hand.HoweverThe cons of PUBG (PlayerUnknowns Battle Grounds) is the servers and the people in them. Yes I get that I'm in the EU but do I really need to play with chinese people and other foreign speaking people? As PUBG has a "ground breaking" voice chat system anyone can talk at the star of the game. But the thing is with that 99.999% of those people are foreign. Not like I have a thing with them it's just I want to talk to people that speak the same language.And with the new 1.0 update out the servers are as slow as ever. With millions of people playing at a time the servers are just overloading. Poor PC performance + Server lag death.

review: I got into PUBG in mid october 2017.. was great. sunk almost 100 hours into it in the first two weeks!!! i loved this game..kept playing it untill early janurary. got top 512 in TPP solo in EU was mega proud of that then the game started going downhill.. Now i get on once every two weeks for two games tops. gun mechanics changed miranmar was great at the sart then they started changing it. added new guns changed the old guns added crates that needed keys started adding more and more key added the battle pass put a game thats behind a paywall behind a second paywall if you want any awesome looking skin.. i do NOT recomend this game. i was 110% against fortnite in december now im starting to think its not too bad.. their servers work not too bad with the tickrate i get over 144 fps in it (my pc isnt exactly weak) which is not even dreamable in PUBG unless you turn down their battle pass actually gives you stuff if you dont pay for it and if you do it gives you even better stuff!!Blueballs get ur together. fix the tickrate for once optimize the game like crazy STOP adding skins behind a paywall (at least untill the core game is fixed) you already got money from me for s sake.

review: I have A LOT of fun playing this game.Time of this review game is still in early access and at this point it is poorly optimised at best!It is still playable if you are happy having random lags. Also if you do not own a monster PC be prepared to play the game with "cake like" buildings. DAnyway just because it is a fun game ( optimized) I still recommend it. ** Update 2018 09 12 **So I have played pubg more than I should've. I've uninstalled this game because of the poor network code ruining almost every game for me. I did not play pubg for about 4 to 5 months and after a long holiday decided I will give it a shot again. Thumbs up on improving many aspects of the game especially the netcode it is much better but there are still a lot of desync issues happening etc that needs attention.In my opinion this game has / had so much potential but being a developer myself I can tell you right now fixing something that is broken is almost impossible to get 100% right. It is almost better to just dump the legacy code entirely and re write the game from scratch with proper developers at hand.I have a love hate relationship with this game and I do enjoy to play it with my friends.Finally living in South Africa this game is not easy to play with a latency of 200ms+. But I still get my 3 to 10+ kills every game and the odd chicken dinner just imagine what I can do with latency of 25ms?

review: I've had my eyes on this game since it was still in closed alpha before even launching on steam and I can say I am satisfied with the outcome. After 21 hours of playing I can conclude this is a very fun game worthy of its price tag. But this game is not for the feint of pc I run a AMD FX 8350 4Ghz 16gb ddr3 hyper x fury ram gtx 1070 FE and a 500 gb ssd. I run at medium to low seetings and get around 40 70 frames. large cities are still to much for my pc to handel but optimization will come in the near future.Pros its $29.99You can customize weaponsgun play feels smoothvariety of clothing weapons and vehiclesDuo and Squad modes work well while also highlighting your squad mates Cons Optimazation could be betterEar when you first spawnopening doors takes some tries when laggingif you can look past the normal alpha state problems then you will really enjoy this game.

review: In Player Unknown's Battlegrounds you play the well known video game icon Bubsy 3D. You fight your way through 300+ zombies to get to the good part of the game the battle royale game mode. It has a lot of depth whether it be in it's shooting or interesting mechanic of building allowing you to play minecraft hunger games at the same time as counter strike. It has other interesting mechanics too such as vaulting. Fun fact PUBG was the first game to ever have vaulting. Overall an underated indie classic that deserves your attention I give H1Z1 King of the Kill a 3/10.

review: Controls like most shooters on PC your WASD keys gets you moving mouse aim etc. If youve been spoiled by MGSV it might get a bit annoying because the 3rd person view makes you want things like switching shoulder view or rolling when prone. PUBG can learn alot from MGSV in terms of controls and player action.Solo Experience if you like stealth play this is your game. Plan carefully and move carefully. Ive made top 10 by stealthing and avoiding combat. Squad Experience even better. Get on discord plan together and set up your team. I thought this was the most fun part of PUBG. FRIENDLY FIRE so watch your shots. The game gives you a compass to help direct your team where things might be wether its enemies or a town.Character Customization if thats what you want and thats what you like...you're SOL. If you dont care and you just want tactical gear or camoflauge colors to blend in you're still SOL because you're gonna GRIND FOREVER.Things Id like to See A shooting range would be nice simple offline add on so we can dial in our ranged shots. More BP would be nice. Local servers would help lag as well as maybe keep the language barrier down to a minimum. None of that p2p BS.

review: I've put in a lot of hours into this game! One of the reasons I built a PC for the first time ever was to play this game. It's Early Access so it's expected to have some bugs and issues. But unfortunately this game has been plagued by hackers and cheaters! It's become overwhelming and lately I've found myself playing other games. Bluehole bans these cheaters/hackers but the ones who get banned just create a new account and purchase the game again. The purpose of them rebuying is because the game has crates that you can open with Battle Points earned through kills and wins. They then sell these items on the marketplace for real money. It's ruined the game for me and many others that I have played with. Also pressing F for 25 minutes to loot items only to get killed by someone that's hiding in completely nonsense spots feels like a waste of time. This game requires VERY little skill. If I could I would rate this game a 6/10.

review: Pros After the 100 hour marker for playing this game I managed to get my first game. This was after 100 hours! Since I usually play deathmatch games like CS GO or Unturned (Sandbox) But they all involved combat I've almost never have won an arena game in my 3 years of gaming but playing this game has trained me into being more aware of my surroundings and gave me time to come up with new looting tactics that can be used in later on. This game is all about pressure especially during the top 10. Ya know? Whenever I kill anyone or if I get jumped It really gets my heart pumping trust me if you like being under pressure this is the game for you.Cons There are a lot of stream snipers so watch out if you've got a big audience on Twitch. Also this game is REALLY buggy but there is sometimes a workaround or maybe you just need to restart your game. Since this is in Early access that's expected.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This will be short and sweet. People can say what they would like about the unoptimized part or that it's lacking content. Ladies and gents it's early access. For $30 it is so worth the money in every way. If you want a game where it gets your blood flowing like the water coming out of your faucet this is such a game for it. Yes sometimes it can be frustrating but for a competitive early access game it is very well done plenty of weapons and gear along with devs that are trying really hard to follow through with everything promised. There are already two new maps more vehicles and weapons planned along with vaulting and possibly take downs. With that said the person behind the game made Arma 3 Battleroyale and helped with H1Z1 so that goes to say he won't be giving up anytime soon. If you want a game that you can just sit down and play that is easy to learn this is the one. It will take many hours of your time. Yes it has hackers here and there bugs ect but almost every game does. Especially early access games such as this. So if you can look past that get this game. Hope to see you on the battlegrounds.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'd like to leave a good review but my game won't launch. What can I do to rectify this problem? I have windows 8.1 pro evga z97 classified mother board intel processor i7 4790k 16G of Ram and a gtx 970 gpu....I finally resolved the issue after reinstalling windows 8.1 onto a new hardrive the OS treated the new hard drive like a guest account. All settings had to be set to run programs as administrator. Another review reccommended that you run it in compatibility mode if you can't get it to launch which worked except for it would not load the steam account. The steam account failed to initialize when compatibility mode was activated. In short the game launched and was fully functional after I activated administrator privileges and deactivated compatibility mode. The game is definitely worth $30.00 and can't wait for the full release.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Oh Boy PUBG. Where to start 100 People. Last one standing wins. I just cover aspects of the game as any outside drama can be researched elsewhere.Pros + Decent weapon variation+ Fun Co OP play. Duos or squad super fun+ Different play styles can work here so it's open to be played however you'd like.+ Large Map+ Ton of variations for the weapons also adjusting to the play styleCons Buggy as br&gt Buggy as br&gt One map so far Cosmetics being sold before the game is completed Buggy as br&gt Honestly for how buggy this game is I love it to death. It's the closest thing I've gotten to Mod DayZ ( current DayZ BTW). This game is thrilling and every game feels fresh to me. The bugs are plenty Stuff not spawning until after you land. Cars flipping left and right. Ghost sounds of actions that never happened. Landing with your parachute leading to like a 15% health loss. Cosmetics clipping through scopes making visibility impossible. A TON of bugs. But I enjoy this all the same.Be cautious. If you're like me and needed to feel the thrill of playing DayZ Mod again this game is for you. If you can look past the bugs and inconsistancy of parts of the game its truly some of the msot fun I've had in a very long time. If you want a polished game this is not it.I recommend this game purely on the basis of how much fun I have not whether or not Bluehole deserves your money. I spent 30 dollars and have gotten 164 hours of time at the time of posting this. I'm sure to spend more. I've made worse purchases.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
