review: i've had more than enough after 600 hrs spent. i have played maybe 2 hours solo the rest was with friends. most of them stopped playing. i un and reinstalled the game a couple times after being frustrated again and again. i seriously don't know how i could rack up so many hours in this game while at the same time enjoying so little of it. i blame it on social pressure and that half my friends list wanted nothing but to play pubg for the last year. surely spent about 100 of those hours in menus alone. what's good? gunplay feels good and semi realistic in mid to long range engagements. the maps have some nice vistas. playing in a squad with friends can be fun. that is actually all i can think of. i kept playing like many others in hopes they'd fix the rest up but they never did. what sucks? almost everything else. controls? still janky as hell with no real flow from running into vaulting or basically doing anything. netcode? still bad framedrops when you encounter other players like in dayz rubberbanding you or the enemy believing to be in cover while actually lagging behind and really hanging out in the open hits registering after you turned into cover you yourself killing people in dubious ways that feel undeserved graphics? while the maps look alright as long as you're not moving the player models are like advanced ps2 models. seriously wtf is wrong with the hair on the player models that's not hair. wtf bluehole. also there are still many graphic bugs and glitches in the game. bodies and weapons floating in mid air parked vehicles appearing to have an epileptic seizure is a common thing. the game has no artstyle at all and what original assets there are are not very impressive or beatiful. gameplay? it's fun from the point you get the hang of it and get better as long as you aren't burned out already by the games jankiness. i haven't played all the br games out so i can't comment on the balance of the map and circle play much but i think it works alright in sanhok and erangel while miramar is a borefest. how much you get out of it ultimately depends on your willingness to try and git gud so to speak. the game will never really reward you for it tho. this is because the game attracts hackers and gives incentive to camp and ambush. if you are good at this game you will constantly be well placed and probably even win regularly but you will also be killed cheaply a lot of the times and you will start to camp and play like a coward yourself. i found that at that point where you think of yourself as being somewhat good at the game it's less fun. because there will be all these rules in your head what is alright to do now and what not. and then the game will become like work. you will argue with your friends in the squad and people will be because everyone thinks they know the game and that they are smart about it. this game produces bitter burn outs one dude in my friends list actually told me he will never play again with a mutual friend after they had a falling out in pubg. wtf... what else? ing lootboxes terrible cosmetics you wouldn't even want your character to wear every update that adds something makes some other thing that worked fine worse every new gun is op at first then later nerfed to hell and back. the new challenges are terrible. war mode is fun maybe once every few weeks this week i checked back because war mode was the only thing i enjoyed playing lately with my friends and some of us wouldn't even bother with regular matches anymore. they made a mode where they just took out all the guns except the .45ers. wtf bluehole. this supposed to be war mode. this is just normal squads on sanhok with less guns. who thought this was a good idea? war mode is cool whenever it makes the game less tedious to play. so short rounds respawning high powered guns basically a death match. metal rain is at least an interesting concept. but this weeks war mode is further confirmation that bluehole actually has no clue what makes this game fun and just shoots blind and every once in a while happens to hit the mark. i got the game key from a friend back then but would never shell out 30 bucks for this. if you really need to check this game out try to get it somewhere for about 5 bucks that's what it's max worth is imo for the little actual fun you can have with this game. the only way i'd reinstall this again would be if they would revamp the game from the ground up and actually addressed all these issues but i have no hope for that. they will continue put out lootboxes they are planning to monetize custom servers as well and that is all they are working on money making schemes. i hope brendan greene will not put his nick in the title of a game he worked on because that would be an instant no buy. if you put your ing name on it you should be about fixing it not doing fancy talks at conventions about esports. have you even played your own game? actually forget what i said about getting it for 5 bucks. buy a different game or play fortnite instead. i haven't played this a lot but i actually wholly enjoyed my time although i thought i'd hate. it's a real professional game while pubg is almost a glorified asset flip with decent gun play that gained cultural significance by accident and peer pressure. don't believe the hype avoid at all cost. i could have learned a language in those 600 hours that is also semi fun but at least it builds up your intelligence in character. playing pubg is like planning an assassination on your own soul and intellect. save yourself

review: If you like drinking a cup of tea in the Afternoon then perhaps this game is for you. It is very relaxing from the scenery to the explosions that appear randomly in the map. It puts a new meaning to the song "What a Wonderful World" kono subarashii sekai fukuwa so in summary this game is one hell of a drug once you start playing it you can't stop and if you stop you get withdrawal syndromes such as "Inability to stop playing the game" I had experienced this and accepted PUBG as a new lifestyle perhaps I can make a living out of this I thought to myself but never the less back onto the topic. PUBG is a very great game made by someone named PlayerUNKNOWN. This game is truly a phenomenon and there is no any other like it. It is truly a unique game with different mechanics from other games. In this game you can run across the map for straight 5 minutes pick up stuff from the floor shoot stuff and best of all drive stuff. This game features everything that you can possibly dream of. I always dreamt of a game like this and now it is REAL that's right. THE FUTURE IS NOW! This game brings a whole new meaning to "gaming" it reinvents the term "gamers" into another name it is known as "CAMPERS" that's right. Not only can you pick up drive and shoot stuff in this game. YOU CAN ALSO CAMP! Oh boy where do I start you don't even need a tent for camping there are HOUSES all over the place and you can pick from Mansions to small houses down in the suburbs or you can just settle for a bush if that's what you'd like camping is fun in this game you get to meet people and maybe say hi and shoot them afterwards or you say hi and they shoot you afterwards either way works but wait we are missing out on something... ain't it a bit sad if you are camping all by yourself? WELL NOT ANYMORE! This game lets you CAMP with YOUR FRIENDS. THATS RIGHT!!! Your FRIENDS! (well if you have any) You and your friends can turn a house into a camping spot and sit down as you wait for the circle to close in this is what I like about the game. The CIRCLE its a circle you know and I love circles. They are round and have curves in this game you get a CIRCLE but not just only one but TWO CIRCLES!!! There's a good circle and a bad circle one is named Mr. White dood and there other Mr. Blue dood apparently Mr. Blue dood doesn't like being blue and electrocutes people who are OUTSIDE it Mr. Blue Circle wants attention you see it wants people inside it (that sounded wrong) so it can grab all the attention and watch each and every one of you destro hug each other and say hi. Now we have Mr. White dood he is a much more introverted dood and stays away from Mr. Blue dood it hates Mr. Blue dood. As soon as Mr. Blue dood touches Mr. White dood Mr. White dood immediately runs away to another spot but within the radius of Mr. Blue dood. But while all this Love and Hate relationship happens with Mr. White dood and Mr. Blue dood you and your friends are probably discussing about life while inside these circles more often your conversations should start like "Nice weather we are having" and it starts from there to Advanced Nuclear Theory. &lt &lt Last Words&gt &gt The last thing I'd like to say about this game is that... this game... this game is really special... its... its really something that I think is gonna stay with me for a long time. I'll be playing it when I am depressed I'll be playing it when I am happy heck I'll be even playing it when am asleep. This game is a must for everyone... hope you all enjoy and peace out and remember to spread the love

review: A genuinely good concept pretty addictive and you can leave games without impacting other players doesn't seem much but that's pretty great to me.However on the technical side the game is dreadful. Don't even dream to get constant 60 fps even with a $1000 GPU as the game almost only uses the CPU anyway. Freezes are common. The game is slow and clunky as hell dark souls seems smooth in comparison. Even the menus lag (?!).The game stands well on its own right now devs don't need to focus on new features new implements or anything like that. They just need to optimize the damn game that's honestly the only thing preventing it from being a great game.

review: I cannot recommend this game. The vehicles are weird to drive the animations feels like every limb of your char weigh 2 tons and the servers should be better. Plus the loot system is dumb who cares about useless tshirts and pants ? Give some bullets or scopes or any actually useful stuff instead ! If at least you could do like H1Z1 and scrap the clothes to make bandages but no 100% useless. At this point it would even be better to find nothing. And this dumb loot systems makes luck a big influence in your games. If you can't get some scopes your options are rush someone hoping he can't aim or hide and hope no one sees you. spoiler hope rarely works.It is still kind of enjoyable but it needs some improvement to make it really enjoyable. Well at least i can farm and sell crates to get my money back ...EDIT They finally improved the looting system it was long overdue. Ah and now that they disabled trading the crates directly between players they are worth almost nothing (a few cents). So you can't even get your money back unless you play thousands of hours.Oh and the new map is nice much more action and a lot more loot to loot making luck a lot less important than other maps which is nice.

review: As realistic shooter this is simply the best of the best.It feels like a modern shooter that we all know and love and yet everything is there just to name a simple thing... Bullet drop.Anyways it's got everything you would expect from a Battleroyal game.You are dropped onto an Island to duke it out with other players The player last standing is the winner and that is all there is to it.However as simplistic as that sounds there is a lot more to look at then just that.This is a tactical shooter tactics can overcome many obstacles even if your weapons are a lot less effective then that of your enemy One well placed shot in the head and your opponent is gaurranteed dead... unless they have something to cover their head with ofcourse.Many a things can be used for cover Buildings Stones... heck even grass.With all this in mind and... Well I could keep on going with cool sounding stuff.... This game does have it's flaws..Most of which are EA problems.You currently as of writing this can find many bugs of sorts I shall name a few Crashing Flying buildings Graphical glitches Lag Frame drops Micro stutters and the list goes on.But even knowing all that it is still a blast to play and I can highly recommend you get this EA game if you have the money and Computer to run it Just don't expect a finished product... Not yet anyways.

However the game has remained in a poor state for the entirety of it's existence.Pros + Fun to play with friends+ Nice variety of guns and modifications+ Good for a couple rounds if you're not trying to win+ Decent bullet physicsCons Poorly optimized Gunplay is awful moving while aiming causes most of your shots to miss even if you account for recoil Vehicle physics are terrible causing random crashes and flips for hitting a bump Hackers Quite laggyAll in all fun to play with friends for a little while but it's not worth taking seriously. If you're looking for a more competitive shooter play nearly any other game out there.

review: Edited 2/21/2018Disclaimer This review is based on the game is at the time of this review. If it improves or degrades in the future I will update the review accordingly. First of all the idea for the game is outstanding. The battle royale style game play is a lot of fun but there are quite a few hurdles this game needs to overcome to live up to this hype.1. Hacking Hacking is killing the game. If they don't do something soon this game will fall into obscurity in less than a year. Supposedly Bluehole has implemented some antihacking measures and they have implemented a reporting system with replays. I'd say about 30 50% of the games I play have obvious hackers. The most common are the no recoil aimbot and the ability to see players through objects and terrain. 2. Performance desync and hit detection I have been 10 yards behind someone lined up the cross hairs on their head and waited a moment to steady my aim only to see my bullets pass right through another player. Another time I watched the replay and it even showed the bullets going through the player's ear only to do no damage. A second or two later the player moves and they take damage ... to the foot?!?!? What the heck is wrong here? You have games like Planetside 2 that's been around forever and it's able to outperform this with hit detection. The same goes for melee which is a hot mess. If you land in a populated area like Hacienda or the School and get a melee kill it's more by chance than skill.3. Reliability and stability The game still crashes at random times. Sometimes it takes 5 seconds to load and sometimes it takes 5 minutes to load and you're falling into the ocean. This is on the same computer running an Intel Core i7 4770K with a RX 580 and an SSD. The lobby still needs to be restarted from time to time and sometimes you get the "not allowed user" error which makes no sense. Again the game has great potentional but it's not worth $30 for such shoddy quality. How many millions of dollars have they made and they still cannot address these issues that aren't present in games much older? This is all really frustrating when you see the developers releasing new clothes and hats without actually addressing these issues. We don't want more clothes we want a working game. You've created a new genre of games and you're losing your following to other games that have picked up the battle royale genre. Fix your stuff.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Quite possibly the biggest pile of disappointment that I've ever bought don't even buy into the "Mostly Positive" reviews this game has the most unbelieveable bugs you could think of for a $30 game.Cons Textures often never load while parachuting Game crashes from the littlest i.e sitting still in the warmup area. Game completely freezes when you're getting shot at. Effects are so damn resource intensive that sometimes your game may crash goodluck surviving red zones. Getting one tapped by a revolver from 50 ft away when you have a Level 3 helmetPros Decent playerbase Sometimes the updates may fix something. Decent player control and weapon mechanics.My advice Go buy H1 you'll have the same issues except for the whole game crashing t so at least you can try to win the game somehow.

review: My review about PUBG after 30 hours of playtime. First off do i recommend this game to you people? Yes. However there are some bugs and things that can make the gameplay really frustating sometimes. 1. Every 5 match or so i get game breaking bugs that leads to my death ingame. 2. There are 2 maps in the game. Some people like the new one some the old one. But the fact i cant decide which map I wanna play is really really bad. Because.. 3. .. i have a really bad pc but i managed to run this game at aceptable FPS but the new map is really heavy for my pc and i like to play the old map 10 times more but sometimes i got to play the new map 8 times in a row and there is not much i can do.But these are the only downsides of the game like i said i can play it really good even tho i have a really bad potato pc the guns are cool and feel amazing the looting system is nice cosmetics are cool the maps (even tho the new map is really tampering with my fps and loading time) are both really good ok etc.I'm gonna play it now and in the future but i hope those things gonna get fixed cause these are some game breaking bugs for me.(and im gonna upgrade my pc in the future cause this maybe fix one problems from the list P)

review: Overall not a bad game although I'd suggest waiting for a sale to buy it or until its official release. Combat isn't bad gameplay is intuitive and fun. Character customization is minimal but not a big deal. Gunplay is decent although 9/10 times you'll just wander around for an hour collecting items only to be sniped or shot by a passing dune buggy pair. Weapon mods are cool and well executed. Graphics are a bit intensive I run on low and I've got a decent mid tier PC. Map is often slow to load and you'll find a lot of heavy lag spikes early game. Overall pretty good for early access although it definitely has its quirks to work out. 7/10 would wait for full release or sale.

review: I bought it I loaded it I clicked on "Rules of conduct" I uninstalled it and finally I requested a refund... While the majority of the rules are fine there are a few that are honestly ridiculous. Plus i've heard too many horror stories of this games moderators in regards to these rules... "Do not use extremely foul language including but not limited to excessive profanity or language that is graphically sexual grotesque or violent." It's the Internet pal GET ING USED TO IT!"Do not impersonate other individuals." This is pretty vauge cannot I not go on there and claim "I'm Morgan Freeman"?"Do not team kill there is no excuse for non accidental team kills. If your teammate is breaking these rules report them to us instead." HEY PLAYERUNKNOWN IVE GOT NEWS FOR YOU! Have you ever thought of turning friendly fire OFF??? Whatever the case whether it be an accident or not a troll could use this to get the accidental(?) team killer banned."Do not team teaming is defined as two or more players in the same match working together in a larger group than is intended for the selected game mode." This is what gets me the most why can I not team? There are many different play styles and this is just limiting those styles. I get where PlayerUnknown is coming from he doesnt want a big group of people picking off individuals. Honestly though how likely is this to happen in the first place? "Do not stream snipe this is a form of cheating and you will be banned if you do it." Basically if I stream I can get people banned for killing me? o I'll truely be feared amongst the PUBG community.This game looks fun but with those set of rules I cant play this.

review: I have really enjoyed playing this game since Early Access but cannot recommend it in its current state. It has been a great way for my friends and I to come together as a squad and despite the many bugs and development hurdles it has remained fun.However it is now absolutely riddled with hackers (who are almost exclusively Chinese) and the fun has stopped. This past weekend we had a hacker (aimbot/ESP/etc.) in 9/10 games. Any sort of skill or effort to get to the Top 10 is nullified when someone named laozhengxiou29994301 guns you down from 400m away full auto with an AKM. The replay/kill cam system has made it very easy to tell whether someone is hacking.What's worse is that the developer refuses to take action or even acknowledge the issue. They are actively suppressing posts about it on their official forums and on Reddit. In fact PlayerUnknown claims that "region locking" would be xenophobic! But he also stated that the vast majority of bans are Chinese players. Thus I'm forced to conclude that BlueHole/PUBG sees only dollar signs and couldn't care less about remedying the rampant cheating. Some people suggest playing FPP since cheating is less common (but not unheard of) but that's no solution at all. I enjoy TPP and the hackers shouldn't be the reason I stop playing it.So I've decided to stop playing PUBG until the developer acknowledges and fixes this issue. It is sad to see the game go this way but cheating has absolutely ruined the experience for me my friends and many other players.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: EDIT As of the 1.0 launch the performance issues have been mostly fixed and you will notice signifigant performance improvement I know I did.What I likeGame is fun easially the best in it's classVariety of quenes allow you to tailor your experience to your particular friend groupShooting feels good (hit detection is wonky but that's nearly impossible to get perfectly)Feels tense and exhilirating when you get down to the last few playersGraphics look good and convey the wasteland run down aesthetic well enoughWhat I don't likeAdding lootboxes in EA after the devs said they wouldn't be included until full launchDevs banning people for ludicrous reasons including "stream sniping"Devs banning people for accidentally using "exploits" in a horrendously broken game (it IS EA so I'm not faulting them on that front)Abysmal optimization (At least on my rig GTX 1060 6GB 8GB RAM i7 3820 3.6 GhZ also can't fault the devs for that as it's EA) the game will freeze lag and function poorly more often than not and almost every game will fail to load the textures on buildings when landing making it so I can't loot inside buildings and most times I just end up dying.In conclusionOverall if you only care about gameplay and don't mind the questionable ethics of the developer then I cant't recommend the game enough this is an extremely solid foundation that will only improve with time and what better time to get in on the action than before launch. However if you have a hate boner for microtransaction lootboxes and favoritism towards streamers then you might want to skip out on this one. If you're like me and don't have the best PC avaliable (or at least one on par with or less powerful than mine) then I would suggest waiting for the game to progress more and recieve some much needed optimization updates. Being an early access game and all it's hard to score it the game does so many things amazingly and yet falls flat on it's face in other areas but i'll do my best. Category Score Gameplay 9 Technichal Performance 7 (subjective) Presentation 7 EVERYTHING IN THIS REVIEW IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE AS THE GAME MOVES FURTHER ALONG TOWARDS RELEASE

review: After nearly 400 hours on this game I'd have to say it's my favorite competitive game. The massive maps with 100 players is something unlike any game I've ever played. It's quite a good game I love it and I'd recommend it to anyone that hasn't played it. While the game's optimization isn't the best if you have an OK gaming PC then you can run it on low.There's a massive problem in this game that all PUBG players can agree with me on. The hackers foreigners on US servers and low ping players. Ever since 1.0 game out I've noticed a lot of hackers on the game recently more than there have been which is never good. I've seen hackers shoot through walls cross map I've seen hackers run across fields going speed of sound I've seen it all. But note that hackers are only in a small amount of games but you'll definitely see one within the first 10 games.Foreigners. I'm not xenophobic but the problem I'm having here is communication. When you get queued up with chinese players in English servers it can be irritating. For example you've got low ammo and you need your partner to hand you some but he speaks Spanish there's no way you're getting your ammo because he doesn't understand a word you're saying. Low ping players (aka people from other countries). This is a massive problem. When you are hiding behind a corner you'll be dead before you see the player because they're lagging so bad. If you shoot them first you'll be dead before they're downed. ThIs is the biggest problem in PUBG. Something needs to be done.I love the game it just has issues like every other game.

review: I really can't wait for a real studio to take on the battle royal concept and do it right because Bluehole has got to be one of the most incompetent game developers of all time. This game has so many issues that are a huge turn off Chinese ping abusers and cheaters some of the worst hit detection in a multiplayer shooter unstable performance even after early access and the list goes on. Bluehole has done absolutely nothing beneficial to the game's health since 1.0 in fact all they have done is add in loads of microtransaction loot boxes. The concept of this game is seriously addicting and I've had plenty of fun in the 250+ hours I've played but that doesn't excuse the laughable progress this game has made since early access. If you are looking to get into one of these types of games I'd start with Fortnite. It's free runs like a dream and has a very active development team. (Seriously if there is an issue in Fortnite it often gets fixed overnight while with pubg bugs and glitches will stay in the game for months before anyone bothers to fix them)

PUBG still has too many issues to be considered release ready and as such I can't recommend it.

review: A battle royal of 100 players you can play in teams of 2 4 or solo. Player's drop into a map loot weapons health items and attatchments for said weapons.A wide range of weaponry from fully automatic rifles to grenades (rpg's and other explosives are not included).Positives of the game so far Gun play feels nice and impactful bullet drop off is not really an issue so newbies will feel right at home just aiming as normal. Vehicles work well and usually have enough fuel to traverse the entire map abundant enough to be found in tough places but not abundant enough that you'll find one immediately everytime you drop. Smarter play styles are endorsed and rewarded long term as combat is very explosive (sometimes literally) and due to the power of weaponry often short lived. (This is good becuase those skilled enough can fight their way through but people like me can just sneak around until late game).Negatives New and therefore bugs are an issue I have an i5 6500 and a gtx 1060 6GB 8GB RAM and I'm having issues with gamer performance I can only imagine what lower end cards and cpu's are performing like I will not get above 40fps (everything on low). Pistols feel a little weak they will win a fight for you (as long as you can aim) if your opponent is unarmed but in a situation where you are fighting against others that have rifles I wouldn't expect to ever win unless they don't have body armour on or a helmet and you get constant headshots rendering it (in my opinion) almost entirely useless. May or may not be a negative stronger weapons feel strangely abundant it is unlikely that you will go through a game without seeing an m14 or finding a shotgun (even if it is the double barrel one). This doesn't leave much for a 'search' aspect of the game other than to pick up meds or to pick up grenades or the start where there is a nice mad rush to find a gun asap.My personal opinion is that the game is pretty fun I haven't got bored yet (I get bored easily)

review: I've played my fair share of BR games and this one by far is the best I have seen. I'm only 2 hours into it at the time of this review but after the initial 2 hours of any other BR game I absolutely did not feel as satisfied as this game has made me feel. Some notable moments Running across the bridge (stupid I know but I was out of time to get to the safe zone). A buggy is coming at me from about 200 yds away. 30 rounds in my M16. Switch to semi auto line up my shots and I kill the guy driving it. The buggy comes to a stop right in front of me. I loot the guy quick grab the buggy and head into the safe zone. Waited prone by an airdrop knowing other people were close. Sure enough two guys run at it and start blasting each other. One guy drops and the other runs to the airdrop. He goes prone next to it and I wreck his from behind a tree. I end up with the airdrop and both of their loot. Right off the start 4 of us are dropping into a small group of houses. I sprint inside and go right upstairs hoping to find a gun. I find a UMP and ammo inside a room. I hear footsteps downstairs. I shut the door to the room I'm in crouch and lock my sights on the door. I'm frozen in place so I don't make any noise. I hear the other guy come up to the floor I'm on and run around inside. As soon as he opens the door I blast the out of him and drop him.Overall the thrills and tactical strategic type pace in this game is incredible. It's not arcadey like H1Z1 and it's not a walking simulator like ARMA. It's a perfect mix of the two making it enjoyable for anyone who even remotely enjoys other BR games.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Amazing game. I played during the beta weekends and they've taken everything good from the Arma mod and H1Z1 and combined it together. A tiny bit less realistic than Arma and way less arcadey than H1Z1. It makes a good balance of fun and realism. Shots feel satisfying and the hit registration is great. Lots of guns that are worth using too.

review: Gameplay I enjoy this game really much. The game is fun addictive easy to get into but hard to master. You can really see the difference between a good and a bad player even with the RNG of the circle and finding loot. Complaints I don't understand all the people whining about the devs. The devs are great and let normal player like me play super early versions of maps like Shanok. So not only streamers and pros get to experience and give their thoughts on maps in early development. Personally i played Shanok before most of the textures were even added and I could give my feedback on the map. Another complaint is that theres alot of bugs in the game wich is absolutely true (most involving vehicles). These bugs does not bother me at all for me they are just fun. However if you are bothered by bugs just avoid crashing ur vehicle into other vehicles and everything should be fine.I feel like most complaints come from people who just lost a game due to a bug or they got killed by a hacker wich is kinda dumb. The reason the game has negative reviews are because of people raging (I believe). Cheaters I've also seen many complaints about cheaters but I have only experienced 3 cheaters thus far and It does not really bother me too much. (3 cheaters with 380h played). Tips A tip to the devs however is to remove the red zone. The game already has enough RNG with loot zone car spawns and the fact that your playing agains 99 different people every match.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Just buy the game it is in early access but it has less bugs then some full released triple A titles (I'm looking at you For Honor)Some lag at times especially the first few seconds when you first land (I have an HDD though not an SD so that might be my fault) other than that its smooth. Some lag spikes throughout the game but they're spaced out enough that you barely notice and it has done nothing to diminish my playing experience (2 3 big lag spikes). Takes some time for the main screen to load (I haven't timed it but probably around 30 seconds) which is a little annoying. I was disconected from host once in 24.4 hours of playtime which definately was annoying because I was doing particularly well that game. Still one disconect out of 24 hours and 40 something games played is a lot better than 3 disconects per every 4 games you play (Looking at you again For Honor) I heard that the game will be optimized in about 5 weeks but I haven't confirmed if thats true or not. Those are the only bad things I've noticed I'm not gonna list the good because pretty much everything about the game is good.In case you're wondering here are my specs Gtx 970AMD FX 8350 (not overclocked)HDD (only putting that here because it can affect map load times)8gb RAM(Playing game on "high" settings)

With next patches pubg is more and more unplayable because of lower fps de sync and input lag (their servers run on low tickrate as I know). If something is incomprehensible or bother you what I just said you can ask me in comments/priv.

review: This game needs a lot of work and I will play it more as it gets updated but in its current state I would not recommend this game to most of my friends. The game is immediately over if you are unfortunate enough to only find a pistol or a backpack and some upgrades for weapons. All it takes is someone who found a rifle and the game is over. It is a fun demo of the game I expect it to be if you can camp with a good weapon long enough to make it feel like the load times were worth it. I've managed to kill a number of people and I like to think I have a feel for how this game is meant to be played but it still feels wildly unbalance. I look forward to its further progress and plan on updating my review at a later date.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is so overhyped and obviously being used as a milking cow to get more cash.Graphics are ok on ultra but the game is so badly optimized that you need a beast to be able to see and play with that detail. Not that you would want to because it makes enemies harder to spot.After the new update the fps drop is horrible making the game near unplayable unless you don't mind constant stuttering.Even with a GTX1080Ti this game doesn't run smooth.The game suffers from horrible servers with to low tickrate. When you get shot before you see the enemy comming from behind the corner then you know what i'm talking about.Cluncky controls and movement try looting a house in first person. Yes first person because thrid person is just cheese all over as people can just peek around corners without ever exposing themselves. Randomness is your worst enemy.Cheaters Cheaters Cheaters .... Just let it go and go play something else.

review: I'm a huge fan of survival games but I didn't have the chance to try H1Z1 since I didn't have a PC for over 2 years. I did play the Battle Royale mod games such as Day Z Rust (although they're a different concept).I've been playing this game for almost 6 hours now Solo and Duo with a friend. I have to say for being an Early Access it's FUC**** AWESOME. It's really fun to play with friends and graphics and optimisation are pretty decent for being an EA. I have an i7 3440k (up to 3.9 ghz) RX 480 8GB 16GB RAM.. I have set graphics to medium and in general I have like 65 70fps in cities it drops to 50 55fps so it's pretty decent in my opinion.I would totally buy it if you plan to play with friends in the future (you can start Solo why not). I just hope this doesn't die like Day Z has...

review: I've played 40+ hours of the closed beta and this seems like the most promising game of its genre. The Developers take player feedback well and adjust accordingly and quickly. Everytime me and a friend brought up a problem it was fixed in the next patch. This game beats all other battleroyale type games even in its early stages. Its got a large variety of weapons (and they just added the SKS since CBT. WOOT!) attachments that are universal and some are unique to certain weapons a vehicle system that doesn't promote jumping out of a car going 90kph a great map that has many unique locations. Sure it needs some work but the optimization has started slowly but surely and gets better with every patch. AND REMEMBER KIDS. ITS IN EARLY ACCESS.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Company has total sellout practices which affects the game in many ways. Both in development and in features. Console release being the latest one to affect such but not forgetting past events either(like the chinese ad issue&amp microtransactions). Development has been slow lately due console release and bugs still varied in countless ways. SSD being one of requirements to make game playable(yet not listed so in official requirements list). Even free beta testing from players doesn't help them to remove the bugs and warping. Not to mention cheaters.This game is a big hit though and 1.0 will probably bring last patch of huge influx of new players in to the game. Therefore fun time for new players to still enjoy the game. I still wouldn't recommend this game though unless you are a hardcore fan of the series and can't get enough of it elsewhere. Even then you should really look if you want to support this kind of company whose only success was excellent marketing plan.

review: Having played Fortnite for a while I needed something more. My kids have been playing this a lot lately so I took the plunge and bought PUBG. And I'm not disappointed. It's a bit reminiscent of "The game formally known as WarZ" only better. The vehicles work you can generally tell if someone is around (open doors missing loot) and cover from trees bushes fences etc. The thing that I like the most having played Fortnite first is it takes away the "Cartoony" aspect of the game. The first time a sniper fired at me and missed scared the crap out of me. The sound is quite atmospheric. Shots echo in the distance the C 130 overhead sounds authentic and bullet stikes and misses put the fear into you. To all the sooks getting ads in their lobby maybe if you turned off your mike and stopped being such a tool online people would care but until then suck it up princess it's only the lobby.

review: At this games current state officially released out of early access and an update since release I can't recommend this game t people who haven't already purchased it. By all means if you pay this game don't stop. The game itself is good not without fault but that's a similar common criticism with any game. However this game imparticular has some nasty optimization issues still. For example my current rig main components AMD APU A10 7850K MSI GTX 1080 8GB the game sees better frames on 4K and 1440p than on 1080p! Despitet this this is heavily biased and can't (fully) be blamed on the game as there is a limiting factor in this equation my cpu. But still the game remains incredibly unstable post official release which is to some unnaceptable myself partially included.Furthermore the game graphics aren't that bad either to be fair to Bluewhole their graphics are not the worst however the anticheat needs work not a fault of their own necessarily more Battleye's but nevertheless it could still be improved as cheating is a prominent presence in this game. The actual gameplay wouldn't be too bad if the prior poor optimization issues were fixed. A recent addition to the game which I believe appeals more to newer players is the ability to vault through gaps which seems insignificant however when being flanked compared to before this is a game changer now everyone can use this move whereas before only a particular type of player could. From personal experience this has caused issues and lead to my untimely demise.Overall Graphics 7/10 Gameplay 7/10 Content 5/10

review: EARLY ACCESS REVIEW Do you like COD ? Do you like counter strike ? Well maybe you should buy OVERWATCH if you haven't done that yet because this is not a fast paced FPS here you'll have to use your surrounding and your brain so forget about having high reflexes and such and let me explain you the pros and cons of this game.But first please note that FOR NOW if you are looking for a game that will let you gain level and the more you play the more you'll get skills point and such well then this is not in the game you play and every match is pretty unique you win/lose earn money buy a crate that contain a random cloth and you keep playing. There is a leaderboard and a ranked will come at some point.Pros A good variety of weapons You can customize aim sensibility and keyboard (and probably a controller) One match should last around 30 minute average if you are not a run and gun player Every match is different with some fixed elements that allow you to improve The map is huge and is pretty interesting Patching every weeks and one big monthly patch. A smart player can kill someone with fast reflexes Lots of tactics to use depending of the mode 3 mode Solo Duo Squad (4 players) 30$ for such a game is a good deal You can customize weapons by adding mods Not a pay2win (there is no ingame shop) Being cautious is rewardingCons 1 map (they are working on new maps) not fully optimized yet so having a bad PC won't help you Luck is a part of the game that is upon all of the players you may get lucky or not. It's a minor detail but it can bothersome especially players that talk about having "skills" they will get very annoyed. No kill cam server busy on week ends but who would knew that so many players would join the early access ? Not me. Some bugs and glitches but it's an early access so it's common.Overall If you are looking for something that is not an fast paced generic FPS and you want a game you could play all day or when you feel like it then this is probably a game for you.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has it's moments but they are few and far between. I play this with a few friends and we manage to make it to the last few people standing just about everytime we play. But after a while you start to notice the flaws that make this game not so great. One example is we have run into obvious hackers in about half the games we have been in. By "obvious" I mean running faster then a car in circles around my team or taking the full force of a granade and running away. We report them as we see them but we keep seeing them. It's even more noticeable in the end game when your down to just a few players who kill you through buildings or appear in random spots you were just stareing at. So in a game you play with about 100 other players give or take a few at the start. Thats almost a guaranteed hacker every match. Also the NA servers are flooded with non coopertive asian players who don't speek english. We have a three man party most of the time leaving us to pick up a random in team matches occasinally. But 90% of the time it's an asian player who either runs away as soon as he hits the ground team kills one of us or runs around stealing all the ammo for guns he's not holding. It was funny at first but it's getting old quick.Lack of any creative features aside from the five or six base models and haircuts is kind of odd concidering you have to pay 3 000 credits to change them. And most of the cloathing you unlock is boring and pointless considering you can pick things like that up in game. The coats are upwards of 30.00$ on the marketplace so It dosent surprise me that evertime I open a box it's the same white hat or a plain t shirt that I already have. So the tactic quickly became sell the crap items I get and buy one of the better looking ones from the marketplace. But the marketplace is already flooded with these crap items so nobody is buying them. So now I have 3 white hats I can't do anything with. And a bunch of stuff that I don't ware. If you can get it on sale for half price it's probibly worth your money. I wouldn't really recommend it otherwise.As of 11/07/2017 I'm running into hackers too much. Played two games worth noting in the last few days. One had an asian player who single handedly cleared the map and won. He was taking out teams of four left and right with a sub machine gun. When he made it to us he took us all out with one shot. Two of us had all lv 3 gear so there is no reason why we should have went down that easy. the other was us vs. another team for the win. We noticed they had no gear on and took no damage. Needless to say they won. So it really begs the question. What's the point in playing a game where there is no progression and you have anywhere from a one to four in a hundred chance to actually win and a 50% chance to play against a hacker? This game needs work but it already made it's money. And I made mine back selling the stupid clothing items the game out as prizes. So I guess what I'm saying is If all that drives you is a floral pattern shirt and a pair of goth boots then this is the game for you.Also I'm fairly confident this game uses micro trans matchmaking. I sold a few crap items and bought a pair of black pants and a gas mask. The next 10 games were the best I ever had. Every shot landed people wen't down after two hits and I made top 5 at least 4 out of the ten times. I bet if you pay attention to it you'll notice this too.Well just played the new update 1.0 got to 2nd place in a singles match and didn't get any of my points after being brought back to the main screen. 750 BP god damit!Now I just won a game of squad on 12/23/2017 and the game fleaced me for another 245 BP. Do you get punnished for winning now!? I have the screen cap to prove the only squad match I have played so far was a win. But no points again!As of 1/31/2018 Most hackers I've seen in a game yet. The team I was paired up with the teams we came up against. This game is just gone.

review: "PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is a fresh take on battle royal games that has taken the Steam store by storm. Its really enjoyable and a fresh new experience in which I have spent over 200 hrs on. PUBG was a fun to play early access game which millions of people have bought and participated in it being the top in action genre. However ever since the weekly and monthly patches has stopped I am sad to say the game has gotten boring. While I appreciate that the developers putting a lot of time and work into pushing new content I am concerned that the Xbox One version of PUBG has taken priority over say optimization and realistic features which affects most of the community seeing as the majority of players are on PC. So while I am glad to see PUBG on other platforms I would prefer they fix optimizations and glitches in the game first before starting a venture into Xbox. Overall I would recommend PUBG to people who are looking for a fun enjoyable time with friends That being said since optimization for the game is taking so ridiculously long I have not been enjoying the experience recently so I would not recommend the game as of now." Kerrman7 Personally I love the game but many other things are also broken and unfixed. The game is still in early access but this is the time for the developers to pull together the reviews and work on what the commutify wants and general optimisation rather than making new events just so they can sell cases and make money. If many vehicle glitches and bugged were fixed I feel like the game would reach wider audiences but for now the game is still in early access and I hope to see it reach full release but until then I would not recommend this game for average consumers 2 out of 10.

review: I love this game. I really do. But my main issue comes from what the devs are doing.These devs aren't trying to make the game any better if they are attempting to sue the competition that provides the engine their game runs off of provide greedy and microtransactions that would come in when the game was 'finished' push out the game to XBOX (which was a ing travesty) etc.I really like this game because it offers combat that I like. It offers me combat that Fortnite doesn't. I personally wanted a shooter like PUBG for a long time and I am thankful. However if the developers continue their incompetent behaviour the game will die. I want this game to do well but with the direction of the game as it stands it will continue to be plagued by bugs and poor optimization while the developers at Bluehole do nothing but do Class A drugs and make more money off of it rather than make even more money and make the game better.I would not advise you to play this game unless you are stubborn like myself for thinking this game will get better. I also advise you check out Fortnite as Epic Games are doing a decent job at making the game (as they provide consistent updates fixes content etc).

My beef is when you're actually playing. Be prepared to run into hackers because there's a lot of them. Thousands being banned every single day but they just keep coming. They originate from the countries that are supposed to be playing in asian servers (They have a few choices as far as servers go) But they head to the North American servers instead. It genuinely ruins the game and a region block needs to be put into place. Hopefully the devs will get the message.

review: As someone who once considered Player Unknown's Battlegrounds to be extremely buggy and basically unplayable I can definitely say that the game has improved tremendously since it came out of EA (Early Access). The game used to have constant hitreg issues vehicles flying in the air asian cheaters etc.. but 99.9% of those issues are fixed. Of course Bluehole should stop trying to milk the game by adding the event pass and paid cases considering the game is $30 USD but that doesn't take away the fact that the game is actually finally fun and playable. As someone who played in early access and quit due to the unplayability of the game due to cheaters and bugs I can confidently say the game has been fixed. Thanks Bluehole for actually paying attention to these bugs.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a game with a simple concept be the last one standing. Simple in theory hard in practice (Unless your shroud but dont lie ur not so yeah struggle). Pros Guns feel great and every gun feels unique Vehicles have simple controls and are easy to understand Very easy to bring salt out of your teamates and teamkill them (but you never heard that from me) Winning feels very rewarding.Mixed The game contains a lot of bugs and glitches which can be both hilarious and detrimental to your gameplay and enjoyment out of the game. Maps are diverse and unique however limited in selection. Map selection was only added A few days ago whilst having multiple maps for more than half a year. People bring their tents everywhere they go A house with 20 rooms? camp in a corner! Grass with very little visibillity? Set up shop for 5 minutes!Cons Third person mode is very annoying to play in as people can camp round corners and shot you way before you spot them First person remedies this and the only real way to play PUBG without generating salt. The game is updated rarely and takes forever to add new content fix bugs and balance guns (which has only happend once in all of the games lifespan). Has limited modes and incentives to keep you playing the game. Microtransactions are cosmetic only however they are tradeable and are random to recieve. Toxic community and will talk you when you down them.In Conclusion is this game worth it? I believe so. The game at its core is very fun and very realistic. Player Unknown has nearly perfected the battle royale mode but lacks to provide the game with the support it needs to stay relevant. If you likre Fortnite give this game A shot you might like it and vice versa its ok to like both games. But at the moment falls behind Epic and fortnite due to lack of support for their game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

You better of enjoying the game in the future if it will be free to play one day.

review: I bought the game with a friend a week or two ago and I enjoy the game allot actually. I'm really not sure what peoples problem is with this game but I have never seen one hacker I've had no problem with people from other countries ping or other connection issues ECT. To be completely honest I think people are just tired of the game. I realize that im extreamely late in buying the game and I don't have allot of hours logged in the game and I still have allot of fun every time I jump out of that damn airplane. The people I ask in game and most of the people posting negative reviews have allot of hours in the game. I don't want to say that the game is shallow but 800 hours of jumping out of a plane and doing almost the exact same thing is bound to get boring. If you're on the fence about buying this game just do it. I think it's worth 30 big ones if not for the 25+ hours fo fun that you are guarenteed from the game at least from my point of view. I will update this review when I have more hours logged.

review: If you enjoy DayZ by far the best purchasing decision you will make. If you hate DayZ still the best purchasing decision you will make.PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUB PUG PUB GEE PlayersUnknown's just Battlegrounds etc...........) is one of the best "be good aim true" experiences that you will play.Even though I am a god WWCD (Winner Winner Chicken Dinner) every game ever you can still get 2nd place! Let me tell you when you finally beat me in a game you will feel like a god among men (or god among god with me...)Last finally if you need a con to play this game it's that you shouldn't play 'Pick Up Group' Squads (as of 12/29/17). You WILL be placed with a Chinese team that is 200% better than you (25% as good as me...) Good luck communicating.Though you shouldn't be picking up groups in Squads be sure to make friends when possible (not with the enemy!) and GIT YOURSELF A TRUSTWORTHY SQUAD! The game is best played with 4 player Squads. It saturates the battlefield to where you won't ALWAYS share a building with an enemy whom is chuting in on your tail.All in all you will love the game even when I'm all over you on the Battlefield PlayerUnknown's Battlefield! Kip

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds a phenomenon that has gripped the world. First off i'll say the game's 1.0 release was not by any means a 1.0 release the game is still riddled with bugs and clunky mechanics that will urk the calmest guy in his most solitude state. Hackers currently take over the population of the game and sometimes it feels there's 2 3 Hackers per game on Third Person luckily First Person there's a lot less of these vile little cretins running around.The game is a lot of fun in short bursts with friends but it has A LOT of problems broken promises from Developers a vile and draining gambling microtransaction system that isn't even done well at all simple things like Skirts cost up to 300. The right? If you're like me and love customizing your character before an epic battle you can absolutely forget about it with this title and a lot more it's the pinnacle of what's wrong with the gaming industry right now greedy corporate bastards.Now if you can overlook a lot of problems more than what's said above and just have some mindless/competitive fun with friends then pick it up it's not an expensive game by any means you get your money's worth in hours of fun with friends but there's stuff i just can't overlook so for now the game is a thumbs down. Here's to hoping they iron out this game with dedication and love over the next few months.

review: DO NOT BUY UNTIL THEY OPTIMIZE THE GAME I've been looking forward to playing the game after watching some Let's plays on Youtube it seemed like a fun squad game to try out allthough expensive at this point of the development.Scrapped 30e and bought it thinking I wouldnt't have any problems running it since my specs are better then the system requirements not by far but should've been good enough especially since i ran The Witcher 3 on medium even though it had higher requirements. Instead even when I've put the settings to "Very low" which makes the game look like it was made 20 years ago It still feels stuttery. I don't get that much FPS drops and it's playable but it just doesn't seem smooth and so many times that's the cause of death in a 1v1 fight which really shouldn't be the case for any fps game.All in all stay away from it for now unless you have the highest end possible gaming PC also don't trust the system requirements they aren't enough to make the game playable for you. For 30e it isn't worth it IN THIS STATE (especially now that the servers lag constantly too). If they optimize the game fix all the server issues and gamebreaking bugs go for it it's a fun game although not as fun if you don't have a squad or at least one friend who owns it. EDIT AFTER SEPTEMBER UPDATE I've marked it positive since they've actualy done some optimization and the game seems to run decently now although still with terrible graphics. Everyone knows the games fun by now and if they continue optimizing like this it should be a guaranteed purchase for everyone. So at this point id recommend it it's fun it's competitive gather some friends and have a good time just make sure you have a good PC first that's well above the requirements still if you don't want it to run at below 30 fps )Also i just want to emphasize this agian DO NOT BUY IF YOU JUST REACH THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS. The actual minimum requirements are the stated processor a GFX card that's at least a generation above what they wrote an SSD hard drive (the game has rendering issues and it gets rid of the most annoying problems if you have one) and at least 10 GB of ram. And that's if you want to run it on 1920 1080 with everything set to very low IN THE GAMES CURRENT STATE.

review: PUBG I have had on record since day one of Early Access release and since then I can say there have been a lot of changes to the way the game looks how it's played and how far it has come. I was excited to play a game of a new genre and had potential to be a Number 1 seller which at first it was and credit where it's due. But since the official release and port to consoles all I have noticed is that the devs are just throwing in new bits of content and adding new "features" into the game without fixing certain issues that have been around for a long time. The Driving in PUBG has always been something that I have left to someone else simply because it's broken. You can be driving in an open field and hit an invisible wall or the smallest obstruction that any vehicle can easily drive over with no consequences at all and the vehicle you're in will ragdoll for what seems like forever taking out the integrity of the vehicle as well as the HP of the passengers inside. Countless amounts of time this has happened to me and my squad and the result has always been game over.The new items within the game both Cosmetics and new Weapons have been nice to look at and can somewhat seem like a luxury to find the clothing I'm not too bothered about as I'm more about spending the time within the game on the lookout for opponents however the weapons especially can seem a little scarce from time to time. The addition to more weapons and higher tier items has lead to less likely "good" finds seeing as Supply Drops seem to be rarer than usual (Although this could also be down to the other players getting there first in which case fair play) however it's rare to find another player with a better weapon than one that would usually spawn. Now the elephant in the room. Loot boxes. Why? Simple answer Money. Before the official release and for a short while after the loot box system worked amazingly you get rewarded with in game currency depending on your performance in game similar to an XP system. You then use the credits earned in game to redeem a random loot box which would then give you a cosmetic item. It was nice to have something new every once in a while but again I was never really bothered although having a squad with the same outfits was fun at times. Now however they have put a real life price on the loot boxes as like most Valve Titles with their loot box system (CS GO Team Fortress 2 etc) you now have to use your REAL money to open a box. Sure it's less than 2 to open a box but that's EACH box! Surely the grind to get 700+ for a single box is enough of a struggle for some! One thing I have had an issue with since day one is the abysmal loading time of the game itself. This is where most people would go "Just get a good PC" but considering I have spend close to 2k on mine with the specs more than the recommended requirements it should load quicker than the time taken for the game to start and for your player to drift to the ground. I'm sure you've noticed those AFK players at the end of a drop one of those would usually be me for the first game but i shouldn't be a free kill as I easily have the requirements to play this game!I have realised that the developers aren't keen to help players with genuine issues with the game and would rather ignore the situation or retaliate. A friend of mine purchased the game and had "Issues with his account" and when he queried the dev's they said they couldn't do anything about it. Most would get annoyed at the fact that they've then wasted the money on a game the developers won't let them play so he told them to fix it. The outcome? Permanent Account Restriction! THE DEVELOPERS BANNED A PLAYER BECAUSE HE COULDN'T LOGON! How many other developers or companies would ban someone from playing their creation most would do what they can to fix it. I had similar issues to this with content that I purchased on another game not being available and after various forms and forum's it was fixed with a compensating item in game to make up for it. The game that I was having issues with was Star Wars The Old Republic by BioWare. BIOWARE! They can be atrocious at times with their support considering it's EA but even that beats what I have seen from the PUBG Corporation.Most of the players in game seem to be just as bad at times with the option for Voice Chat always being disabled simply because the toxicity of the players. I decided to enable the chat just to hear what was occurring and all I heard was people screaming down the microphone a barrage of people trying to be funny by repeating common phrases and memes and then the abuse from one player to another mostly resulting to very explicit and racial language.Overall the game was pretty good and enjoyable at the beginning but now the devs seem to do nothing but add more content as opposed to fixing the game. The attitude from the devs is absolutely appalling and they seem to be more interested than raking in money from those that want those loot boxes as opposed to keeping their reputation. The playerbase seems to be a Chernobyl based on the toxicity and the gameplay itself has become a bore. Considering the more recent reviews on this game have been negative and their players leaving I can confidently say that they won't have a leg to stand on in the future. Needless to say everything that I have earned in game is being sold on the steam market to compensate the time I now realise I have wasted and if there was an option to refund this game I would do it in a heartbeat.

Now it's just a game full of cheaters and takes way too long. A lot of people have made the switch over to Fortnite like I have because of this game being in a bad state with barely any updates. If changes came to make the game fun again with little to no cheaters I might consider playing regularly again. I do not reccomend this game as of now it's unoptimized has a ridiculous amount of cheaters and bugs and games take way too long.

review: The best thing about this game is when vehicles bug out in a funny way (but you will most likely die and possibly take your team with you). I'm glad this game is getting cucked by fortnite. The list of bad things about this game is endless and the fact that it costs 30 squids is an insult. The graphics are playstation 2 tier but even PS2 games actually loaded properly and you couldn't buy in game tracksuits for them for 40 squidwards. You'd think with all the money this game has made it would be improved majorly but no. It's still utter garbage especially if you're not dicking around with a team of mates. If you don't like dying due to not having a NASA level computer to load buildings quicker than others to grab a gun faster or having bad luck then I would not advise getting this game. Despite all of the hype caused by streamers there is nothing worse than stressfully looting for 15 minutes to be sniped by someone you don't even see and then having to restart. Disconnecting for a few seconds has become even more torturous. Maybe 1 percent of people use global chat by the way to make jokes or whatever. Don't hope for the same shenanigans on twitch.The fog map can be very entertaining however the rain and thunder map is painful as those sounds assault your ears 4 times louder than they should. I could go on about hit detection etc but I'm losing the will to live. I have no chicken dinner goodnight.

review: One of two things happens every game You land inside the circle and are safe for the entire game (meaning you loot up and then sit and do nothing for half an hour) and then get destroyed in the final fightORYou land in a place super far away spend the entire time running toward the safe zone only to get shot in the back by someone you never even sawOther than that game runs like barely managing to maintain 60fps on 720p (GTX 970) there are tons of bugs the controls feel sluggish sometimes houses just don't load properly sometimes your parachute gets caught on trees or buildings and you take damage before you even start sometimes you get killed by people behind walls because the netcode sucks. Instead of fixing the problems BlueHole is focused on adding lootboxes and hosting pro tournaments which the game is clearly nowhere near ready for.Don't buy it unless it goes below $10 dollars and even then it's probably more worth it to spend on something that's actually good.

review: Ok i have to say that this is a insanely fun game... when it works. (hence the ''Yes review'')Pros A lot of tactic involvedGreat concept for a good game A lot of fun playing with friendsMany different gunsTraveling avalible by boat and carHuge playing field (maybe a little too big tho)Cons Right now there is a huge problem with rubberbanding (player teleporting to previous location) this might be because the full game just launched and alot of players started playing at once tho.95% of all the games consists of camping or runnning for 20mins looking for people and getting killed by someone camping in a city.Camping. nuff' said.Summary Its a really great game with alot of potential but i'd like to see more improved servers (im sure the team is working on it but still)I really would like a bit smaller maps to force players to engage in more firefights.As i said awesome game fix these two things and i would love it even more but please prioritize the servers and the rubberbanding problemThank you for your time.

review: A mix of Arma and King of the kill. Not an arcade style battle royale like King of the Kill but based on the same principle. This game is more slow paced but ramps up with intensity as time goes on with a consistently shrinking circle and the player numbers dwindling down to the last man or team standing. You can play as solo duos or as a four man squad. Each queue is specific so you will never join a game as a solo against a squad or duo. Personally it reminds me of the exciting looting elements of the DayZ (Mod) and the intensity of not knowing where people are along with the terrifying moments of sprinting across an open field expecting a sniper shot at any moment. If you enjoy battle royale type games and are looking for one that is a relatively slower in its pacing you will definitely want to buy this. The devs are very active in the community and are quite consistent and frequent with their updates.

review: Hi guys i am songbaoXD a chinese PUBG player. I am not a pro but this article it's just to make sure that everyone who wish to buy this game can know what PUBG is. First i need to claim that if you use to play Fortnite then you can't say much and judge this product i know there are lot's of people saying that Fortnite is way better than PUBG in different ways either Graphics Weapons Maps and lot sort of things but i don't want to argue any more. But just saying PUBG is a mature game for those gamers who extremely like battle royale games. PUBG is really similar to H1Z1 if you use to play it then it's good for you although i never ever tried H1Z1 before because it's dead. PUBG has two maps it's a 50% chance to get any of the map. So you need to know every looting area in both maps such as military base or El Pozo(first is the old map second one is in the new dessert map). I prefer Old map for the "noobs" because it's easier to see those people hiding in the ground. There are advantages in PUBG like 64*64 ultra big map and vehcles and sort different guns. There are disadvangtages too for example there's a guy in chille suit right next too you but you just can't spott you and you got killed by him using a frying pan.That's the end of it it's a extremly good game please add me if you want to play together. Thank you.Hope you enjoy it.

review: though the game is entertaining i do have a few complaints. points i feel can be too easily earned if you know how to do it and those who fight to survive dont get many in comparison. Say you go afk and last 3 and a half minutes you can earn perhaps 75 coins while a player that lasts to rank #34 with no kills earns 119 there is no reason to play if the reward is slim to nothing. I would base the coin on an evaluation on distance traveled by foot vehicle kills and most importantly rank. The time you survive is irrelivant in this situation. These simple changes would change afk strats and force people to play for the advantage making the game more enjoyable for everyone. Out side of this the game is wonderful a few more weapons to add to variety for common weaponry (and more use for the pistol they are initial spawn use at best) and this would be 12.5 times better than before. Im not a big fan of games where you can die in 2 seaconds if you dont see the other guy first but this game encourages more gun fight situations

review: Good game with bad optimization and anti cheating. With OC 4770K 4.4Ghz GTX1060 6GB and 32GB RAM and all low setting excepet view distance I can only get about 75 avg fps in 1080P game. Some of the low objects seems walkable but in fact you cannot go through it unless you jump. Lived in the U.S. but I suffered rubber banding in even NA server. Also anti cheating is a huge problem for this game since most of us met those who cheating and kill your easily. It ruins the game experience.It's hard for me to recommend this game to others. So just play if you friend will play a squad with you.P.S. After the official release there are still so many people cheating.

review: Product received for free. In early access it was fun if not frustrating. The hackers the performance issues the bugs and glitches the crashes. You accepted them as a part of the mystique of an early access title.The gameplay remained this fun sense of stealth tactics and teamwork (for duo/squad). It's that gameplay has kept PUBG afloat.Since 1.0 the performance has gotten much better and with any hope the game will continue to get better. I feel like the 0.9 version to 1.0 was a massive step in a legit shooter that stands the test of time up there with the Battlefields and Call of Duty's.I have enjoyed reliving DayZ (the Arma 3 mod) days I do want to see the streamer only 4 5 v 96/95 zombies mode come to be a legit queue hopper in the future I think it will bring a fun alternative way to play.

review: 100% worth the price.I don't normally play PvP games in general but this game is done so well.The main problems with the game right now are optimization and server lag. Both of which will be sorted out in the coming weeks. I want to bring attention to the balance or the line this game falls on between tactical and arcade game play. I feel (along with many others) that it's done so perfectly. The drops and drop locations are random so the learning curve comes from bullet travel and bullet drop at range and what to expect from certain scopes. Alot of fun alone and even more so with friends. 10/10

review: I've got quite a bit of playtime in this game and I can wholeheartedly say that despite loving this game (for the meantime) it will soon be ran into the ground by the sketchy development team. Bluehole has repeatedly lied about early access features microtransactions and is putting more time into developing cosmetics than they are into actually improving the gameplay. Optimization is poor and don't expect to be able to smoothly run this game with anything less than an newely built system. Server latency and Connection is poor and has not had a thorough revision since the release of the game. PUBG has sold nearly 5 million coppies and refuses to create dedicated servers. Instead they decide to use a third party ( Amazon if memory servers me correctly) to host games for the almost 400k players on at any given time. Expect the game to randomly discconnect mid round. Expect to get shot through walls expect to fly off the road if touched by another vehicle. The bugs in this game are horendous and often (about 1 out of every 10 games) causes it to be unplayable. We are talking everything from not being able to control parachutes to not being able to aim on a vertical axis. This game needs some serious work and based on the lack of progress shown the lack of developer support and the uyndeniable greed by the developers within the next 6 months I can gaurntee that this game will be dead. The developers will cash out and leave the players with nothing more than a half finished game and $30 less in their wallets.

review: Great concept for the game I'd recommend it to anyone desperate for a KOTK experience that's not KOTK the game is VERY simillar in everything but with slightly more features including You drop from a plane so your choice of where to start is more varied and personalized.There are more weapons a lot more cusomizability to said weaponsIn my opinion a better mapSomewhat destrucable terrain (fences and minor stuff like that)Usable water (boats swimming)For anyone who is not desperate for another one of these games I would stray away from buying this title at it's current state it has very poor service and every 3 4 games will be rendered unplayable because of this (rubber banding and just general lagginess and that's coming from someone running on a 100/100 fiber line.) The game runs fairly poorly on my somewhat high end computer hardly ever reaching 60 FPS out in the wild and slugs down to 35 ish in town. Also alot of the animations looks like garbage some of the player models do tooWant to clarify that I'm one of the "desperate" people who really wanted a new H1Z1 and as a replacement for that it works really well but if you are aren't like a 100% you'd enjoy the game I would wait for some of the bugs and issues mentioned here and in other reviews to be resolved before investing in it. I have no doubt it will be a better game than KOTK if the issues gets fixed.

review: Where to start with PUBG... How about the great and addictive gameplay that pulls you in after every loss even if you feel like a stale piece of garbage turkey for walking into a house and not watching your corners and gives virtually no reward for winning besides some scrap of self worth and something to brag about to mates. The graphics are not to be shun even though they are par for the course with ganes that come out these days the map layouts are memorable and iconic and after about 10 games i knew it like the back of my nuclear warhead. One negative thing that can be said about this game are the performance issues which aren't that prominent since the 1.0 launch but are still present another thing is the CHINESE why can't Bluehole just give them their own server since OC and NA servers seem to be getting the brunt of their hacks and teamkills it just doesn't seem to help bluehole in any way since this could lead to a chunk of the playerbase quitting. Overall.. iss pre gewd

review: I'm a transgender woman who rarely plays online games other than MMOs I can solo and especially not games where voice chat is important and I might be outed as trans. I got into the game because a few fellow trans players had a sort of informal guild but I got super into it and I started playing random PUG squad games and in a bizarre way it's inspiring. Like I haven't got hit by transphobia once I'm sure it'll happen at some point but it's like being put in a fictional situation where you have to work together or fictionally die really builds enough tension that everyone works together.The key thing I'll say is this I have an anxiety disorder and PTSD and I find this game to be a therapeutic tool. It's like I constantly feel this pressure IRL that something horrible and life threatening could happen and this game lets me... blow off steam? Anyway I love it it's like IRL Hunger Games and it's awesome.

review: I have an i7 7700 and gtx 1060 and are able to run it on ultra with 70 90 fps. Yes its poorly optimized but not quite to the extent that people are trying to make it out to be. Saying that "top high end rigs" are having trouble playing this on medium settings is just an outright lie. My previous computer (AMD A10 7800 + Radeon R7) could run this game on very low settings with an average of about 26fps. So if you have a low end comp beware you will not break 30fps

review: i very much so want to give this a good review since its quite a nice game and i havent experienced any issues with the game itself since i actually have a good computer. however what makes me not want to give a good review is that every single game i try to play since a month or two ago i have been always getting matched up with 3 chinese players no matter what time of day it is in north american servers. it wouldnt be so bad if at the very least they were good players however they are never good and die within the first 20 people dying. besides that its a great game. the graphics are quite beautiful if you can run it at full quality. Erangel the island map is pretty good i especially love dropping school. the other map Miramar is fine but i do feel like it needs more work and more stuff the loot especially has a worse roll then Erangel. the guns are nice there are a good amount of different guns and the gun machanics are nice and pretty realistic. vaulting redzone and the blue circle are quite nice and im glad that the creator himself wants to improve the blue circle especially.

The graphics are good and all that that nice i guess.Also i dont like the new map (Miramar) i feel like it should been filled with more action but the developers did the opposite and put 20 towns instead of like 2 3 large towns and 3 medium and then 1 or 2 small towns.My opinion may change after 1.1 but i don't know what to expect from it.
