review: Before getting triggered remember that most Pros/Cons come down to personal preference with almost any game.Pros Good mechanics (Barely becuase CQC is complete sh*t)Decent graphics (If you have a monster PC)Cons Lying devsHorrible banning systemUnoptimizedNot very originalMap is too big for how fast the borders close inUnoptimized twice because it's that bad.(Personal Con) Not very fun solo.To sum it up Not really worth the $30. Overhyped honestly. I can run Grand Theft Auto V at 30 FPS on Ultra graphics with no other programs open (besides Steam obviously)But I can't manage to get more than 45 FPS on this even on the lowest of low graphics. There's a problem. Wouldn't play again unless in a group with nothing betterto do.3.5/108/28/2017
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: unoptimised unbalanced poorly designed janky mess that will go the way of dayz due to lack of support and maintenance of the devs.controls like your a tank stuck in a lake of syrup and has some of the most tedious gameplay that essentially boils down to running away from a blue line and then getting killed in the top ten because the rng gods have frowned upon you. If you want a game with player choice then you should play this game because the two choices that you're lamped with at the end of every single game are just simply amazing. Run out into the open and be cut down by bullets or actually attempt to move up in a tactical way and die to an electric blue force field. omg such choice. I can really see how taking away all semblence of decision making and player agency in the final moments of the game while one or two players are sat happy in their little safe zone not having to move while every other player runs towards them like a headless chicken really is the best way to discover the best online fps player.player unknown is quoted as saying in an interview that the best player should win every game this however is not the case as he has just made an rng s**t show of a game.This game has almost as many problems as dayz and if you did even five minuites of digging online you would see countless reviews from people taht know wtf theyre talking about absolutely decimating this game absolutely murdering this game with words because it is just a tedious repetitive janky mess of rng s**t

review: Honestly... I really hate this game. I want to like it but the controls just feel like garbage. It isn't smooth and nearly every time I die I feel like I've wasted loads of time when I could have been playing a better game. The whole loot system is a pain. I love the feeling you get when you first drop in and you're looking around for something to protect yourself with but with all the debilitating bugs poor performance and cheaters it's a real let down. Even if those things were fixed I feel like the guns feel super sluggish awkward and downright not fun to play with. If there were a shooting range so you could get used to the way recoil and aiming worked (which isn't simple) then I feel like that would be an improvement but overall... just don't waste your time.

review: Is propably the best concept regarding BattleRoyal Games but also one of the worst programmed ones. Owning it means you are kinda forced to play it cause its so overhyped that all your aproxamitly 100 Steam friends seem to play it. But meanwhile it is just killing are your skill you maybe ever had in any shooter game cause of its purely made rng elements and everyday you play it means another day of exploring more bugs in a seemingly alpha phase game. I can not recommend buying it even though i had some fun with it for following main reasons 1. The Game devs dont really give a about bugs being in the game the only thing they are focussing on is more "content" but even that is such a slow progress if you metion there playerbase as of now. 2. So many RAGE Hackers! All hackers you meet dont give a about anything they are just walking around with esp Aimlock and autoshoot enabled. On top of that the devs seem to like them cause they do nothing to stop. 3. Trust me this is the most important one of the three. You !will! spend at least 75% of your time into this game and the more you paly it the more you hate it but cause all your friends push you to play. As a result I can not recommend this game to anyone at least if they dont want to waste all there spare time in one of the worst and most overhyped casual game of all time.

Weapon updates are terrible making some of the best guns ok or terrible and the worse guns even worse than they were (AKM). Item spawning is honestly garbage with such a big map that you can drop into a town and only find couple pistols and shotguns yet there are a dozen buildings. You'll rage more at this game than actually playing and enjoying it. If I could return this game I would for my money back. You get what you pay for. review: PUBG is a battle royale shooter a la H1Z1 made by the person who "invented" the genre 2011 with the ArmA 2 mod and definitly the most hyped and talked about game of 2017.Battle against up to 99 other players solo or in squad loot the insland find better gear run away from the death zone and try to be the last man/squad standing!After more than 200 hours into PUBG i can't really say that i hate it.Yes it has bugs. Yes it has cheaters. Yes is has many problems.BUT The feeling you get every few rounds when the player amount drops below 20 when you hit that insane Kar98 headshot when you get a road kill when you win with an 3 player AUG spray down when you sneak behind the hostile squad and knock 2 out when you and your buddys cruise through the map trying to get away from the bomb or death zone when you kill somebody with a pan when you get that loot drop with an AWM in it and also if you die by stupid bugs or through a chinese cheater... is INSANE!The developers need to get their sh*t together and start fixing this game!Still i can definitly recommend it to anybody that likes shooters adrenalin rushing gameplay and to play with great mates!9/10

review: This game is good fun when alone and magnitudes more fun with friends in a squad. PUBG can be fun for those who have little military knowledge like myself and enjoyed as a fun tactical shooter alone or with friends. However I have realised how greatly realistic some of the features of the game are in simulating real combat while playing with friends who have a basic to moderate level of military knowledge/training which some people may find to be a selling point.*Since many people seem to be review bombing this game in relation to stream sniping bans I would like to highlight that neither me nor anyone I know has experienced this I think it is affecting very little people compared to the number of people jumping on the hate bandwagon and the issue seems to be happening less as time gone by so maybe the devs have listened to the complaints?Conection I haven't had too many issues with servers or connectivity in the Oceania server Although a few of my games have started with some server lag this corrected itself after a few minutes and has only affected a vast minority of my games (2 games out of between 30 50). A lot of people also seem to be complaining about connectivity issues so i'm not sure if i've been lucky or if this is mainly affecting people in China or other northern asian countries and North America.When i first played I had a game or two that was interrupted by the game client crashing this hasn't happened for many months and I found to be acceptable at the time since it was quite new to early access.Updates and new content are regularly being added as well as bug fixes so it seems like the devs won't be pulling an ARK SE on us.

review: tl dr This game is fun. This game is life. This game is love. And a little bit of rubber band. 8/10 will be 10/10 once some minor fixes are implemented.Do you want the battle royale type of game then this is it. You can't compare it to any predecessor except for the actual game mode. The weapons have a good balance the military grade loot fixed locations really does create another dimension to the tactical aspect of the game. Do you want to jump straight down and challenge up to 15 20 people for the scarce loot in a smaller city or do you wanna fly far away maybe grab a car and go to a remote location for your loot? This game offers it all. The cars are not as illogical as in H1Z1 and this took a few games to get used to. I truly do love that end game is not about driving a car in 150 km/h jumping out to 2 tap people. This goes for both solo duo and squad. Mainly because if you jump out while your car is moving you will take damage. Hell you might even die because of it.The weapons and attachments this aspect can be kind of random. At times you'll find yourself with every attachment you might want sometimes you simply won't. It's an even mix of rng and you actually planning if you'd find something of interest early of the rounds. The weapons are evenly balanced and with full attachments no gun really sticks out of the mix. In my opinion this is one of the best aspects of the game. If I had to compare the weapons to any other title I'd say Arma.The only negative thing I have to say during this review would be the rubber band lag that has been occuring on the servers for quite a bit since launch. I still play through the rounds every time that's how fun this game is. The developers are currently working their asses off to polish this game and I'm sure it won't be long until they've sorted all the issues.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Brought to you by Sellout Inc. Player unknown also worked on the infamous cashcow H1Z1 and worked hard to bring you the same level of support for bugs and hackers. The worst game optimisation I have ever experienced. Terrible server lag at the beginning of every game. Sync issues that cause bullets to either miss or hit and do no damage. Render issues on slow pc's that allow players to walk or drive vehicles through walls on a regular basis. Buggy title screen. And that's just what I recall off the top of my head. These are all known issues that have been present since release. Not to mention the aimbot and speed hackers which dominate the higher ranks. The game may be in early access but that doesn't mean a free pass to treat the community like ****. This is the top selling game on steam and they seem completely incapable of fixing issues that we've all been shouting at them about since day one. Instead of fixing the games flaws they would rather battle Microsoft for a console release.It's a real shame because this game is really fun. Especially playing with friends. But its issues ultimately lead to frustration and that is killing the community. The biggest streamers seem like they're on the verge of giving up the game for good. If the community dies in early access I don't know whether or not it can ever be revived.At the rate it's going I'm not getting my hopes up that PUBG will ever leave early access.

review: This has to be one of the best multiplayer games I have played in a while since cs go. The game is very stable and very well polished the gunplay is great. All the items and guns feel good and unique. The map is fantastic the land is diverse and does never feel boring and repetitive. The game is not very glitchy and seems bug free. The game in general is great and very satisfying. Its also worth noting that there i am economy built around this game like csgo and TF2. Which meand you can get items worth hundreds of dollars!!! The only difference is that instead of random item drops and opening cases or crates the game rewards you with coins. If you get enough coins you can open a crate fo free!!! Which means you can get an item worth hundreds of dollars for free and the price for these crates are reasonable and you should get them every several games you play. I defintely recommend this game if you like online multiplayer shooters. The game is satisfying as hell definitely worth the 30 bucks.UPDATE I just want to update that this review was posted before all the t that did with banning people and adding updates that are making the game glitchy and buggy. It can all be fixed easily and the game used to be great but they have to fix it and also add more content. My cousin got a global ban because his random squad teamed up against him with another team and tried to kill him so my cousin killed a few of them in return. Fix your this is unacceptable. You better lift the bans of all of these people you wrongfully convicted including my cousin. 2nd UPDATE Game is getting better. Keep it up. More optimization and content. Good work. Totally recommend.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First I would like to say that over all this is a good game it has a good idea behind it but i find that many of these ideas where either dropped or pushed off to allow this game to be let out (hence the early access). I am well aware that this doest represent the game in its final state but as in its current state i can not at all recomend this game.Heres why I have a glitch everytime i load in that forced the buildings not to render this makes it impossible to loot or do almost anything in the game for around 1 2 mins. Now this is the most vital time in the game as most players are killed in this time frame. I had assumed that maybe my computer couldnt run the game but after hearing the same problem from multiple friends with MUCH better computers then i have i can only guess that this is a problem within the game itself. Now onto the most glairing issue the conflicts. I can not even begin to explain how poorly this game delivers on combat as most is either so close only shotguns or full auto weapons will be very effective or your going to get sniped from so far away you cant seen them (personal favorite). I can't tell you how many times i would get great gear and weapons only to die instantly after walikng outside. Now i believe that this isnt something that ruins the game entirely bu it does make matches feel extremely futile as i would loot get good stuff see no one at all then as soon as i would leave the town or city be dropped by a someone i had zero chance of fighting. As i have around 16 hours of gameplay at time of writting i can admit that around half of that time was spent looting just to die almost instantly. Now i dont belive that dying in a battle royale is unfair its the whole point of the ing game. But when you allow player to die from reason at all it seems pointless to try in some matches when i feel like im the only one without a rifle with a scope. I would also like to mention that even though all of the above problems can be very detrimental to gameplay i've found that playing with friends or good teammates can negate some of the problems but obviously not all. Overall i find PUBG to be a fun game with around half of my matches being fun and enjoyable even if i die (which is all part of the game) meaning the game has potential but needs a lot of work to get it there. I recomend buying this game much later when the content is better and more reliable across all matches.

review: The core game is good but the game still has some major issues. Preformance is average major fps drops at times. Bad server preformance. Desync and lag is common. Enjoy taking damage behind cover have your bullets pass thru enemys or die in 1 frame because of super bullets. Devs take forever to fix/improve things. Devs ask for community/pro player feedback then tend to ignore it or do the opposite. No ranks or meaningful leaderboards majority top of the leaderboards are hackers. You have to pay 10 bucks for any kind of meaningful proggression with battlepass a "season" is only 4 weeks.PUBG corp seem more interest in adding more things you can pay for then improving the game. Every new patch tend to break something. They put them on the "test server" for maybe a few hours before pushing them to live. Giving it no time to be properly tested beyond that the game dont instantly crash.At time of writing the current state the game is some of the worst its ever been 7 months after "full release".

review: PUBG is a great game in my opinion it is very fun and a great game to play with your friends. I am however dissapointed in the fact that i can barely get the old map and every game i play is the new map (most of the time) which can make the game very repetitive and the new map is already starting to feel dry. Even with this though i always come back to this game as moments can be very intense and exciting (or rage enducing). This game has flaws like the cheaters that flood games but I am very lucky as this rarely happens to me and Bluehole has done a DECENT job with handling these hackers. Also the game has bugs like getting stuck in a tree or a rock but this has only happened to me a very few times considering that i have 100+ hours and it is unlikely to happen but when it does it is extremely frustrating. IFor the casual player this will be a great game to mess around in and for the competitive player this is the game for you and it is so satisfying to win the game and when you win the grind will be worth it. The game also is demanding so dont expect to play this on your nvidia 210 gpu but in all seriousness i have a high end gaming pc and i dont experience any issues but i know that this game isnt the best performing pc game but hey its still better than console. And despite the flaws of this game i really recommend it because it is fun to come back to even after immense frustration. This was totally worth the $30

review: Great fun with friends. Some issues with the game crashing every now and again when loading into the pre game lobby but the game is still in Early Access so some issues are to be expected. This is simply a game of survival. Find the best location to exit the plane with the least amount of players around you while also looking to land in places containing a plethora of weaponry and armor. It's both a PvP and PvE game. The PvE is very limiting in that there is a border which reduces in size over time (with warning) and also certain 'red areas' of the map which explode every once in a while. Had a ton of fun playing the game so far hiding in cars in the open with players somehow failing to notice us and allowing us to survive until the last 2 teams alive in duo. Tons of fun. Some of the guns don't quite work to the best of their ability for example I shot somebody 2 times in the head with a shotgun from point blank range and they did not get downed which is slightly annoying but hopefully these issues will be rectified with future updates.Definitely recommend the game if you're looking to have fun with a good group of friends. I will say there isn't really an end goal to the game as all you do is play to win each round and rack up a ton of BP (in game currency) to purchase rewards which include clothing.

review: Mmhm where to start. When I first bought this game I wasn't really passionate into it and didn't give much care. The only reason I bought PUBG was because of how much attention it got but I was mainly playing CSGO so I didn't bother playing much. However when I started getting better at the game I thought Holy Sh*t this is pretty good. I gave PUBG more attention until my friends eventually bought the game. This is where the fun started. I was fully into PUBG I swapped over from CSGO to PUBG but as everything the more experience you have with something the more flaws you find. I have eventually gained enough hours to confidently write a review. And so PROS Great attention to detail (Scopes attachments bullet drop map scaling zeroing with weapon scopes etc.)Easy to learn controlsAlways updated devs (Always working on bringing out new content and fixing bugs.)Very competitive (Don't expect PUBG to die anytime soon)Not too high level gapHackers are always dealt with (Once you see a hacker and report him he is gone for good.)Super satifying feeling when winning a gameInternet is not as a big factor (Where you could play in EU or Asia whilst in OCE and still have a good fighting chance.)The game is only at the early stages of its full release (PUBG as of now will only get better.)Friends completely help and change the PUBG game (PUBG is 120% better and more fun with friends.)You can make a few bucks from PUBG! (The more you play the more points you get. With these points you could buy crates and open them or you could sell them for steam bucks. As of now I have made 50 bucks just playing off PUBG.)CONS Game breaking bugs everywhere (Vehicles exploding randomly 2 bugs found in school where you could peak through the walls and even shoot enemies getting stuck randomly looting glitches etc.)Devs prioritise the wrong updates (Where they release new content without fixing the fundamentals of the game.)Beast PC to run at constant high FPS (I have an i5 8gb RAM GTX 1060.However I have the game set to VERY LOW as if I go higher such as high I achieve a good 80 fps but always stutters down to 20 fps every few seconds which essentially makes the game unplayable. Probably due to RAM.)Sh*tty servers (I really mean it. I have had the dumb main menu tell me how the servers are too busy and that I had to reconnect. A few times it took me almost 8 minutes just to get into a dumb game.)No map picker (PUBG now has 2 maps however I feel like the latest map is not my style and compared to the first one I dislike it. The devs however did not implement a map picker into the game and you are stuck in the inevitable void of wishing you get your preferred map.)Conclusion There are more PROS and CONS of which I have probably not listed but these are the ones which are most significant in the back of my head. I could imagine PUBG as a really cool looking friend but the more you know her the more b*tch slaps she increasingly gives you. It has so much potential and I still am positive about PUBG but I have my faith in BlueHole and hopefully it will only get better from here on.P.S. I absolutely suck and hate Fortnite but it's because I still haven't had much experience with it and I definitely recommend PUBG over Fortnite IMO.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: A few points addressing issues other reviews have reported Never had optimisation issues Bugs are common yet only ever minor always resolvable with a reboot or the main menu reload button. Oceanic servers have great ping and are unfortunatly flooded with foreign players usually from Asia however I have never experienced a capacity issue and have always been able to get into a server.Been a long time fan and after playing both major competitors I can say I prefer this over Fortnite by a longshot. Unlike Fortnite PuBG is a lot more mature and is followed by a community of serious and competitive players. In PuBG you wont find any party buses or emoji dance offs Just sheer gritty challenge.

review: If you can't be bothered to read this entire review take this one line away from it then It's better than its competitors but that doesn't necessarily mean it's playable.If you are bothered continue to read.Small things first "IT'S EARLY ACCESS YOU CAN'T CRITICISE IT!"1) It's available to purchase on Steam for 27/ 40/ $50. If you're charging that much for something you're stating that the content is at least worth that much regardless of the potential future state of the game or what your intentions are to improve it. If you expect people to pay this much NOW then it SHOULD be worth it REGARDLESS of its development state.2) Being early access is not a 'get out of jail free' card for having bad anything in your game. If anything you want these things highlighted so that THEY CAN BE FIXED. NOT HIGHLIGHTED NOT IGNORED BECAUSE "IT'S EARLY ACCESS " IF THERE'S SOMETHING WRONG RESOLVE IT. You are CHARGING PEOPLE MONEY FOR THIS."X has this issue too!"/"Hey X has this worse."Does not justify this game having it especially if it's critical to the core gameplay.Performance If you have the power to whack it up to the good settings good for you. You'll have no issue here. If you don't then you'll have to suffer a poorly optimised game for now. Have fun with those fps drops and bad latency. Or if you want just let this burn a hole into your library.And now what matters.Gameplay This game relies heavily on RNG. What loot you get and where the circles start. It's not a completely cardinal sin but it sort of reduces your skill as a factor in how you'll perform.The circles move way too fast and hit way too hard the progression from stage to stage is so fast it's no wonder multiple games are being played at one time people are forced to have to either have no gear at all because they have to evade "the magical blue field of doooom!" which will absolutely destroy you if you're not in the area it says by the time it starts getting to you then it also provides an unfair play to people who are just waiting for you to turn up and pick you off as you come to the area to try and escape. It's entirely down to luck if you get good enough loot to survive and the right weapons that you can use to fight. But if you're already in the circle good for you! You'll get to contend with the next major issue which is Hitreg. The hit registration is absolutely atrocious in this game. I've emptied entire clips into people and hit nothing but then they hit me back and I die. I've dealt absolutely no damage with shots that should have hit. Good game. It IS possible to kill people just not when you need to. But even if you luck out enough to actually be able to hit someone that STILL isn't enough because...WHERE ARE THEY?! Sometimes you're just in a good position with good stuff scanning the landscape. And then a shot hits you. Unfortunately the sound you made while being hurt masked the direction the shot came from that is if you could even tell if that shot were to miss. So having no idea where the shot came from you attempt to get into a good cover against a person that you have no idea where they are. Except you're dead now. You've just been killed by apparently no one. Good stuff. And yet when it's your turn to be the predator when it's your turn to look for the people to catch off guard and have them wondering where the you were you can't find anyone. No one's visible. At all. You look all around the area before it starts to close in again. Where are they indeed. Then you keep looking and you fall victim to the invisible sniper.I guarantee you that you will spend a lot of your time dying to just any random person completely out of nowhere. And you don't even get the chance to do the same.Other Wanna drive? Have fun . Your car is extremely loud and offers no protection to you if someone decides to shoot at you. And even worse if you absolutely have to get out to avoid and/or fight someone you MUST stop your car dead. If it's even moving a millimetre an hour you're gone. Bye pal. Now. Just one of these would be okay. Not all three. This is ridiculous. The distance you could cover? What distance. You're overturned because your vehicle weighs nothing and will happily overturn at the slightest thing. Even if you drive carefully the fuel you start driving with is quite little which you can top up with a can but is counter intuitive when you consider the completely negative utility that is driving a vehicle....So why am I recommending this?Really all I'm doing with that is promoting discussion. I actually adore this game. I just wish it could be better. RIP 2017 2017 "Not H1Z1."
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: One of the best games I have ever played it is in my top 5 of all time. Right next to NES Mario 1 Halo 2 Timesplitters 2 and Counter Strike Source. review: Time for an honest review.First and foremost do yourself a favor and mute all chat other than team chat. There is literally nothing of value to be gained from listening to the public chat.Now that that's settled let's tackle the gameplay. Is it fun? YES. It's like Battle Royale meets Hunger Games. You and up to 98 others get dropped onto an island with nothing and have to fight to find weapons and gear to survive. But can the gameplay be improved? Absolutely. There are definitely lag issues and for a $30 game one would expect more from the servers. That said I think the whole "the Chinese are ruining everything" outcry is a bunch of whiny bull. Look at my hours played. I'm on 29 hours as of this review and I'm a top 2.3% player on Third Person Solo. You can find ways to do well like... say NOT running around shooting everything that moves? You get much better ranking for survival than you do for killing others so it pays to remain unnoticed.Anyway enough of that. Can the graphics be improved? Absolutely. Does it suck to get killed before you even know which direction you're being fired upon from? Absolutely. Are the physics a bit wonky? Yes. But even with all of its flaws the game is still fun especially when playing duo with a partner. It's not for everyone but if you can overlook a few flaws the fun more than makes up for it.

review: This was a tough review to write as the game is incredibly addicting but has so many aspects of the game that just feel off or unpolished. Even though this is a game labelled as Early Access and is doing great in sales there are many things that the team should be prioritizing. So far the early access cycle for me has been akin to that of ARK's it's been very fun fun enough to overlook the current negatives. However the more I play it like with ARK I begin to tire of the countless issues the game has and that the dev team seems to avoid dealing with. The large problems with the game are the way the servers are handling traffic and client side problems. With these two problems there is a lot of lag and problems as hit detection is purely client side which can cause a lot of problems with things such as Desync. Another problem with the game is what seems like PR defensiveness about their game. This is shown from having issues with Fortnite having a Battle Royale game mode and the fact that they advertise in their game to Chinese players because they don't want to have servers in China so they advertise for a proxy service. If you are able to get past all the rather serious issues (most of which are not listed) and not get into a game with a Hacker or Streamer (Stream sniping is extremely over reported for) then by all means buy the game but in its current state I cannot personally say I think it's worth the 36.99 CAD the game costs with the state of optimization and connection quality

review: Many have been tantalized by the concept of King of The Hill Games such as H1Z1 KotH and Arma III were the first to introduce gamers to the concept of kill or be killed. With a variety of scenarios and locations to do battle with your team mates or face off against the masses alone PUBG has gone the extra mile in designing a mind blowing location for the battle to take place an endless series of options to choose from and the honor of being the best. This Survival game tests your skills in PVP strategy and gives you the sense of adventure you are always looking for. Starting out in a plane on the way to the island you can make the choice of where you want to leave the plane. Parachute down to make your way towards the designated zone to do battle. This may all seem easy enough but with a deadly force growing closer and closer you are forced to face your opponents in a volatile environment where anything can happen. Search through buildings and scavenge for resources and means to defend yourself. Modify weapons. Take advantage of vehicles to ensure you get to the safe zone first. Party up with a friend or create a team of four players to ensure a solid victory. Customize your character with cosmetics attained by earning points for every game you play.Check out the trailer for yourself! https //www.youtube.com/watch?v ODWCbu_cuqkAvailable for purchase on the Steam Store http //store.steampowered.com/app/578080/

review: You will have an angle locked down which you know someone will walk into.You will shoot them the instant you see them. They will have terrible reaction time and bad ping. They will still win. Why? Because they already turned the corner and shot you on their end. 300ms ping guy walks around the corner sees you and shoots.150ms to tell the server he walked around the corner plus your ping for the server to tell your computer to display them.The death cam will show you staring blankly off into space as if you never saw them turn the corner. People with high enough ping can peek kill you and pop back behind cover before you even see them.The region locking everyone is requesting is a bandaid solution mind you. The netcode is the root issue. I wouldn't recommend supporting this developer until they do something about it. It is so atrociously bad it makes the old CoD4/MW2 engine netcode look like a masterpiece. It's quite dissapointing they've made no attempt to fix this core issue with the insane amount of money this game has made. The final straw for me writing a negative review was allocating their manpower towards building a new map rather than working on polishing the core experience. It tells us they don't prioritize it as an issue.

review: TL DR Game was great concept but rough around the edges. Developer was slow to fix problems made money got complacent and the game is now infested with Chinese hackers.8/10 at launch 3/10 in current state. I bought it 3 4 months after launch. It was well worth the $30 dollars I spent for the amount of enjoyment I got out of it. If I had purchased the game 2 months ago I could not say the same. The game is early access and so there's a lot of major issues including optimization and glitches which can be discarded as typical early access phenomena. That said major issues with the game's engine have been unresolved since launch obvious client side exploits have existed without any acknowledgement from the developers and the game world is laughably strung together. This game is not competitive. The sheer fact that ANY tournament was held is an insult to the consumer. The game itself does not lend itself to any sort of esport. One of the biggest elements in PUBG is luck. The drops you find the circle's positioning on you vehicle spawns and more are all almost entirely out of the hands of the player. WHICH IS FINE. But the only reason it's fine is because PUBG is a GAME. It is not an esport and should NEVER be viewed as one. Furthermore the state of the game is absolutely pathetic for any sort of competitive environment. Grass doesn't render in after a short while which means you can be camoflaged on your screen and completely in the open on another player's. Objects render in differently depending on distance so that tree you're hiding behind could be slightly to the left on someone else's screen. Water is an impenetratable shield against bullets (watch the ending circles of the Gamescom Invitational to see why this is an issue.) The vehicle physics are an actual meme. Literially they are the running joke of PUBG. Now for the client side issues. From the beginning of the game it was obvious that too much of PUBG was in the hands of the client and not the server. If your teammate had poor ping he would run faster than you EVEN WHEN HE SHOULD BE SLOWER. Now to be fair this is an issue that can and should be overlooked in the context of an early access game. However these issues were completely overlooked in the development schedule. Instead of addressing the issue that would no doubt lead to major hacking problems the developers ignored it issued slap on the wrist punishments to a handful of .ini tweakers and proceeded to focus development elsewhere. When we needed engine work regarding anti cheat we got a grenade rework that still doesn't work properly. This led to the massive hacker infestation currently plaguing the game. Needless to say the ease at which the game can be hacked is hilariously sad. Speedhackers and aimbots run amok in at least half the games played. Worse yet hackers can shoot through terrain from miles off. You can be killed inside a house by a person sitting in a field 3 miles out from you. One of the saddest points in this game however has to be watching the developer grow complacent. The amount of small QoL updates and new guns/weapons has dropped from bi weekly to bi monthly. More time has been spent by the lead dev tweeting at streamers than discussing development progress on the game. It's very obvious at this point that PUBG has made it's money and it's done. It'll continue to update of course but it is not eager to make itself into a better game anymore. The game that was seemingly immune to the early access curse has fallen to it. I could go on about the state of the game but all you need to know is don't buy. Wait. Maybe when the developers get organized and commit themselves to making their game legitimately great will it be worth the buy. Right now the game is so overun by hackers that it's lost the only element that made it playable fun.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PlayersUnGrownBattleFields.. I mean PlayersUnknownBattleGrounds is a game focused on an aerna style gameplay. You start in a lobby either Solo Que's or teams up to 4 (duos and 3 4 in seperate games). First you are greeted with tons of lag fire and screaming normies. Dont worry by the time you hit the ground about 5 will have disconnected (YAY less threats!) You jump into a C 130 with the other 99 players and fly over the map in a straight line that changes every game. You will look at the map and find a place to land (word to the wise dont land at school... you WILL die there ) once you land if you have a pc you may have to wait for buildings to render (Those Clay lookin a** buildings) if not you enter the house and start looting. Finding guns ammo gear meds and hopefully a damn scope.If you have survived long enough Congrates! (ur not ) At this point you want to focus in on the wall and find out where it is heading and beat it there while dodging bullets and a car or two for those scrubs that accualy use the cars considered to be ear for those around. the circle will close in at sections of time to keep the game play going. OH! Almost forgot those OP loot drops that come around once in a while good luck surviving that Anyways the game goes on till your dead or you got winner winner chicken dinner! Overall the game is great concept art balance. But there needs to be big opimization fixes ( a I5 6420 GTX 1060 PC shouldnt be on all low.) But with some time this will be fixed9/10 is my rating for the things that need to be fixed minus(ing) a point on my scale. I'd recommend it to anyone who likes arena games and has a good pc.NOTE alot of people have been talking about the streamer stuff and getting banned for no reason but you have as much of a chance of that happening compared to getting struck by lighting.

review: Ah totally OK game. Right now it's a glitchfest and it propably will be for a while. The servers are laggy and shooting can be a bother if you're hit by a lag spike. And I was killed once cause I got stuck in my buddy crawling on the ground. My character vibrated quickly and suddenly my healthbar was empty and the zone damaged me for the remaining 1%.The gameplay is choppy. PUBG doesn't care much for gpu it's more cpu dependent I think. I never checked the facts online so I'm not 100% sure. Going from PUBG to most other first person shooters will give a much better and fluid experience.But they're steadily releasing bugfixes and new content wich is good.And there are many funny moments in there if you can accept the bugs and glitches.So let's wait patiently til release date.

review: So PUBG (Player Unknown's Battlegrounds) is one of the most hyped games in the WORLD even in beta it can be better than many games. As every single thing there are positive and negative aspects in PUBG TOP 3 POSITIVE ASPECTS Variety. Most of the games are repetitive however PUBG is not one of them. In every game there are lots of possibilities and situations which makes PUBG a dynamic game influencing players to adapt themselves in each situation. Shooting and mechanical system. PUBG's Shooting system is the main atraction of the game so it had to be good and IT IS AWESOME! So satisfying and clean all hitboxes are basically perfect. PUBG's game mechanic is as awesome as the shooting system for those who don't know the game mechanic is what makes it different and authentic. I have played many FPS and Battle Royale games but no one has such a good system. In PUBG there are pans that can defend you from bullets there are scopes (2x 4x 8x red dot holographic ...) and there are so many tactic in each game which makes the game more difficult but also more dynamic. Graphic. One of the most important things in a game is the graphic. PUBG's graphic is amazing! The vegetation in general buildings texture and my prefered one the sea graphic makes us more excited to play it. Congrats to PUBG team the graphic is amazing! TOP 3 NEGATIVE ASPECTS Rendering problems. PUBG requires so much RAM for rendering the map. I have 12RAM and it still don't render perfectly most of the time. FPS.PUBG is not a game that everyone can play because it requires an awesome config but it's expensive too you guys could make some things softer like Vegetation in general make the texture a little bit more simple and things like that. (Create a graphic mode like that would be nice!) But the people who has an awesome config could keep playing in high graphics. Training. It's not a 100% negative point but a sugestion. You guys could create a training mode for those who can't shoot or adapt themselves to most of the game situations. (A game that if you die you instantly spawn again in a random place of the map or a place that you choose) RAM and RENDERING chart RAM Does it render well? 8 No. 12 It depends. 16+ Yes. Originally posted by stan /id/steamstansteam/ )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I really wanted to get into this game but after spending 16 hours I was left with very conflicting opinions. Before I begin I want to assure everyone I am trying to avoid completely bashing down this game as I am aware it is still an early access game and I know the game is subject to change. At this time however I cannot recommend it at this stage in development until I see some much needed changes.To begin I'll weigh in on my opinions about the game and underlie particular pros and cons. What made this game enjoyable for me and what makes it very disappointing and even unplayable. I'll start with the cons as this is a negative review.CONS TERRIBLE PHYSICS (Vaulting is coming soon to compensate for the bad physics but jumping may still be awkward after the change) EVERYONE IS A BULLET SPONGE!!! (Players often absorb 6+ shots to the body before they are killed while headshots are an instant kill. Seems fair enough but there is a bigger issue that needs to be addressed due to the reward which I'll mention later) ACCURACY GOES OUT THE WINDOW WHILE STRAFING!! (While in 3rd person the character their weapon and the reticle all remain static while strafing but weapon spray becomes astronomically unrealistically god awful while moving rendering you a useless shot. Will also mention later) INSTANT DEATH AFTER EXITING VEHICLES even when it's only going 5 mph GAME IS NOT OPTIMIZED BLOCKY UNTEXTURED BUILDINGS AFTER LANDING (Doesn't happen to everyone but plagues a lot of players. Also they cannot be entered until they load which leaves you out in the open.) PROS FPS BATTLE ROYALE GAMEPLAY MAP LAYOUT IS BALANCED VERY EXHILIRATING GAMEPLAY (The action is there. It's very heart pounding exciting and sometimes terrifying) RNG (Can be frustrating at times but every now and then you stumble across some lvl 3 gear immediately upon landing. Also it's a rush to loot everything before all the other players)As far as the headshot mechanic goes for being as brutal and rewarding as it is gives a huge advantage over other players that aim for the torso. Weapon accuracy is nearly 100% while standing still and something like 25% while strafing (obviously not fact checked but feels close to it) so when I try to avoid enemy fire by walking sideways I cannot aim at all and miss most if not all of my shots and the other player usually wins the encounter. If I stand still to fire accurately I become a silly pencil stick baiting for an easy headshot. At the end of the day this game leans heavily towards rewarding headshots clearly way more than realistically aiming for the torso. This is my biggest gripe!To wrap it all up I have a long history of playing FPS games like Battlefield Call of Duty Black Ops and even Delta Force (very nostalgic game for me) and when I play PUBG and am forced to abandon old habits like moving while gunning and shooting a sponge and not dying the game becomes very discouraging to play. I really want to see some more improvements in the following areas listed above. In the mean time I'll sit on this one for a while and keep checking back to see if any of these changes make its way into the woodworks so I can recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've played this game now beyond my refund period to try and understand why this game is popular. I thought it looked bad when it came out. However I bought it because I thought I must have been wrong considering how many people that play it. Nope my intuition was right.So I'm just gonna make a list of things that are just flat out bad (there are so many things that this review would be an essay if I went into any detail) Game objective and strategy Aiming bullet and hit mechanics (extremely important for a multiplayer FPS) Netcode interpolation and real time mechanics (extremely important for a multiplayer FPS) Character movement (extremely important for a multiplayer FPS) Progression Matchmaking User interface Art and graphics Performance Physics Community Anti cheatList of things that are good ???The fact that this game doesn't have any meta really says it all. The game design is just so bad that it's hard to find any interesting winning strategy. Basically it boils down to what random stituation you happened to be in once you encounter an enemy and 1 minute later one of you will be dead depending on that state.

review: The game is an amazing experience to play this is something you cant say often with Early Access games The dev team seems very passionate about their game and have openly stated how long the game will stay in the Early Access state (which is something you can say alot of Early Access games do *cough* DayZ *cough*. Overall in its current form the game is enjoyable yet due to being still in development it still has its proformance issues and bugs that are fixed every update might I say.I mainly wanted to post this review in light to all the negative ones being written complaining about the implimentation of the key system. Which despite what people are saying about broken promises which are arbitrary as it is a test of the system a completly optional addition and it supports the gamel. Not to mention the fact that these claims of broken promises are irrelivant in what world does a private developer need to adhere to a promise that they mentioned in one off conversations.

review: This game is so much fun but as of right now it is filled with nothing but cheaters. Mostly they are Chinese cheaters but there is the occasionally non chinese cheater. If they cannot deal with the cheaters like they haven't for quite a while now they need to region lock the servers to at least temporarily band aid the situation. Of course that means Chinese players will be absolutely screwed but at least it will somewhat help for the time being. Something needs to be done out of the last 5 games I have played 4 of them had deaths due to cheaters hackers auto aimers whatever you want to call them. They are going to be the downfall of this game. It has never been as bad as it is right now. I want to enjoy this game but dying in the final 2 because of a cheater is getting tiring. Just dying at all because of these cheaters is tiring.Yes this game is popular but everyone can only take so much before this game dies. It doesn't deserve to die because it is tons of fun but at this point they need to learn that they cannot just do nothing.

review: Sanhok map looks and feels amazing. I wish for a redesign of Miramar as I think that map needs more love. Erangel is good as is.Love the event pass although I would like to see the timed skins go. If you put in something make sure it's permanent. People will riot for this just so you know.Other than that the netcode and server performance needs a bit of love as well and would love to see that tweaked a bit more.Other than that the game is in a pretty good place at the moment with all things considered.I don't think that you can call this a 1.0 full release to be honest. It's a very solid Beta at most.Overall good fun and great for competitive peeps. I can recommend it but I also would exercise caution as it's not a finished product by far and you need to bear that in mind. It's currently on sale I believe it's a fair price for a 20 currently even at full price of 30.

review: I thought a game that sold so well would have a very decent server. PUBG proved me really wrong.There is a certain time everyday (around 10 p.m +8)that my friends call it a 'girl server period'. We have to keep refreshing the UI in order to connect to the server.What disgusts me is that BlueHole is not trying to fix this at all but selling 'The only official accelerator of the game' instead.Besides the server problem this is a game for cheaters.Imagine you looting for 15 minutes and then getting a head shot with a AKM from 1KM away.Self aiming is not the function that destroys this game. It's the function that allows you to see through walls.This gives cheaters a huge advantage and you wouldn't even know they are using hacks.I understand there are cheaters in every other game but I don't think Bluehole is doing a good job banning cheaters.For those of you considering buying this game I would recommend you buying a hack as well so that every player can be equal.

review: First off I got to say I love this game. Its diffrent from most games I play. Its a mix od DayZ H1Z1 Arma 3. I have over 150 hours on this game and I love the way matches are made up. Once a game ends you can jump right into a new match. There are many buggs that have been fixed.There are a few things that I hate such as there tends to be server lag and the servers do go down time to time. As well it takes about 2 seconds to get into a car/bike. There are also some issues with being able to jump over simple map objects. But all in all I would recomend this game for anyone whos looking to have fun looting gear and killing people.

review: Smh. One box that happens to cost a 2.5$ key made everyone just straight up jump on the trigger train cuz of a single broken promise It's saddening to see so many people bashing on the game so quickly without giving it a second thought. Does it affect actual gameplay? No. Does it Affect the actual experience you get with your friends and so on? No.So why do people jump on this trigger train as if a company breaking a few promises was a sin or some sh*t. Companies have done this before and sometimes for fair reasons too. All in all people are legit stuck in the past thinking that if one company fails others who does similar actions will go the exact same route. Cmon...People should stop being so sensitive and take action once it truly matters when actual foul play is at bay. Once they decide to legit do something VERY shady that's when I'll agree that it should be stopped. But until then Calm the f*ck down people. It's just a few cosmetics for crying out loud give the game a chance to grow to it's fullest before straight up bashing it to the ground.Anyway. Very fun game Definitely best enjoyed with friends but very decent when played solo as well. Hope there's a bunch of more content at launch. Until then 7/10. Very decent!EDIT Nvm it's trash kthnxbai D fix ur priorities and respect ur fanbase PlayerUnknown's BanningGrounds.

review: i used to think it's just steam in general because everytime PUBG patches my steam crashes. at first i thought this happens with every game but then i noticed this only happens with pubg.now i try to open the game my whole steam crashes and it says im in game.more than a year of development. full release and this game still has issues like this? no wonder fortnite which is a FREE GAME is taking over.i get it you USED to be an indie company but now you aren't. you also have massive amounts of sales. but then some of you would probably say "developing a game takes a long time". these people have more than a year to optimize this game and guess what? epic games had 2 months to develop fortnite. no not just the BR game of fortnite because the singleplayer was just finished 2 months before the BR game of fortnite. they also released the mobile version of PUBG so clearly they have the resources and time to optimize this game.either their devs are lazy dumb or they just clearly don't care. you can't blame unreal engine either because fortnite which is a well optimized game that's already in mobile is made from unreal as well.and before you say "you only have 20+ hours on the game". i'm reviewing the playability not the experience. the experience is fun but how am i able to play if it keeps crashing? optimize your sorry excuse of a game or better yet just make it free.

review: The game is great it appears very promising however DayZ looked like a great thing and it has ripped countless of people off for a game that is still in early access. No real development and they have taken millions of dollars from people who were expecting real time updates and bux fixes only to be screwed over for something that will never end up being finished. Hopefully this game does not end up like DayZ.There should be a clause in early access games that forbid them to factor in any additional money making activities until the game is out of early access and in its release cycle. Early access games should be forced to provide a release date within 12 18 months of being in early access.I am not a fan of paid crates or boxes or buying things unless its cosmetic additions only especially when the game is incomplete.When did society allow game developers to sell us games that in some cases never get finished or continue releasing DLC content which is really a cover for things that should have made the game at the release date? (Numerous developers are guilty of this).I would hope this game reaches a proper release without ripping those off who supported them in Early Access however I am not happy with the monetary system they are talking of bringing in. Finish the game then add anything you like on afterwards don't screw those who supported you.For now in its current state I will recommend it. Lets hope my opinion stays that way.

review: For the price of 30 euro you will get at least 80 hours of fun.Still thinking it might be fun after those 80 hours.After 90 hours just like in my case you might win a game. Yes I suck. But I have fun and I rage when I play this game. Other games has me sighing but I actually rage while playing this game sometimes. And having a game that makes me rage is fun for me since it means it is challenging. And this is challenging. The element of random combustion is one that I include here. Or crashing with a vehicle.Are there issues and bugs?Yes. But I'd like to remind you that this studio is also named after the game they developed. By that I also realize that this might be the first game of its kind they have developed. This is a big open world game where one or a team of up to 4 stands on the hill as winners. Or chicken dinners. Also known as Battle Royale. At the same time they are relatively fast in isolating issues with their patches. Compared to EA at least. And many big studios. I'm running on a soon 3 years old laptop. I'm running on Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 4720HQ CPU 2.60GHz (8 CPUs) 2.6GHz Memory 16384MB RAMNVIDIA GeForce GTX 960M with Display Memory 10168 MB Dedicated Memory 2019 MB Shared Memory 8148 MBAnd it's running on low on everything except textures and view distance that is on medium for a constant 30 60 fps. Yes it's bad but consider that its open world. After a recent update it started running a lot better than ever before.Playing this game solo is fun and quite challenging and it's you against 90+ others. Playing together with a friend using some kind of voice coms such as Discord is even more challenging. Coordinating where to look to shoot the same target at the same time as you try to listen to footsteps and movements outside is hard. But honestly it is way more worth it in terms of fun.

There seems to be an influx of them into the game right now and Blue Balls is too busy raking in the cash to give a In the last five games I've played two have had aim botters that have killed basically everyone at around the final 20 30. It's ridiculous watching the same person's name appear on the side of the screen killing six people in less than ten seconds.TL DR Tons of hackers and not enough anticheat being implemented.

review: This game is the definition of Battle Royale.Perfect mix of Military Simulator ish gameplay with a sprinkle of Arcady Type Modes found in some other games.Pros of this Game Has wonderful potential Very Active Development Very Good Communication towards Players Weapons with attachments Balanced Gameplay Fun and ThrillingCons of this Game Unresolved Bugs OptimizationThe Developers are actually listening to community/consumer feedback which is always a plus in my book and the fact that they are open with the progress of the future features they tease of us e.g Vaulting 3 New Vehicles Desert map etc another thing is that this game is really polished and fairly optimized from an early access game though there are occassional memory leaks and crashes but at least its far better than the launch/closed beta client a few months back. To sum this up this game is great if you have friends or if you dont have one you could make friends from randoms and or the great amount of discord servers dedicated for this game. For it's price its a far better experience compared to other 'active' early access titles.Would truly recommend this game to people who seek Thrilling and Suspense gameplay! Well done devs

review: I personally love this game and will continue to play it but I can't recommend any new players to buy this game. It's a prime example of poor business practices. The game has only come out of "Early access" as a gimmick so it would shine ahead of the other games yet it functions and plays like an incomplete game. I refuse to believe 1.0 is a "finished product". The game is slow the loot system is horrible and the servers are the worst in any battle royale game. It runs pretty well but has slight hiccups during gameplay and the beginning of games are rubber band fests. Personally I'd give this game more time. It's DEFINITELY better than a good chunk of its competition but it has an undeserved stigma attached to it just because "everyone plays it". We can't be blinded by mob mentality. Just because your friend group owns it doesn't make it perfect. Game is great! I'd recommend it if the game wasn't a buggy mess. But now that it's "final release" something tells me the servers are here to stay.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Id like to warn anyone considering purchasing this game that this company has weekly updates at 10pm EST for about 3 hours followed by a 2 10GB update. This is consistent for every week ive owned this game. I can only speak to my own personal experience but ive never played any game that has had weekly server matenence during peak game play hours. Seems pretty careless (esp. considering the US is a large fraction of the gamers playing). I get it we arent all in the us. Sure. but why not meet in the middle. Do the update in the morning instead of the evening. The gameplay is not incredibly consistent. The game itself glitches in odd ways. Sometimes you cant jump from the plane sometimes you cant hear anyones mic's sometimes you cant see your crosshair when you ADS. Sometimes your shots dont register. Sometimes you shoot a guy 4 times and hes fine. Sometimes you are driving and all a sudden you are dead because there was a "wall" there. For some reason you can "hit" people if they are standing next to the side of a car...? The actual game play itself review Spawn time is too long and doesnt reward any kind of fast paced game play style. The community of players is toxic. Most players camp for the entire game. The game play seems to reward this kind of behavior. With the addition of new items the game is starting to feel like it has too many things in it. As said in above paragraph the game is rather glitchy. They even tried introducing special events yet they dont do them consistently and some of them are just not fun at all. The loot crates are pretty dumb and people who buy the clothes in this game is insane for spending money on virtual cosmetics that get covered up by the neccesary game items. If it was free id recommend it. Im going to keep playing. Perhaps i should just buy arma. I dont know. But i wouldnt recommend you spending the money on it if you are debating between this and something else.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've heard of many people saying that hackers are around every corner in this game. So far i haven't seen anyone. I know that there are some hackers out there but some people just can't accept that some players are more skilled than them. If you haven't bought this game yet i can understand. Sometimes you do rage AF. But at the same time that's what makes this game so awesome. It's not a game where you win every round. It takes some skill to win. I'd say you should buy this. If you aren't a person who rages every minut then you'll like this game. Because of the fact that many people actualle put time into this i'd say you should buy it. GL to all of you who already own the game.

review: Holy Hell......Look i know this is early access. I know it has a small dev team. To say that this game runs bad is like saying a large sandpaper rapped cucumber in the rearend might hurt a little. This game feels like it was optimized by adolescents high on meth. I had high hopes for this game in the Beta it ran ehh okay. I have a top of the line PC. I play all games including all Vive games on ultra all the time. This game has a gimpy hamsters at the wheels of a lamborghini aventador and it's crashing off a mile high cliff. I don't even think i will keep this installed for future updates.Do not waste the cash on the hype. Maybe a year from now..I am just saying how i feel from one person who has played games for 20+ years.

review: I spawn in with nothing but a pistol some guy rushes me I shoot him 12 times with a pistol he shoots me once with a shotgun and puts me down to 50HP. He then rushes me with an AK I shoot him 4 more times and then he kills me?? This isn't a game of skill it's only a game of luck. Don't buy this game for this price waste of money. The game also like to lag a lot not FPS but servers and there's a lot of glitches when riding in cars. You will also find that you either land and die to someone who has better loot than you by pure chance OR you spend the whole game looting and running only to die to someone that is camping in a house or on a hill. There's no skill in this game just luck and camping. It's like a worse Call of Duty dethmatch. I can honestly say that H1Z1 was less B******T than this game.

review: I love LOVE this game.....But they really need to region lock these damn servers. Im tired of people coming into NA servers from other countries and making the game experience lag. Oh and you know their ability to shoot through damn walls and teleport in and out of buildings. It really makes us (my husband and I) not want to play this game anymore. And there has been ACTUAL harassment from these foreigners but since i cant see their names or who is talking i cant do anything about it. Have had several gloating about being in a NA server just so they could get wins and things up for "American B itches" and wish they could kill us for real (not joking they actually said this). So until the Devs get their heads out of their asses and stop messing with these damn "paying for cosmetics" t and actually fix the game bugs and do what needs to be done with region locking i wont be playing this game very much. If things get better i will change my review. But as of now i will not recommend this game.

review: Player unknown s Battlegrounds is one of the most disappointing first/third person shooter experiences I ve ever had. There are elements in the game that work really well like the map and its diversity The ability to play a battle royal game in groups and the way you gather loot. But there are so many holes in this game on every parameter that you sit back amazed that they held a tournament on Twitch when the game is so broken. One of the first things you notice is that the shooting and general weapon mechanics don t work. Unless you have at least a 8 times scope then you ain t hitting where you aim no matter the distance. Pistols the VSS the Saiga 12 shotgun and the SCAR L without a modded sight are completely useless. The SCAR L because the Iron sights don t work in any way and the Pistols and the VSS because they don t do any damage. The VSS is for some reason chambered in 9mm parabellum like the UMP and the UZI but does the same damage as the Beretta 92fs. A VSS is in reality chambered in 9x39 which is closer to a .50 BMG round but ingame it s beyond useless. The Colt 1911 does less damage then the 92FS which makes no sense and weapons firing the same caliber do different damage. The AK47 Kar98 and M24 fire the same caliber ingame bur fire totally different rounds in real life and they don t do the same damage ingame for some reason although firing the same caliber. THe weather in game is the worst I ve ever seen. If it s raining you can t hear a car drive right by you because the rain sounds like a Immortal concert and the fog makes it impossible to see more than 5 meters in front of you unless you have a good scope. After release of the beta there were a ton of cheaters and there s still the problem that if you turn down the graphics in game grass and bushes disappear in the distance so you can see people lying down in the grass 500 meters in front of you without aiming. How the loot is spread out across the map is . You can find lvl 3 gear in one house and multiple weapons of high caliber with attachments all over the plays in one house and other times entire towns have nothing other than pistols and lvl helmets! Players land at a spot and get lucky and that s what this game is all about . Luck. On top of all that the sound of gunshots and when you take damage is the worst I ve ever heard. You can t here where a guy is shooting from no matter how close he is to you. The sound of the shot bounces of every grass straw and tree and all you can do is run for cover and if you get hit you have a seizure and tinnitus because the sound of you getting hit is like to iron skillets smashing together next to your ear and a moan on full volume from your character. There is zero satisfaction in playing the game if you don t win because of all these stupid features. There is almost no skill involved in this game because you can t win with loot and you know there are players who have looted one house and they ve gotten all the goods they want and are camping in the middle of the zone waiting for you! Ohhh and I almost forgot the melee weapon the pan can block .300 winchester rounds .. A ing pan! And we re still waiting for the vaulting mechanic to be put in the game so that we can jump over 30 centimeter high fences!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After playing this game for 1400 hrs between my two accounts and earned a fair amount stocking skrits I would say for me this is a good game. But before you get this game here's a check list for you to complete before buying the game Is this game listed below 20 dollars(I got mine for 15 in April and have seen a few price drops since)?Are you DMG+ in CSGO?Do you have a 970/1060 or better Nvidia GPU?Do you have 16G ram?Do you have a 144Hz/165Hz monitor?Have you played H1Z1/ARMA3 before and wouldn't tilt if you encounter cheaters 5 games in a roll?Do you have steam friends with decent mic that will play Duo/Squad with you using Discord?If all the answer is yes then I have confidence that you will very much enjoy this epic game. There's a play style for everyone. Now whenever I hear gunshots I run towards them the best way to get loot/kill fast and win the game IMO. Don't hide like a chicken and die with no kill you won't enjoy the game.

review: My PUBG experience.Load in to the islandTry to talk to friends/squadToo much noise Ctrl+mGo to plane and unmute master volumePlane is too loud. Mute volume againDrop off to a place. unmute volumeFree fall sound is too loud. Mute volumeFinally land. Can unmute volumeGet some guns.Kill some people.End up in a good ranking./Die by motor bikeDieRepeatWin a Chicken dinnerPLAYERUNKOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a really great and exciting game. I think about all the thrill and the possiblities that could happen in this game. It's future is bright if the devs do good. Pretty much the game is a game with no limits to be added like different modes and different items.This is why I recommend it. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATLLEGROUNDS is a game that tests your Decision making positioning tactical combat calculation and aim. I have to say that PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS has more to come with lots to enjoy at the momentAnd It's worth the price to pay for in my opinion

review: Even though PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds is still in Early Access it s already a groundbreaking online shooter. Each game starts the same way but its remarkable ability to feel like a fresh new adventure every round has kept me coming back for hours on end. It manages to approach the Battle Royale style death match made popular by games like DayZ with relative simplicity without sacrificing the essence of the hardcore survival sim creating a tight focused and no frills experience that places it leagues above the competition.Battlegrounds wastes no time putting you right in the middle of the action as up to 100 players join a server and pick their moment to jump out of a plane and parachute onto a large 8x8 km island. Even this first act is a critical decision and must be part of your strategy jumping early lets you hit the ground first giving you a jump on the competition but may also place you farther from the center of the arena where the fighting must inevitably funnel towards. Jumping late might give you some distance from other players giving you some early breathing room before entering the fray. Jumping right into the center especially in large cities where most players drop will place you right in the middle of the action.

review: Lets be honest. PUBG's hitreg has problems alright but that is a rare accasion. People will blame hitreg for the game trying to center a single ping instead of both players in the fight having 2 different pings. The game is actually doing it's job and tbh doing it well considering 90% of the player base is either in china or across the country from the pubg NA server itself. PUBG's server lag is different it's pretty bad but overall is a pretty good game and can be flukey at times and you will "look" like you just got shot around a corner when really it's just what the enemy see's not what you see. So please don't be cancer and just blame lag because it's "mostly" not the games fault and your just a bad player. Also don't say its bad when you only have 150 hrs because you have no where near enough hours to be able to judge a game. It's good has its flaws and will fix them when they can. Also hard to run unless you have dual 1080s or 1 ti. make note of that people with bad computers.

review: The game sucks. And I will tell you exactly why. The gameplay itself isn't bad. It's the engine that is garbage. I have a pretty decent PC (check profile for specifics) and this game is almost unplayable if you don't have a system with 16GB of RAM or over. If it doesn't all of the buildings will not load in for a decent amount of time. I'd say about 5 15 minutes. And that can be HUGE because need loot. And you can grab guns but it takes awhile to get them in your inventory. And if you want the game wait until it comes out of early access because by then the engine will hopefully be optimized by then. If not then these people are lazy and money s. Before buying this game make sure your PC is better than the recommended specs.

review: This game is good too good. If I say what is good at PUBG I will just be repeating countless players writing reviews for this game. However what will be the only different thing at this is how PUBG on a potato PC.Here is my gaming experience every game.1. Go to matchmaking(45 fps)2. Meet your enemies at match start(30 fps)3. Ride the plane(12 fps)4. Parachute down(4 fps)5. Wait 2 minute tops to be able to enter buildings(1 fps)6. If game is playable then it is the only time to scavenge(20 fps top)7. Play until you die(17 fps)The only thing that's making me give this game a thumbs up is the hope that this will be fixed.Just remember PUBG not everyone who enjoys your game is as affluent as other gamers.But still I like the game. And I hope you will optimize this game to befit such computers like mine.

review: Great! Finally I rebooted my windows...after some weeks. Game just frooze to death.The game should be called UNPLAYEABLE'S BATTLEGROUND. It has zero optimization. Despite the fact that it lags in ALL matches (no I don't have a bad internet connection) the textures takes time to load after landing I couldn't do anything sit and wait for eternity. From the 2.7h registered I could REALLY play about 30min (maximum). So yes this game has zero optimization (EVEN ON THE LOWEST GRAPHIC SETTINGS). The concept of the game is interesting but this developer is just an amauter in game developing. I hope a serious developer take the same idea and release something that can be called a game.Did you notice that it is early access? Obviously I did I just didn't expect that I'd need a XEON latest CPU or an Core I9 with 64gb to play this game.Ok thanks Steam I can ask for refund.

review: I mean yeah it had a good start but then the game started to get less popular. Bugs started happening more often and people were tired of getting 0 content (other then a few guns)When first person was added everyones was like "Finally a solution to camping" but it made camping worse which overall made the game worse. This added with the poor hitreg and poor server issues made the game start to die out. You can hit a guy twice in the head with the sniper and he wouldnt die you would see blood and you'd think you have a kill but he somehow 1 taps you with an m4. Dont get me wrong this game was amazing the bugs in it weren't even that bad but after 300 hours and alot of bugs which were added because of the new content just made it die for me personally.Once the new maps come out i guess this game might get a second chance but atm its just a money grabQUICK EDITPeople are complaining that the game is unoptimized but how can you optimize a game which isnt finished? This is the only thing which i will back this game up on otherwise it just gets boring...

review: This is an awesome game and I really do recommend you buy it. There's many pros and cons to this game however.Pros It's a fun game but challenging and if you're that kind of gamer that loves challenges and PVP this game will defintely suit you. It's not pay to win usually a lot of games are and this game is totally fair (Mainly because it's a battle royal game). To be quite honest there are as many pros as you make it. The satisfactory of winning your first game whether it'd be a solo duo or a squad the feeling is amazing and it still stays intense so it will definitely keep you entertained for a while.Cons This is not bashing anyone this will only be constructive criticism. Many of you that are thinking about buying this game you probably heard of the devs I myself do not know all about this but from what I hear the devs sort of favortise the streamers and make outright bans. (Again I'm not bashing anyone because the game is still awesome). The game is really frusterating even the best of players cannot win every single time so if you're a player that usually gets frusterated easily then it's time to tough it out. Optimization it's an early access game so of course they're going to work on more major stuff so I'd suggest for now that you might want to get some good specs and if you don't then you might want to wait a bit before you get those better specs (I have a GTX 1050 TI 4gb and I average around 50 60 frames but it doesn't feel as fluent).You definitely have to try this game out and when you do believe me you will not doubt it anymore!

review: I haven't had many playing hours before this review but there's a few things to point out.Still needs a bit more content(more maps visuals items) and a huge improvement on graphics. UE4 is great but the whole graphics and texture feels like playing a 10 year old game. Not to mention that it's still power hungry since it has not been optimized yet.I am still recommending it to everybody as the game is still in it's early stages and there is room/time for improvements. The overall experience is still great. Whether you like to be playing solo or in a group you will definitely find it fun and challenging from time to time.I will edit this review later when updates are rolling out.
