review: There are plenty of stuff wrong with this game such as Connection issuesRng loot will make you loseRng circle will make you lose 9/10 timesSound effectsRarity of vehicles (Seriously the major cities should have more then one or two vehicles.)A game which rewards you for playing on lower graphics setting (Setting foilage to low so tactical players cant take cover in bushes or tall grass)Jumping over anything takes one or two tries most of the time No campain. Regardless of the genre a game without a campaign or story of any kind is like a half a game. This problem is made all the more worse when you take into account the second issue. The the biggest sin of all for a survival shooter the shooting mechanics are terrible and not fun. Especially for beginners. Because of how wonky and unfriendly the shooting is in this game without a campaign or way to practice the only way to get better is the 3 or 4 seconds one will encounter in combat. For veterans who are already use to the system they dont care but starting out in this game is fustrating for many and many do quit because of this. Enough about the game's faults though. Here is the real reason you shouldn't buy this game. Back in the day a game in BETA was free. It was a small window where you could play a small portion of the game for FREE for a LIMITED TIME. Now however people have been suckered into buying games because steam labels them as Early Access. Call it whatever you want but at the end of the day you are paying for a game that is not complete and may never be finished. Complain about the bugs in the game and the devs just grin and say "What do you expect it's still early access." They of course say this while they are fanning themselves with your money. When they finally can be bothered to work on the game they patched in micro transactions so they could make even more money. Its no big surprise that companies only care about money but it would be nice for a change for a company to be honest and make a fully polished bug tested game before selling it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: BUYER BEWAREUntil more is done to optimize this game the listed minimum specs cannot be trusted and in a game like this that is very important.Running with specs beyond the listed minimum but running things at the lowest possible settings I still encounter terrible dips in framerate and slow rendering which is damning to gameplay. Trying to enter a house is difficult when it refuses to load looking like a solid brick of splotched playdough with no doors.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So let's be honest and straight forward Don't buy this game until the situation has improved.The core gameplay idea is nothing too new considering it's been taken from other games in the first place and lots of similar games are popping up all over the videogame landscape at the moment but that's how the business is at the moment nothing new nothing we consider bad anymore anyway. While PUBG brings some interrestings concepts together and was fun to play for as long as it lasted the negative arguments against the game outrunned the positive ones rather quickly. It didn't matter if we ended the round top 10 or top 50 frustration was all that was left after each and every game.Why? For several reasons. I've shortened the list to the most severe aspects for a good start Don't expect to be good at this game if you don't have a very good aim. You either have to step up to the skills of others very quickly or you will end up as canon fooder in literally every round. For at least that's one aspect I like Aiming helps you step up to the better loot of your enemies and with a good shot even an inferior situation can potentially be turned into a win. The map is brutally underdeveloped. While it at least doesn't feel too generated it has been put together with little to no effort feels absolutely loveless in design and when you come across a stone wall that floats more than 30 centimeters above ground you can even see the lack of effort that has been put into the map. But luckily the devs are up to the challenge and will bring up even more unpolished and unfinished maps. Sad to mention that these issues could be fixed in a week or maximum two weeks of map design if someone really wanted to. Just aim for the head. Going for a solid body shot has literally no value in this game. If you waste 29 of 30 bullets for one headshot you will win nontheless. Worried about missing your shots cause your enemy hits you in your belly while you aim for his head? No worries your character doesn't even flinch when being hit in the neck or arm your weapon stays steady in every situation for as long as you don't flinch yourself at least. Anyways a lucky headshot will always do more damage than 5 solid shots in the body always. And that's what makes this game so ridiculous. Not even does a single headshot (or two not that it matters as bullets seem to seek out for heads anyway) takes you out directly even if the enemy doesn't hit you in your head directly you have no chance of knowing where he is in more than half of the situations. Why you ask? Cause your character is painless! Remember? He doesn't flinch. Cause he doesn't know where the bullet hit him. And why? Cause the community thinks that 'hit markers' that point in the direction where your body hurts is 'casual' and makes the game 'too unrealistic'. While we're talking about realism. This game blantly tries to claim to be a realisitc battle simulator and while we better not talk about the concept of a giant energy wall that kills everything that is behint it slowly and painfully and that moves over the map in semi random circles (we'll get to that later) there are a lot of things that couldn't spit on the word "realism" more than a 'hit indicator' would do. Naming some of them No Stamina &gt Infinite Sprinting Infinite Jumping. No exhaustion &gt Aim steady even while jumping. No flinching &gt Cause no one cares about being shot anyway. 'Full' fuel tanks last for about 2 minutes &gt Feels like we're powering electric cars with fuel and wonder why they don't drive. Godzilla Footsteps &gt Cause everyone can hear you walking through five stone walls. Infinite revives in squad mode &gt cause headshots don't hurt that much if your buddy is around right? And many more features like that. The wall basically spoken this is a mechanism that aims to draw the players together. The circle randomly spawns when all players have landed and reduces its radius at intervals. Everyone that stays outside the circle will receive continous damage that increases each time the circle has reached its new position. Where does the circle spawn? That's absolutely random. Will there be a player perfectly in the circle waiting for you? You bet there wil be. While that is at least a situation you can be sure of you can't be of the actual circle position. At least 50% of the time you will find yourself at the most distant point possible of the circle and you will be constantly running for 10 minutes straight in order not to die to the stupid wall that is most of the time faster than you can run anyway. So if you have no vehicle (which spawn so rarely that you can consider yourself lucky if you find one but ironically won't stop spawning once you have one) you're as good as dead anyway unless you have a ton of medkits with you. Loot Is Deal with it. Loot boxes Lets not talk about the concept of an early access title with real world loot boxes trying to get a glimpse on what market counter strike owns there and what money values flow around there. It's just a cheap attept to make even more money than they already do by selling copies of the game. Blantly spoken the 'cost for their gamescom tournament' is just a cheap excuse. Cheaters Tons of. Starting with anti recoil macros for logitech mices which are capable of nullifying your recoil for every assault rifle and submachine gun (and are ironically not banned from usage) over people simply deleting textures to see transparency instead of black textures (and therefore can just strip the game of grass and brushes and the like) and stuff like player outlining names of drops and players showing all over the map etc. etc. Horrible. Oh... and did I mention that you have to turn 'foilage' down to not think you're hiding in knee tall grass while everyone else can clearly see you resting on a plain dirt texture? The client bugs out 9/10 times preventing you from queueing up opening loot boxes changing your loadout seeing your stats and at least one crash in 2 play hours.While it would be generally okay that there's still a lot left to work on considering this game claims to still be early access and tons of client bugs substantiate that claim very strongly the devs are just pumping in content and ignore the most urgent and most annoying bugs and circumstances that would need treatment as soon as possible. But lets be honest with ourselfes as long as developers keep pumping 'new content for free' we don't even ask about such fixes anyway right? Cause they're doing 'so much for us already'. So we kinda create that mischief ourselfes. I'd say give this game a year or two until it is polished up and ready to hit the shelves but until then the hype will be over anyway and people will have moved on to a different game. So buy it if you're willing to jump the hype train and throw money out of the window but don't expect it to be worth it.

review: i was on the edge whether to get this game or not as i didnt know if my rig would run it. (gtx 970 old 2nd or 3rd gen i7 3.4ghz 16 ram) as i struggled with arma 3. I decided to give it ago and it runs fine only thing turned right down is shadows evrything else is on high and i get 70 80 open areas with smaller buildings etc and it drops to anywhere between 40 60 in built up cities etc which im fine with aslong as i can see people moving and i can shoot them its good enough for me. If you can run it i would say go right ahead and spend the money its a great game weather you play it alone or with a group of friends even duos is great. As soon as you jump out the plane (your choice where) your heart rate jumps up and the adrenaline kicks in. If you land next someone find anything to kill the person with even if its a frying pan just get a weapon before them. Play it how you like go all guns blazing if you want but with out a silencer you are more than likely going to do die and get shot from across a field. Or stalk your enemy and take them by suprise work with your team and surround the enemy in a barn and they wont know whats hit them. In total i have been playing for 30 hours which is nothing really but its took me this long to finally win a solo ( heart rate was well over 100 at the time acording to my fitbit) and managed to win a group game aswell. Every kill is satisfying and feels hard earned even if i dont win or get in the top 10 aslong as i get atleast one kill im happy. Dont waste any more time go and buy the game.

review: This game is by far possibly the best battle royale game out in the market. However I'll keep my opinion short. It lacks really core things. First of all close combat fights are a joke. You literally pray to the RNG god on who's bullet will be registered on the server side. Second the game officially got released with most of its major bugs that were know since day one like car collision and item grabbing. Finally maybe the most important thing is THIS GAME IS A WASTE OF TIME. I mean it for real not to bash on it. The amount of time you'll spend on finding a match waiting for the player ready time waiting for the plane to get to your possibly most wanted location drop of free fall land find a gun and get into the action. If you are short on time or want to experience fast shooting and killing atmosphere this game is not it. IT IS A WASTE OF TIME. You'll spend all that time I listed above just to possibly get killed because you weren't LUCKY enough to find a gun OR got your gears BUT the game favors random people and you'll spend your time AUTO RUNNING to catch up to the safe zone only to waste your meds on rehealing and getting duck hunted by someone who had the favor of safe zone.Buy and only play this game if you are really in desperate need of wasting your time by playing a game. But get ready to see the menu screen and the plane. Oh here is a final tip Ctrl + M mutes the game sounds. You'll need it during the plane and free fall section.

review: enjoy this chicken stir fry recpie Serves 4 10 mins to prepare and 10 mins to cook 325 calories / serving HealthyINGREDIENTS 1 orange zested and juiced 2tbsp soy sauce 2tbsp sesame oil 250g (8oz) tender stem broccoli 5cm (2in) piece root ginger 1tbsp sunflower oil 1 garlic clove finely sliced 1 red pepper deseeded and thinly sliced 150g Straight To Wok Noodles 400g (13oz) chicken fillet cut into thin slicesMETHODStep 1 Mix together the orange zest and juice soy sauce and sesame oil and set aside.Step 2 Blanch the broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes then drain well and set aside.Step 3 Finely shred the ginger. Then heat a large frying pan or wok add the sunflower oil heat it until sizzling and fry the ginger till it's crisp.Step 4 When it's done remove with a slotted spoon. Add the chicken and garlic and stir fry until just browned. Remove the meat using a slotted spoon and set aside.Step 5 Add the red pepper and broccoli and stir fry for around 2 3 minutes until it's just tender. Add the soy sauce mixture bring it to the boil then return the chicken to the pan

review: 50 hours in this game (and counting) not even rocket league or CSGO can cure this addiction. Better rage simulator than CSGO or Dota 2. Better "China numba wan" simulator than H1Z1. Better hacking simulator than Watch Dogs or Mr. Robot. Better "unoptimized" simulator than Batman Arkham Knight. Better salty simulator than the Dead Sea. (BUT STILL 1.5 MILLION players in game at any given time.) Toxic enough to my new insect killer. Better language learning simulator than Rosetta Stone. Better crate opening simulator than CSGO. Best "find hitbox" simulator out there period. You also get to choose from a decently large number of servers.Choose a China to play in 1.) Central Asian China2.) South east Asian China3.) European China4.) Oceania Pacific China5.) North American China6.) South American ChinaWhat I learned from this game China numba wan You can die jumping out of a car going at 2mph. Taiwan numba wan. Shroud is better than DrDisRespect. You spend 20 minutes looting just to get headshot by LinHangWuei from 2 miles away with a ING FRYING PAN. Cheats still dominate the game even after 9277372 patches of 26.2 MB each and three different anti cheat systems. Your computer dies before your character. Your skill level is directly proportional to the amount of paint you have on your gun the number of banana stickers and how well clothed you are. Logic Level Undefined. Played this game. Ruined my life. Told my friends. Ruined theirs too. Dank game 69/10 would play again.

review: With its current price tag this game has a lot of development required before it should be recommended.Firstly remove the stupid in game price to change your basic appearance thats pretty pathetic.Secondly optimize this game after every patch since the price requires it Movement is quite awkward doors are too slow to open if your running its difficult to to interact with a lot of things such as collecting a weapon etc.Game resolution appears downscaled with a horrible post process effect which reduces the visual fidelity of the game further.The sound mix needs revision too as currently footsteps are quite hard to hear with terrible immersion..So performance graphic fidelity and soundmix require work and by that I mean a lot of work you set the bar very high for yourselves with a price your price tag.Thirdly from what I can tell there is no in game reporting feature and no in game punishment feautures Me and two friends played the "Squad" mode where it placed us with a random person as that game mode requires 4 people thats fine but after talking to him to regroup with us he comes shoots and kills us all with no kick?Now that little check isn't hard to implement it wouldn't be more than 12 lines of code at max (including the client.disconnect handling too!)A community without a voice and without some control only further places extra pressure on yourself the development team.However what's more worrying than most is that the impression I have of the game is that it's current development roster involves either a single person or less than 5 amateurs.Personal opinion I enjoyed 2 games before it was boring as the sense of immersion was constantly disengaged thanks to the lack of kinetic gameplay and disinteresting soundscapes. The quality of play is quite bad.I know this is an early access game but focus is on making money rather than a quality game why's that?Answer High pricetag smaller playerbaseSmaller playerbase less demographics for improvementLess demographics pointless early access.A pointless early access which is nothing more than a safetynet while you cashgrab and ditch the game.We will see but right now if you want a few rounds of a Battle Royal game download Last Man Standing as its free and can easily satisfy your want for now.TL DRPrice is too highBad quality gameplayBad performance tweaksNo community focusNo in game punishement / penalty systemDeveloper focus is money over production.This is my accurate opinion.The game can be fun they just don't care or at least don't show they care.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: People are crying about bad optimization. Welcome to 2017 soon 2018... if you have a wooden pc I can confirm playing this game must be crappy. However I must admit the optimization can be better but it's actually playable as long as your pc contains quite new stuff and I don't mean having a gtx 1080 or what ever. I have read reviews of players having 'fps lagg' while they have better than me in their pc (Probably lying kids to look cool) But I'm running this game on ultra except for two options these are on high. And it's pretty smooth no sign of 'fps lagg'. And yes.. lately the servers are lagging in the beginning of a match. Still playable in my opinion once you're on the ground there's a moment of annoying laggs but after half a minute till a minute the lagg is most likely gone. I have no idea if this only applies to me. Have fun

review: Product received for free. Last time the game was just badly optimized and buggy but despite the flaws it was forgivable.The player base believed that they would fix the problems and all would be fine.But they never fixed the hacker problem letting cheaters from China run rampant.They refused to region lock China which is responsible for a majority of hackers.They removed the ability to trade items because they couldn't stand the thought of players earning cash from trading.And now they're charging players who have already bought the game to pay for an event pass.And the worst thing is game breaking bugs still exist random fps drops still occur players are disconnected from servers mid game for no good reason whatsoever. It is evident the devs no longer care about the player base. Their primary goal is to earn as much as they could with this game before jumping ship.If you've bought this game for full price or a discounted price you have my condolences. If you haven't bought the game don't bother. The devs will most likely make it free to play before next year ends to maintain their player base.

review: at 107.6hrs i can say this game has proven itself to be an awesome addition to my gaming collection. Other games that have played similarly turned me off the Battle Royal style game. When i saw this take off i thought i would give the game type another chance and i am not disappointed.the gameplay is awesome i love the new First Person mode they put in. I enjoy that FPP and 3rdPP are seperate. The looting system is decent and the customization is good too. The spawning of vehicles and weapons is random enough that you can get screwed pretty hard but you dont get screwed too often keeping the game fun. Ihope to see new maps soon as people have figured out where the best spawning locations are now. This game almost plays like a full release and we are still in early access. totally worth trying this game.

review: It's popular. It's entertaining. It's rewarding Is it worth 26.99? No not in its current state. I have experienced minimal bugs that isn't the issue but the current lack of variety and it being in early access renders it not worth even 20 maybe 15. When it comes out of early access and is a fully realised game then it may be worth nearer the price it currently is. I will still recommend it despite the disagreement over price however as I feel the game is a neccessary asset to any modern steam library especially if your friends are playing it.

review: I LOVE WIENERS!!!!! &gt (Serious post please read on)Ok now listen up this is a serious post and i wan't people to see it so upvote it or however it works if you wan't my wiener because i feel like this is my first review on a game ever anyway.Im getting so sick of all these negative reviews on this game is it because there negative and that im a fanboy? no.It's because everytime i check the reviews on this game theres more and more negative ones and to make it worse there all just complaining about being banned for trolling streamers.Before i get to the stream bans let me give you my full review on this game.Do i recommend this game? Of course it's alot of fun you can tell because i have over 100 hours and i play it atleast once a day. i see people say this alot latley but no im not a dev kiss i personally enjoy this game 100%.I have never wrote a review before so im just going to do this cons and pros thing. PROS *Good Graphics*Fun looting system (to me anyway)*Gun fight's feel nice and feel smooth (once again for me not sure for others)*Gun's feel realistic and bullet drop seems normal*Car physics are great to me*Easy and simple controls*MORE COMING SOON (maybe) CONS *Yes graphics are nice and all but the game isnt that well optimozed? I can't really say because i don't know how to optimize a game so i have no say in the matter.*There seem to be quite alot of bugs from what people say i personally never see these bugs but it is early access so there sure to be fixed*MORE COMING SOON (Tell me what i missed because i can't really thing of more right now)i also forgot to mention there were alot of negative reviews on this game about micro transactions.I feel like this reviews should not be getting upvoted it's so bloody stupid. There all personaly reviews just complaining about it when it effects the game 0%. When microtransactions came out i just completely ignored the update because i didn't care i don't understand what people are complaining about THERE COSMETICS.Now to end this post with the banned reviews.1. Theres never any proof they were banned and someone pointed out that this guy played the game this week after claiming he was banned.2. There is a 50/50 chance you could of been banned by the devs for trolling but come on... be honest.3. They all just happened to run into very popular streamers you say you werent trolling but how do we know you didn't do it twice i don't know how stream sniping works and if its easy but lets say you wernt stream sniping.And in the 1 out of 100 chance you got in a game with a streamer how did you know it was a streamer?and out of all the people you honk your horn at it's a popular streamers and last did you hold down the honk button around him untill you died? otherwise how did they know who you were and reported you. plus they wouldnt ban you after 1 time. My review on horns I also wan't to give you my review for horns alot of people say why even add horns when you knew people would troll with it and that there useless for me thats not true. USES *Hold down the honk outside of buildings people are in and while they have there attention on you trying to find you someone could sneak in and kill them*If you don't have a mic or do idc you could do two quick honks at your team letting them know you wan't to go )*Driving can be boring so it's fun yaknow*MORE COMING SOONAnyway end of review sorry for it being so long i like to type and writing this review was fun.

review: Ok well after 132 hours total played so far on this game i still am absolutely in love. Even with it being early access and having bugs and crashing here and there not often mind you this game has brought me more laughter and fun than any game has in a very long time. Yes you drop into a map and try and kill other people over and over and over again but it is NEVER the same any round. Some of the hilarity in the game really makes it shine. I personally only play in FPP as I feel 3rd person is for people who need the camera gimp and it also feels 100x more realistic. Overall this is the best game on steam marketplace right now in my personal opinion. 10/10 would buy again 10/10 would reccoment to a friend 10/10 go ing buy this D

review: Well this is kinda stunning i think this is one of the best Battle Royale Currently out on market.you've got three pistols three shotguns five assault rifle's two light smg's two heavy smg's and three sniper rifle's. its not much to go on but you are actually able to customize them. like put a red dot or a holographic sight. Or why not a silincer on a sniper riflle. They wont even know what hit them!The combatmechanic are way more accurate compared to other Battle Royale's gamesfor instance a double barrel shotgun kills you in close range no matter if you've got the best armor or is amazing shot with assault rifle's. you will drop dead on the floor.you can adjust the bullet drop on the assault rifles I haven't had the fortune to have a sniper to try it out yet but i can say it about assault rifles. (to do that you need a customizable scope)its a bit hard to spot others unless they are moving around feels a bit like "arma3". The map is huge and there are alot of space to hide on.so you could either play full tactical or you just could set up ambushes.Another good thing you cant jump out of the moving vehicles and one tap people You have to slow down or almost stop before jumping out unless you want to die.like in other games don't mind me i am just going 110 on the road ow a person jump out and boom headshot. dosent work That way. its way more hardcore!you can choose your spawn location or where you want to drop so if you've got a friend with a slow pc You could give him extra seconds before jumping out of plane.on the negative part i have had some fps drop's and some server intability when the game was a bit laggy first 5 minutes but hey its still early acces and That stuff was expected.an improvement I would like to see set two different communication channels one for proximity chat and one radio for the group. Currently you talk in both which is not that good for a full tactical play. but i assume most players use third party communication while playing with friends so its not an issue!This game is worth every single penny I spent! Get It &amp let's team up. i see you on the island )

review: This game is full of hackers lots of game breaking glitches for example I have been killed in the top 10 many times simply because my gun wont shoot full ammo just a regular M416 and when I left click the majority of the time nothing happens my gun won't fire and I end up getting killed because of it. There is no reason to want to play the game when you simply CAN NOT shoot you're gun to defend/attack its game breaking. And again the amount of hackers/cheaters in the game is insane Also the massive problem of people living in Asia joining NA servers constantly and then they have an instant advantage because they are so laggy they are impossible to shoot at and actually land a shot before they spin around and kill you through a wall and its rare to join squad mode on an NA servers and actually have english speaking team mates huge language barrier. The game is a really good idea and it can be super fun to play with friends but its just not consistent with good performance and not running into game breaking glitches is impossible most of the time. Sometimes unplayable.

review: Lots of people will tell you that this game is pure and absolute garbage and they are correct. This game is incredibly unoptomized and no matter what specs your rig has there is no possible way to get a good frame rate. Bullets don t register there is lots of desync 9/10 times you get killed by some slap happy kid with a pan because out of 30 hits that showed up for you not a single one actually hit them. The devs are more concerned with making money and turning this game into the next big esport than they are trying to fix the fact that you need to have a quantum computer to have the game not crash every time you die. THAT BEING SAID the game IS fun. It doesn t have to be a well made game to be fun but it certainly doesn t hurt. I m coming up on 400 hours in this game as of right now and I have enjoyed most of those hours playing with friends. If you want my opinion do not buy this game if you are going to complain about how bad it is. I realize that the game comes with bugs and that many people don t like it and if that is you then you need to realize that it s still in alpha and that s what you get when you buy into a game that is in alpha that is still no excuse for them marketing it as a full game. So basically what I m saying is if you re going to buy it be aware that there are bugs and they are working on a huge game to meet everyone s needs so just be patient with it.

review: Fun and ok...yeah...just ok. The game is fun for a while. Going between solo and squad mode is fun and playing with friends is even more fun. But something is missing. It's a big island with a shrinking playing field. Sure the game is still under development but I can't help but feel it's missing something. In a way it reminds me of Call Of Duty except for the massive play area equipment items and lack of special attacks (drone helicopter etc). But hey... don't forget there's 100 players lurking around...A friend uses a $1/hour standard for rating the games he plays and I think it's a good idea. For this game I'm not quite there yet but I will be in no time.Pros Game is Under DevelopmentLarge playing fieldLoads of playersFun to play with friendsCons Game is Under DevelopmentView is kind of buggy when close to walls or switching to first person weapon viewSuggestion Buy the game if you have other friends who play this and play with them. It's always fun riding in a car together when trying to rush to play area. Tense moments are highly satisfying when you're there with your friends and you pull through a firefight.The game isn't horrible but it's also not super great. But valuewise it's on or close to the mark. Perhaps not the most polished game but enjoyable nonetheless.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Boot up game create character. Medium settings.Start match. Audio of plane plays still loading. Audio of parachute plays still loading. When I click I hear punching still stuck loading. Finally I get an image. dead.Second attempt.Loads up fine. I parachute to a village on the edge of the island. land. Everything looks like clay. Some buildings have no walls. 3 minutes of running around before everything loads up. Constant lagg and rubberbanding. By this time the playing area was forcing me to run all the way to the other edge of the map. Constantly running for my life still only had a pistol at this point. Last 15 people a plane flies overhead and practically drops a care package on my head. M24 nice... I guess..? Find an UMP9 in the building next to me. I get shot at. I hide. Got off 3 shots. Died.Finished in 8th place by just running around and being clueless.Clicked back to menu and CTD'd.For me personally this game is a no. Refunded. I get that it's still in Early Access and I do hope they improve the game. But I won't be buying it any time soon.

review: Well done for an EA game and Dev shows early signs of actual continued development. I will reserve complete judgment until the product exits EA. Currently there are some issues with server lag but really no glaring technical flaws otherwise. Hopefully this will be remedied in the next month with the Dev's "optimization" patches. There are many "quality of life" things that I'm sure will either be added and/or looked at IE Toggle lean...plllllzzzz.The introduction of 1st person servers will up this game in my book to a 10/10 along with continual tweaking of the overall game balance I have faith all of this will be delivered before exiting EA.8.7/10 for me. I will sink many hours in this gem and mine much salt due to my old eye site and shoddy aim.

review: Let me preface this by saying This game runs like absolute garbage on ANY PC you throw at it. I have a $1 000 rig and I have friends with multi thousand dollar rigs and it kicks all of our rig's butts equally. This game NEEDS optimization. Me saying this may turn one off from playing the game.BUT HOLD ON. IT GETS BETTER.PUBG though a laggy buggy piece of trash manages to be one of the most fun games I've played in years. The RNG element and high intensity of the end game allows for extreme replayability even though you're essentially doing the same thing over and over. I love this game especially when I'm playing with my friends. Hopefully with some performance optimization this will become one of the best games available on steam rivaling giants like DOTA and CS GO.Cons Poorly Optimized Buggy on all computers even high end rigs Lag Spikes common even on fast networks Developers don't seem to listen to the community Low tick rate servers lead to poor hitbox scanningPros Intense amount of fun Infinite Replayability Good Combination of Luck and Skill 10/10 Frying Skillet deflects bullets NO META

review: I'm not usually a writer of reviews but I simply have to with this game. No game has kept me away from Counter Strike for more than a few weeks a month at most. PUBG has been the only game I've played since I got it several months ago though. Constantly being updated and improved yet already a perfectly good game at it's 27 early access price this game is a must have for any first or third person shooter fans. Never before has a game made me feel so tense. The opening and dying moments are intense.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Yes I am aware that this is early access. That being said as it stands this game is not worth what you spend for it and I cannot recommend it in good conscience to anyone.Played for an hour and a half and encountered game breaking bug after game breaking bug after game breaking bug falling through the world character models not rendering until after you're dead getting stuck in an endless reloading animation loop and never actually being able to reload vehicles randomly flying into the air and killing you when they land. Needs a metric ton of QOL changes to make it worth the pricetag too. I live in Canada and it keeps putting me in their Asia server (unplayable amounts of lag) the amount of RNG is comparable to Hearthstone (Redzone following you play area dicking you over going through building after building after building and finding nothing not even clothes for your entire play) and just the general amount of lag is stupid (aiming at a player right next to you takes 10 seconds if they start shooting having to open doors again and again because they open but don't open and then magically close).And then there's the hackers aimbotters godmoders I've even seen someone nocliping. In almost every game there's someone cheating. This game is not worth playing for this amount of frustration.Honestly if you want to enjoy this game stick to watching YouTubers or streamers play it. It's like skateboarding with bricks for wheels it might bring a funny image to mind but when you try it yourself it just sucks.2/10NOTE I will be comming back and checking on this game every once in a while because the devs are working on it and it has so much potential to be awesome. My review is based on what it is at this time.

review: This game has come so far so fast. Is it the madden killer yet? Of course not. But it does have the best customization options in a sports video game ive ever seen. I was able to create a team with full custom uniforms and logos in just an hour after learning the basics. Roster customization is also very easy. This series can very easily be the future madden killer with the right funding. The developers are constantly updating based off player feedback and the series looks promising as a whole. Don't expect a madden level depth of content but rather a fun and infinitly customizable survival experience. And for $20 this game is a massive steal.

review: EDIT Still the same servers with client side animations leading to 2 second delays. Dying behind a wall only to watch the deathcam where you didn't even make it to cover at all. Can we get refunds after 400 hours played? You guys should offer that.This game has so many good things going for it. It also has just as much if not more bad things most of them are easily overlooked and the game thoroughly enjoyed regardless of its negatives. However there reaches a point where gunplay (especially early game) is just basically a horrible experience with terrible optimization delays rubberbanding and all around low server speeds. They've had plenty of time and money invested and optimization has been largely ignored since the first few patches. I love this game. The amazing concept gunplay realistic(ish) approach. Even ignoring all the bug causes players to turn into Nightcrawler and pass through walls like they aren't even there or even drive through them in a vehicle. Still this optimization and just outright horrible server are enough to make this game not even enjoyable to play.Therefore(tl/dr) Great game however the performance issues just can't be ignored this long and still enjoy playing it.

review: The novelty of this game is definitely apparent but when you start winning consistently and get to 100+ hours its novelty is outweighed by the bad netcode very average visuals even running 4K60FPS and poor developing which is starting to show with the inclusion of mechanics like paid loot boxes. But the one thing that ruins it above all is the hackers and streamers. It is absolutely rife with hackers especially Chinese as well as streamers who live on this game and use soft aimbots to make them look like they have skill in their streams. It becomes apparent how much of a problem with hackers this game has when you look at the statistics for hackers banned per week or month which may look good but hackers being banned from one account will not stop them from simply making a new one and carrying on. When this game dies it will die very quickly people who overcome the learning curve for this game like myself have no real appeal to this game anymore which is poor considering after 110 hours i am already done with this game not a great deal of time in this generation of gaming.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Awesome game. It's only going to get better. The only problem with the reviews are the people complaining about Microtransactions. I understand that the Developers fell back on their promise and wanted the game to be released first. And promises broken are not exactly worthy of trusting them again. But let's be real here... Microtransactions don't effect anyone but the people that buy them. So It's not a big deal. However... the point that they are trying to get across is that Microtransactions introduced in early alpha stages just mean to the community that they just want more money and that they won't deliver a full release game because they can make a bunch of money off of microtransactions. Well... I understand that point. But at the same time this game is so popular people are demanding it to be made well. And I think the Developers want this game to be a masterpiece as well. I'm not going to get angry about this game just yet. So far they've made many improvements and it is a game that is worth your 30 dollars if you want a game to play with your friends and have fun. To be honest this game reminds me of the type of games I thought about when I was little. A large scale game vs many players in a battle over a large map to see who will win. What kind of strategies will you try to develop? It was well worth my money here.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game runs anywhere between 2 60 fps on low depending on where you land on the map. New FPP mode is as unstable as you could possibly fathom. Constant rubber banding teleporting and stutter on item pickup makes it impossible to loot or even navigate on any game mode now.They've got a good formula for a game but holy sort this sort of thing out. 25 for this atm is a joke.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Starter for all you people giving this game an entire poor review on microtransactions The game is not making you buy them they are simply put in by the devs to test ad work out any bugs with them. It's not like you need them unless you wanna walk around waring pink trackpants or a school skirt that adds no benefit whatsoever to your gameplay. CS GO does it as well and look at THAT game. Anyways review timeI absolutely love this game so far can't get enough out of it in all honestly. Ever since the First Person Perpective only matches have been added it's even more fun! This game is very easy to play and understand other than how weapon mods work even then it won't take long. Pros Very quick to get into a game shouldn't take longer than 10 seconds Fair no microtransactions that boost your gameplay Decent community Very fun gunplay! Doesn't take a quadrillian years to find a gun! *cough* DayZ *cough* Has a very dedicated Dev team! *cough* DayZ *cough*Those are some basic Pros but now the ConsCons Very buggy..but that is to be expected from and Early Access Game Poorly optimizedThose are the MAJOR cons most likely to be fixed in future updatesThis game has such a good future ahead of itself it's being updated left and right (even yesterday it was updated).10/10 IGN

review: Okay I am gonna say this right now.I enjoyed the f*** out of this game right until version 1.0They not only made the glitches worse but also introduces things like broken matchmaking a billion hackers and unbalanced guns.The games drag out way too long and just aren't fun you collect loot for 10 minutes then you walk get shot or shoot someone and walk some more.This could be forgiven tho but instead of fixing this the devs just keep making it worse and worse every single patch.First there came a second map which was fine until you realize you can't choose which map you play then came the third which was fun but they also introduced micro transactions battle passes and even more glitches and performance issues with the fourth map on the horizon It isn't looking all that good.But the biggest problem of them all is the fact that they made a even called Fix PUBG an event designed for fixing the game. this is already bad but after 4 months and the event ending they fixed less than 10% of the bugs.The game still isn't optimized has glitches hackers drags out way too long and has more micro transactions than fifa.Instead of fixing this they just keep adding guns thinking its fresh and exciting while you still just disconnect mid game from time to time.Please PUBG you were great but you ruined everything you had going for you.Thanks for (reading).

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a really fun game but shouldn't not be fully released because there is way to many bugs in the game for example client side lag which ruins so many games for people and there is a thing which three of my friends and I experienced which is when you get shot at it freezes for a split second and you get killed (it isn't that we have a bad pc because we don't the average gpu is a 970. One of our friends has a 1070 and it happens to him aswell). The devs should have not released pubg on xbox until pc was finished or atleast there wasn't any game breaking bugs. PUBG isn't a bad game it is just the devs need to put a little bit more work on the bugs and not add new things until the main bugs are fixed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ok... so. From my experience PUBG has been a really fun experience. Had a lot of fun with voice chat and especially with my friends when we go around just fuc**ng around it's the funniest thing ever. But I do have some complaints.1. The optimization even on some higher end computers the game can still run pretty badly. But you do have to realise it is still early acces...2. The desync Desync doesn't happen that often but when it does it can really ruin your chances of killing the enemy or even winning the gameBut if there is a downside there must be an upside aswell right? Yes you're correct.1. You can choose to have fun and mess around or tryhard and win every game.2. The graphics are amazing.3. The gameplay is really good and polished even though I said there is desync. ( which is really rare )4. It's worth it for a $30 game.In conclusion I really like this game it has been an amazing experience and like I said especially with friends. You have a lot of options for both winning or just having fun so I would rate this game 8.5/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Bloody awesome game! Honestly see a lot of negative reviews here... And I don't really understand them. I think a lot were written out of frustration to be honest lol. It is a difficult game but the challenge is always welcome. Very fun to play with friends. You do need a relatively high end rig to run it on max settings at a smooth frame rate (I get about 70 80fps on Ultra 2560x1080 GTX1070 Asus Strix 16GB DDR4 i7 7700K OC 5.0Ghz) but besides that really no complaints. Had plenty of rage quits but that's just because although I'd consider myself a decent player I'm far from the best. Besides... A hard game makes victory more rewarding... Everybody knows a well earned Chicken Dinner feels better than an .

review: Early Access it s already a groundbreaking online shooter. Each game starts the same way but its remarkable ability to feel like a fresh new adventure every round has kept me coming back for hours on end. It manages to approach the Battle Royale style death match made popular by games like DayZ with relative simplicity without sacrificing the essence of the hardcore survival sim creating a tight focused and no frills experience that places it leagues above the competition.Battlegrounds wastes no time putting you right in the middle of the action as up to 100 players join a server and pick their moment to jump out of a plane and parachute onto a large 8x8 km island. Even this first act is a critical decision and must be part of your strategy jumping early lets you hit the ground first giving you a jump on the competition but may also place you farther from the center of the arena where the fighting must inevitably funnel towards. Jumping late might give you some distance from other players giving you some early breathing room before entering the fray. Jumping right into the center especially in large cities where most players drop will place you right in the middle of the action. The tension mounts during the descent as you get a good look at the swarm of players in your vicinity but things really pick up the moment you hit the ground as everybody scrambles for weapons and gear and the killing begins right from the get go. Backpacks for holding more items a handful of protective gear like helmets and police vests healing items melee weapons and a good mix of firearms are in good supply. But It's not just skill in this all out shooter game sometimes you need to rely on your enviroment to save you and sometimes your friends may not even be your friends in the end. In this game you're always on your toes and your head on a swivel.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: THIS GAME IS BEAUTIFUL OMGNot only are the graphics gorgeous and will most likely keep improving but you can't even process how gorgeous it is when you john cena someone with a frying pan. Because you can do that in this game! It would legitimately be the perfect game for people like me who enjoy not just mass destruction but being forced to use strategies and outsmart 99 other people IF it wasn't so FLIPPIN laggy. I think out of the 30+ games I've played so far all but 3 of them I have lagged on. It's mostly rubber banding which is infuriating. Now whenever I'm confronted with another player It doesn't lag as much as it does when I'm just looting a building. Which is sort of backwards but lol it's good for me! Of course you can change that number and make it 98 other people with Duos and 96 other people with Squads. And wait it gets better you can go Solo and make it auto place you with one to three other people so you have to work together with complete strangers which makes the game even more complicated and challenging. It's not exactly Bluehole's fault that other people are OP XD so that's not what I'll rant about. Instead I'd like to see the weapons such as sniper rifles and M16A4s and SCAR L's to be a little more common in the little random houses and warehouses scattered across the map. In my hours on this game I've only picked up two rifles and the second one was from a fresh carepackage. Otherwise this game is the best game I've got on my list and it's going to stay that way for a loooooong while. &lt 3 &lt 3
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I wish I could recommend this game I have had a lot of fun with it but as I type I'm AGAIN unable to log in an play because the game is down. They have basically limitless money between the game sales and the keys they sell for boxes etc so how is it that the game still has issues just running? On top of this the game is seriously over hyped. Sure it's great and it launched the battle royale craze but more so because it was the right game at the right time. As I said it is fun I have played a lot and I have 3 solo wins (so I'm not just being salty here) but I feel like most other producers could do it better.Another issue I have is no real reward for playing. I mean why don't I get anything when I win? Sure it's satisfying when I won my first solo match I was beside myself but shouldn't I at least get a cosmetic to wear in game or something? I can grind for crates which have a like a .001% chance of dropping the really cool items but that is not fun either. I welcome all other publishers to copy PUBG and make it better.

review: With having been a HUGE fan of h1z1. I can honestly 100% say that this game blows it out of the water.I was nervous that I would get bored with this game quick after investing so much time in a game of the same exact style. But once I felt the shooting mechanics I immedietly realized what H1 was always missing... A GREAT DEVELOPER. Maybe one the best I have ever experienced with a game. Everything they say they will do... They do... Its not just releasing half of what they say for one big update every half a year and then have the game offline for 2 days. Daybreak ruined a great thing and they only have themselves to blame... They were money hungry with the paid content. When all they had to do was just deliver on fixing there game. This game has made the developers millions of dollars and will make millions more. H1Z1 is now dead in the water. With a scramble to start being a good developer its to little to late. Battle grounds is here.... And its here to stay. Jump in. Jump out of a plane. And get to looting folks! STOP READING AND JUST BUY IT!(as far as this being an early access title) It wont be for long. Maybe half year tops. Because that is what the developer said. And that is what the developer will do. Yes there is a hacker problem (apprently) I don't know if I have expereinced any in my 200 hours of game play. But GUESS WHAT. The developer will do everything they possibly can and they will fix it. They promised optomization first. And every update is a HUGE improvement. So when they decide to tackle the hackers.. IT WILL BE UPDATE AFTER UPDATE fixing the problem as well. Sorry H1.. you are done SON!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is pure trash. I am glad Steam has a refund system.The biggest flaw for this game is friendly fire and POOR optimization. Framerates are all over the shop affecting your playable performance. The graphics are rubbish considering the system resources it uses. Another big failure is friendly fire... The devs have enabled squad play except they can kill you anyway? Wtf? I follow my squad around for a good 15 minutes thinking they were friendly then they just shoot me? What a waste of 15 minutes.The gun shot sounds in the game are complete rubbish as well it sounds like mono you honestly can't tell what direction gun shots are coming from making it difficult to judge where to go. The player base is the next problem. It seems that the majority of players are trigger happy bags they don't care about survival nor do they think of a sensible approach when playing strategically.I know the game is in early access but to be honest I was generally bored with this game I haven't played a game this bad in over 12 months and I have played ALOT of early releases this has got to be the worst.Save your $40 and go elsewhere play Squad or any FPS for that matter there are plenty of Free to Play first person shooters that are better then this all round.

review: The game we all love to love and love to hate. This game has it all. It's a great idea and somewhat of a good product. But this game has many pros and cons.I personally watched pewdiepie play this game which brought it to my attention and as far as I can tell the game is absolutely fun to watch (because I have a bad graphics card so I can't run it as nicely as youtubers do you probably neither do you). The game itself when I play it is an absolute blast wether I play all by my self or with my friends. The gun arsenal is quite big comparing it to H1Z1 and Fortnite therefore it's superior not only because of the guns but because of it's more realistic and has better graphics (if you can render them anyways).But despite the game's great idea and the amount of content it is just bad after playing it for a while (which is logical but it's not getting boring as games usually do after a while). The game has poor servers poor hit registration poor physics (therefore it's not completely realistic) and poor optimization despite their efforts to optimize the game. It is certainly getting a lot better patch by patch but none of their improvement will be fully appreciated unless they improve their servers (and no it's not my internet's fault).In conclusion the game has a lot of potential due to the creativity of it's developer but despite his great ideas the game is running poorly making the game very irritating to play. I hope it will run smoothly after the 1.0 release as for now I wouldn't recommend playing it and also... I would like to say that playerunknown should play PUBG to see how it feels to play his game to have some insight. Because when he tells us that he doesn't play his own game it makes me wana smack his head every time my shotgun pallets go trough my enemy.I would rate this game 5/10 for great content horrible performance and the posibillity of the games improval.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TL DRthis game is just a mediocre battle royal yawn fest. do not buy it unless you really want to waste 30 bucks on something .the reason i have 80+ hours is from leaving the game running and idling becuase i was too lazy to turn it off.pros fun with friends like srsly phun.thats about itcons input response time is too high for my liking thats not very good for a game with as fast a pace as pubg has. especially in the beginning when you just land client side hit reg &lt yes this is a problem you if you don't agree.unoptimized (but its ea so who cares I'm a ing dumb face for even caring at least according to the steam discussion page) seriously i know its only ea but still if my gtx 1080 can't handle this game at ultra 1080p and get at least 30 fps i don't care how early access that game is it's unoptimized it's a bandwagon. now not all bandwagons are bad but some people are buying this game just because they've heard of it and recognized the name or because their friend told them about it and that person has no idea what they're buying or what they're getting in to when they buy pubg and thats not the game devs fault or the games fault and its not really a factor into my negative review i just think its kind of .mediocre. its just another battle royal yawn fest that only is really fun for 30 hours at max after about 30 hours of playtime you realize how repetetive and un replayable it is. the weapons are nothing special either just your standard shooter games weapons.

review: Okay so im gonna make this quick and short... So first off im writing this review because I think most of you need to be informed about this game right now. If you considering buying this game please consider that at almost every corner your gonna die by a hacker lag vehicle turning over and exploding random headshot by guy you didnt see 1000 meters away proning behind a tree in grass etc. Oh and also...... its kinda luck. If your thinking how the hell is an fps game luck? Well let me tell you! There is a possibility that you actually wont die by any of the things I listed and once you do good it gets you hooked. You get kill hungry and want to get more kills because of how good you just did. Then the game on you again and you die by a speed hacker. Another thing is sometimes whenever you jump out of the plane you get what i like to call a follower. Now what these followers do is follow you into the building your gonna get your loot from and this game is laggy. Trust me when i say its not my internet. But you go to get the gun and your press f to pick it up and your guy does this whole long animation thing where he bends over and picks the gun up and sometimes it takes 4 tries to pick the gun up! Well sometimes these followers somehow get the gun before you even though you were there 10 seconds before him and you end up running like hell. Straight out of the building and the same thing happens to the door it takes five tries to finally open it. By that time the guy is reloaded and down the staircase ready to shoot. You run out the door and you see the light not the sun but the light... the light of hope. So you run take 5 steps run behind a wall en then you die. You kinda scratch your head for a minute and think well how did he shoot me. So then you just go on to the next game and rinse and repeat. So basically what im saying is that there is so many BS kills and deaths and it gets really annoying. Dont buy the game just yet. Let it get optimized and patched up a little bit before you purchase. By the way for you folks that stayed and read this that whole quick and short thing at the beggining was kinda sarcasm.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: For those who didn't read the patch notes there are new crates that are being introduced with new loot. there will be three different cases and one of the three will require a paid key to open. The only case you have to pay to open is the Gamescom Invitational Crate that will only be available for a limited time and will be sold to help pay for the Gamescom Invitational. "Proceeds from the sale of the keys to open the Gamescom Invitational Crate will be used to provide funds needed to organize the eventto provide a prize pool for the invitational winnersto support a selection of charities" 7/27/17 parch notesso please instead of just jumping on the bandwagon without any knowledge look something up in you life you lazy sacks of crap. Dont disrespect a good game with good developers. They are not haggling you for money because they really dont need it. They are testing the system of using keys temporarily while also trying to fund activitites to promote the game. You are playing an early access game with the idea that you will be interested in whats happening reading patch notes reporting bugs and giving your opinion about the game. dont just read others opinions on reddit and act like they are fact.

review: The amount of negative comments for this game because of a broken promise is too high. Seriously people are going to bash on the game and give it negative reviews because of a broken promise for microtransactions that are simply cosmetics? They are doing this for a gaming invitational (which can cost alot of money for the people who dont realize that) plus this game has had 2 3 updates almost every month since the release and the difference between now and then is night and day. I got this game within a week after it released on steam (yes i know i only have 86 hours its because i waited for bug fixes and for the game to not be as laggy as it was) and its one of the best EA games ive seen when it comes to updates and bug fixing. If you are deciding to buy this game for gameplay I highly recommend it. Dont listen to the people that hate on cosmetic microtransactions that give no in game advantage they already said they were going to remove them after the event so dont buy them simple as that.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I cannot recommend this game for the following reasons Developer's censorship of community Poor quality client/server relationship The client which says it killed first is always right (Due to BlueHole's chosen network format) Developers want to sell a bare bones game that requires you to purchase cosmetics through CS GO lottery system Developers have much needed work for the basic animations and mechanics but they focus on flashy parkour animations? Developers need to fundraise $350k for tournament/charity even though they broke $150 million in sales Developers are keen on making streamers Gods in the community Broken promises Frying Pan (Melee) is capable of deflecting melee/bullets/vehicle collisions when positioned correctly. (Infinite durability) #Broken Lack of proper reason behind loot locations Inconsistent physics for players/vehicles Game's graphics determine whether you see players better or not. Disabling/lowering graphics means an advantage meanwhile beautiful graphics on capable PC's will suffer due to their inability to keep their renderer consistent and clean. This is a major problem in a game where sneaking/hiding is mandatory. The bottom edge of a player darkened while prone. Damage values aren't grounded in logic/physics. Bullets drop while traveling (aside from some...) however decrease in speed or overall penetration doesn't reduce damage received. As a result shotguns headshot at medium to long range dealing 40+ damage per pellet. (100 HP total per player) Weapon diversity lacks good melee options or even a basic military knife Parachute mechanics feel like you're playing Pilot Wings 64...... My bad Pilot Wings 64 had great parachuting mechanics for its time. I apologize... 1/10 wait for developer's apology or acknoledgement of mistakes wait for optimizations refund for mediocre development shoved down your throat.

Character customization is limited starting clothing is severely short in amount but it makes earning money for more gear that much more satisfying. Feels like Arma Miscreated and Rust combined with Counter Strike. My only beef with the game is the lack of a story or explanation and the weirdly out of place sci fi blue wall of death that moves ever closer to the center. I'd rather some other peril would kill off players in those zones (snipers helicopters fire explosions). It just doesn't really fit.

That doesn't work out here) and it's very rng and luck based. So much that it just becomes boring and even frustrating unless you're really good at PUBG. Because then you can just kill everyone anyways.This is not the game I had in mind sometimes it's fun but it's definitly not worth the 30 euros I spent on it.

review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan Romano &amp Asiago)Note grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling. In a small mixing bowl add the ricotta and mash with a fork. Add in the 3 cheese blend Cheddar cheese eggs salt and pepper. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth paste like consistency. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough. Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water oil and salt. Mix. Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs water oil and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough. Take the dough out of the mixing bowl shape it into a ball and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic. Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters. With a cookie cutter or upside down water glass cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15 20 dough circles). Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells. Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough. Fill a small bowl with water dip your fingers in and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle. Fold the dough in half over the filling making a half moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a homemade touch as well. Repeat this process for all your dough circles. Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker. Roll the dough into two sheets Place one sheet on the ravioli maker and form the filling cups. Fill with the ravioli mixture. Lay the second sheet of dough on top and roll it out. This will seal in the filling. Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli. Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5 6 minutes or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test. If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time you can freeze the rest Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce grate some fresh cheese over it and enjoy!

review: Product received for free. While I really do enjoy the game.. There's just some things that I just really can't get behind. A head shot that according to death cam is a body shot? On level 3 armor? With a Kar98? Just doesn't seem possible to me when I've taken M24 shots to the chest even closer with level 3 armor.Pro'sThere is an absolutely huge player base making queue times super quick more often than not. Which means under 2 minutes to game start typically.Lots of variety in the weaponsGreat for playing with your buddies or just meeting new people and running squads for HOURS.Sounds are pretty accurate on locations of firing/vehicles moving through the map.Con'sLooting isn't equal (go figure right?) End up running to three or four different compounds just to get a full load out. I'm talking even past a pistol here.There are some really impossible shots going on that just don't seem rightYOU MAKE ME GRIND BP FOR HOURS AND THEN MAKE ME SPEND MONEY TO UNLOCK MY CRATE?! I should have the choice for a locked crate or not.Two maps have been released since I got this back in beta.. WTF brah?Overall I'd say a decent 6/10. Replayability is great graphics are pretty good sound is excellent loot is not very predictable lots of hackers.

review: Finally! Something to take me off my heroin addiction. I've heard about this game from a friend but now that I think about it he is my new dealer.When I started to play this game I didn't understand nothing that was happening in it. "Just another search and gather game" I said to myself. Boy was I wrong. Everything about this game is addictive from its graphics its gameplay its quiet and its gun fire with bullets that whisper death in your ears. From the soft winds of Gatka's fields to the massacre of Sosnovka Military Base this game is a masterpiece. I just love it when unexpected guests show up at my dorsteps and enter uninvited. There is always a hungry shotgun waiting for them. And then is the thrill of running through the fields of gold praying to God that AR or SR isn't pointed at you.But the best of all feelings is the one when you run from the blue circle. When it catches you without medkits you forget about everything and everyone is just you and your feet. Best and fastest 5k in my life.So keep up the good work Bluehole it's going great so far!

review: Ok...... well here is a review from someone has had multiple wins (look at profile) anyways i would like to state that my system i play on mostly is worse then anyone else's. people that have been complaining about proformace issues all seem to have 1080s which i highly doubt thatss the case everyone on fourms has powerful i7s that cant play because of frame rate? lol i dont see that as a problem for your specs boys. i have a laptop (the system i play mostly on its a i5 200u duel core 2.1ghz or something like that a mobile cpu lol a 2gb gfx card made by nvidia 840m im pretty sure and i pull atleast 35 fps in 720p now my desktop has no issues at all playing at 60fps 1080p on ultra anyway enough of that ill start my reviewits ok i mean its not like this game hasnt been done before H1 or in arma 3 the game itself has issues people seem to miss that point even though its in EA which i dont understand why people are complaining about bugs nor am wondering why people are complaining about system issues. people seem to have the understanding the game sucks because they have to get kills and high frame rates to win ummm no i have a 2kd you have to outsmart you enemy.the main problem i have with this game is that its trying to hard to be a competeive shooter its draining all of its hype to be something its not its alot of fun to play and its fun screwing with your enemys but watching it as a esport ill stick with csgo and rainbow dota and games like that. it seems that every issues everyone seems to have is hardware that is completely untrue as my specs for my laptop prove that. get it boys play a round or two stop player play something else the game isnt ment to be played 24/7 its a casual shooter people need to remember that! ) more info for my desktop or even my laptop hit me up i can help with setting up your pc too if you really have a highend system with high frame rates!!

review: So I got 400+ hours in this game played it since February of 2017. Ive seen it evolve and change as it moved through early acces and went too full release. The idea is great. Ive had alot of great fun with friends galavanting around the map. Now heres the problem. Bluehole is too far up their own counting their money too care about those who got them there. Us the players. Those of us who played early access dealt with the bugs and glitches reported the issues. Helped them make a great game. And then they opened it up too China. Its not the sheer amount of chinese players playing the game its how theyre going about it. There were hackers you ran accross in early acces maybe 1 everyone 5 6 matches and that was a high rate. Now its every match. Bluehole themselves have said 99% of hacks are coming from China. Banned 1.5 million. one solution too cut down on it region lock. yes you can get around it but it makes it a little more time consuming too do. Also ban too either steam account or hardware. Even those that dont cheat they access NA or EU servers and with their ping being horrid they slow down the game for everyone else playing. Lag Spikes rubberbanding game crashing all these things are now rampant ever since PUBG hit the chinese market. Im not fully blaming the chinese players but there is definatly a correlation. So until Bluehole gets their head out of there and fix the problems that have destroyed this game dont get it. not even for free.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Do I recommend this game?Yes...and no.Postive Critiques First off this game is very fun! The gunplay is great each match is completely different and everything you do is up to you and your team. At first you have no clue what you're doing and every little thing tenses you up. Guess what that tense feeling never goes away!Every match is a totally different story whether it's due to the your luck with loot drop locations or even the weather! (Especially the fog)Negative Critiques This game has problems its main one being optimization. A must have is at least 16 GBs of RAM a quick quad core processor and an above average graphics card. (Optimization is being improved all the time)I have a pretty decent gaming desktop and I still have FPS problems on low settings mainly in cities/populated areas and when spectating other players. (Check profile for PC specs)The servers are a bit laggy every now and then but problems happen rarely.In Conclusion If you give the game a few breaks and a decent amount of time it will probably become one of your favorite games despite its problems every once in a while. Wyl33 J's Rating 7/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a work of art. Yes is may be $30 USD but what you get from it is pure high action quality. Yes it's compeditors have to started to grow out of it's league but in reality PUBG is a sublime work of art that works at it's own pace. If im going to review this game then I might as well bring up it's main rival "Fortnite" a game almost the same in playstyle. Fortnite offers reliable multiplayer compatibility high quality voice chat and an addicting playstyle. To the media Fortnite completly incinerates PUBG by popularity standard but if you think about it PUBG isn't mean't to be played like Fortnite. Unlike Fortnite PUBG requires it's players to have an enormous amount of FPP/TPP combat skill. You could go for weeks in PUBG to not even get intoi the top 3. Fortnite's play style is more "by the book". If you have good aim a twitchy finger good hotkeys a knack for quick non strategical looting and a full squad of people that can do the same you're golden. However In pubg looting is one of the most difficult parts of the game. For starters you can only have two primary weapons one pistol (or sawed off) and an unlimited about of grenades that have to have assigned hotkey if you don't want to drag them into you grenade slot via inventory. Oh... and one melee weapon for the trolls. Along with this hard to use (versus its compeditor) loadout you have gun modifications. Suppressors Flash Hiders Extended Magazines Quick Draw Magizines a combination of Quick Draw and Extended Magazines Angled Grip Vertical Grip Thumb Grip Holographic Sigh Red Dot Sight 2x Scope 3x Scope 4x Scope 6x Scope 8x Scope 10x Scope 15x Scope Backgrip Cheekpad Bullet Loops Shotgun Schokes you name it! Rather than finding upgrades of each particular gun (as it is in fortnite) You have to work your way up with gun modifications and even then they only give you slight advantages. Everything else is based on what gun you can have and your shoot and cover technique. Something SUBSTANTIALLY important to note is that you can build and PUBG. You also can break stationary objects other than windows. This makes Fortnite less about skill and more about how fast you can click your hotkeys. PUBG is all about cover if you don't have it you might as well be a sitting duck. PUBG 86/100Fortnite (in its league) 89/100
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Like most early access games PUBG is lacking in both content and quality. The clunky mechanics bad servers and poor optimization only serve to worsen the experience. If Bluehole had waited to release a finished game (instead of jumping on the battle royale bandwagon like other similar companies) their game would not be the unrefined mess that it is today. In its current condition I do not recommend buying PUBG but I am excited to see what the full release will bring.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have never reviewed a game but after seeing this game get so many negative feedback I felt the need to tilt the balance a bit to the positive side again. First of all this game is not for the "casual" gamer it requieres concentration team communication and a lot of in game knowledge to fully enjoy it. Secondly pubg is very hardware demanding meaning that if you plan to game with a low end graphics card and cpu you are most definitely gonna have a hard time. Thirdly imo pubg is a team based game sure you can play solo but playing with other people certanly adds an extra layer of fun. Fourthly pubg has had many updates over time a lot of bugs have been fixed and new content has been introduced to the game. As of right now pubg is certanly not a AAA fully polished game but it is not as bad as people make it look like in the negative reviews. Finally I hope my review convinces someone to try the game for what it is and not for what it could be.

review: Good concept bad implementation. This should still be in early access. Full retail price plus paid loot boxes. Inconsistent shooting and hit detection. They have made a ridiculous amount of money selling this game which would mean they could afford bigger and better teams to work on the game but updates still feel poorly implemented always cause more glitches and dont seem to address the core issues with the game (ping abuse hit detection low server tick cheaters the list goes on). Winning is a heck of a rush and makes the frustrations seem worth it for a time but that novelty wears off quick and the game could be amazing if not for the technical issues.
