review: Its a early access game so take everything i say with a grain of salt might be changed in future.This game is very unoptimized on my mid high end pc i have alot of texture bugs which degrade my gameplay enjoyment when someone has advantage of actually going into buildings and taking guns while you have to wait until game decides to load in the textures and you can actually do something but in general i think the performance is pretty good i have GTX 1050 8GB of DDR4 and i5 7300HQ and i can actually run this game flulently at med settings 1080p one annoying if youre comming from games like CSGO is that you will be annoyed by all the campers who sit in grass and wait for you to push up graphics arent that good even on ultra and the graphics options arent that good for example you cant totaly disable anti aliasing and that frustrates me because i dont see point of AA if it makes your game way more laggier.I never actually really liked these battle royale games always wasnt fan of them cause they were based alot on RNG but this is something else i actually like maybe not the game i might play often but deffinetly a game i will play maybe once a week or so really like the looting aspect and the shooting mehanics but main annoyance is that texture bug i talked about in general i recommend this game for anyone who likes games like battlefield with large open world and for anyone who likes to strave for the N1 place in everygame. Im hoping the dev's fix the games bugs in future and this game might be one of my favorites8/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: OK you want to hear a real review of this game?First off this is the most fun I've had with a multiplayer game in years. Most of that was playing solo btw. Very intense the shrinking death circle to slowly push players into battle forces smaller engagements on a very large map. IDK if that was a PUBG invention or not but its damn brilliant. Squad play is most rewarding if you have a decent team to watch your back. Getting a win in team play or solo against 99 foes is very sastisfying AKA the Winner Winner Chicken Dinner. When you get it you will know. Early Access yes. Bugs yes. Optimization issues i suppose. YMMV. I have an upper mid range rig built in 2015 and it runs great. I paid $36.99 CAD for the game as of early 2017 and I feel it was worth it. Who knows where it will go if anywhere. But thats early access. I bought in and it delivered. It doesnt need to go further for me but if it does it would be epic.

review: Can no longer recommend this game due to greedy company tactics dishonesty false advertising and general ******* by greedy companies. Owner has not only broken his Early Access promises by charging real money for cosmetics during EA period but has also been trolling the community on twitter over the backlash this dude is a piece of **** and this should have been apparent by the way he jumps from company to company selling his stolen game idea and running away with whatever money he can farm. The game itself has had absolutely no improvements to functionality optimization gameplay or any other actually important aspects but has pumped plenty of time and effort into double charging it's playerbase for cosmetics. Much like with H1Z1 KotK we're seeing a pattern that apparently is directly linked to the greedbot Player Unknown himself. Once the game leaves early access you'll no longer be able to obtain any cosmetic progression in the game without spending $2.50 to randomly gamble with crates which is ultimately worse than just releasing paid cosmetic packs at face value. This game is a fun at first cash grab that is going to get worse with age and while I've had fun playing it (When it isn't crashing lagging freezing or killing me randomly due to the myriad of bugs) I'm definitely hanging up the hat so to speak. I refunded this game once before some friends got it and I wish I could refund it now but life is what it is.

review: I can easily consider PUBG one of my favorite games of all time not only is it a "battle royale" type game but there is a lot more to it than that. The game was officially released out of beta but it's still buggy and not sufficiently stable enough for the high amount of concurrent players. A ton of things in the game need to be fixed//updated... A big part of the game is surviving a way to to that is finding a vehicle and using it to find resources. I LOVE the vehicle physics they're just honestly hilarious to play around with especially with friends. It's always nice to see what'll happen when you do "this or that" it could either go two ways you die from vehicle explosion or you get flung 20km into the air and then die from impact. The game has a very long way to go for example the shotguns somehow their range is unexpectedly high. I lost track of how many times I've smashed my headset against my monitor because I've been sniped by a shotgun across the street from me... I think that should be minorly adjusted. It brings to my attention that PUBG Corp or Bluehole decide to push changes to the UI instead of fixing gameplay issues such as framerate stuttering even on a high end PC and a lot more issues that would take too long to sit here and list. Other things on the more positive side In my opinion I think the weapon mechanics are perfectly fine and balanced the way they are atm but I would like to see another big set of weapons added because let's be honest here we've had the same guns since initial alpha release...Overall when you get past the negative parts and bullsh*t mechanics in the game it becomes a ton of fun especially if you got a squad of friends with you. and get that chicken dinner. It feels good to win Highly recommend if you got a group of friends to play with!Edit The March 2018 update dropped for PUBG adding emotes a friend system and a lot more including bug fixes. It seems to me that everytime they introduce something new into the game it interferes and breaks something else of higher importance. Because of the games popularity to load into a server though MM would take a few seconds. After the new update they ed something up like usual like matchmaking is really buggy (sometimes it'll get stuck on a "Started Matchmaking" screen) and as an addition to that when MM does decide to work it can take up to 1 minute versus the few seconds it took before. If bluehole is gonna keep adding to the game they have to make sure it won't mess anything else up because I'd rather have fast and reliable matchmaking rather than emotes but of course that's just me .. I still recommend the game positively because I'm sure eventually they'll improve their system and this won't be an issue. April 2018 March 2018 issues have been resolved ) I was surely confident they would recuperate and they didEnd of April/May 2018 Update Accoording to the patch notes for this new update new scopes were added new weapons new vehicles and some other loot and entity adjustments for gameplay improval.What we found out A lot more was changed that wasn't mentioned for example AR Spray Patters// Recoil Patterns... The patchnotes did mention a buff to the SMGs and a tone down for the ARs but they literally made them useless garbage... The M416 used to be the best AR you can find and no questioning it (statisically at least) the pure fun of the game. The dev team literally took everything good about the ARs and f*cked it in the a$$ ....So now if you want to engage in a fight that's medium/long range you are forced to use a sniper rifle or else there's like a 1/20 change you will nail a shot using an AR. Don't get me wrong everything else about the update is absolutely great but why mess with the ARs if everybody adored them the way they were. It's honestly upsetting because I've put so much time into mastering long range// medium range AR fights and now it's all put to waste. Probably the only good thing about the update was the changes to the M16A4 it's back! Before PUBG 1.0 release the M16A4 used to be an insanely good gun for medium range and finally it's back. It sure is really nice to have it back and I really hope PUBG Corp eventually bring back the ARs but again there's less than a 1% chance they'll do that since they are going through this path for their game where they want to make every weapon valuable and there's a chance you could win a fight with any weapon obviously exluding somebody with an AR versus somebody with a pistol because that's obviously unfair. But UMP9 vs SCAR L actually has a decent chance to win now especially since 90% of the loot you find is attachments lmao it's crazy how common grips are now. I'm finding myself with 10+ in my inv every game because I have no clue which are useful for what. Anyways I respect the desicion path they're making for their game and I'll for sure always support em' but man I will miss the old ARs more than anything else. R.I.P &lt 3 forever be loved OP ARs

review: I very much regret having to discourage getting this game it's extremely fun and very rewarding to kill someone in. However it has SEVERE lag issues sometimes to the point that it feels like the servers are either more braindead than a Trump supporter or actively plotting to kill me. Recently the lag got so bad that I was forced to leave a game because it forced me to drive my UAZ into a river while outside the playzone. I VERY much wish I could recommend this game but the literal game breaking lag means that I cannot in my right mind put anybody else through that. If the developers fix this issue I will happily update this review to more accurately reflect my feelings about the gameplay model of PUBG.

review: This game is seriously addictive for me personally I love competitive multiplayer games and this game is the first game that I considered to play besides Dota 2 it's as fun as it is frustrating you can play 1 match and die within first few seconds because another player landed in the same spot as you but just a few seconds before you or you can make it all the way to the top 10 or even first place if you play your cards right the game has a learning curve you have to learn the tricks of the trade if you want to survive.I recommend this game yes it has issues yes it has bugs just last night me and 2 of my friends we're playing we got ambushed in the open and was hiding in some bushes the guy took out both of my friends and he finished off my friend as I was reviving him somehow that triggered a bug that caused my character to stay in the same pose and I was unable to turn anymore I stayed alive by using my friends Medi Kits and bandages and managed to get our team in the top 10 that way hahaha. I've had so many laughs with this game it's really at it's absolute best when you play with your friends with Teamspeak. Criticism I have about the game It's terribly optimized the game requires a lot of work on the performance side.The game is more than terrible if you don't put it on a SSD even a SSD will do. Else you will spend the first minute of play with a broken game while everything loads it's very hdd dependent.Streamer bans? Luckily it has never happened to me YET! and I hope it won't I never ever cheat in any game and I will be very sad if I get banned for not even cheating which according to some of the reviews is quite the problem play fair and it won't ever be a problem for you.This game is huge amounts of fun once you learn how to handle all it's flaws I've had many nights so far where I played from after work till 4 the next morning even though I have work at 9 lol it's that addictive for me. JUST ONE MORE MATCH D!!If you like this review give it a thumbs up )

review: Previous Review 19th December 2017So it's been roughly a year since I posted my review so I figured I'd make a edit to it since I haven't in almost a year.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a highly competetive FPS battle royale which has 3 (soon to be 4) maps. You have Erangel The original map and my personal favourite. Erangel is the second largest map in the game. The reason I like Erangel so much is that it is fairly colorful (Compared to the largest map Miramar) and has many good looting spots etc. Miramar The largest map. This map is a very good map for sniping as it's mostly plain land apart from the buildings and farms on the map. Many people dislike it but personally I don't mind it as it's always fun to pick off people and watch them scuttle away from hundreds of meters away.Sanhok This map came out a while after Miramar. It is the smallest and probably the most popular if not just as popular as Erangel. If you want a quicker game this is the map to go for. Be wary though as it is 4x smaller than both the maps so the likelyhood is after a close encounter more than a quater of the remaining players will know where you are so be careful of that.Vikendi The upcoming map. It is snowy and slightly larger than Sanhok but still the second smallest map in the game. So far it seems pretty fun and enjoyable (from what I've seen)Now the question is this worth a pickup? In my opinion 100%. If you are looking for a more competetive game than Fortnite H1Z1 etc than this is the place to go.

review: I thought this game might be fun so I bought it during steam summer sale.Boy was I wrong. Between the lag and the glitches this game is impossible to play. The game frequently hiccups during firefights especially close range. Sometimes I'm dead before I actually see an enemy come around the corner. Try picking up a gun when you land before someone else does and you press the action button 4 times and it doesn't do anything. Then you get shot by the guy that landed next to you and got his gun first.Aiming is impossible and since you only get a chance to shoot maybe once each game you can only practice once every 10 minutes. This means you have to play hours and hours before you develop any basic proficiency at the game. Even then you can't get a kill because of the previosly mentioned technical problems.I thought maybe this game would be ok since it had been out for about two years. Wrong again. Don't waste your time. Play something that works.

review: Ah yes PUBG. Or should I call it the massive airsoft arena. Welcome to the game where your hits do not register and the ones that do only deal 20 damage. In this game you should enjoy emptying entire magazines of an M16 on an enemy and see that they become swiss cheese because of all the exaggarated blood effects but then still manage to get killed by him since your bullets didn't register and the ones that did didn't do much damage. But it doesn't only end there! The enemy does ALSO see himself turning into swiss cheese. Basically the player who has 5 ping less than you wins eventhough you saw them first and shot at them first.A game where you can lie down in tall grass or on top of buildings and watch your enemies without any risk. A first person only mode is coming but that is not enough. Either fix the netcode or put a "hardcore mode" where people die faster so the bullets that DO register at least kill the target.They added bullet drop and travel speed to this game so it is "realistic" however the guns are all pea shooters so there goes your realism outside the window.Instead of this generic peashooter game you are better off playing CoD or BF1 softcore mode. At least those games have somewhat better netcode.

review: The game needs some love from developers. The patches almost always mess up the game but are fixed before the new patch comes in and then break again with the new patch. Also there is a high spike in cheaters that use aim bots and wall hacks. Usually you can tell something is up when the player count falls under 30 within 4 minutes. It's hard to recommend the game because it seems like the developer is rushing to make as much money as possible before the game gets over runned with hackers.Update 11/22/2018 The game still needs work compared to other BR. I would just skip it at this point as the developer has no idea what they want to do with the game. ALso they still focus on money(skins boxes) rather then any meaningful improvement.

review: I'm extremely disappointed for this game because it had such an promising premise when it was still in early access when I bought it. The game was unpolished and unoptimized for the most part it was full of cheaters and various bugs/glitches but I was fine with it because it was still in early access.Fast foward to this day and what has changed? Not really much. The game runs a little bit better but its still highly unoptimized. It still has tons of bugs and glitches its filled with cheaters and as a top of the cake the gameplay is still very very unpolished.The only thing that has actually changed with the game is that how greedy Bluehole has become with it. The only progression system in the game is tied to the loot boxes and you need to use real money if you want to open those boxes.To make matters worse Bluehole recently added this "Event Pass" feature to the game that is supposed to add a little bit more progression to the game where you can unlock various cosmetic items. The core idea is cool but the problem with this is that it costs 10$ and you have to "renew" it every 4 weeks or so. As in whole this whole "event pass" is an carbon copy from the Fortnite's Battle Pass feature but its more greedy.I'm not gonna list all the problems that this "Event Pass" has but you can learn more about it from this video https //www.youtube.com/watch?v dKP69TUnQQAOverall I really wish that Bluehole would turn their boat and start focusing fixing and improving their game instead of implementing new methods for milking our wallets dry.Pros + Fun to play with friendsCons Unpolished gameplay Unoptimized Hackers No real progression system to work on Filled with greedy microtransactions 10$ Battle pass every 4 weeks in 30$ game is not tolerable !Do I recommend?No. Do not spend any money on this gamebefore the Bluehole starts to listen feedback because otherwise that money is only going to be wasted.Based on their actions Bluehole doesn't seem to care about their community anymore because they keep implementing more greedier MTXs every month or so while the actual problems with the game is left untouched.Verdict 3/10 Below average
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well i am fully aware of the fact that this game reached the top playing multiplayer game of the current age. But as a multiplayer gamer i cannot recommend this game. Mainly because of the RNG attached with the success of this game. When i died most of the time i died because of bad luck as there were no vehicle spawns or the circle was too far away or it was on an enemy team. If landed on some landmarks which were located in the center most of the times youll die for bad luck as well by not finding any wepon where as your finding one. Camping in this game is hugely favoured as it is safe and rewarding without a good enough scope the last 3 or 4 circle os impossible. And the biggest problem in this game is HACKERS. 20% players in this game uses various types of hacks.So the gist of my review is that this game is bad if you want to have competition and skill based combat. if you just want to have some fun with friends then this game is very good as this will give you some good times. Except those times when youll die miserably by the hands of a hacker or a very lucky person with a better weapon or sight.

review: I've played this game for almost 90 hours. The desync and lag is terrible. Unless you play at off times. You die behind cover constantly. The 'Circle of death' is too fast so you have no chance of outrunning it if you are far away or don't have car. The circle does so much damage towards the later stages of the game that if you don't immediately head for the new circle you're dead. The guns are really nicely detailed but are far too inconsistent to really choose a favorite or superior weapon. My biggest gripe is how the biggest threat in this game is the circle and not the other players. Seems completely backwards to me. At least in H1Z1 you can at least tank some of the gas damage to get to the safe zone. I ve tried full boosting to try to outrun it and you still can t.If they would just fix the servers and desync this game would be amazing but i don't see them doing that anytime soon. I know it's still in early access but i don t feel like that s a good excuse for the constant dying behind cover when your character model is fully behind an object. This game feels like how Overwatch was before they upped the tick rate on the servers from 20. Wait for patches and optimizations for the game before you buy it.

review: As a developer and 3d artist I have to say this game is amature at best it lacks any type of optamizations uses high resources and above all gets a constant game freeze left with message Network Lag Detected at first thought it was network issue. Checked for line jitter 30ms on the highest test 10 or less on average. Then checked upload and down speeds are more than sufficient next checked a ping test while playing and ping test did even better when game dropped maintaining a 80ms relay on average. Next though maybe Anti Virus or firewall so added exclusions to every binary file in the PUBG folder. Then closed out anti virus (Kaspersky) final step changed NAT type from secure to open and still having the same issue. I am more than confident it is not my network or computer not to mention no other network apps drop when I open them or games when I play them.

review: I delayed buying this game for months. I saw their rise to fame their greed their incessant belief that they were the top dogs on the market and anyone who conflicted with them(cough cough Fortnite) had to be taken down...and then all the bad started to leak out. I stayed away from this game knowing all of that not wanting to get involved and preferring to keep my sanity. Then my friend convinced me into buying the game and I dropped into my first match.It was an exhilerating feeling that first round. The high you get that high you want to repeat for round after round. Getting down to the final few winning your first chicken dinner learning the bullet mechanics and what guns you do and don't like what ones to stay away from....that fascination stays with you for a good 60 80 hours of playtime. You meet your first cheater no big deal you knew about them these things happen right? Then you start meeting more of them. First it was one every dozen games then every ten then every six. That number continues to fall until you're almost afraid going third person in NA because you're gonna lose chicken dinner to one guy who autolocks a headshot on your whole squad or fires with no recoil at a 100 meters away.Losing isn't bad losing to cheaters is especially when they recently implemented new anti cheating software that seems to have only allowed the rampant cheating to grow worse. And as the cheating gets set in your mind you start seeing more problems in the game. The way the vehicle physics work how a tiny clump of dirt can stop your vehicle short. Getting stuck in walls the game twitching to make a vehicle fall on you. The parachute getting caught then sending you slamming to the ground and nearly killing you. The lack of grass rendering at certain distances to make sniping wars in fields completely one sided. Queueing in duos or squads on NA and getting a full squad who can't speak any English whatsoever then proceed to kill you if you get anything good. This game could be great and its clear the developers don't care about fixing it rather then throwing more content at us and making as much money off this as possible. Don't buy this. Did I get fun out of my 50 hours or so? Yes and I can still enjoy myself and win chicken dinners. But the hackers and the little things the small issues that have been in this game since LAUNCH and they have chosen NOT to fix will tilt you off the face of the Earth. Save yourself the trouble these devs don't honestly care about you. Just your money. Did I mention keys you have to buy to open some loot crates too? 8)

review: Game is honestly pretty broken. If you look around the internet you can see a considerable number of pretty convincing accounts of improper banning and the fact that they always favor streamers. The biggest problem is how you get banned so easily. Pay $30 for the game and then if your game loads with a glitch and you do not exit and keep playing there is a good chance you will get banned. The issue with the streamers makes sense when you consider the nature of the came next to its sales model. In reality winning in this game is more luck than strategy. It seems like getting in the top 20 players is skill based but getting into the top 10 and then winning is mostly just luck. But in order to motivate people to buy and play the game they have to make it appear that you can win make it look attainable. And this is why I think they let streamers get away with hacking and try so hard to protect them and make them happy. The streamers are the commercials for this game. Overall this is my take I really enjoy playing the game for what it is. I know every time I load in it is a ssmall chance I will win but I enjoy playing with friends getting lucky kills and wasting the time. So if you want to buy this game to win and succeed I would say look elsewhere. But if you have $30 to blow and you enjoy laughing at rediculous buggy incredibly nuanced stuff with a group of friends it may be worth it.

review: As of December 2017 this game still suffers from massive performance issues. Particularly in early game fights weapons are almost impossible to pick up and enemies often only update at about 1hz or so. This is from someone with a high end PC and internet connection who has no trouble running most games.While the test server does improve performance in terms of FPS it causes the game to crash multiple times per session on average. The issues with this game have gone on for too long in my opinion and I can't recommend this game until these are fixed.

review: First This is my first EVER Review of a game.Second I've played this game Every Chance I have and this is just an All Around Greeat game. I've played all the way throguh the Early Access of this game and even played the Test Servers. This is THE FIRST GAME That has ever went from Early Access to Full Lunch on Steam for me. In the Time line that they set All the way too the completion and "They are still working on this game" it has been Amazing. This game Like Many other Game Titles that Are or Have become AAA does have it's ups and Downs. Let's Start with the Cons... As I like to Start with Bad news then End on a Good Note.1 It still Lags when you have a Full 100 Man Lobby. This Stops with in 30 Seconds of Landing...2 You still Run into Hackers I've ran into About 15 my WHOLE TIME PLAYING (Currently Have 290.4 Hours on Record and this will Grow.) Also what AAA Title Doesn't have hackers? AKA Sore Losers who can't win a single game they Play EVER...3 Still Has a few bugs but Not Game Braking.Thats all my complaints.Now Let's Move onto the Pros.1 Love the Gun Play and Gun Sounds.2 Combat can be Fast and intense (Only Game that Really Gets the Adrenaline pumping for me.)3 It's Fun as HELL to play this game with Friends and play it Solo as well.4 The Vehicles in this game (1) Sound Good (2) Feel Right when Driven (3) Seam to be Very well Blanced to One Another.5 The Developers Listen to What 95% of their Community wants. The other 5% Are Either Idiots Cry Babies Or Hackers.6 When The Developers say they are doing something It gets done and NOT HALF !7 It's Priced Well...So Well infact That I went out and Bought it for my Xbox One Yes it's Still $30 there too.8 IT IS NOT PAY TO WIN THANK ING GOD. It Takes Some Skill to earn a win even if RNG Bites you in the In conclusion The Mixed reviews are just that An Opinion Like me or of someone whom had either an Amazing Experience or a Poor One. I Love this game and Can't wait to see what the Devs come up with Next for this game. Don't just Go off of my Opinion or someone elses to see if you will like this game We all Know it's a 100 man Battle Royle and you're not going to win all the time every single day of the week. You need to play it and have your own Experience to Truly form an opinion on this game. Now get out there and Game on!!

review: The game has not one but the worst optimization I have ever seen. The game may be still in alpha but other similar games do run on my computer still when they were in alpha. I can not comment about the gameplay I have to comment only that the graphics do not load and if you do not have a high end pc you wont be available to play the game. To explain my situation I will examplify with other games. Rust is one of them. I had that game since its release. I played it in medium graphics since its release and always had over 60 fps. Same with games like CS GO which I bought last year and others. There are no games that have never run on my computer. Many of you may say your computer is garbage or the game is still in alpha. Thats not an excuse. The game was released over 6 months ago I played this game 3 months ago with a friends account and the game worked perfectly fine graphics loaded seconds after I started playing and my fps were over 50 constantly. The developers just do not care they literally dont give a f*ck about optimization. TL DROnly buy this game if you have a really good pc the game is probably great but is optimized.

review: An incredibly flawed game with performance and lazy developers that take months to fix and update the game. Devs who side with streamers against their own players and run ads on their players after they have paid 30 for the game that isn't even finished. They added loot boxes going against their initial statement and showing us how little they care about their players. They just want to squeeze the money out of the consumers without even having a finished product Siding with streamers their main way of freely advertising their game Adding ads to the Chinese servers/version of the game since almost 50% of PUBG players are Chinese Added loot boxes to generate extra revenue and scratch the gambling addiction gaming is growing in us. Meanwhile over almost one year we are getting a couple of weapons minor fixes a vaulting system and a new map (Remember that a lot of the assets in the first map were bought). Keep in mind that this game already generated hundreds of millions if not billions. PUBG is just using their popularity in an uncontested market getting more money while still not making the game. So essentially you're just giving away your money for a barebones product with slow and greedy developers. This game is envisioned towards casuals that's also why they're porting it over to XBOne to increase their profits with an unfinished game. The 'PUBG genre' needs more games to compete with this one otherwise this game will be milked forever and become another DayZ. For now stick to free to play avoid wasting money on these unfinished garbage and wait until a finished experience gets released. This is no different from EAe and Ubishoft so stop being part of the problem.To boost its popularity they're trying to make this game into an esport which is stupid in its current state It's focused a lot on random elements to be considered truly competitive. This is a casual play with friends type of game that is still enjoyable to watch but not competitive enough to make a scene out of it.By the looks of it Bluehole or PUBG Corporation or whatever it is seems more interested in stopping people from making games similar to theirs essentially cutting competition rather than making their own game better and properly competing against other games. Truly shows how greedy they are.Even after release the gameplay is still broken with major desyncs server lag hitreg issues. You might think it's fun to play with your buddies but you'll soon realise how frustrating it is to die to rng or die to bad hitreg.After the release 2/10. Broken unfinished unplayable. cashgrab.

review: I jumped face first in the battle royale genre with day z mod I loved the idea that you were dropped on an island where almost everyone is your enemy and shoot your way out to survive. Aside the surviving aspects as drinking building or hunger mechanics pubg is just a shorter faster more action punched and a little less tryhard day z where your actual goal is to be the last man standing. At the beggining i was addicted and fell in love with pubg as it had all the aspects of a royale game i was looking for but still it felt like an unfinished game or even a mod to a game. Harsh visuals for the eyes dry textures low tickrates unbalanced weapons that you cant rely on grass is visible at 150m &lt or less so stealth is kidna broken too etc. Many bugs and clankyness deleted the "competitive" aspect of the game as long as you cant really rely on runing behind covers hiding in the grass or just trying to dodge a bullet as you can easily be shot while behind a wall because the server had a hiccup or you can miss a shot as the server had a huccup or you can fall of a cliff cos the server had a hiccup etc etc. Let asside the unwillingness to listen to the community or even respect it's costumers. 30euros game infested with locked lootboxes. I am not a hater of the lootboxes but as i see the game goes on and progresses it's development i clearly see that they are doing their best as they know that their game is dying to milk as much money as the can while they can . Started from nearly 0 locked lootboxes and now they even sell rare and costume cloth sets with a new set like every week or two. They fixed some problems with the stability and the frame rates but the netcode is still trash. They pioneered the fame of a genre they tried to remain the best but they misserable failed to stay relevant accepted that fact and as i stated before instead of listening to the community better the game or even showed some respect to us they just shove in your face their new cases and cloths AND freaking ????battlepasses????? like it's gonna fix my unstable game experience.TL DRAs the game develops it makes it even harder for the consumer to enjoy or want to play it anymore. Every new "feature" is indifferent passive or a new way to milk even more money.As i went forward and experienced other battle royale titles I can say that most of them do things to keep you intrested commited and "reward" you for playing and spending your time in their game. They do their best to be eye appealing bug free and most important fun and not exhausting for the player. They develop and better their games they dont stand idle or even worse do backward steps and destroy what they have firstly managed to build.PSPlease take my review with a grain of saltFiled lawsuit claiming another tittle "copied them" and with the latest patch the "new" reward system is nearly identical with that of title they lawsuited.Irony bipods impertinent to players apathy and struggle for relevance

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a quality Battle Royale style deathmatch that is good but not great. It doesn't add much unique value to the genre but game design at its core is simple which justifies its decent replayability. PROS (+) Good developer players interaction and feedback(+) Graphics quality on Unreal Engine 4(+) Large map and diverse terrains and towns(+) Practical gunplay (+) No microtransactions or premium currency (purely cosmetical and largely irrelevant)(+) Flow of gameplay is decently paced(+) Speed of matchmaking is almost instantaneous NEUTRAL ( ) Customization could have more depth( ) General structure of looting fighting and moving (adds capacity for competitive mechanics but also for repetitive boredom)( ) Loot drops can be inconsistent CONS ( ) Poor use of Battle Points currency (has no intrinsic value or purpose)( ) Requires decent hardware to play effectively( ) Lack of variety in weapon choice( ) Constant server lag and frame rate issues( ) Probably would not recommend duo or squad with randomsThe game is one of the most popular right now with good reason. It sets the standards and expectations for what a Battle Royale game should be. PLAYERUNKNOWN's combines high quality gunplay and brisk/simple game structure to separate itself from the rest of the pack.

review: Somebody finally took the survival genre and skipped the part where they try to pretend it won't just turn into a PvP game. There is no confusion about what your objective is when the game starts. Get in kill everybody else.Unfortunately some people have been using these review boxes to complain about cosmetic only pay to open boxes and their personal beef with the developers. The game is fun. Hands down the game is fun. You don't need to like the people who make something to enjoy the product and if you don't like the idea of paid cosmetic boxes don't buy them! I know I won't but it's not going to make stop enjoying the game with my friends because Bob from accounting spent 100 bucks on sunglasses and tank tops.It is an early access game so there are a few hiccups here and there (and world voice chat on the starting island is ATROCIOUS WOULD RECOMMEND MUTING THAT RIGHT AWAY) but nothing even close to game breaking. Not only would I recommend this game for anybody who likes PvP shooting and open world PvP survival I've bought extra copies to gift out. GOOD FUN!

review: With high negativity circulating PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS at the moment I thought I would throw in my two cents.This game is fun frustrating goofy and rewarding. Each kill feels like you earned it each death feels like you've brought shame upon your family. After playing close to 200 hours I feel im finally able to grasp the layout of the map how each gun works and so on. My rig is heavily outdated running a Gigabyte 660 Ti In order to play this game I have to run all setting on close to the lowest possible so commenting on optimisation and graphical changes is out of the question until I update my hardware. but to say the least even with horrible graphics the gameplay doesn't change that much besides the long distance rendering and not being able to aim at far enemies. After playing for a while it seems you get used to this. Early access means early access When buying this game you agree to the terms and conditions that follow an early access development. You can't simply expect a game to be bug free this early in the alpha. Although it is frustrating getting killed by a ghost car clipping through textures that unexpectadly splattered you all over the walls in the so called "saftey" of a town house for all your hard earned loot you have to expect this kind of poor gameplay from a large scale early access title. Hang on to the game and play it later in the alpha and pre beta when the game has more bug fixes. The devs are obviously working hard to pump out fixes as shown with the 1 5gb updates every odd week. Server issues PUBG has suffered some serious server issues as of late with the the extreme popularity of this game it was only a matter of time. from one million players less than a month ago to 1.5 million last week and a new peak of nearly 1.7 million two days ago it is obvious that the initial servers can't keep up with the huge spike of players. a recent statement from the devs states "First of all we would like to sincerely apologize to everyone for the recent server issues which resulted in long waits and any inconveniences " and " Despite our daily efforts there were some unexpected issues during peak times". Until the upgrade of the servers it seems as though we will have to wait out the issue. More information on the server issues can be found in this article &gt http //playbattlegrounds.com/news/95.pu Even with the recent bad reviews i still enjoy playing this game a lot. I feel it will definitely be worth the wait when the game is finished even if it takes a long time.

review: Amazing Early Access Game. 800+ hours has taught me a few things.1. This is not a co op game people are not your friends.2. When you need a weapon you'll get a crowbar while the guy besides you will get a M416.3. School has taught me I'm not Shroud.4. Physics in this game makes for some great flipping moments.5. Backflipping a motorbike is easier than in real life.6. When I shut my eyes at night I still hear the damn RAIN. 7. The game doesn't have Velociraptors this makes me sad.8. The pan is level 4 you can only receive the Chicken Dinner while wearing one.9. There are 3 categories of equipment for guns. Weapons Ammo and Attachments. You will only find 2 of these categories and it will make you cry.10. There are snakes in this game I recommend good boots when travelling through long grass.11. The gas mask will not help you survive in the blue gas I know it's confusing.12. The map names are wrong. Prison and Shelter should be called Crater and Bunkers. Someone needs to be fired over this naming travesty.The game is good why are you reading this review instead of playing the game.

review: Hands down this is the best battle royal game to date!Pros 1) It's a challenge start to finish. 2) Looting is half the fun3) Games start fast 60 seconds at the most4) Playing with friends is also quick and easy5) There's 3rd person and 1st person modes6) Winning don't come easy. So it makes winning that much more satisfying.7) There's a refresh button on the main menu. So instead of restarting your game do to an issue you just refresh and move on. (Most of the time)Cons1) Driving needs work2) Servers have issues sometimes (restarting the game fixes it most the time)3) Jumping over anything taller then 2 feet is an art form mastered by only the most agile of gamers. (Climbing and vaulting is coming soon)4) More control over the sound would be great5) It's possible to get banned for team killing car horn harassment and stream sniping.Overall the cons will be fixed with patches. No big deal. Some patches will "ruin" the game in the eyes of some people. But that's early access for you. The majority of the negative reviews currently are people complaining about microtransactions. The microtransactions are purely cosmetic. And yes some things you get are camo. But trust me camo conceals absolutely nothing in this game. The ghillie suit is the only thing that helps with concealment and you can only get that from a care package in game. Good luck with that one btw.The only other thing is the banning. Team killing is damn near impossible. You knock someone out before they bleed out and die. So if you team kill you're doing it on purpose. Dude might have deserved it though. Horn harassment and stream sniping is another ridiculous thing. If your driving around laying on the horn you're an a## hole. And the chances of landing in a game with a streamer you just so happen to be watching is impossible. There are no name tags in game and you can't pick a server to play on. I enjoy this game and I get my a## handed to me constantly. But that adds to the fun. Buy the game and try it. Don't listen to the negative cry babies.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I think a lot of the reviews are being a little unfair. If people are getting banned for killing streamers then yeah that is really and needs to stop.HOWEVERThe game itself is pretty entertaining. Mildly frustrating at times but that's usually down to my own incomopetence rather than any fault of the game. You don't have to be the best equipped to win you don't have to be the most skilled with 98 kills to win and using your head a little can easily carry you into the top 10 or 20. Equipment feels well distributed and I haven't had any issues with major bugs which is nice for an early access game. Controller support is decent and the controls make sense out of the box though the game does play a little better with mouse and keyboard as you'd probably expect. Overall 7/10. Its fun and varied enough that most rounds play out differently enough and the game mechanics feel solid. I think the fact the game is based around one mode with somewhat limited features may be a letdown eventually but I got a good two and a half years out of League before getting bored so that's not necessarily the case. Just please don't add crafting.

review: As much as I have enjoyed this games over the many many hours. I can't give it a good review. Let's start with what they got right about the game.Pro's Gunplay The gunplay in this game is so damn good. It feels great when shooting. Super smooth and it feels like it does what a gun should do. Despite some bugs this is probably the strongest part of the game. However this only applies to mid and long range fights. More on CQB later.Multiplayer The ability to play with your friends makes this super enjoyable. Being able to play with 1 3 friends at any time is awesome. Loads of fun and some GREAT memories already.Gameplay Now the gameplay leads to a lot of intense situations like so intense your heart races and your hands shake and even to the point where your heartbeat is the only thing you hear. Also this game allows you to play any type of style that you want. Slow fast aggressive camper. It is wonderful the pace of the game is what makes it so damn good and allows it to capitalize on the intensity of the game. But there are some downsides to it. More later.Dev Team So it seems like the Dev team are super committed to making a full game and servicing it throughout its life. This is wonderful. Also they release regular updates and they do listen to player feedback to an extent.Con's Let's pick back up where we left off Devs Now I almost NEVER bash devs as I know it takes forever to implement fixes and patches and clearly I like them from the above comment. However there are some SERIOUS net code issues within this game. Like seriously bad. These have been there since day one. Let's say the net code one day one was a 2/10. After 6 months is pretty much a 2.2/10. Very little improvement has been made on this front and its gotten to the point to where I play one game and get so titled due to the net code issues. It does baffle me how they haven't made more improvements here. Optimization Riddled with more bugs than a 100 day old dead corpse. It's abysmal how buggy the game is. I have a PC that can run Wither 3 on max settings at 100fps. Why on earth do i struggle so god damn hard to even break 60 on the lowest settings for a game that is 1/10 as graphically advance. Also one of the DUMBEST things ever is when you land somewhere and there is no loot in that building/area so you continue onto the next one and then someone who landed after you had all that gear render and proceeds to shoot you in the back with a gun you never even saw spawn in.Overall this is an incredible game that brings hours and hours of fun to mine and many of my friends lives. However after defending them for months and months about their being seriously persistent issues I have begun to turn against PUBG. The bugs and poor optimization have made this RNG/Strategy based game into almost all RNG. I don't like the fact that one of the most fun games I have ever played will receive a thumbs down from me but I believe it is a deserved one.

review: Gaming has been coming along for a while now and I have been happy to year after year be delighted with new creations and on occasions new genres of gaming. This was such a year not only was I delighted with a first person shooter that feels very realistic and has beautiful eye candy but also a whole new way of playing Battle Royal. Since the release of this title there have been a few others to come forward and right now we can see that this genre is only at the start of its life. Yea! I mention this story here though as I feel this was the game that started the genre and will forever be told in its history in future. best part it's also really good.The game does require strong hardware if you want to win I started on a dated first generation i7 with a graphics card that would stutter on all settings at low(I called it pixel PUBG) but the reward of the experience when you do have a half decent machine is simply wonderful.Built on the Unreal Engine the world content is very beautiful. The shades and textures are a delight and I honestly find it hard to believe that things can get any better than this. Mind you I would have said that nearly 20 years ago with Unreal!There are many areas in which the game can improve but I have no doubt it will. New content creation and bug fixing is something we have all come to expect of titles as a given and surely this will be no execption. The creators have just completed a large round of bug fixing as well as releasing a new map in time for Christmas holiday Vikendi.Simply a superb game that has to be tried. I enjoy titles like CSGO but the scope of the world map is wonderful and makes for more unpredictable play. The visuals are great but the adrenelin is always pumping and that gets may vote every time. Great work PUBG Corporation! Keep the good stuff coming.

review: After roughly 130 hours I'm writing my first review ever of any game. I keep trying to play other games MMOs RTS and other FPS but I keep getting this itch that PUBG can only seem to scratch.First off I don't have a ton of wins less than 10 to be exact due to a few reasons(in my opinion). First the game is still poorly optimized for mid range systems. I shouldnt have to turn all my settings to very low to have a stable framerate when their is visually no difference between very low and ultra at 1080p. This also goes into poor hit detection and server lag that causes your perfectly lined headset to miss and your opponent to shoot you behind a wall they couldnt possibly of seen you behind.Second I love playing duos or squads but the community is indeed very immature and it's hard to find people who won't call you names or just simply rage quit or team kill you for loot. So i play solo.... a lot. Thirdly the game does have a high skill gap. It takes some getting used to the weapon and looting mechanics... when and when not to ADS or when to peek etc.. I died so often because I thought my enemy could'nt see me.Being an old school CS 1.6 competitive player this annoys me.Fourth(which is also kind of like my first) Is random framerate drops during CQC. Ive notcied added 16 more GB of ram and using a SDD while overclocking my 1050ti seemed to help but when you're fighting in a hallway and you're enemy just walks in front and their MUZZLE FLASH droped you to 30 fps from 144fps for seemingly no reason you'd be upset too.All those things aside the game is heading a much better direction than when i first played. I can actually play for one... I win games now. I've met some pretty decent duo partners.I defintely recommend this game if you like shooters if you dont mind a learning curve or dying a lot.

review: Having spent 100 hours in this game (and it would have been a lot more if I had the time) I can say it's one of the most fun and engaging experiences I've ever had. I've seen a lot of bad reviews and I honestly them totally unfair. It's filled with reviews of people that claim low framerates on "high end" machines forgetting that even the with the best hardware there are settings you should tweak to your advantage. Also recently it looks like everyone is comenting on how bad the event pass is. Sure it might not have been such a good idea but let's not forget that unlike other games (yeah I'm talking about Fortnite) PUBG used to solely rely on profit from selling the game itself and from skin crates and other cosmetic items trade. Fortnite on the other hand has a greater playerbase sells event passes skins and all kinds of cosmetics which don't even have a counterpart in PUBG and has been doing so for a long time. Thing is nobody forces you to buy the event passes. After all they offer no actual in game advantage in winning the chicken dinner which is in my opinion what this game is really about and the ways in which you achieve that goal of course.

review: There are so many people that are not recommending this game just because of Chinese hackers. Sure it's definitely a problem but they are already developing a new anti cheat that has banned 1 million cheaters. The problem is going away.Anyways I think the gameplay is incredible. There are so many intense heart pounding moments. It's also a great game to play with your friends becuase you learn to communicate and adapt to the game. There's always that one game that just makes you feel so good inside and some games you want to throw your computer across the room. That happens along with pretty much every other competitive game. The devs have also optimized this game so much since it first came out in early access. They are also really taking their time on new features and things in the game to make sure they can get the quality you would want.Desync is also a pretty big problem and im not sure what they can do to fix it. But I don't think one or two flaws is enough to not recommend this game.

review: 95% of people are overly hypocritical of this game. Yes it has its problems but they are getting better. Most of the people who don t recommend this game all have 300+ hours. If a game is bad enough to where you don t think people should buy it why do you continue to play it?This is an advanced skill based game. Progress comes with time and the more you play the better you get at hitting the longer running shots. It takes longer to master unlike fortnite but the reward in the end is loads more fun. There are a few hackers here and there but the death cam makes it easier to sort them out as well as helps you learn from your mistakes. The game is always improving and the players are getting better.Love this gane to death and highly recommend it to everybody who enjoys open world shooters or exploring games
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This in game is stupid good. It does everything right and gets rid of all the worst parts about DayZ and all related game types. Thirst/Hunger GONE! No tedious pickups only beneficial ones....guns mods bandages and first aid kits gasoline containers....and cars WORK! I like the 'clunky' feeling the occasional person complains about because it's not CoD/Overwatch smooth and twitchy. It takes aim and recoil management.There are occasional bugs of course in 24 hours I've had 4 or so server drops. One hilarious bug where I was trying to jump on crates and got stuck in a permanent falling animation luckily I was able to shoot wildly until someone came over to me ever the more curious and I switched to frag and showed them the error of their peaceful ways.10/10 would murder suicide again. edit Specs I5 4690k 4ghz(oc'd) 16gb 2133mhz ram Msi Gtx1070 Gaming Z (oc'd) 7200rpm HDD (lol). On 4k High settings I'm getting low to mid 30's fps 2k half high half medium I'm getting around 40 42. There are dips in frames but it's not enough to notice or bother me... I do get mostly 60fps on ultra in 1080p but the game looks god awful in comparison.

review: I have super mixed feelings about this game. On one hand it is a very fun very tense battle of survival that is great when it gets down to the last few. Just hiding on a hill waiting for people to duke it out is still as exciting as going in with your whole squad and whiping out a team of three. I love the tense fights where action could happen out of nowhere. The map is fun to explore and there is plenty of fun places to check out. The devs are optimizing well. I used to not be able to run this very well but now I can run it pretty smoothly with a few updates. So now even a few potatos can run this which is nice.On the other hand it's buggy and experiences a lot of what other Early Access titles have. Just go in expecting that. The player base is toxic as hell. Don't try to solo. Don't try to join a duo with strangers. Don't try to squad alone. It's horrible and most people don't speak your language. You might meet a nice kid or two or a cool person willing to grind with you but most often than not you get some person that doesn't know your language and they ruin your fun.It's fun. It's fun and challenging and getting that Chicken Dinner is really rewarding after slogging through a half an hour of tense gunfights. But the playerbase is horrible it's a little buggy (to be expected of course) and now the devs are dropping microtransactions on us.I'm really stuck between really loving it and really hating it and most of the time I'm really hating it.

review: The game is fun if you dont take it too seriously. Creator constantly goes against what he promises or indicates IE not finishing PC early access b4 paid crate launch and announcing work on console edition b4 PC finish. The game can be summed up with accuracy being random selection from an array (even your first stabilized shot prone). which means every shot you fire is subjected to lots of RNG. No I don't mean sway or recoil from firing I mean RNG on the 1st shot. This occurs even at small distances of 100m which is unbelievable considering that is not a far distance for a AR or sniper rifle to fire. Little Recoil during jumping. Zero bullet penetration through most types of material(save doors and windows windows being far from perfect). It encounters a lot of problems when you are overlooking ledges trying to shoot often times your view will be unobstructed( in 1st person and 3rd) but you will still hit a railing or something dumb. Prone is very difficult to pull off near objects or on even slightly uneven terrain as the games collision detection is bad. There is minimal flinch on hit making an encounter progress in the fashion of targets spraying each other down with little regard to cover. There is no slow on hit(temporary or otherwise). Be prepared to shoot some one in the chest 3 5 times and then waste the rest of your clip to confirm the kill as they wriggle on the ground. As of a recent patch an AWP chestshot would not be a 1 hit kill (against targets wearing lvl 2 armor) and this gun is only and rarely obtained in dropped high tier loot crates. You can melee in the game and the damage has been tuned better but do not count on killing a target that is downed with melee as in 1st person or 3rd the accuracy is hot garbage at best. Most of the game revolves around a gimmick of the week or patch. First it was shotguns then it was the vector then the UMP. I imagine the game prolly is worse off for not being on arma but now has a wider appeal with its coding 33 tick servers and now is running on Unreal Engine (yay a small positive).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While I have not personally suffered the developers of this game seem way too ban happy. If a squad member starts killing you and your squad you have to sit back and watch or get banned. Did you honk your car horn near a streamer? Yeah you're banned. This is a combat simulator. Toughen up fruitcake.Additionally we have been informed that weekly and monthly updates are no longer a thing. Although the company claims that this will not affect their dedication I'm not so eaily convinced. I hope I am wrong but my eyes are seeing the beginning of a pretty awful business model.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: i have never gotten a game to 100h so fast in my life. Best game i have ever played I have a good PC so performance is not an issue for me i crash sometimes mostly when my friend throws a stun at me... I have bought this game for 5 of my friends and i will 100% buy this game for consoles later. It has realistic gunplay and good looking graphics many guns and attatchments. And is overall an awesome intense frustrating battle royale game definetly the best of it's genre. i don't recommend buying this game if you don't have a semi high end PC. solos can get boring real quick imo duos and squads are really fun though and if you do not have anyone to play with you can still search duos and squads and get teammates maybe make new friends or maybe new enemies i have found really cool people when being matched with randoms but i have also found some jerks. I would definetly say that this game is worth the 29 99 price tag.The game does not come without flaws though. I used to feel like every update improved the game performance wise but not so much content wise. Now i feel like it is the opposite of that but same amount of content less performance. The early game lag got better at one point but then with the Mini14 monthly update it got worse i got less FPS and more lag i sometimes tend to lag out of my cover leaving me exposed which is very frustrating. When this game is fully released it will probably be the best game ever imo but in it's current state i would give it a 7.5/10

review: I started playing this game around June of '17 which is a year to the month of this review. I enjoyed it at first and the gameplay was exhilarating despite the few bugs but I knew those were just the caveat of an early access game with a moderately small dev team and let it slide. However after about 6 months of this game not getting any real improvements began my gradual decline in enjoyment. Come January the game still has terrible game breaking physics glitches that get me killed every few games. Incorrect bullet registers lack of variety and still no significant patches. I decided to bury the game officially just a month or so ago and uninstalled it for the foreseeable future due not only to my loss of hope that it will be fixed but my realization that it most likely won't be fixed. Now that they've added paid DLC map and Event Pass it's become obvious that they're just going to try and ride the money wave off and cash out however they can. Goodbye PUBG it was nice while it was still in the early stages.

review: Meh game to be honest. I don't know what the fuss is about. The only reason why you should be playing this game is with your friends thanks to the rather unfinished content and rather bland gameplay. However why the hell would you play this game to do that? Talk with them in real life walk with them or something. If you're dead set on computer games say you've got a friend from halfway across the world I bloody bet that a blithering free game can just as well do a similar or even better job than PUBG at providing a good experience for you and your friends. I hated getting dragged into PUBG with some of my lads 'cause the game sucks in my opinion. The map is not at all interesting and have I told you that the gameplay is just as dull? There's no substance to it. Loot shoot loot shoot until you die! It might as well be a Mass Murder Simulator 2017!Also they're not even finished with the bugs and the shady stream sniping banning business and yet they want to port to console... and they want to screw another company over because that company simply replicated the gamemode? Sure if the code was line by line the same as PUBG then we would have a problem but no Player Unknown you're a bit of a hypocrite for labeling your name on top of the word "Battlegrounds " definitely not taking a bit of the H1Z1 formula and claiming to have pioneered the genre. I just thought that this guy may be a bit of an considering how he plasters his very creative username in the title of his game.I'll tell you what take these 30 dollars and spend it on another game.

review: Its a really good game thats about where the good ends. Theres too many cheaters and the development team seems set on doing the absolute minimum they can get away with about it a lot of people say this is over exaggerated but its really not I played 5 games tonight and 3 of them had me killed by cheaters 1 I managed to kill the cheaters and the last there wasn't any cheaters and I won the game. On top of this updates are pushed out into the game that dont work even though they have a test server that people use that would discover these problems and the few updates that do work on release annoy the loud part of the community who then complain and get them removed (examples Weather conditions and Blue zone changes).All in all I still like this game and I will still play it even though I ask why after every game I play even the ones I win. Simply because I like the challenge and I dont like the competition (Despite the fact pubg is trying its hardest to become their competition). Best suggestion buy it play for an hour and make a choice at least you're covered by steam's refund policy then.

review: PUBG is not a bad game... if this is what you're looking for. You drop in try to scavenge whatever you can get your hands on die repeat. There's no persistance between sessions save for the few cosmetics you can unlock. A game can last between a couple minutes (if you manage to land in a very contested area) to around half an hour. You can see action the very first second you touch ground or you can spend the whole match without firing a single bullet.Honestly I tried to get into the game but it's not what I want from a multiplayer game. That being said if you like "battle royale" games this is definitely the best out there. It's just that I can't personally said I enjoyed it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Recently games to me have been bland and just not as appealing as they used to be for me...This game however is a gem its one of those games that you see and turn a blind eye when the beta comes out. A couple of months pass and you hear about the game again whether a mate mentioned it to you or you just saw an ad video livestream etc. You then watch a couple of clips about the game and become instantly hyped about playing the game on release. Now I know this is a early access game but to me this game already feels like a full game of course there are going to be a few bugs &amp glitches but thats to be expected with new games. The devs said that they will be releasing updates monthly to the game. I would also like to mention that there is an actual bullet drop system crazy right? Another aspect i like about this game is the fact that there's an actual learning curve learning how to use the weapons correctly with the zeroing system and being able to become more fluid with the controls in the game to benefit you. So where do we stand?So far i've had so much fun playing this game and hope to play this game for much longer.Price? i dont think its that bad. In my eyes its reasonable for what you get/ will be gettingRecommend? Hell yeah even if you've never gave a game like this a chance before I think you should still give it a shot worst comes to worst and you don't enjoy it you can refund it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game was good extremely enjoyable even but then they absolutely broke the game.Before the microtranscation patch the game in my experience ran flawlessly and I had a great time. In fact I enjoyed it soo much to the point where I sank 90 hours into the game. Then the patch came...Not only has this patch shown that the developers can not make a promise (no paid micro's during EA) it also completely destroyed the stability of the game. As evident for many users constant game breaking freezes and buildings not rendering for certain people completely make the game unplayable in many situations especially since these issues occur extremely often in around 50% of the games I play now. Somehow due to a recent mini patch these freezes have been able to blue screen me something which has not happened for years. Keep in mind that PlayerUnknown himself is making questionable decisions and that the dev's believe that stream sniping deserves bans (it does not as the streamers can fix it themselves). Absolutely disgusting. I will still play the game as I love it but the dev's have become untrustworthy.1.0 Update 300 hours in (Edit on24/12/17)What a dissapointment this was. I have been playing on the PTR (PTS etc) since it came out and I can happily say that the really important problems have not been fixed. Easily the biggest issue is the severe rubber banding that still occurs in every single match I play varying from severe to barely noticable (usually severe). This affects the early gunplay massively as everyone is teleporting around plus it becomes really difficult to loot on a map that is scarce with loot in the large buildings. Additionally your early game foes may not be experiencing the rubber banding absolutely spelling your doom when they find you. In fact this problem has made me begin to despise playing this game as most games cause me to die not from a lack of skill or mistake but the network just ramming me more than the other guy 3 metres in front of me. Furthermore I have begun to hate the new map as they decided to prioritise it to a stupid ratio so its always the new map compared to keeping it balanced with Erangel. How could I possibly enjoy the new map when every experience is downright trash and the good moments only happen when the lag stops? I feel as if this really ruins all of the great things that they added with this release such as the new UI Sounds Replay System Guns and Improved Framerate. The fact that they released the game and didn't fix the rubber banding ed audio (red zone) and directional sound despite the fact that it was in the ptr is just a spit in the face.Edit They seem to be finally addressing the lag.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It is actually a really good game if you have a decent system to run it.I am owner of a Lenovo Legion Y520 gaming laptop and it has a GTX 1050Ti GPU with 4GB of VRAM and i haven't ever experienced a framedrop I always get 70 90FPS.But before you buy this game make sure to get your beaten up properly no matter how good you are with shooting games xD Coz this game is purely skill and nothing else and all the people complaining about not being able to play are the ones who lag this skill.I am myself very new to this game so yeah it'll take some time.And yeah I've not encountered any so called *hacker* in the game as of now.It's overall very enjoyable if you rather play solo or with your friends.I would recommend it definitely.BECAUSE YOU SIMPLY CAN'T TRUST ANYONE JUST BY WHAT THEY POST.That's what i trusted and i am not regretting it. ) Update After spending a couple of hundred hours in the game i can say that not all that is happening in the game and what all the people say about it is true.In the 200 hours i have with the game I HAVE ENCOUNTERED 3 4 HACKERS till now and i'm pretty sure they were chinese !! One thing that is definitely needed in this game is REGION LOCKING yes PLEASE !! Let the chinese people play among themselves and the other countries among themselves.

review: Decent gameplay some things are annoying as far as the way guns work in game but it's a fun time to play with friends.pros lots of laughsSMG's are decentalmost no game is the samebeing updated can be played your way (fast pace/sneaky mode)cons currently buggy at main menu with team if you switch options sometimes teammates cant ready upsome glitches where you can get stuck in corners/wallscars flying/exploding from running into one anothershotgun seems to have too much range without choke (personal con not so much game?)Things that dont count either way as con/proOverall not a bad game can be frustrating as any survival game is after you looted for 10 minutes get geared out and then you die to some random guy laying down by a tree for the last 5 minutes.random loot spawning on top of crates you cannot get to is also a problem feel like maybe they shouldn't spawn of top a 3 layer crate that only can get to by landing on?Game is worth buying and at least trying out for an hour just keep in mind you're probably gonna die a lot as in every game for awhile. Unless you've played ARMA and other titles that are kind of similar to this game. It's frustrating and makes you rage sometimes when you die from some random crap that makes no sense at all. Recommend you play with friends to make this experience that much better!

review: This game might be the most frustrating game I have played and very overrated. Here are some reasons why 1. I suck at the game. This might be one of the biggest reason why this game has been so bad for me. I agreed that if I can play like twitch players this game can be very satisfying to play with. But unfortunately with some level of previous FPS game experience like Cod Battlefield and some causal CSGO I am not good enough to enjoy the game. And that should be fine as long as I can improve and get better. But the learning curve for this game is insane. I have played games that are noobie unfriendly but I have never seen a game that is this punishing for new people. Here are some reasons . There is no matching system. You get into games with people who have played this game for months and maybe with good passive FPS experience.. This game has 0 tutorial it teaches you nothing and everything you learn are from dying and dying. Even the basic aren t so obvious to the new people such as you can t jump out of a car and start shooting right away like what bullet goes to which guns what equipment does what. The game expected you to just somehow know these. Once you have past the basic now you get to the point where there is hidden tricks that impacts the game so much but you never get to learn such as how you should Tap pick everything instead of using the suggested F such as how to drop to ground faster (which I still don t know but you know there is a way because everyone is so much faster than you) how you are not suppose to use the strafe or hold to aim because they are literally useless or how to jump out of windows. Until to this point your games will be miserable and the only participation you have is feed other people like a dummy. I don t understand why this game has to have hidden tricks to level the skill cap like how am I suppose to know to bind my keyboard so I can jump out window how am I suppose to know you can tap W to fly further??? And these details fkin change the game so much that if you don know them you are so done. 2. The battle royale game mode. This game mode is new to me and I feel addicted to this game but it has so many things that nobody speaks of. First you rarely win. If you are an average player you rarely win game. Imagine a game where you win less than 2% of the total game you played (or even worse if you never played FPS before) This is bad but acceptable as long as I can have fun the win doesn t matter. BUT NO out of 98% games you played there is little fun in them. You either spent 20mins to loot and start to do the circle and died without knowing what hits you or you dropped to the popular area and see people who knows the little trick pick faster and drop fast manage to kill an unarmed you. It is either one or another. And I guarantee they aren t fun and very very frustrating. If I play a MOBA or CSGO I know what happened what went wrong and I spent less time get to that point. But this game just punishes you so hard that don t feel like you are learning anything.3. The optimization of this game. This game is poorly optimized that means your computer probably can t run this game smoothly. People with 1080 plays this game in Very Low Setting just so they can have an edge In the FPS. When you are playing with 40 50 FPS you are at a huge disadvantage. I was actually so into this game so I upgraded my PC with a lot of money but in the end this game doesn t deserves.In the end I wouldn t suggest you to not buy this game but if you buy and you are new to this genre expect the following 1. Spent a lot of times exploring the game and get killed countless time before you understand the basic and maybe hidden tricks of this game from youtube.2. Expect to face dilemma which you either face the enemy right away in an unfair fight and die super fast because people drop so much faster and pick things so much faster than you. Or spent times looting places and get killed 20mins later and give everything you looted to other players. Which one ever is more fun for you I usually switch back and forth and close the game in the end wanting to smash something.3. Play with lag. Either the FPS or the Ping that you don t even know of. Sometimes I have to think about why am I playing games. Games suppose to be fun. This is definitely not one of these game. You can get good and rekt other people with enough effort but the road to that point takes more than enduring.

review: This game is WAY too expensive for the state it is in. I could care less about the microtransactions other reviews have focused on however this game is ridden with bugs. When I first bought the game it simply would not launch and I spent 2 hours trying to fix it. After finally getting the game to launch I was able to get into a game. Buildings simply took WAY too long to render resulting in my death from players that could actually get gear. Not to mention the constant stuttering lag and network issues along the way.Don't waste $30 on this game like I did even if you have a friend who wants you to get it.
