review: So to be honest I never really thought I would write a review for this game. But I feel like people hate on this game currently too much. I'm not denying this game has it's flaws but I seriously don't think this game is bad after all.Let's start with the negatives At the moment the game has hard FPS drops. No matter what you have as a graphics card CPU nor any amount of RAM will save you from them. On my medium gaming rig it's ranging from 50 140 FPS. Most of the time during the game it is at 100 140 FPS currently. With weather effects like Rain or Fog that are implemented it can be between 90 120 FPS while at the start of the rounds it mostly is around 50 FPS but after you drop it's mostly no issue at all. I'm playing in 1920 * 1080 resolution with graphics mostly set to medium except for Terrain Distance which is on Ultra for obvious reasons.The UI bugs out quite often. I think about 20% of the time you have to reload it over and over and over again to be able to just start a game. Currently the UI also has the bug that when you're playing Solo it automatically assigns you to an Asian Server for some reason which I find really annoying. It's just a hassle to reconfigure it although it's not hard to do.The banning system of PUBG is somewhat questionable. I heard that some people got banned for stream sniping while others were banned for teamkilling a teamkiller. While the first one is a dickmove they have since stated they reconsider how to proceed with that stuff. However I was never banned for that and I feel the majority of players didn't as well. The second one is an easy thing to circumvent Just don't do it or just play with friends. I know I only play in Squads / Duos with people I know. Otherwise the Single mode is also available.There is also a problem with the game having some questionable choices in the Arena you're playing in. Sometimes it's not clear from where you can really shoot your weapon without shooting a wall / rock / window board or something else in front of you. It happened multiple times to me that I suddenly shot something in front of me I wasn't aware of since I was completely unable to tell there was something obstructing the guns barrel. Those weird design choices are also reflected in the windows of buildings where you can see bars obstructing your view whether you're standing crouching or lying flat on the floor while anyone who sees you standing at the window from the outside can shoot you easily through the gaps. Also those obstructions are unbreakable. It's also rather annoying trying to shoot someone through the staircase railing when you're fighting inside the house. It can happen that you can't hit anything through those gaps while the enemy is perfectly capable to do so. I had it once that I couldn't shoot an enemy with 40 rounds.Sometimes this can also happen in an open field where you empty a whole magazine into an enemy and he doesn't fall over while he just one shots you. Even though you got hitmarkers all over the place for him you sometimes don't hit for whatever reason. The shotguns are currently way to OP capable of killing you as a fully T2 equipped enemy with full health in one shot on a distance of 20 meters and the bullet time is currently non existent. If you shoot an enemy and he shoots you at the same time and you drop first your bullets seem to disappear not hitting the target for some reason.Now you may ask yourself why this review is still recommending this game? It's because that the game is awesome even with those flaws that sometimes make me rage as I can't say this game is bad. Here are just some of the positive things I can say about this game The multiplayer Map is huge and even though you can run around not seeing anyone for 20 minutes straight you're still at the edge of your seat because at some point you will stumble over someone. Whether right at the start in the middle of the game or at the very end. The game makes you feel like you're literally in a warzone right now and one misstep can lead to your demise. In that regard it is also extremely unforgiving which makes it only more exciting. You don't want to lose your loot you scrounged up earlier in the game so you take fewer risks? Or do you want to have some fun and actively seek out fights to risk your own loot but get the option of gaining even more? Always a tough decision to make.Although it literally doesn't make any sense the reduction of the playable area in intervals is making those rounds really interesting. You find yourself on a large scale map where the playable area gets smaller and smaller and smaller. Forcing you to make a move on your enemies and pulling all the players closer to each other. Here it is also a tactical decision you have to make each time you find yourself in a different terrain. Seek out cover and take the slower route? Go over the field and risk getting spotted by your enemies? Stay outside a little and risk low health before encountering an enemy?The weapons in the game handle mostly really well. With the exception for the shotgun which is ridiculously overpowered at the moment. Otherwise all the other weapons seem pretty good to me as they are. Even though I can't recommend the SKS or VSS for personal reasons. In the hands of others they might be useful but I hate those things.The mix of seeking out a droppoint at the start of the game is a tactical decision as well. Places where there is more potential loot more people will drop leading to fights early on for supplies. But dropping somewhere where almost nothing is is making it easier to concentrate on looting alone but you possibly won't have the stuff you need to survive later down the road if you're not really lucky or find more unlooted places along your way.Looting at the beginning is also a great way to ensure some sort of fairness although the Loot Map is currently a bit weird. Sometimes you can find thousands of weapons in one corner of a house while all other houses are empty and sometimes you can't find a weapon for the life of you while the game is drowning you in weapon attachments. Still overall this ensures a certain fairness so that even players that come later into the game have a fair fighting chance instead of you leveling up and unlocking more weapons as you go so you can just choose them at the beginning of the game like other shooters do.The games driving mechanics were a bit clunky at first when I started this game but over time it has certainly improved. Currently the driving mechanics handle rather well and the cars actually behave like they're supposed to most of the time with a few rare over the top exceptions.And now to the last point. Improvements. Even though many gloss over that point and say there is nothing being done to make this game even better the developers are constantly adding stuff to the game. For example the VSS and Mini14 weren't in the game when I bought it. Back then the game was also really poorly optimized so I had FPS of about 40 FPS on average. Now I don't even have to fear drops of that number since I usually get over 100 leaving me with at least 60 most of the time. The developers are also clearly listening to their community and keep in touch even though it broke 15 million sales since they have introduced the First Person Mode after public demand. You still can choose third person mode if you like it better as well. They also added fog to the game which gives it sometimes an even more ominous touch and it makes fun to play in. As far as I know they're even working on different daytimes. They're also adding more to the current map they have outside putting more lootlocations into it so players have more choices. In the future they're also adding an entirely new map with dust storms which will make it only more incredible.So I hope you found this helpful. Since Steam won't let me write more ...

review: I have played H1Z1 and similar games. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG) is a game with a lot of similarities with H1Z1 king of the kill but it is better in most ways.PUBG is a game where you can play solo duo og 3 5man squads you and 99 other players can parachute down from an airplane that crosses the large map when the game starts. Depending on where you chose to land you may have a lot of time to gather weapons armor and equipment before heading into the safe zone or you may have to engage in close quarter shooting shortly after landing if you chose one of the popular landing spots.PUBG is still in early access but is well balanced and well polished it runs well (apart from rare server lags (short durations) and the occasional bug. The gameplay is solid and the replayability is very good even though the map is the same no game is ever the same.Shortly after you land you are notified of a safe zone which appears on your map this safe zone will shrink as time goes by and anyone left outside will slowly lose health until they die this ensures that the game zone gets smaller as there are fewer players remaining and by doing so keeping the game exciting and challenging.Game 9/10 (very good game with well made mechanics)Content 7/10 (still early access there are a lot of guns ingame and a lot of possibilities but more are added every patch)Community 4/10 (there are not many ways to socialize if you play this game alone you will be shot at on sight ingame and the waiting time for the game to start is too low to socialize. A teamfinder tool could help solo players team up but does not exist atm.)Price 7/10 (the game is not cheap but imho it is easily worth the price. if you find this on sale i can see no reason not to buy it. if you think this game is for you and you are considering buying it all full price it is still a good buy.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS Has hands down beaten H1Z1 at being H1Z1 Pros Many weapons. Many vehicles. A huge map that is unique. Good weapon mechanics especially for an early access game. Its already massive fanbase. Unique concepts such as choosing where to land instead of it being random. Gun attachments are amazing. Nice graphics. Cons Very poor optimisation myself with a rather decent PC is getting terrible framerate even at Very Low and for the most part everyone I know who has $1000+ PCs are running at Very Low. Rain. Just destroys your PC. Server issues there are quite a few lag spikes that make the game unplayable at times. From what I have seen it is a tactical advantage to use low settings as most foliage is not visable and players stand out more. Pistols are so underpowered there is no use for them as a side arm unless you cannot find anything else. A rather ugly main menu. Lackluster character customisation. As it stands I give PUBG a solid 8/10 it has made me never touch H1Z1 again. I look forward to the continued development of the game.

review: This game doesn't deserve anywhere near the bad reviews it is getting.IT'S CALLED EARLY ACCESS FOR A REASON. THE GAME ISN'T DONE. YOU WERE WARNED.Personally I've experienced server downtime lag when joining games and diconnections. But you know what? The game is ing fun. The game is hard you can't expect to win even 5% of games just by being around average. But I can't tell you how truly SATISFYING it is when you and your teammates kill the last enemy spraying bullets in every direction but his until you get that one last hit and are awarded the CHICKEN DINNER!!! There is a reason this game has so many concurrent players and it isn't because of the bots going for loot boxes. They wouldn't be valuable if the game weren't amazing already. This game is totally worth more to me than $30 Hell I enjoy it more than any $60 Steam game I've bought.Yeah there are issues but you can see the improvements Bluehole has made. I don't stutter or lag anymore when parachuting and landing. I NEVER get disconnected anymore as long as I'm on a NA server. The game updates such as bulletproof pans motorcycles and my favorite the Mini 14 have all added little quirks and new strats that make the game all more enjoyable. People think Bluehole making a surprise succes will somehow translate into instant improvements on all bad aspects of the game but they're wrong. Hiring 100 more devs into this little Korean company won't instantly magically mean they know how to fix all the bugs or have new ideas to implement into the game well. And we've all seen how fickle gamers can be when an update is added that they don't like. If you bought this game knowing it was in EARLY ACCESS and think you're getting ripped off you're an idiot.Buy this game so I have more fodder to practice my aim on. &gt )EDIT I do have one complaint still. Render distance for things like fauna and structures shouldn't change based on graphic settings since it is a competitive game. I wish I could play on full graphics without being at a serious disadvantage in terms of sight lines.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is FINALLY starting to get it right! This game is finally becoming good! Took a LONG time but it is getting there now.

Do not buy this game basically no matter what. There are now at least 3 options that are superior to PUBG in its genre (BR) in every capacity.

review: Performance is abysmal even after optimising in game settings and adding launch strings.Server side lag and desynch is appalling.The client is absolutely awful ridden with bugs and will randomly dump you to desktop at regular intervals (even though windows key / alt tabbing are disabled).In game UI is terrible with the worst problems being getting stuck in inventory and clicks being 100 200 pixels to the left of where you actually have the cursor.Hit detection is poor and line of sight appears very buggy / rudimentary.There seems to be no compensation for the appalling netcode / server side lag when driving vehicles. If you are travelling at any speed and it resynchs the result most of the time is that the game goes to you laying face down on the ground dead with the text "you have fallen". Becoming airborne even with perfect synch is either a death sentence or instant wreck.There's also the issue of bringing the vehicle to a COMPLETE stop or even rolling back very slightly but then realising that the server was lagging and being presented with a screen showing your body 10 20 metres behind where you thought you were the vehicle smoking against a tree and the text "you ran yourself over". On the other hand occasionally you'll crash or jump out at full speed and sustain no damage whatsoever. There's no consistency.This said as a squad based game there is some potential and fun to be had.As a single player game especially with the terrible server lag and extremely poor directional audio (the worst of any similar game I can remember) it's entirely geared towards camping ... which is incredibly dull and against the spirit of the game.On this note there needs to be an option for randoms to queue up for duo / squad.Avoid at all costs for now. Re evalute in 6 months.People continue to criticise DayZ (rightly) and refuse to play it due to ongoing issues ... but its issues are absolutely nothing compared with what Battlegrounds currently faces and in a massively simpler game using an immensely easier engine to work with.Whether it lives up to any of its potential remains to be seen. For now it's a shadow of the Arma3 mod the core mechanics and netcode of which are light years ahead.

review: What a game this is. For only coming out in March and being an "early access" game it sure has taken off. So far selling 8million copies which is quite crazy. Though when some people look at this and see that it is an early access game they might be turned away because many of us know what happens to many early access games. They never get finished. Anyways the look at this game seem to be quite promising. The developer is constantly working on the game updating it and fixing bugs to make it a better experience. Even though this may seem like a game that is already out there (like H1Z1 KOTH) this is different and offers a more fair and oddly simple/complex gameplay. Anyone can jump in and learn to play. The game teaches you how to play you die you play again you then learn that you must not die. Very simple idea complex on how you play it and what you make it. Here are some of the pro's and con's I have with the game.Pro's Easy to jump in and play Fun to play with a group Well BuiltCon's Controls can be a little odd Optimization is poor right now (obviously it's EA so it will be fixed and i'm not too worried about it)Not too much to complain about as it's a work ijn progress but i'm thrilled to see where this game is going. The dev's are hard at work and making a quite enjoyable experience.

review: Sonic 3D Blast also known as Sonic 3D Flickies' Island in Europe is isometric take on a mix of Sonic platforming serving as a spinoff to the franchise and Flicky collecting'n'leading hot action. It was developed by Travellers Tales and Sonic Team former doing main programmer job while latter came with game design ideas and some more. Well they did want Sonic 3 to be isometric to begin with. Also riding on whole pre rendered trend that went hip with Donkey Kong Country. Published by Sega in 1996 in the West only. 32 Megabit ROM the biggest that Sega Genesis can see at a single time.There also were Saturn and PC versions made near the end of development of this supposed Genesis swan song replacing the cancelled Sonic X Treme. Saturn had improved graphics redbook soundtrack different actual 3D special stages analog input. It's technically the best version. PC version was similar but lacked few graphics and had 2D parody of special stages yet had autosave feature.Sonic Blast on Game Gear is a different game despite fitting in marketing wise.The game that you have here is nothing more than emulation of Sega Genesis version.I don't usually talk about mods but Director's Cut exists and it was made by game's main programmer so it's sorta semi official. None the less back to what Sega gives us there.Now technical part about Sega's emulation here The Sega Classic games that you purchase on Steam count as DLCs for "Sega Mega Drive &amp Genesis Classics" game that should appear in your library.It has Bedroom HUB which is the one with many features yet lags for many and Simply Launcher which lacks Workshop and Online but at least it works just fine for everybody.However Simple Launcher has it's fair share of glitches as well. It can crash. And it does the second time you go to main menu so always quit after saving there so it doesn't crash when you want to save next time!Emulation itself mostly sound isn't that good but it does it's job. Also yes emulator supports quick saves.As alternative you can use external emulator to run games that you purchased. Sega kindly placed in all games that you purchased in "uncompressed ROMs" folder that program itself doesn't use just change file extension to ".bin" or so. The file for this one being "SONIC3D_UE.68K".I also demand you to read digital manual of this game first. You can find it here on store page or go to "manuals" folder of game root and open "S3DB_MG_EFIGS_US.pdf".Robotnik has discovered that Flickies on Flickies's Island can actually travel between dimensions by using huge rings. So he trapped them all in Badnik robots to search for Chaos Emeralds. These robots aren't any different no dimension travel there. Sonic is back here and ready to save em all while his two gang members chill around.The core gameplay keeps the Sonic formula going. You can run around and you can jump. Seeing how it's isometric it has a separate button that you can roll with. Or spindash if standing still. You still defeating enemies by either jumping or rolling. Albeit using slopes by rolling doesn't play a big role here at all these are weak slopes. The controls have some inertia to it pleasently. Too bad Sonic can't immediately turn 180 degrees around he does a small circle. Still uses rings health system where as long as you have any rings you will survive a hit but then you have to recover all the scattered rings.It's a rather forgiving pleasant take on isometric style. You can run in all 8 directions. It hides nothing important behind walls. There are shadows for everything. The floor always has checkered tiles so you can measure borders are clearly defined. While Sonic is a bit too fast the game doesn't require much precision platforming. Well there are few but you can cheese most of them by using nearby spring pad or so. The levels are varied as well some having sorta puzzle elements. Spinning pads are great on the second zone.Protip You can break ice spikes in Diamond Dust by rolling into them.Powerups are back through breakable monitors. Invincibility extra life speed up so on. By the way Sonic icons that aren't in monitors aren't extra lives by medals. Collect 10 of them and you will get a continue. There are shields each giving you extra hit against normal stuff. Blue one is immune electricity red shields protects from fire golden one gives you active ability where you do Protip Get a red shield in a Volcano Valley or die.Each zone has two acts along with a boss one. The first two acts are divided into two three stages. And in each stage you have to save five flickies. That means there are only five badniks in a stage and most of them are static non threats. Not too exciting. At least game somewhat makes up with stage hazards. But the game is still too easy. Then you break those robots and have to grab birds. This is where Flicky inspiration comes in. The birds will follow you in a line and they can be broken off with projectiles after which they scatter around. It worked in Flicky which was a tight 2D game where you constantly get chased by cats you would die if they touch you and simply scatted lines of flickies if they touch those. With risk reward applied as you got score by bringing in bigger lines and that would lead to getting extra lives in a tough game. Here? Not a tight design it's just there. Projectiles may throw birds off but that just happens not something you pay attention to. Collecting birds over lava is pain. There is too much space nothing chasing you. Yea. It's just there just making you spend a bit more time in levels and thus isn't exciting.There is usual optional quest for 7 Chaos Emeralds. Actually they look like Halls candies which would explain why Sonic can't turn into Super Sonic. Super makes games too easy anyway. You do get an extra final boss and good ending however that's good. To get an emerald you must find Tails or Knuckles first just chilling. Both of them appear in each act hiding or appearing somewhere in previous stage once you progress feel free to backtrack. Last appearing in Volcano Valley. It does mean you can get two emeralds per act one from each. You get extra life on repeat. Just give these fams 50 rings. Though they will take and store any amount so don't bump into them.After that you get into a special stage. You run over bridge collect rings and avoid bombs. It looks incredibly smooth the best on Mega Drive. Albeit gameplay is a bit plain and is too easy. Still fun.There are usual bosses. Robotnik every time. Most often you just wait for him to get down and hit him then avoid his stuff repeat. Varied health. Not bad but not too cool.Protip For Volcano Valley boss instead of trying to get into pipes first you should curve your jump off side floor to hit Robotnik then you will be bounced backward onto pipes.Not much options. Just sound test and controls. Bare minimum!As for graphics. Well. They tried to do DKC thing with prerendered sprites because it was still cool albeit 1996 was somewhat late. Which isn't the smartest thing to do on Genesis as compared to SNES it has low amount of colors. Still devs deserve some love for managing to create smooth vibrant world. And fitting intro FMV into Genesis cartridge is just awesome. Too bad that ending is just a bunch of images with text.Music is great too. Chiptune goodness the best from few composers on the project.Overall eh. Mixing Flicky and Sonic is a nice idea as evidenced by game like Wiz'n'Liz albeit that one was only somewhat Flicky. But this isometric execution of it is weak. I still wouldn't call it a bad game. Pick only if you want some chill isometric platformer.

review: This game is hot garbage and will be milked until dead. Once someone comes out with a BR that isn't cartoony bs and they pull it off right (looking at you Battlefield 5) this game is toast.Some of issues that are still plaguing this game as of this review Bullets do not connect with target instead they pass through and hit behind them. lag/ping/network code is garbage adn you'll be killed when you think you made it behind cover becuase on the enemies screen you are still visible. Terrain is screwed up and you can get stuck easily with no way to escape other than killing yourself and either losing the round or hurting your team. vehicles are hot steaming piles of trash. they randomly explode fall through the map flip fly away or get stuck on the smallest pebble. You also take damage touching a vehicle if it is moving even 0.01 km/h regulalry knocking you or killing you. Animations hang or don't play at all often leaving you reloading over and over while the enemy is shooting you. Sometimes you can jump off a four story and take no damage then slide down a four foot hill and die. Player LODs are broken so often when you think you see the player peeking you really don't or they can see you and shoot you but the LOD model isn't visibleat all.Some clarity on some stuff Hacking is still present and prevelant. Less so in FPP than TPP but still there and it's really poisoning the game. * The two main hacks I've run across most in this game are Radar hacks and recoil controller. These make it so that the only way you're going to kill the enemy is that you snipe them from an unknown location and kill them before they see you. Starting a match in a location somewhere that has a lot of people and encountering someone with either of the hacks means you are at such a disadvantage that you might as well cram your kb/m up your a$$ and hope it doesn't comeback out ever so that you're not tempted to ever play this again. The game itself is broken apart from gameplay. Menus don't work the game disconnects constantly or doesn't allow you to connect with your teammates. TOXIC AF

review: I never really write reviews but I thought i'd voice my opinions.I feel like a lot of the criticisms on this game are unfair.It may just be me getting lucky but I've never really encountered a lot of hackers in my games.I think people who complain about lag should stop it (usually) isn't the games fault and for me I get more timeouts in Overwatch than this.I also don't see the huge problem with asains in the NA server yes it shouldn't be a thing but it really shouldn't be a huge point that you get a lot of asians on your team. If you play so much duo that that ruins the game for you buy the game for others or encourage friends to buy the game so they can play with you.Aswell I don't think it's fair to critisize the game on all your " t deaths". Although the game is not always fair I don't find it a problem (other when I die and get salty) enough to downvote the game. Maybe people should come to terms with the fact that they're not that good I did that a while ago and altough it was hard it helps me have a lot more fun.Finally I don't agree with the people who say that the game becomes unfun for two reasons. I personally get bored with a good game that I enjoyed 20 60 hours in. Only a few great games that I have I still find fun after 60+ hours into and it looks like this will be one of them. And it's not like I didn't enjoy those game either I still have fun. Now it may be because I don't play as much video games as *cough cough* some people and I can't relate on the scale that their talking about (200 hours+) but I feel like your setting yourslef up for failure if you think a $35 dollar game will entertain you for 200+ hours.Overall I wouldn't say that this is a perfect game without any flaws because it's not. I couldn't even mention all of them without losing my attention span. But I think the raw enjoyment I've had with this game overpowers that and thats why I think anyone thinking about getting this game should. And remember these are all just my opinions so it could differ from person to person. If you'd like to point out something I missed or got wrong please do so respectivley with a comment on this review.

review: Came back after hearing some major fixes had been applied. At first it felt great responsiveness was up and the server seemed fine and then I had my first mid range encounter... I'm still appalled at how terrible the hit registration and bullet travel works in this game. Found myself still having to lead my target by about 10 meters while the guy is running at a fixed sprint when in reality I wouldn't have to lead them by more than a few inches to a foot at max in real life. Especially when this target is about 20 meters from me. As an avid shooter and veteran I can't get behind how terrible the leading still is in this game. After getting frustrated with that first encounter I had my second encounter in the same game where I managed to dip behind a wall to still be killed by shots that had been fired long after reaching safety.For some additional notes I run a fairly high end rig and have very good internet. My ping/latency usually never spikes beyond 50ms and on average sits around 35ms and in game I sit at a decent 190+ frames. Oh well I'm sure ill come back and try it again at some point but I still can't get behind the way the game operates even after all this time.

review: After putting in 107 hours into this game I can (hopefully) say that this is the best game in recent years running with Rainbow Six Siege for that title. Each round played is awesome i mix of tactics fun terror and epic win moments all wrapped up into a map with 100 desperate people trying to win. Yeah this game is Early Access it's buggy (Duh) and I'm not gonna lie has optimisation. Other than that it's awesome! First person mode is truly a blast but in my opinion 3rd is still better (Until OC servers of course). Solos are relatively fun duos are super neat also but SQUADS is where this great game can become an amazing one. Having intense shootouts with your mates versus some other guys and his mates is the best feeling especially wiping them all out. Please do get this game you won't regret it!Bear

review: Right from the start I got to say this is the best shooter I have ever personally experienced. The game has more potential than I could hope for but as of yet it still remains a potential. There are countless bugs holes flaws and simply annoying things in this game. Throughout the updates of the recent couple months the game added new animations and mechanics such as putting away the weapons when applying meds (tilts me every time I play) completely screwed up the jumping mechanic couple updates ago making you hop in slow motion almost while looking like an Easter bunny. Things like this alongside flipping your vehicle on tiniest bumps often dying if on a bike truly ruin the game experience for me. But none like the new circle mechanic. I have 2 000 games played with about 1 000 hours. But even being as devouted of a player even reaching top 100 two seasons in a row I am seriously considering taking a break from the game until these things are fixed.Recent update servers are garbage desync is beyond belief ping on my local servers is 1500 (and I'm on 100MBps up and down) you get shot behind walls your shots don't register if you drop to school or Yasnaya Polyana the FPS tanks to unplayable. At it present stage the game is broken AF and simply put it sucks. I would not recommend this game to a friend.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I would recommend this game to anyone who plays shooters. Never before has a game gotten me so excited so angry or so blood thirsty as PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds. Game after game I drop off the plane with the same anxiety and pray to find a gun in time to slaughter the nearest enemy and still game after game I get the same adrenaline rush when I find said enemy and paint the ground with their entrails or the rage and defeat when they find me first. If you haven't picked this up and experienced the shock and awe of Battle Royale yet you're just wasting your time reading reviews you could be flying over Erangle deciding whether Sosnovka Military Base or the High School will be the more greusom battle whether the Bunkers seem safe or if Gatka might be far enough from the flight path to give you a chance at survival. It's time to fly drop fight and claim your place at the table with a Winner Winner Chicken Dinner.

Until they declared me a false prophet and beat me down. I once witnessed my friend rolling around in a U.A.Z. blasting Phil Collins In The Air Tonight thru the lobby chat until he came upon an enemy team. He then crashed the vehicle and killed a member of the team. There was so much laughter from both sides they couldnt believe what had happened. I can keep going on funny expeirences but you should just buy the game and make your own. Enjoy!

review: This game is the definitive Battle Royale. It's the one that set the genre and is being copied all over sometimes in a plain shameless way.If you have performance problems don't put everything on "ultra" because the game does feature some advanced and taxing graphical effects. It runs really smoothly on my GTX 970 and even on a Ryzen 5 2400g built in graphics.And regarding all reports of "cheaters" and "desyncs" after having played 100 hours I have never seen one and desyncs are very rare. If you play in european territories you definitely won't have those problems.The guns are amazing. It's the best gun play I see since the STALKER serie. And there's a training ground where you can experiment because it's quite a steep game.And no matches is the same. There's so many parameters and things that can go wrong that you never knows how it's going to end. A lot of fun especially if you play with friends but also in solo.

review: It's kinda hard to recommend it's not for everyone. You really have to sink a good few hours into it to get an idea of how the game plays and how some of the weapons function. This game might have plenty of guns but you aren't gonna be doing a whole lot of shooting. I recommend trying out some of the guns at the starting island. You'll probably suck at it the first few matches but with practice you'll get better. I'd recommend wearing a decent set of headphones whilst playing as it increases your overall awareness. Even something as simple as hearing an enemies footsteps or a door opening can save you. Remember to take off your shoes and close doors behind you. It's also surprising how tense and scary this game can be. Lastly turn off the voice chat. It gets extremely annoying. Overall I enjoy this game haven't had any problems with it yet. Maybe give it a shot and if it isn't your cuppa tea then get a refund.

review: Ive never had so much fun in a Battle Royale game before! For an early access game this game (aside from bugs and some balancing issues) feels worth the money.Pros + Long lasting fun+ Amazing with friends+ Getting kills is always satisfying+ Allows for a lot of different strategies (both good and ridiculous)+ Adrenaline kicks in when the safety zone is tiny and there's still 5 6 people alive+ Loot crates are earned and opened in game purely on playtime and points in game (Yay! No microtransactions....yet)Cons Only 1 map (as of this review apparently will be adding more later) Jumping in this game is awful Some loot is super common whereas others are too rare Bugs and crashes happen a fair bit on older rigs for sureOverall 8/10 worth $30 because it's very replayable

review: PUBG precisely the market leader for games rnReview Firstly i'd like to say that the game is not as much fun without friends you can indeed do a Fill search where u get matched up with random people and have a good chance of making a few friends but overall playing Duos and Squads and Events is a lot more fun than Solo although solo isnt bad.I find the Cons of solo to be Quite a lot of running could get slightly boring alone. Too many campers hiding relentlessly. Quite a long game and you could die almost instantly though rewarding to win can be frustating sometimes. Minor things not too much. Secondly on the gameplay's part the game is hyper realistic. There is bullet drop realistic car in respect that cars can blow up easily and it isnt impossible to shoot through car windows also the cars have fuel. As for Ammo there are various types and the inventory arrangement is something you rather learn overtime the way i learned how to play in basics was by watching guides for beginners helped out a LOT. The weapon attachments are quite differing to range and that makes you the decision maker for how you want to play your style. There are a number of ways you can play according to your style whether be sniper ambush camper(Though Undesirable by other players can prove useful sometimes Con Leads to a slow and boring game from your perspective) assaulter rusher (The kind who generally dies easily unless played very carefully).One thing I'd like to remind you when you're gonna buy the game is that theres TPP and FPP Third person and First person now if youre playing first person its a hard chance that youll get jumped on out of nowhere as in third person you can look without actually peeking your character in enemy sight.Strafing Useful to dodge sometimes peeking corners overall it doesnt have too much usage but when in corner Tree to Tree fights or from cover it is very useful.That pretty much wraps it up if you have enjoyed games like Rainbow Six Seige Battlefield Counter Strike this could be your new jam )Overall Review 9.5/10PS Dont worry about servers lag isnt a big problem Yes can get small spikes here and there when picking up items but generally not a problem.

review: This game was fun when it was released. I had played the Arma2 BattleRoyale and Arma3 BattleRoyale for a long time before picking up PUBG. The problem now lies with the rampant amount of hackers. Playing for 4 hours did not come across a game without hackers. The in game reporting feature doesn't do anything and they request you report on the forums with evidence. Trying to report on the forums means I spend more time policing their servers for them than playing the game I PAID for. Bluehole does not comment on the amount of hacking in their game and rely on battle eye's comment with random ban numbers that can't be verified which are only fractions of a percent of game sales.PUBG has turned into what happened to DayZ. It became the most popular game only to have the game so completely ruined by hackers that the playerbase is leaving.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If you haven't heard of this game already you must have either been living under a rock or you are not a gamer. This game is fun for a while but like anything it can get stale. I find it way more fun to play in squads with friends but solo can be fun sometimes. Hopefully the devs continue to update this game and make it better. The Sanhok map is a step in the right direction imo. The other maps are a bit too big and a lot of times you end up running/driving across the whole map without seeing a single player. The smaller Sanhok map fixes this by making all the major loot areas close enough to each other that once you clear out your drop area you can move to the next area and have people to fight. So it gives a good pace of looting and shooting. A lot of people their pants over the competitor to this game Fortnite. Imo Fortnite is a stupid cartoon baby game compared to this. I don't like the art style it seems so goofy and casual. Plus with it being free you know everyone's little brother is on there spamming dead memes into their mics with prepubescent nails on a chalkboard voices. I know a lot of "pro gamers" play Fortnite and that's fine but it doesnt change my opinion that it isnt for me. My advice play this game if you want to play a real man's BR and leave Fork Knife for the kids.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Honestly would lovet his game if it wasn't such a laggy hacker infested micro transaction piece of crap. The concept and style of the game is all great but it's like they don't know how to do anything else right. They took months to reset the server to be playable and i dont think they've even started banning the hackers. The loot system for boxes is just stupid you have to pay in game money for the boxes which u get at random you don't get to pick which ones you want. and the one with the only really cool clothing requires a key that costs 2.50 so not only are you paying in game for boxes you get at random you also have to pay real money for a key and you only can get so many boxes a week. Why? what if i have enough for the boxes why limit how many i can get? Their servers are just laggy pieces of crap everytime i land the first 20 seconds of the game i pretty much can't move so i can't make any drops to high poplulated areas and i still rubber band and not let's not forget about all the dam bugs they need to fix that they've honestly had so much time to do. driving through open fields and hitting nothing causing ur car to flip and randomly blow up getting you killed. or when your shots don't register i've shot people so many times in the head and i watch my bullet travel right through and nothing. I would not reccomand anyone waste their money paying for this crappy game it's just gonna you off and make you want your money back. They don't listen to the community and im just waiting for someone to figure out how to make a game like theirs just better cause they will actually hear what their community wants from the game. The fact that this game was still dealing with all the issues it was and they were still trying to host esports tournaments is just sad. They are only want money and don't care about their community. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IS IS CRAP.

review: There is 2 things I absolutely hate of this game and that in my opinion make it unplayable This game is way toooo slow it doesn't matter if you like action or want to play sensible you are likely to spend a lot of time doing nothing if you like action you will probably die a lot and this game does not have a quick way to get you back in you die you wait until you are in the main screen again you select start again you wait in the lobby again you jump of the plane again etc...Then you jump somewhere where you know you will have a fight and if you die after play for 2 minutes you have to go all over again I wish this game had a quick system where as soon as you die it just fill a plane with 100 people and you are ready to go in a few seconds (the number of players is enough to do so).If you play sensible and go to somewhere quiet to get some equipment you will probably just wander around until the circle is small enough to have you encountering other player and that take ages!2 things that would make me love this game is smaller maps and faster ways to put you back in the game I'm definetely hoping that in the new battle royales that are about to come this year they solved those problems.

review: I have found this game to be fun and highly addicting lately (I'm one of the few that has left Fortnite and came here) even with its many flaws. In this review I will address some of the good and bad things I've seen in this game. This is my 100% honest opinion of the game at its current point.Main Pros 1.) I have never seen a cheater (not even once). I play split between TPP and FPP and I have never seen anyone hacking in either of them. When cheating is addressed and exaggerated by anyone who reviews this game they either are very unlucky to come across a hacker or they're lying just to lower ratings of the game.2.) The looting system is well done and I see it as one of the better systems out there. Back in the H1Z1 days I found myself stumbling around the looting and finding that even when I'd drag something DIRECTLY over the slot it wouldn't detect my actions. In PUBG it is very negotiable with how you loot (opening the inventory or picking up) and it is highly responsive to dragging items.Main Cons 1.) This goes directly to BlueHole please start to give a about your community... Do you not see that you're game still has and had potential?!? This whole lawsuit wouldn't be necessary at all if you just took a step up and won your community back! The reason Fortnite is succeeding is because Epic is so good at listening to critisism or obtaining new ideas from their community! it seems that the more you do to prevent other BR games' success the deeper a whole you're digginmg for yourself. This is my biggest issue with the game it's representatives.2.) Hit detection is one of the biggest flaws with this game. It is the sole reason (other than RNG) that makes me rage the most. Deadass I've hit a pebble on Miramar and my entire ing pickup truck flipped for around a minute resulting in me losing the game for no reason. This is an easy problem with an easy solution the problewm with this is IT ISN'T BEING FIXED STILL!!! If the devs come to their senses maybe when Sanhok releases they can fix some of the vehicle/player hitboxes as well.Conclusion This is a great game it always has been but BlueHole needs to straight up admit their wrong doings and pick their heads up off the floor. This game isn't dead yet but it will be if the right moves aren't made for this game soon. I beleive in it and I hope BlueHole can make the right descisions toward saving it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Before i Proceed with the review i would like to address i DO NOT approve of Bans being brought apon people who have killed streamers and then get banned for "stream sniping". I do however approve of them banning streamers who are Breaking rules and thinking because they are streamers that they will just get a slap on the wrist. Since that is over with lets get onto the actual review.I feel after 300 hours this game is Repeatedly enjoyable the endless possibilities of this game make it a fun experience for enjoyers of the "Unknown". The Devs actually work on this game constantly unlike its Counterpart H1Z1 and care about the state of the game. They add new interesting ways for the game to be played like the Rain where you're hearing is less reliable in close quarters and makes things harder to see in darker areas (atleast for me). Then the newly added Fog Weather affect that makes the game a more Close Medium ranged focused game. Weapon wise they are doing in my opinion doing a good job at keeping them Reasonably balanced. Playing Solo/duo/Squads all offer a unique experience where ur either relying on yourself or teamwork to achieve a win.Also this game is only 30 bucks compared to 60 dollar AAA games where its only about money with the devs and not making a quality productAltho there has been a microtransaction sort of thing in this game Pubg doesnt rely on them and focus on them like Csgo and h1z1 heavily relies on them it doesnt add "Pay to win" outfits that gives the enemy an advantage. The driving for me can be a little weird at times but atleast ur car doesnt burst into flames after a small crash or rollover. But what is a game like this without some weird Vehicle physics that at times make no sense but can add a new aspect to the fun of the game. Also u can do tricks on a bike which is pretty Rad.Now to talk about the more bad things. I feel the game is pretty not the most optimized game in the bunch but for me it works fine.The planes are levels of loud never thought possible. Ctrl+M default to mute master volume while u take ur travel aboard the Loudest C 130 In the world.The fact that we can't make our own custom games without a partner ship is a disappointment but im sure thats bound to change when the game comes out in full release.In game all chat is pretty ing awful and home to open mic equivilent of /pol/ users. Can mute with Ctrl+TOverall i would recommend this game being the fact that its 30 bucks it has its flaws but it still in early access so u will see some of those going away and some new ones arising. I love playing this game with either serious players who make people accuse them of hacking cause they probably spend to much time raiding po i/school or casual goofballs who like running people over and honking their horns. There is a reason this game has sold over 10 million copies and with the xbox release coming and out of early access i bet it could even sell another 10 million.

review: VERY GOOD GAME. Even tho its in early access its pretty good. It is a very good game but for low budget pc's you will not be happy with the fps/outcome. But for high budget pc's its insanly good. I have a gtx 1050 ti 4gb and i play on all very low 1080p and i get around 80+ fps. Now for the cons. Their are so much glitches. When you reload the shotgun it could sometimes keep making the reload sound and reload animation aeven if you switch guns. The people who made this game are adding guns and different types of weather and not focusing on the fps drops and the server issues al all. They are also adding more cars. ITS NOT LIKE H1 IN A WAY. What i mean is if you ever played h1 and jumped out of a car while driving fast your would know you font die. But in PlayerUnknown BattleGrounds if you are driving fast and jump out you will die instantly Even if your are going slow you will still take damage. ALSO BUY THE GAME NOW BECUASE IT WILL BE MORE EXPENSIVE WHEN THE FULL GAME COMES OUT BUT I DONT THINK IT WILL COME OUT OF BETA/ALPHA/EARLY ACCESS BECAUSE H1 HAS NOT EVEN COME OUT OF BETTA/EARLY ACCESS/ALPHA.

review: My thoughts after PC Update 1.0 compared to the earlier builds of this game (Early Access) Framerate has vastly improved. I average over 110fps with Texture/AA on Ultra and everything else on medium. (i7 2600k/980ti/16gb RAM) Overall lag has reduced Replay system is convenient esp. if you're not a content creator or don't use recording software (Can view replays of up to the last 20 matches played) Redesigned lobby and lobby/system UI There are now 2 maps that are randomly selected (new desert themed map) Vaulting (not clunky and feels great) Driving physics improvements (Driving offroad is noticeably different and imo enjoyable and adds to the imersion) There is now a Deathcam feature Weapon &amp Ballistics improvements Elements of UI has been drastically improved. HUD/UI/Minimap have all been redesigned. Slight improvement of detail on weapon thumbnailsWhile this BR has been in the rough for quite some time after this patch it has definitely been a great overall improvement. There are some glaring issues though such as running into hackers occasionally (I've only ran into a few hackers with my +500 hours of playing and from what I'm noticing it seems more common in TPP mode) low tick rate on servers and the lack of region lock. Although those issues sound signifant the game is overall stable and I still recommend this game (even at full price) especially if you have some friends to play with.

review: It's a very interesting concept but the game is not that fun. Here's how most games go Spend 15 minutes looting. Sometimes you find some really good stuff sometimes not. You're eventually forced to relocate and you get shot and killed by someone you never see. The game is basically camping as much as you can and then using good strategy when you're forced to relocate. In most games it comes down to who is lucky enough to not need to relocate. Combined with the random loot there is way too much luck involved for this to be a good competitive multiplayer game. Since each game has 100 players and only one person wins you are going to lose most games. This is different from two team games where you will win about half of the time. This makes winning feel so much better but losing 30 times in a row isn't much fun. There are squad modes where you can play in teams of two or four. These are more fun but I don't think it overcomes the other downsides. The biggest problem I have with this game though is the netcode and/or server speed. It has been proven to be worse than any other current competitive multiplayer game. CSGO players often complain about the 64 tick rate (updates per second) but this game has 8 which would be considered unplayable in CSGO. In PUBG bullets take time to reach their target and drop based on distance. Combined with the bad netcode/servers it makes it nearly impossible to land shots. Even shots at someone right in front of you will miss. The best thing I can say about this game is that it's only $30.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: What is it with unfinished video games being marketed as full products these days?PlayerUnpolished's NetcodeGrounds is a teambased crate simulator that claims to be "the ultimate battle royale experience" or whatever and should be considered a very rough open beta at the very best. As far as this battle royale fad goes I have to admit that as much as I detest the game Fortnite does it leagues above PUBeG. In fact anything else does something better than this game.Do you want a hardcore team based shooter that's unforgiving yet reasonable (with less but still present netcode issues)? Try Rainbow 6 Siege.Do you want an open world to explore at your own leisure and shoot up with your friends with tight gunplay better performance and incredible visual fidelity? Try Grand Theft Auto 5.Do you absolutely insist on playing this ridiculously overplayed trite genre but have an ounce of self respect and value it with more than just your left toe? I dunno man there are plenty of alternatives and I can guarantee they're a damn sight better than this.In closing I'm so very glad a friend bought this for me so I didn't have to give BlueWaffle Hole a single penny...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is one of the most ambitious and promising games right now! The gameplay and atmosphere is like no other game out right now perfect!Its problems however are way too distracting to recommend at this time. The optimisation is bad to say the least and thats its biggest problem at the moment.The UI can be a little better and there should be more to do outside of the main game (costomization leveling modes etc) but thats something that can be added later im hoping right now the optimisation NEEDS to be fixed because its setting the game back way too much. One more thing im hoping that this is the game that keeps its promise and doesnt stay "early access" forever just so it has an excuse to not be worth peoples money. If they keep it and they are out of early access fix the lag and add just a bit more content this is going to be game of the year for sure!

review: The idea behind the game is pretty cool but gets old fast. There are often moments where you randomly get killed by people you don't even know where are shooting from and moments in which you lose time waiting for someone to pass close to you and who probably will never know from where you shot him. Besides if you can't wait anymore and decide to leave your safe spot you get ista killed with headshot from 3 different guys who were actually camping the buildings nearby. The game is still a work in progress but right now for many people it has problems which make it almost unplayable like huge drops in fps and very long texture loading time that forced me to wait many times for the door to load before i could enter the building. People obviously will kill you while you wait for it to load. In my opinion the game feels boring already after 9 hours of gameplay. Anyways if they manage to fix all the technical issues it may still be a decent game. A game for campers.

review: Best 30 euros spent. /sThis game excels at sucking big time like for real.You think a game that is played by millions of people must be good right?No this game is pure where do i begin?Optimization its more than an year that this pice of garbage is out and it can still has low framerate at the lowest settings with a gtx970/i5 4690k/16gb ddr3. Even if you had a beastly rig you would still experience heavy stutters and random crashes.But dev must have been doing something about it right? yeah they released a mobile version and a xbox version that is even less optimized its a joke 3/10 Makes my rig look like a dishwasherGameplayWasn't sure wheter to include this in optimization or not you would wonder why well... because apparently bad optimization gives gameplay features... yeah! first of all i've never heard of a game introducing a feature like 'vaulting'It's like a dev told you in his next big game presentation that his title will have a huge feature called 'walking'.like wtf? you must be out of your mind to see that as an 'improvement' of the game its a necessary feature for the type of game but it was added half a year after the game's release and not only it came late it was now we need to talk first how they removed the third person fov .ini fix because it introduced 'unfair advantages' instead of introducing a 3rd person fov slider that wouldnt make it unfair since everyone could use it. now with vaulting in certain spots you can make you character climb trough floors or walls and see trough thats definitely a fair advantage! you want to know what else is a fair advantage? the game not loading textures! so you can go trough walls and see trough walls like there were none to begin with (and this was with tha game installed on ssd)3/10 phew phew shoot at enemies that don't see you wowNetworkWorse than optimization and trust me that's alot to say. The server's thickrate is a total joke lag compensation doesnt even exist you can't get to know how much ping you are getting because there's no actual way to know in game you need to go to third party sites to see it there's a huge amount of dsnyc and you can't even be sure you have actually hit an enemy from the blood splatters because if there's dsync in place your enemy might just still be full healt... a total joke 1/10 the worst i've ever seen they're not even trying hereSoundWhat sound? directional sound is non existent you might aswell play with your head in a oven over at your kitchen and still get the same informations that you would get by playing the game with a decent headset in your room without any noise. If you happen to hear anything you still won't be able to pin point the direction from which the bullet came from and you will look like an idiot taking cover from the wrong side like a pack of ing fruit now just think about how's it like to be shot from a suppressed weapon you litterally have no chance especially if the game forces you to go trough an open field. Oh and because the core feature of the game is to be 'realism oriented' you don't get any information by the ui from where you got hit because ofc if you get hit in your by a bullet you still wonder if the bullet was shot from the side or in front of you right? /s4/10 Tries to be annoying more than it tries to be realistic (i said realistic not good it doesnt even try to be any good)MovementIn this game you roleplay a blind drunk slug it litterally feels like that there's a ing delay for everything you want to open a door while you're being shot? ok sure just wait a couple seconds wait for the slow animation you try to walk in.. hit the door you character looses momentum and you have to wait for a total of 3 seconds to enter a door (yeah there is momentum in this game you can't just press W and walk that would be to easy! what were you thinking? nono you have to wait that that slug of your character actually initiates the animation and starts moving) and this is whitout dsync if there's any well then you might aswell play ping pong with the door because the game starts to register every imput you gave before opening the door so the door will open and then close again very funny indeed especially when you need to move fast to save a teammate. Same goes for jumping ostacles if you run full speed and jump something and hit it with your thumb's nail you get bounced back lose momentum you have to walk back get momentum and try again.1/10 just because you can movePlayerbaseYou got any problem? it's not tha game's fault! it's you! i have a gtx 550 4gigs of ram and an i3 800 and i get steady 100 frames! Game's pefect bruh!5/10 Atleast it has a playerbaseAvarage gameYou queue up for first person (beacuse you get motion sickness for the low fov in third person matches)Get in a lobby and hear ppl screaming out lout You mute everyoneThey still start shooting the hell out of everything they find just to make some noiseYou wanna get on top of something just to play around or to get away from noise12 year old kid stops you from doing that by bodyblocking youGame startsYou pick a spot where to landYou land with other 3 pplyou see them picking up weaponsyou change house to lootonly finds stocks scopes bendages smokes dresses.9/10 mathces end here without you even shooting a bullet1/10 you manage run awayfind a pistolin 10 minutes you MIGHT make it out with a couple kill and decent lootyou run for the circlerunrunrunRunning simulator 2018you hear 'phew phew phew'you get hittry to guess the enemy's position by the sound of the shotsyou realize you can'tcoverwrong side get hittry again rotate coverstill get hittry again rotate coverthis time you go prone and start healingstill get hitdead 30 minutes walking around like pepsi mannice game

In my perspective PUBG feels like a new and fresh take on multiplayer which is fantastic. Of course disclaimer the greedy ers had to go and throw microtransactions in the form of loot boxes into an unfinished game in early access AFTER promising that they would not do that very thing! With most any other game that would tank my review immediately as that is about as anti consumer as you could possibly be but its a testament to how good PUBG is that I still feel that the game deserves a positive review after the it throws. Just... maybe don't trust the good times to last too long the game looks more and more like it is going to turn into the flaming pile of that is CS GO. But who cares about tomorrow?

review: Use a friend's account because you can't afford the game yet.Drop. Die. Repeat.Drop. Loot a body. Die. Repeat.Drop. Loot get four kills get awesome loot form their bodies get blown up by Redzone. Repeat.Drop. Loot. Nine kills in quick succesion. Another four kills over the course of the round. Naded and second place. Repeat.Drop. Crash. Repeat.Drop. Loot. Air drop? Near me? Loot it AWM 15x scope. Get 19 kills first Chicken Dinner. Feeling hyped. Repeat.Drop. Get punched to death. Repeat.Drop. Find a vehicle. Run over a guy loot his AKM. Take that AKM to your second Chicken Dinner only killing the last guy. Repeat.Try Squads out with friends get ed because they rush into fights and die fast instead of playing it out.Back to Solo.Drop. Loot barely sitting with only a Vector and a P92. No kills the entire game but get the zone circles lucky on you. Get another Chicken Dinner as the second to last nades himself. Repeat.Drop. Loot. Look at the time its 3am. Get two kills of the bat but get run over by a guy in a buggy falling from the sky after a long jump. Repeat.Drop. Loot. Top ten with no kills.Time to take a break for the night.Next day same general stuff this continues from March to June when you buy the game for yourself from someone's old VAC banned account (in CSGO) for cheaper.Close to 1000 hours in PUBG start playing on and off as College starts and eventually get a second account gifted to you for your birthday.Same thing every time I play Drop. Loot. Kill a few top ten. Repeat.PUBG's Desert Map Miramar is released on their Test servers. Get back into the game and start playing intensely getting a few Chicken Dinenrs here and there.Get some more time in enjoy it all the way until the release of 1.0 early this morning.Drop. Loot. Die in top ten. Repeat.

review: Product received for free. (KEEP IN MIND THAT ALL MY OTHER HOURS ARE IN MY SECOND ACCOUNT SO DONT START TO CRITISIZE ME JUST BY MY HOURS. I HAVE 327 HOURS IN THAT ACCOUNT.)Well to start off this is a pretty good game. But just like other games this game has pros and cons too. So lets begin.When i first bought this game i initially thought that this will barely be able to work on my pc. Fortunately i got solid 60 fps. The gameplay is decent. It is hard and made for those who think that they are pros in FPS Games. But this game has crazy bugs. Sometimes it happens that when i land my parachute stays open and wouldnt close. The driving physics are terrible. They lack the modern day physics. There many more bugs that i have noticed in this game which were minor. The servers are broken all the time. It disconnects me majority of the time even tho i have good internet and ping. Next are the hackers. They are literally unstoppable. Either they finish the server or they freeze it etc. They do all kinds of stuff with their hacks. This just ruins the game.Overall i would rate this game 4/10.

review: If you are the kind of person who enjoys finding a nice corner in all FPS games and living your days out waiting for a couple of people to walk by in one game then you will love this game. I very much dislike this game because that is how this game plays if you play solo 90% of the time. This game is extremely slow paced if you are looking to win a game and there will be too many times where you will have absolutely no clue where you died from when you make it into the top 30. I would honestly recommend this game if you can always play this game with friends because solo is just a slow paced show. Playing this game solo just feels like a waste of time especially if you want to win because you will spend 40 minutes seeing maybe like 5 people and it will likely end with you having no clue where you are being shot from and then lose in the top 30 with only 3 kills and that you spent that much time in one game just to have absolutely no clue where the guy shooting you is at. If you are lucky you will drop in the center of the safe zone where you will then spend about 10 minutes looting and then the remaining 40 minutes in one room waiting for people to come to you and you'll still be lucky to see 5 people the entire damn game. Again if you enjoy almost no action (in solo) and enjoy games where 90% of the game nothing happens and enjoy having no clue where you die from in the end then you will probably love this game. I can see the appeal of this game but atleast in solo I cannot find enjoyment in a game where NOTHING happens.

review: Got 15 hours into CBT and I was really pleased with the gameplay. Gunplay is amazing and responsive the hit reg is on point. Performance wise I tought the game would be more optimized on EA launch. But considering it's launch day the servers work really great. Im getting constant 70+ fps some areas I get all up to 110+ fps ( changes back and forth 70 100 ) so after a few months I look forward to that steady 144. Textures on ultra effects on low and everything else was on very low.All in all i'm very satisfied with the game and highly recommend it for anyone who are looking for a solid shooter game. This game has a bright and positive future. Player Unknown aka Brendan is a amazing developer!Specs i7 6700k 4.0GHz GTX 1080 8GB OC 32GB DDR4 2666MHz RAM.

review: Cheaters LOTS of cheaters. Lag in every server it doesn't matter what region you live in you WILL lag. No exceptions. Which brings me to my next point. Chinese ping abusers who deliberately join NA servers because it makes their ping so high that they are almost impossible to hit and impossible for them not to hit you due to THE LAG Loot spawns almost everywhere are almost all absolutely f(ri)cked and vehicle spawns may have 20 vehicles in 1 place and none throughout the entire map Extremely unreliable anti cheat Toxic community that is worse than CS at some times (good thing you separate from all of them right when the match starts right?) Miramar. Just Miramar. The map itself is one big flaw. It's too huge and is extremely difficult to solo on so if you have no friends watch out for this map (regarding the fact that theres only two maps just watch out for the darned game itself)overall yeah dont spend $30 on this game go buy something else unless you have like a lot of friends who play it then yeah do it because if you squad up you might actually have a good timebut if youre an absolute loner no dont im warning you you WILL regret spending money on this game

review: The game itself is actually very fun and its just one of those games that actually make you feel... alive. Thats what really makes it pop out from other games because out of all the games that i play its the only one that can really make me be scared and nervous and its just so awesome to feel this while playing. Im afraid tho that the game is still in beta (you can buy it but its not 100% finished yet) and because of that the ammount of bugs is pretty big. But the main problem about it is the fact that the optimization is horrible. Even people with modern rigs cant seem to run this game like they should be able to. I personally get less fps drops in GTA 5 than in PUBG. It isnt really fair to compare them since one of them has been out for quite a few years now and PUBG isnt even realeased yet but its just for you to have an idea.Basically if you dont have a good pc and dont want to have to go thru bugs and stuff i would recommend for you to buy the game once its realeased. I really think the game has a lot of potential to be one of the greatest games out there but it still has alot to go thorugh.8/10 (Just because its in beta and there optimization is pretty bad)

review: 4 out of 5 Stars. Game is awesome... a few tweeks will make this a Game of the Year contender... more maps maybe different eco zones... also make motion a little more fluid... more gear to buy and drop... and stop the crashing and network lag when lots of people drop in same place... overall incredible job keep fine tuning and listening to your fans... it is turning out to be a great game!!!***UPDATE***The game has gotten way better than I could have expected. With the addition of new maps Mirmar and Sanhok the game has propeled to new heights. I have sunk hundreds of hours into this game and feel hands down this is the best battle royale out for my style and taste. I say this because of the battle royale genre this is the most realistic version of a combat shooter out. Fortnite and others that are in this arena aren't the same. I'm not going to get into the whole PUBG? Fortnite? and who's best? Plain and simple a battle royale is a battle royale. Last man standing wins. So can't base it as whos the best BRG? Instead you can only say which game style do you prefer? Do you like real camouflage style stealth with weapons and ammo that come close to real world physics and effects then you should get this game. Don't expect overcharged dance moves and boogie bombs here. OG out!

review: It's really hard to say how I feel about this game.I love this game I love it. I love the concept and when it plays right it is one of the most thrilling and tense games I have ever played. But the key word there is "when it plays right." This game is terribly optimized I don't have the newest fanciest card or a six core processor but with what I do have I should be able to run the game above the lowest settings. Whenever I do the game slows to a grinding halt and turns into a slideshow. Even at very low settings the game struggles to load textures upon dropping in.The loot spawning doesn't feel too bad to me though when I drop into a military base and don't find so much as a handgun when everyone else has assault rifles and shotguns I can't tell if I should be mad at the game or at RN Jesus. I'm not asking for a fully loaded SCAR every game but high value loot areas should be just that. All in all that's really not too big of an issue for me.Another issue with the game is hacking. A lot of people say "Well I haven't seen one so there can't be that many!" Well I didn't run into any until recently. It seems a lot of the time people confuse skill for hacking but it's becoming more an more rampent and it does kill the fun of the game when you and a buddy are in the top 15 only to have a Chinese hacker come through the wall and blow you both up. I want this to be the game we all want it to be. I'm (foolishly) hoping that the devs don't the bed with this. I don't want to see another DayZ. I don't want to see another ARK. I don't want to see another great game lost in Early Access Hell.But whatever despite all that it's E Sports ready amirite?

review: This game is highly addictive and also highly based on RNG. You drop from a plane and parachute to a location of your chosing across the map and even if you pick the same place 20 times in a row you're guarenteed to get different levels of loot each time. Sometimes you'll be stuck with a sickle other times you'll be fully kitted out with an Mini14 and all it's attatchments and personally I like it.As someone who loves just running around and looting stuff in games PUBG is great because 90% of the gameplay is a running/looting simulator until you make it to say the last 20 players of a game which is when the action starts to happen. As far as Battle Royale games go this game is pretty well balanced in terms of loot the zones in which it spawns and the dispersal of air drops the combat itself could use a little work as there are occasional buggy hitboxes and hackers which can't be avoided but all in all its incredibly fun.As someone with a terrible aim I much prefer playing with friends and I like the fact that this game offers not only Solo and Duo gamemodes but also a squad gamemode for up to 4 people. ON TOP OF THAT there's also First Person gamemodes for those who hate their lives and enjoy having limited vision in games.As a game that's still in "early access" lol? It's great. It's being updated constantly and the developers seem to be listening to what their customers want. Also the graphics are pretty which helps.I'd recommend this. I went from playing 2 hours solo and hating it because I suck to playing over 170 hours with friends and rather enjoying it Edit Still good. Still being updated. Fortnite will never surpass this game.

review: Its a well made game. Gameplay is smooth graphics look decent (on high to ultra) and it's decently optimized depending on whether your CPU is up to par. However I did refund the game seeing how I really don't see myself spending too much time with a game like this. You'll end up gathering supplies for many minutes at a time only to pick off a few guys (or even none) and have your progress lossed. Yes I know that it's part of what this game is all about but I can't help but feel like I'm wasting my time on nothing. After a long day I'ld rather hop into a Battlefield server where I can chill and relax and rack up a 10+ killstreak and not have to worry about enemies lurking in the brushes. Summary this game is a good game but it's just not for me. If I was much younger I would have loved to play this game for hours.

review: This game is Do not support the developers.The game is an unoptimized mess it crashes randomly lots of bugs including the world not loading when you land so you get killed while glitching around.The game mechanics are clunky the gunplay is It's also the most frustrating game I've played. There is nothing fun at all with playing for 30 minutes looting and maybe getting some kills only to get headshotted from out of nowhere and never knowing where they were. It's clear that the devs don't care about the game and are only in it for quick cash. I wouldn't be surprised if the game is still just as unfinished at launch but with more cosmetics and micro transactions.I hope my review can convince at least 1 person to not buy this game. It is truly and it will not change. Do not buy it.

The bad news is that the only way to open crates is to purchase keys.Had I known this I would have looked elsewhere for a royale game.It's fun stressful and has some solid gameplay elements but I feel cheated in that I can't unlock anything without spending additional coin. review: I played this game from the beta and over the last year. I loved it and I love the concept really and writing this reallly hurts me. It has grown into a asian cheater game and Bluehole do not want to make actions that fix this for real. The system that sorts people that get thrown into a game by latency is gravely flawed because asians overflow european servers via VPN and that causes technical issues and the ball is rolling with all kinds of issues with latency and lag. The cheating has grown and do grow every day since now the player with the most skills is not being honored but the pllayer with the most divine cheat.. I am not talking about good skilled streamers and such. Look at leaderboards there are known cheaters leading them and Bluehole does nothing about it. They claim to adress these issues with updates but in reality this is not a optimization issue it is a player issue they need to make a system to perform a totalitary region block eveen if it comes to the cost of us not being able to pay with friends in other regions. The game is atm rotten and falling apart and money is controlling what Bluehole is willing to do about the problems. They are an asian company so I doubt they are willing to lock asians away from the european and american servers. Reason is that everyone cheats in asian servers that gives them competition even as a cheater. So being a sucsessfull cheater means getting in to servers where less of the people is cheating. And if they cant get into our servers and get results here they simply abandon the game. That is not what Bluehole wants so they just slip them thru and tells us they try their best to implement systems to adress issues but in reality they just try to optomize the code to run smoother and better with the cheaters still connecting. Well that is of no help I rather play a less optimized game with less cheaters and more people I can actually comunicate with in english at least in a squad. Singeplayer is not even an option anymore. If you want to achieve something at alll you get better results in squad because then 2 3 of the asian cheaters are actually teamed up with you.. So until this game is fixed or dead its not worth anything.
