review: Very addictive last man standing gameplay let down by some long lasting performance issues. Playing with friends is fun and often hillarious. The amount of times I lose an engagement because the framerate tanks as soon as I take fire or try to get the jump on someone is ing rageworthy an issue that has plagued the game since early beta. Granted my machine is running a bit old but this is a complaint I've seen mentioned by people running all manner of rigs from low high end.That said overall optimization was greatly improved at launch which has been great.I've seen many complaints about chinese hackers however I very rarely encounter this phenomenon I play on Japan/Korea and Oceanic servers so unless all these Triads are braving ping to troll american and EU servers exclusively then I'd suggest many of the reports are simply the result of salty players and a missunderstanding of how broken the Death cam is.I'm giving this a Thumbs Up regardless of some ongoing optimization problems and the rare cheater I always find myself jumping into lobby after lobby no matter how frustrating the previous matches may have been the core gamplay is exciting with good shooting mechanics and highly addictive replay value.

review: Giving this a negative review because of the decision to ban 'stream snipers'. While I agree that it is 'bad sportsmanship' to stream snipe I think the blame falls on the player willingly broadcasting their every move to the world. Streamers have the tools to delay their stream and if they choose not to they know as with every game they play that people can use this to their advantage. Not to mention how hard it would be to prove somebody is stream sniping. Also after anouncing no paid for content before release and breaking that promise. I wonder how much development time is going into that rather than completing the game.

review: I cannot recommend this game at its current state. Its extremely laggy buggy and glitchy. Controls feel extremely strange and the maps so large that your hand starts hurting for how long you're holding shift to run. Unless you find a vehicle which are rare and far between. Then to make matters even worse the camera angles make it extremely difficuly to actually land shots or even see someone. And it only gets worse. While people shoot including you the game decides that your smooth 80fps needs to now be 3fps and you die because you can't move. Also there's literally no motive to play the game. Its just go and collect currency from winning (rarely happens) or losing and that currency does absolutely nothing for you. When and if you ever see anyone you will either have an advantage over them or they will have an advantage over you. There's no in between. Most of the time you'll either die trying to find loot from someone who magically found a shotgun in the building you ran into first or you'll get severely gunned down by a random guy with a rifle while all you have is a pistol. Don't buy this game. Wait about a year then buy it. Maybe it'll actually be well built by then. At its current state its about as glitchy and buggy as Ghost Recon Wildlands was during its first closed beta. Shooting moving and aiming just seems awkward and wrong.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a tactical online battle royale game in which up to 100 players get flown across the map and may parachute to any location they wish to in order to loot and to kill the other players in the game with them. As well as fighting other players you must watch out for the circle/barrier keep an eye on the bottom right of the screen (above the minimap). The timer shows the amount of time you have to move inside the white circle before the blue circle comes (the blue circle damages your health) and the exclamation mark indicates that the blue circle has started moving towards you.You can play the game in a duo (two players) or a squad (four players) there are also custom games which filter out certain aspects of the game (e.g. items variety circle time) in order to make the game more fun however you do not get rewards for playing custom games and only PUBG partners can host them.You can purchase crates with the in game currency (BP). The price of these crates double every time you buy one but after every week the price resets back to 700 BP. From these crates you can earn Wanderer or Survivor crates which contain different items of different values some of which can be sold for a lot of money on the Steam Store.PROS Variety You never know what is going to happen every game is different. Fun The extreme rush the game gives you once you get into the top ten is enough to make you replay the game over and over until you get a winner winner chicken dinner. Constant development Cheaters will be terminated very quickly. Worldwide community/servers.CONS The system requirements are very pricey and the recommended system requirements for Medium/High at 60FPS is most likely an i5 7600K/Ryzen 5 1600 paired with a GTX 1060 or RX 480 and over 8GB RAM. Early access There are many bugs as the game hasn't been fully released yet but with the hundreds of thousands of concurrent players bugs get reported and fixed very quickly. CPU Intensive.

review: I honestly don't know what everyone else is talking about. Granted I've only played about 2.5 hours total but I have not experienced any problems with the game. I quickly get into games with less than a minute queue time. I have not experienced any crashes or serious bugs. Game runs smoothly. Graphics look good. I'm not really a big fan of Battle Royale MP. I just don't get it. It's slow and plodding for the most part. You can wait several minutes before running into another person. Your best strategy is to turtle. Find an abandoned house or building with good vantage points and hopefully good loot inside and stay there for as long as possible. I usually get sniped whenever I leave my trusty confines.I just don't find it that fun. Last Man Standing on Counter Strike Global Offensive is more fun than this type of game. Who cares about a circle that keeps getting smaller. Honestly it's not more fun than TDM. At least in my opinion. I understand video games are like ice cream and not everyone likes the same game type. But I prefer quick spawns after death and being involved in continous action.Rate 6/10. I got it for $20 bucks and feel that price was fair for the content (quality &amp quantity).

review: Pros All around fun first person or third person shooter. 100 Players sky dive to a destination of their choosing on a set of two islands. But it isn't as simple as it seems you must master jump times and the way you fly to be the fastest to reach your destination. Chances are at least one person will land near you and the battle is on. I have been beaten down by the troll that follows your every move only to jump and head shot punch you to death. A trait that he had obviously spent time mastering. I myself within the first few days of playing had a game of cat and mouse against a guy with an assault rifle only to prevail with a frying pan. I ran and watched his position and ran back towards him when he wasnt looking I took position around the corner and swung at the air hoping to draw him in. As he reached the corner he saw me and a spray of bullets penetrate my chest and my hp bar hits one tenth as the frying pan pangs across his face. I proceeded to say who's your daddy. In good spirits he just laughs and says I applaud you enjoy the loot. This game has a definite skill gap and even my 9 kill game I fell short with 5th and another game learning you can cook grenades in the worst kind of way expliding my self with a 6 kill third. I am still to win a game but even when I lose I don't seem quite as angry as I do with other games. Which to me says that my thirst for a good game is quenched in other ways. The player base has quickly grown and the game will only get better. The game needs to get better and with that I will give my list of cons.Cons The number one priority at this point is to optimize the game. Even the best systems for gaming can only muster 90 FPS and that hurts for people who spent the extra $$ for the 144hz. The game looks a little ugly if you want to get the best fps possible but with a reshader app which is deemed legal by the company it can bring it to life with more color. Still the need for optimization is high and I wonder if they want to have a finished base product before they go back and alter code if that is how it works. I am not a programmer. The movement system seems almost bad when you first start playing I had trouble clearing small walls using windows for escape or sneak attack. The way to move into a gunfight or move and maintain any semblence of accuracy and even the aiming feels funny at times. This is where I should say this is not really a con does the new vaulting system they plan to implement look awesome. Hell yeah! It is part of the skill gap I mentioned earlier and I have come to get much better and doing all of the movements I could not. I get some FPS drops when the RNG bomb zones happen. Not sure it is anything on my end because I believe I have my graphics and realtek sound drivers up to date. The game is very laggy when you first land and sometimes it can really ruin your game.The grenades in this game a) for the molotovs and the smokes cause small FPS drops and b) the grenades have small area of effect and are often times useless. They are definitely part of the skill gap and part of it I still haven't mastered or even figured out. All around this is a very fun game and a refreshing change of pace from most other shooters.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: MicroTransactions... i don't like them and all they do these days is add the ers.More importantly by the word of the head dev there was not supposed to be microtransactions until after release i think the money bug stug him as if he wasn't making enough money off of the game sales alone.They are trying to justify themselves but "building a healthy source of income" should not come together with "Lying to your community".I understand the Free DLC idea and i accept it but it shouldn't be this way microtransactions should be the last thing you should add there are still a bunch of problems with the game that we are accepting and being kinda pacient because it's an early access and the devs seem to be trying to solve them last patch added a BUNCH of lag and stutter.Look i am not mad by the fact that they added micro transactions in early access nor by the fact that they wanted to add them i am mad because they were added when they said they were not going to add them and most importantly not being completely clear about it they could have added them in the very last stage of the early access but no they add them who knows how many months before release.Aside of that i do enjoy the game not alone but with friends it's a good system they have and a good game they are making they deserve the recognition they are getting it kinda looks like those games that are being made by those devs that enjoy doing what they're doing.I would also love a co op survival not the zombie mode they have but with animals and what not maybe that way we could explore the map more (i like exploration a lot) and enjoy the map the devs created usually what you get to enjoy is what the game tells you and the gun pointing to your head.

review: Welp... worth the PTSD.The last time I played a PC game longer than an hour was a game that rhymed with . That was 3 years ago. I haved owned PUBG for just over a month and just hit 200 hours. Never thought a game with more loses than wins could ever be so much fun. Finally a game that isn't like any other. The "Battle Royal" genre is a game for me that requires attention skill and good timing. All the other gun slinging games get too repetitive and not any real teamwork. PUBG introduces urban strategies that allows you to fight with what you got. Some situtations are good bad and just pure luck. But for the most part you are in control to make the best of it as much as you can.No game is perfect but no game is fun if you can't get off. Hats off to PUBG and wishing for the final product soon. Thank you for restoring my PC gaming edge.

This really affects the gameplay since it will make you lose games because of the most stupid reasons there are. Although it's "fun" because everybody plays it or because you can just join games to mess around with your friends but this title is extremely overrated by far and some of you will not be able to even play this ironically because it's insanely broken (way more than what you see on videos/streams trust me)

review: This game has a tendency to give you extreme lag whether your playing on a QuadCoreSystem or a Potato it is a common problem for games that get popular in a short span of time and and need better servers almost instantaneously some examples for me personally is GTA5online Hitman ForHonor LeagueOfLegends CSGO And a bunch of other games and by a bunch i mean a really big one there has been so many of these Videogame Distribution Companies Valve Uplay Battlenet and others that didint fix their servers right away. With all this taken into account this game has risen in popularity and with all that comes more players and more clients on their servers meaning that sometimes (not always) the game won't run properly. Other than that the game is quite fun the gunplay is satisfying "but some guns need buffs and nerfs such as the crossbow and shotgun". The movement is stiff rigid and takes getting used to but with a few matches in the bag you'll pick up on how to do it. And as far as multiplayer with friends goes it really fun challenging and overall feels like how a Russian game show about random people murdering eachother should feel. 7/10 Tell me your thoughts and opinions.

Totally recommend *(Does not even a $60 pricetag!)* (This game can be buggy their developers mess something up every patch *however they do seem to fix it quickly.* You need a pretty decent PC to play this game and there is definetly some fishy stuff going on with how bans are handed out and how the "monetizaiton" of the game is being done. However the actual gameplay is extremely enjoyable and therefore I fully recommend.)

review: I played PUBG for quite a while now gotten over 40 chicken dinners and have had loads of fun with friends. That being said I do realize that the optimization issues are a problem for most people and that you need a pretty good machine to run it. Otherwise I believe that this game has very intense moments crazy things that can happen. In the overall aspect I do recommend this game because of its intense action fun to play with friends and an experience that is different every time. This game contains Pros Hilarious moments with friends that you can play with and enjoy screwing around Winning after engaging in heavy firefights and scrounging around for loot makes you feel accomplished when you finally win Landing far off shots and leading your targets effectively makes you feel like a real marksman Different plane paths and drop locations so you can have a different experience every time plus randomized zones so you can fight from the hills of Po i to the wheat fields of Yasnaya to the urban combat of Sosnovka Military BaseCons Poor optimization need a decent machine to run it. Will get FPS drops somewhat randomly Community in the beginning lobby is somewhat cancerous (Lots of mic spam and memeing) Added weather effects can screw with your frames completely
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game is lots of fun both in 1st person and 3rd solo and squad and with randoms or friends. Only downside is that about 90% of my region's server (NA) is Chinese players! They don't play on their own servers and they take advantage of the client side lag to kill you before you even saw them.Original review was 11/22/17 update 11/24/18 Game is msotly refined chinese hackers are region locked and the experience is mostly flawless. Only downside is the fact that the devs are focusing too much on adding new outfits crates and emotes instead of adding more gameplay features or modes. The 4x4km map (Sanhok) is nice and allows for faster gameplay but PUBG still hasn't evolved beyond simple battle royale drop in with 99 other players collect loot die or win.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ah PUBG...A game that came out of nowhere taking the dying Battle Royale genre by storm and becoming #1 on Steam.It had it's flaws and bugs when it came out (mainly optimization lag cheaters) sure. But all of that was attributed to it still being in early access and whatnot players had hope of devs eventually polishing the game with bug fixes optimization character models that don't look like NPCs from Oblivion (Great game btw you should play it if you haven't). Back then the game had a charm an aura a SOUL.Now more than a year later we have 3 Maps (1 of them being unplayable garbage with a large map with random clusters of Unreal Engine assets being passed off as buildings terrain and cover and the other 2 being somewhat decent with Erangel remaining a clear favorite among most players) some quality of life improvements have been made but some steps backwards were taken aswell (ie. paid Season Pass with half of the skins not being a permanent item in your inventory).By the time good updates started coming around it was too little and too late most players lost interest and started playing Fortnite.TL DR Dead Game lol
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pubg is my favourite battle royale game on the market. First I should mention that my forst experience with battle royale was around 4 years ago with Playeruknowns battle royale mod for Arma 3. PUBG is a great game alone or with friends. Yes it can be buggy at times and infuriating but it tactile and realistic feel is what makes me enjoy the game rather than its competitor fortnite. With the Fix Pubg campaign that Pubg Corp are running I am hopeful this game can regain its playerbase and be a competitively viable game. Its recent release of Sanhok has demonstrated that the devs know what the players like about the game and the faster paced gameplay makes it hard to go back to the older maps. Overall I would rate the game a 8/10 and will stick with the game throughout its development. Rip
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Worst servers then CSGO hitreg worst the CSGO.Hit reg is client side on this game.Someshit bluehole did and said and did a completly turn and did something else 1. "we wont have microtransaction" later it came 2. We will update once each week later we update once each month now gone to once each 2 months.Even that is alot of stuff that been broken since begining like a UI thats break down to fix this they added a "refresh ui" button. GOOD WORK! 3. Breaks the game remove and add functions that arent usefull removing double binds that dosent do anything.4. The bad communication and none existent post from bluehole start to look like CSGO devs.5. Main menu contains Google Analytics which is the only reason the menu is being loaded from an external source. Without it we would be able to play right now. Also stop spying on your users.ingame menu http //front.battlegroundsgame.com/index.html6. Hit reg that is client side CLIENT SIDE? WTF?So you shoot someone and your client says you hit him. It sends that data to the server and the server compares where the player was on your client to where the server had that player located. If this doesn't match up because you have poor ping that hit doesn't actually go through to the server and the hit won't really count. PUBG has no secondary check on the server side for hit detection. If you hit him on your client and get your packets to the server it just checks off on that and allows it. A big issue here is how there are no trades in the game. If you and an enemy both shoot each other and should kill each other whichever one of you gets your information to the server first wins. After you're downed your bullets no longer do any damage so even if your client also sees that you killed your enemy the server just ignores that information as on the server you're already dead since the enemy got their packets there first. You'd think this means having low latency would just 100% be better but it's not always that simple. If your enemy is lagging their bullets might not even show up on your game before you're shooting at them on your game but by the time their bullets reach the server so that it can relay it to you they've already shot 20 times and you're dead on the server despite never having a chance to see all the bullets they missed before hitting you. Someone could have a high upload speed and get their packets to the server very quickly when shooting you but a very slow download speed and thus they don't see you moving but instead see you standing still despite you actually moving. The hitreg is actually calculated client side in this game.What ever you do stay away from this game right now

review: Game review 9.5/10Highly recommendedPro's Excellent Map Mechanics are good Weapon drop and rarity is great servers are always full (Aus) Not a lot of toxicity Fun factor is all there 10/10 Devs are working hard and pushing out regular updates Quality updates Quality team Not a lot of lag even on cell Reload button in start menu is a life saver great layout of map f%$# all cheatersCon's The majority of cosmetic items i've seen a fair garbage and would prefer some not so great but some tactically great choises one plane to drop fromSuggestions more then one plane to drop from more hardcore skydive physics with maybe birds to miss and just more content on the drop more on the map one or two random events (not just red zone and blue) Animals Quick sand deadly encounters (plane crashes in game) Tsunami on one coastline to 2 squares in (scatters people and items and destroyes vehicles More immersive buildings with some unique areas (gardens shopping mall restaurant but memorable) Sharks Land mines random random crate with cosmetics (accounts bound on pick up) HArdcore ModeAll in all i'm pleased with it as is and would play continuesly when I can. I enjoy the conecpt and the style &amp i'm looking forward to seeing what it becomes in the long run.EDITED To reflect changes. No new negatives many old negatives removed.

review: This game used to be amazing. I'd like to emphasize the line 'used to be' as the game has been a bit of a mess for quite a while. The population has shrunk to a shadow of what it once was and the developers seem to be clueless about what has happened and is happening to their game. I could go into great detail as to what has happened to this once decent game but i will quickly summarise it.*Hackers (specifically the Chinese ones)*Balancing issues (the game was never well balanced but it kept getting worse over time)*Terrible in game monetization*Poor map design (Specifically Miramar)That said if you can find a time machine and travel back to before the Miramar map was launched then you will have a decent/good time.

review: I'm going to keep this as short and sweet as possible.Battlegrounds was a game that sparked up on a lot of YouTube channels I enjoy watching it had great looking intense firefights and overall gameplay so I decided to give it a shot. After playing for about 2 hours I met some guy in a duo matchmake we played together and got to be one of the last teams standing multiple times. After this I yet again met some more people to play with and got a great 3 4 man squad running. We explored most of the whole map and found underground bunkers military installations it really made me realise what a great game battlegrounds is and what it can become. And it's alpha? Get the f*ck out. It's more complete than most games as it is currently.That's the shortest I can keep it. You will not regret buying this game 27? That's worth a goddamn paper round hefty price tag my a**. Plz buy.

review: i get kicked from every single match after about 3 minutes due to a "battle eye error currupted data" and it will not let me rejoin these said matches. theres nothing wrong with battle eye as there are other games i have that use it that have no issues. i have never used mods or cheats of any kind (other then steam mods for games like skyrim and such). and according to forums and google searches this has been a problem since at LEAST april and has no known fix as of yet. devs dont seem to see it as a problem large enough to fix. outside of that there are many other bugs which are to be expected for the most part. but between things like this the constant ads playing during the start of each game and the excessive ACTUAL hackers. this game is NOT worth paying full price for till it is actually fixed properly. at the very least until the devs add the ability to report 1. bugs and crash errors and 2. players on your team for dealing with the annoying ads and fake accounts and similar things. they should focus on the actual game first instead of putting so much effort into making loot crates that cost not only in game points but then also $2.50 just to open. that being said its better then fortnite so....

After clicking the reconnect button between 12 14 times I got in ( Servers are too busy... Try again later ). And I couldn't believe how much worse it got. The framerate was so horrible that my character was literally skipping. I was playing frame to frame... I mean christ.. I play ARMA 3 ( modded ) and ME Shadow of War on this computer. Are you seriously gonna tell me that those games are lighter than PUBG? Nah man.. I'm done. Like I said in the original post. kept coming in so I'm out.

review: Product received for free. (Game was gifted to me by a friend I would probably be more annoyed if I had bought it myself however because the price is pretty high)PUBG has the potential of being a really great game (providing the devs don't run like every other early access game) the game has great gun play gun sounds and solo is the best BR experience I've had. The downside is duos and groups the whole game is brought down by the revive system which is one of the worst implementations of revive in any game I've ever played. My main hope is that it is outright removed because I dislike it that much but if it isn't I have some complaints that should be fixed for me to enjoy duos or groups.1) Headshots don't kill in one hit it's knocks the player out. This can be fixed by simply allowing some guns to kill one hit snipers in general are useless. Let's say there is a team in a house and there is a balcony you see one guy they haven't seen you so they're wide open for a shot you shoot and get a headshot but you down him. What is my plan as the sniper? I can't go into the house I know people are in there and the knocked out player will be getting revived. This system only benefits the team that shouldn't be allowed to have these kinds of mistakes. It allows bad players to cheese death.2) Knocked out players take too many shots to finally kill. It must take at least 5 shots to kill a knocked out player. I fail to understand why a headshot doesn't kill a knocked out player in 1 hit but that's another issue.3) Knocking out players gives me information that I really shouldn't know. If I shoot someone and they die I know they're alone but if they're knocked out they aren't alone.There are other problems with the game that most likely will be fixed this however is a core mechanic so I have fears that this won't be removed and that is a shame because as I said this could be a really great game. For this reason I can't recommend this game unless you only want to play solo.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Just a tip make it playable before you add new things.When it actually is playable the game feels kind of slow but kind of fun in squads at least. RECOIL ON GUNS WITHOUT A GRIP IS BUTT CLENCHING HIGH AND I HAVE TO THROW MY MOUSE ACROSS MY SMALL MOUSEPAD TO SPRAY Absolute rubbish update should've just left the extra grips out. review: This game has created many issues for me I even went as far as rebuilding my PC and restoring OS. I was way past minimum specs and above recommended and sure I could run it High settings and get 60FPS but this game just isn't there in terms of easability to run. Constant crashes that's all I have to say. I'd hop in lobby get into plane and about 5 minutes after looting the game would freeze up and crash to desktop with an error message and yes I've tried every fix out there it's just down to optimization. PLEASE DO NOT BUY IF YOU MEET MINIMUM OR RECCOMENDED SPECS. I only recommend buying if you're absolutely confident you can run it and have a ridiculously expensive rig. This game has caused nothing but trouble which is why I will be refunding it. But it is a wonderful game which I do enjoy aside from the crashing obviously.No I do not recommend this game.

review: A fun game idea that has been poorly executed.Here are my pros and cons starting with cons because they cannot easily be ignored.Cons Absolutely atrocious frame rate for most systems very difficult to maintain 144fps if you want that Horrible movement and physics (has been improved somewhat in the new update but will probably never be great) Rubberbanding on a regular basis Many cheaters/hackers Chinese players on American servers many of them hackersPros + Suspenseful especially if you survive to the end of a match+ Fun to play with 2 or 3 friends (teamwork etc.)+ Somewhat realistic bullet physics (zeroing in with scopes leading targets)My final conclusion is that I wish another developer made this game such as DICE or Rockstar. Their experience with large maps movement vehicle and bullet physics would make this game playable and worth your money. However Blue Hole is a terrible developer and has made millions because they got lucky that people love the Battle Royale game mode. They are slow at improving this "game" that does not run smoothly at all. Year 2017 and games are getting worse instead of better.

review: This is one of the worst things i've ever played in my entire life. Easily one of the worst battle royale games which is saying a lot because the battle royale genre is already just a terrible lackluster genre that should have been a side mode to a base game. this "game" somehow lacks more content than a military shooter set in ww1/ww2 the variety is restricted to 3 maps of course for balancing reasons the only unlockables are cosmetics and ranks the actual incentive to play the game is mostly carved out and resold through a season pass you have to pay for every few weeks when plenty of other free to play games give you daily/weekly challenges completely free on top of that some of the unlocks through that pass are temporary let me make that clear TEMPORARY. so not only are you paying for your own psychological manipulation to make the grind more interesting you don't even get to keep some of the things you earn. oh and this on top of the Valve style loot crates where you have to buy both the crate and the key making things needlessly more complex and confusing for an already scummy system.the game is a buggy unpolished mess that runs very poorly especially when compared to other games that look about the same and run fine and what do the devs do about any of this to try and fix the issues and make the game the best it can be? absolutely nothing actually wait they are doing something they are trying to sue multiple people to sustain a monopoly on the genre so that you only have the one choice if you go to the battle royale genre for your daily dose of waiting in the loading screens and prematching all day long.i can go on for longer but i don't want to waste time just stay as far away from this game and the Battle Royale genre as a whole. i've played many battle royale games to try and understand the appeal and for the most part this genre for me will stay as a thing i only turn on because my so called "friends" couldn't buy anything decent. I absolutely cant wait for the day that this dies off the fact that this is popular is like watching people beg for less content in video games.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I bought this game at launch back in march. I thought the mechanics and the game's approach to a battle royale was much better than H1Z1. I decided to refund it though because of the game's bad optimization(could not even run it with a decent 30 fps on a gtx 1070). But late August I decided to buy the game again and I can truly say that it has evolved into a much more playable and enjoyable experience. It still demands a beasty pc to run properly but once it does.....You just need one more!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game with great potential but Devs have issues with being fair to players who arent popular streamers. Letting them get away with glitches that would get others banned. Also the paid crate system before the game is fully finished shows where their priority lies. There is no reason for them to go about this route. Always breaking the game with recent patches and then never compensating the players because Early Access is an excuse to up a game. Push a game breaking update from PTS to Stable when they knew in PTS it was busted but that Crate system needed to get in.Update to review Game has alot of hackers it seems like lately. I feel like their number of cheaters reported are inflated. Also the servers are very inconsistent and the game itself it largely unpolished. Update 2 since 1.0 game is in a worse state than ever. Hackers are rampant because "Cheating is more accepted in China" and the main focus is really on paid crates and limiting how much people make money on their crate system. Ballistics are crap and anti cheat is the most laughable thing ive seen on a game since WarZ. I am having more fun playing on laggy escape from tarkov and Fortnite than this.Yet there are more people who wanna deny the hacking than people who deny auchwitz. I just dont get where the priorities are for this company. It is about releases on different platforms crates and everything. Where they can make the next dollar. This game shouldn't have come out of early access if they can't handle cheaters. There needs to be a region lock for certain playerbases if they cant be responsible enough to stop the hacking. But then again they don't care. When Uplay is more adept at taking care of hackers you know you are just flat out bad. I notice a common theme when I die and that is it is always a chinese name. Almost never skill (except a couple times where i screwed up) its either laggy players or hackers. Either way they need to go. Other than that the game itself is just horribly optimized and tweaks need to be made to cameras of the players. The newer ballistics system is more random than anything else and has made the game way harder than it should be . This is just making H1Z1 look more and more appealing than anything. Least they know how to handle ping abusers and cheaters. Fortnite a free to play game deals with these issues and has better optimization than PUBG and definately has less money in their budget for the game. It just shows more and more that the main issue with the game is the lack of care the devs have for the community and their game. Steam should see how bad games get sometimes and offer refunds to players who deal with this. Update 3 so still in this state they have improved upon it however the new hacking epidemic is the macro users. The devs upgraded the servers so they run smoothly with less disconnecting but it still seems like hit reg is a nightmare. The way throwables are for frags makes no sense as you still take a lot of damage when you should be out of range. The car physics are still abysmal. Weapon balancing did nothing except make smgs the new mid range weapons and all 5.56 weapons trash. The mini is just awful im better off with a pistol and the circle is stupidly aggressive. It just feels like everything is just something they think of last minute. The game itself is fun because of the setting it has but im just waiting for something of the same setting to come around so i can jump ship from this abortion. Whether it be Rings of Elysium which i recommend more than this because even though the servers are in Thailand they run better than PUBG's servers and all their features make for a smoother enjoyable experience.Update 4 Game still continues to be buggy and just an overall mess with this pass just to make more money on an otherwise pretty inconsistent game. Shots don't land where they should and still just overall becomes a fest. Least they seem to have fixed the blantant hacker issue but the no recoil macro people are just all over the place. Just a sloppy mess with the same issues as ROE for less decent features.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have been really addicted to this game and I will never stop playing it I really like PvP competitive games I was waiting for a standalone Battle Royale game and here it is a lot better than H1Z1. It's not paid to win at the moment I hope it will stay the same crates are openable with in game earned money there is so much more weapons and different type of vehicles which makes it more interesting also the weapon customization is superb for a Battle Royale game. Graphics are really good the only problem is optimization I have to really dip my settings down to suck out all the FPS. Sometimes it doesn't help. I hope they will optimize the game to make it more enjoyable.

review: Despite all the negative reviews this game is still the best battle royale experience on the market today (dec 2018). The netcode is the same or better than of the competitors and most of the major bugs are fixed in the game. Of course there are negatives in the game too like poor loot on some maps or chunky ui or the silly skins to pay and some random little bugs but these are so minor that I personally don't care much cause every game has these too. Worth to mention is that the devs are really trying to listen to the community by making some great updates with corrections. I certainly recommend the game especially when it is on sale for those who like fps and battle royale genre.

review: Product received for free. Why this game was released with the optimization it has is beyond me. You have to have a 1080 to properly run this game its just rediculous. There is this terrible glitch we call...Potato Textures where when you parachute and first land the buildings look like something out of google earths 3D view. It causes your game to stutter like a mother and it takes forever for them to properly render and be able to enter all the while your enemys who have already gotten guns are shooting you and possibly killed you. This is terribly game breaking and needs to be fixed ASAP! Performance aside...it is a very fun game. Its a great game held back by lazy optimization. I do not recommend this game at this stage of development unless you have 1060 atleast! Buyers be warned if you dont have atleast that your not gonna have a good time.

review: Okay so I have been playing this game for quite some time now im a rather patient person and I have been having some serious high hopes that this games developers would actually do something about the hackers they claim to ban people all the time (big whoop buy a new account and continue hacking) 80% of the games I play I get killed by someone through a wall or through trees from a far distance where the shooter never even saw me in the game Ive grown so tired of this problem that I officially regret having ever purchased this game it is finally uninstalled I do NOT advise this game to anyone that hates hackers.Then let me start on the optimization of this game I have upgraded my pc to run this game at 100+ FPS since then they have some minor optimizing but what they constantly ignore is all the bugs ingame like getting stuck on a wall while trying to land after parachuting or the insane amount of times I was riding a bike launch over a wall then randomly explode while not having taking any vehicle damage or let me not get started on the amount of times that I have gotten stuck in walls or fences you end up floating inside a wall or a fence just because you jumped up against it then you naturally need your mates to come knock you down in hopes that you will fall out of the wall (sometimes this works sometimes...) and then ofcourse the latest changes to the weapons which has completely ruined the balance of the game UMP's and Vectors are now the strongest weapons in the game purely because they have next to NO recoil what so ever so forget using your assault rifles pick up those tiny little SMG's and go wreck anyone that has not managed to adjust from the assault rifles.Long story short I dont advise this game to anyone that expects good development or even if you are expecting some sort of realism to the game there is absolutely nothing realistic about this game I cannot count the amount of times that I have heard jokes about this terrible optimization and the so called physics of the game.my verdict started off promosing ending up a terribly crap game thats filled with hackers on all servers absolute waste of time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Everyone's in an uproar over microtransactions when they literally have no impact on the game itself. What you wear has very minimal impact on the game itself and you can rock all black t shirt and pants and be totally fine. So everyone is in an uproar over items going to charity. While they just added 2 new sets of cosmetics for free.About the actual game It's fun and at first really hard. This is my first battle royale style game and it took me almost 80 hours before i got my first win. But once you get good man every game is fun. Sure every once in a while you'll land somewhere with someone else get unlucky with loot and die. But then you start up again and maybe the next game you get 10 kills or a win or headshot someone 500 meters away or all three. I've never had a game other than League of Legends with this much replayability without getting bored. And I'll support this game through almost anything because for half the price of a AAA game I'm getting 10x more enjoyment out of it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So after playing this game during its Early Access stage I had a few problems with PUBG Horrible optimization.On low to medium settings I was still getting FPS dips well below 40 on I5 6600k 4.2GHz + GTX1070. And I play at 1080p no AA. My machine can handle ARK on high settings and yet it was suffering every time it had to render a few houses in a field.High lag.The latency (ping) is difficult to fix but that is not my issue. Even with 40ms ping I'm still getting rubber banded every game even when there are only 40 players. Doors don't always react to your input and you're never sure if you picked up that weapon.Low responsiveness.This could be subjective but I need some form of indication that my input does something the moment I press a button. I don't want to wait 6 8 frames for character to start moving. When I shoot and hit a target I want to know I hit that target. More importantly if I missed tell me how I missed I had a few close quarter encounters where I was definetely shooting at someone's face for the game to not register the hit.While the optimization got a lot better (I can run it on Ultra witout AA and get stable 70+ fps) the other problems didn't. I can't say if it's the best Battle Royale out there but I definetely have a different favorite from PUBG which I still find unpleasant to play moment to moment.If you like your game to run smooth as the new DOOM and actually respond to your input instantly I'm afraid PUBG 1.0 still is not that.Oh and there are microtransactions.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Blackout comes out tonight so cya pubg. The desync is aids. Brenden Green thinks the game should be played out as some long slow progression to one final crescendo of a gun fight. Where all that does is forces you to waste 20 30 minutes of your life before you get one shotted in the back of head by some guy hiding in a a bush. Cheaters run rampant in this game. The production of the game has just been miss managed since day one. The only do there updates and server down times during peak hours And I just can't handle it anymore.

review: Product received for free. The Ultimate Life &amp Death Experience AND YOU MUST EAT CHICKEN AFTER EVERY WIN! XD.Pros Huge Map.Play alone or with squad.Scavenge for items weapons etc.Once everyone dies and the last other player alive both of you stay inside a small play area and your skills required to win.Not P2W or going to be.Raised over $100M in 13 Weeks. Thats fantastic.Price ($29.99) It's not the best price but it's OK.Based on a Japanese Movie "BATTLE ROYALE".Name of Map "Earangel" (Sorry if it's wrong) is the name of Brendan Greene aka PLAYERUNKNOWN's daughter.Cons Not perfectly optimized but playable on most PCs best to play on very low/low/medium don't push the settings to the maxNot recommended for Low End PCsSize is 30GB it's not the greatest but it's OK.Is it worth to buy? Yes if you have Mid to High End PC to get good frames Good connection required No if you have bad PC. So I'd say it's worth it just for fun and it gets updated and has Zombie Mode so it's getting better and more fun!Don't tell me you're jealous because I got the game for free lmao

review: Its fun. Its a fun Battle Royale game and I even enjoy it over fortnite but... The game sucks! In every other aspect. It has frame drops every.... literal 2 5 seconds with a 1070 ftw. Its stupid stupid STUPID "GLOBAL INVITATIONAL" is advertised absolutly everywhere! Microtransactions that make me want to end it all and worst of all... the devs don't give a crap and arn't going to get rid of them. They're not going to fix their game their not going to get rid of micro's they're just going to keep adding buggy frame dropping maps and add more skins then call it a day. NOW I did make $30 off this game from selling crates alone BUT if you're not committed for more than 100 hours on this game to pay your regret off DON'T BUY IT! I REPEAT DON'T BUY IT! PLEASE! IM BEGGING YOU!!! I'M TRYING TO SAVE YOU $30 THAT YOU COULD USE FOR ANYTHING ELSE! AAAAAANNNNNNNYYYYYTTTTTHHHHHIIIIIINNNNNNGGGGG!!! RUN! RUN AWAY FROM THIS GAME AS FAST AS POSSIBLE!! GO! PLEASE!! RUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUNN!!!!!

Man oh man.EDIT 20/12/2017Game runs like a charm now on the test servers love the vaulting system and the new map. Also obviously PUBG still has it's problems (mainly technical) but for 30 bucks those first 100 hours 'honeymoon phase' was AMAZING and of the best value I ever had. It deliverd so many one of kind tense &amp thrilling &amp sometimes even funny moments I don't think I've spend my money better anywhere for a long time. With friends and good co operation shows the game on it's best.

review: Product received for free. To begin with I'm not really a fan of the battle royal genre I find the games mundane. However this game takes the medal for being the most uninteresting and mundane of the masses.It controls like I'm playing Eurotruck Simulator but I have a human character model. There is never a stable connection even on the best of networks it jitters around and can't seem to figure out where to place my character which is just the tip of the problem while I'm looking in my rear view mirror backing my character up and trying to make a right turn around a bend.I'll try to wrap this rant up though the maps are bland open wastelands that just seem to stretch on forever and require a vehicle to pass through them faster because otherwise you are tasked with running around for 15 minutes in a dead and useless landscape just to reach another beige ish shack with 2 stairs up to the top for some sort of items to collect.The character creation although customizable just feels like I'm dressing a manikin not to mention the difficulty in changin the character once it's locked in.I'm not even going to touch on the stupid mistakes the company is making right now either with poorly designed event passes that are shorter and less rewarding than the competition.This is just generally a pathetic bland and uninspired game.

review: I've played a TON of this game over 500 hours and have so badly wanted this game to be good. I had faith that in time Bluehole/PUBG Corp would actually give back to the players that made their game so popular by doing their absolute best to fix the immense performance and hacking issues that have plagued this game from the beginning.Bluehole/PUBG Corp has made it apparent that they have no interest in fixing their optimization problems despite their newly acquired wealth. They've been unable to admit that they just do not have the skill or talent to create maintain and improve a hugely popular PC game. Instead they've put all their effort in releasing paid lootboxes and cosmetics and have repeatedly failed to address community concerns or feedback and performance issues.Stay away from this game. It will only leave you frustrated and regretful that you spent the money on it.

review: The concept is pretty fun. Execution is terrible. As it stands I just can't recommend it. I know it's early access but I'm really really sick of the lag and the RNG that goes into this game. Literal weeks of terrible loot and bad luck whenever I land in a town. Not to mention the gunplay can be really really terrible sometimes. Full shotgun blasts to someone right next to you can either completely miss or do t damage. The WORST part is the lag though. The network connections to this game are really ing terrible. I'm tired of seeing someone going back into cover and still dying. Up to half a second after I hid.Game development is actually getting worse. Instead of focusing on frustrating aspects (lack of torque in vehicles which basically makes you a sitting duck if you stop on a hill ing autoplacement into terrible region servers everytime you start the game etc) they're placing useless garbage into the game like weather effects and more guns. SERIOUSLY frustrating.It has been MONTHS and we STILL cannot actually cancel an attempted join to a match. Even if you quit and reload your game you'll still be placed in the server you queued for more likely than not. &gt Land in a named town&gt Find just a pistol&gt Get run down by a dude with a SCAR L &gt Die&gt Land in another named town&gt Find nothing&gt Get run up on by a dude with a UMP&gt Die&gt Land in a named town&gt Find fantastic loot (scar kar98)&gt Circle spawns on other side of map&gt Find no vehicle&gt Run to circle&gt Immedeatly get domed by a sniper who just happened to be waiting there&gt Land in middle of no where&gt Find OK loot&gt Circle spawns on other side of map again&gt Spend entire game trying to make it to the circle&gt Get down to last 10 people&gt Die to someone with a groza
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After many mixed feelings throughout playing this game and much deliberation in the hopes that this game gets better I can't put this off any longer. It wasn't the lack of fixing for the plethora of issues nor was it the fact that the devs never listen to the community. Now you don't even get points for winning. This game is always has been and always will be filled with bugs because fixing issues is not the concern of the devs. Despite all the issues the most inexcusable bug comes from the one reason most play the game. Winning. I played 3 games of the 1.0 update and in the first realized not a single issue of importance had been fixed. On my third game I won and screencapped as I always do for proof. I won 995 points killing the final player as I rejoice to myself. As I load back to the main screen...I am hit with a horrowing realization that this game has managed to get even worse. I only have 860bp which is what I had last. Not a single point from my win transfered over making that entire trial that grind worth nothing.Chances are I'm not the only one this has happened to and I doubt I'll be the last. Considering that Bp in this game actually is worth money since you can buy crates I wasted time and money because the developers care so little about their players. Having to spam F or drag items into your inventory for a solid minute while everyone else gets guns to kill you as you struggle to perform a basic function is one thing just like how sometimes you actually just die because the door closes on you. Those glitches happen and we're used to them.Getting completely and utterly slapped in the face by a company that cares none for its players by making the one accomplishment achievable worthless even if only on a small percentage chance is far from acceptable. This was just one of many flaws in this game but it was the final straw that made me leave a negative review. The current standing for reviews on this game rests at mixed and I truly hope it hits negative for a wakeup call. I'll go over some of the more base issues that rest in this game. Horrible item spawn patterns (You often find 3 4x scopes in the same room and none anywhere else) Horrible shooting mechanics (Even with a stable connection you can shoot a non moving target at point blank and the bullet will miss) Horrible starting lag (The most crucial part for most matches is the start in which you will spend a full minute trying to pick up one gun and a single box of ammo) Horrible driving mechanics (Do you like flipping 3 times when you hit a rock? This game is for you.) Horrible BP distribution (Pretty sure they lowered the rate it's giving for 1.0 ) Horrible reward for winning considering you might get nothing at all for it There are other things here and there you could gripe about but these are the biggest and most relevant. I truly wish I could refund this game because of this update it has become even more broken than it once was. I have a lot of hours in this game and I don't want them back but considering the game has become unplayable now I would like my money back. I enjoyed the game despite how bad it is at its core but now I can't even enjoy it to the slightest since my one incentive is gone. Fix the game (Which they won't) or hopefully get the Negative review standpoint on steam that you deserve.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is easily the most over hyped and over rated release that I can think of in recent years.The game is wholly unoriginal it is truly the bear bones of battle royale with nothing extra to give or different to show.It looks like crap and plays like crap which are not a typical combination.A good chunk of the assets are stock and textures are frequently blurred or just low resolution which makes the preformance even more infuriating. The server lag is also unbearable sometimes probably just due to an awful netcode.The game just screams early access which it is and that's okay but what's not okay is trying to sell loot boxes and keys in an unfinished early access game. I have played the game for as long as I could bear these things including in solos duos and groups and honestly it's mostly just a waste of time and a great way to lose up to hundreds of hours with nothing to show for it except for a couple screen shots.If you want a battle royale game just go play fortnite it runs great looks great plays better and it's free. Not to mention that there's a whole base game to play if you like the battle royale.Don't buy into the hype it's just not worth it.P.S No my computer isn't bad and no I don't need to "get good".

review: This is the first review I've ever written and after 60 plus hours of play time I guess it's time that I give my opinion. This is one of the first video game for any type console that I have actually played or purchased over the past 15 years and it was a great choice in my opinion. At times I have had issues with the game locking up or freezing but these issues have gotten much better during the past few weeks. You definitely need to invest in some quality head phones to play this game and hopefully they will be able to get the audio/sound issues corrected very soon. At times I've had to stop playing due to getting headaches from all the loud effects and gun shots you hear during game play and the audio/sound issues would have to be my biggest complaint with the game. You definitely have to listen out for your opponents in this game or your game will end very soon. I have made numerous attempts to adjust the game audio and sound on my computer but I can t seem to get it right. I've read and heard several other players complaining about this same issue and we are all hoping this fix is on the agenda and soon!! The only other issue or complaint I have with this game is the lack of a training area where new players could learn the basic game functions and allow the player to get familiar with the weapons. I know that continued game play will help in achieving this but it can suck having to restart over time and time again and in many cases you still didn t get the opportunity to obtain any experience before your killed again. LOL. I actually have a few friends who have stopped playing the game because of this very issue but I refuse to give up and plan on conquering PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds one day. If you have not played this game yet you are definitely missing out!! I definitely recommend in adding this game to your collection!!

review: I played this game on my phone after being hardcore fortnite for a few months. It really was a better experience at first so I bought the PC edition but there are definitely more cons than pros. For instance the game simply does NOT run smooth. Even with an 850m GEFORCE GTX graphics card I can only play this game on VERY LOW graphics and still only maintain 30 40 fps. On top of the constant crashes and loading screens you get stuck at. Another thing this game costs $30 off steam correct? You earn currensy in the game by playing rounds earning more currensy the better you do. The only thing you can spend this currensy on (other than changing your character appearance for a ridiculous amount) is to buy loot crates that contain clothing items. Fun right? Wrong! These crates then require you to BUY A KEY WITH REAL MONEY. EACH KEY COSTS $2.50. SO YOU PLAY THE GAME TO EARN CREDITS TO GET CRATES TO SPEND MORE REAL MONEY JUST TOP OPEN THE CRATES YOU BOUGHT WITH YOUR IN GAME CURRENSY. So I spent $30 on a game that is at BEST mediocre compared to other battle royales and the only way to open my 10 crates is to spend $25 real life dollars. Absolutely ridiculous in my opinion. After a few chicken dinners and countless game crashes/ruined games because of peoples play styles (camping in the corners of three story houses not making a single footstep while peaking at the staircase in third person) my friends and I have made the switch to Ring of Elysium. Ring of Elysium is currently only available in Thailand but you can find videos on how to download it in the States (Where I am). Pubg is a disgrace and it on its own customer base. This game has so many issues I guarentee it's not worth buying. Get Ring of Elysium or fortnite for free even if the graphics are not as great the games simply run SO much smoother and do not try to rob your wallet even after making 10 times their projected sales.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Before I get roasted hardcore from all the haters and PubG fanboys/fangirls/fangenders... I want to say that the devs were on the right track. If done right in the future this game can reach a status so legendary that it can possibly top all the MMO's currently out such as World of Warcraft GTA V Rainbow 6 Siege and more!You can disagree all you want but this is true if done correctly. Now to why I downvote this game.In its' current state there are numerous issues that make this game difficult stressful and nearly impossible to play. I will be putting them in list format and explain a few. Hackers/Exploiters/Glitchers Asian/Europeans filling NA servers (possibly vice versa. Haven't tested nor confirmed.) General Loot Spawn Movement/Controls Weapon statistics (Damage range abilities fire rate recoil etc.) Hit Registration/High Pingers High Ping Servers/Matches Vehicle Stability/Vehicles in General Useful Player Options (Map Selection matches based on rank/skill)So the ones I want to cover are these Hackers/Exploiters/Glitchers. Asian/Europeans filling NA Servers. Hit Registration/Unstable Servers &amp Matches. Player Movement.1.) Hackers are a major issue. Within a time span of 4 hours my crew and I managed to run into 3 confirmed hackers and possibly another 15 more unconfirmed but were suspicious. Thing is there's nothing we can do about it! All we get is a death cam and a report button for a dude locking onto heads without the need to ADS with a P19C and over 200 rounds. Rainbow 6 Siege has a lovely Ban feed which allows players to know that their software actually works but PubG offers no confirmation on any bans made to hackers/possible hackers. (Let's say general cheaters.) which honestly sucks! I'll never know if ButtLicker69xXFazeXx got banned or not. This needs to be fixed ASAP!!!2.) Aahh.. Asians on US Servers. Not a very rare sight to see as it happens to all games! World of Warcraft Rainbow 6 Siege DayZ World of Tanks etc. But in this case it is consistent well known and what's worse is that nothing is being done about it. For the 30+ hours I have played I can say with as much disgust possible that I have never been in a stable PubG match (solo or otherwise perspective as well) with no Asians or Europeans. Never. Meaning you have players with 500+ ping bolting around you like Dash from the Incredibles and you're just sitting there trying to hit something that already lit you up 20 times over. Terrible I say!3.) This coincides with #2. Going straight to the point you can lock onto someone's head (legitimately no hacks) with a Kar98k. Sitting on a radio tower with an 8x scope cheek pad and compensator and fire away! Oh what's that? You are clearly shooting at a stationary target's head and chest but bullets seem to go through them? OH WAIT! You shot someone in the head point black with the new Sawed Off but he can still stand and unload an M249 into you and heal as if nothing happened? Hit Registration is absolutely garbage and sparratic random. Along with the unstable high ping servers bonded with the already 500+ ping Asians on US servers and you have yourself an impossible target. 4.) Movement is extremely janky. First Person is all I play and when I turn it feel as if I am attempting to turn a Semi Truck with no power steering (Yes I have driven large automobiles such as Semi Trucks with no power steering. Not fun.) Movement is awkward which included proning crouching and recovering from them. Jumping swiming driving parachuting the new vaulting... It's extremely bad.I am not going to offer solutions as I am in no position to do so due to many reasons including little to no knowledge in game developement. But what I do know is that games can come a long way and as players WE made your game know. WE play your game. WE bought your game. You owe us an enjoyable experience and as players WE depend on YOU Game Devs to give us that experience we were promised.Also game uninstalled from my library due to a possible art copyrights?! So I have to sit through a long install once more because someone forgot to credit someone??? Absolutely disgusting... For those that want to buy this game buy it at your own risk and willingly. It's broken it's unenjoyable but if you wanna give this game a chance then more power to ya!

review: Notice how most of the negative reviewers have 100 1000 hours played. The game is fun and well worth playing. Cheating is not as rampant as the negative reviews might make you think. Particularly since the addition of the death cam it's now easier than ever to find and report cheaters.I can mention only few games that can provide as much value as PUBG. It's 30 and I've clocked over 400 hours and I'm not done yet. The game is being updated continuously and each update is typically an improvement. I doubt I can find any game wherein the haters have clocked as many hours as PUBG. But I get how it can be frustrating to lose a round because of a glitch or a bug or cheater (which is a rare occurrence) but those are present in all competitive games. So if you're on the fence about getting PUBG don't be. It's without a doubt the best battle royale game on the market today.

review: Oh PUBG how do I explain what makes this game both great and yet at the same time a total ing dumpster fire? TLDR 10/10 would play Potato Simulator again. If the game gets optimized and they fix the server issues / hacking then I would definitely recommend it. While yes I do greatly enjoy the game there are times its made me want to (literally not metophorically) punt a small child into a volcano. Just a few examples for all of you who are wondering about getting it.Pros There are some awesome moments out there that make you want to come back for more. Nothing is more satisfying then cooking yourself up a DELICIOUS chicken dinner. This is especially true because unless by some stroke of luck you get one early on (or you are just really good) you could concievably not see a dinner until you are 50 hours in. Now as many people have stated this game is exponentially better with friends. I've come to notice getting Solo wins is much much harder. Both because its you vs 99 other people with no help from anyone and because chances are you will get mulched or turned into pudding without knowing what happened. Duo and Squad offer great communication enjoyable gun fights (more on this later) and some absolutely hilarious moments. I told a guy who's team I just killed he could join us only until we stopped and he was left to rot in the middle of the desert. In game chat can be a gold mine at times and a total nuclear wasteland at others.Cons Prepare you because its about to get ruined. The one take away from all these reviews is this game runs like steaming garbage... It's basically like someone with two broken legs trying to crawl to the hospital. While yes some mechanics are cool they are horribly unoptamized and some are flat out broken. You could hit one of the VW busses with a bike and send your target into the next dimension. Thats just one example of the thousands of game breaking bugs that occur almost every game. Hackers hackers hackers. Player Unknown's Battlegrounds huh I could have swarn I bought Hacking Simulator 2017. At one point it wasn't that bad maybe 1 in 10 matches. Then for some entirely unjustified reason Bluehole / PUBG Corp decided to let in the Chinese. (It wasn't the letting China in that was a problem. IT was the way it was done and how it worked out) Now about every other game you have a pretty high probability of running into a hacker. Hope you like getting aimbotted bud.Gun play basically is a shot in the dark. Its both satisfying but underneath you realize it can be totally ed. Zeroing is absolutely insane and good luck adjusting perfectly to hit someone 400 plus meters out. If they aren't standing still you might as well be out the car window into your own face. Bullet damage is broken shotguns are still disgusting. Basically unless you really follow up on your shots and dump a decent amount of ammo into someone chances are you will underestimate how many bullets you need to down someone. Even then the bullet damage can just not register and you're still screwed.Finally the damn loot boxes in EA. First off don't sell loot boxes that contain items that in reality DO HELP YOU HIDE. Also for some reason streamers have items we can't have? Thats not even that bad but to claim that the trench coats don't help hide you is ludacris. BUT FINE we accept it. Then you go and lie and say there wont be payed loot boxes in EA. outta here. Take Away I would love to recommend this game. I really would I just cant. Unless you have a pretty decent rig a literal ing endless amount of patience. You will get angry and it'll be often. OR you are a masachist. Ultimately this game has tons of potential but is severly handicapped by the devs and frankly their absolute lack of common sense. Chances are PUBG will go the way of the dinosaurs if they don't get it together.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is so fun and frustrating at the same time. Learn the maps learn your pros and cons learn every weapon and be aggressive and most importantly have fun. I definately recommend this game to the players who are into FPS games for a while. review: Best asset flip of 2017.PUBG has a neat concept. It's not an original concept as they'd like to claim since they stole the idea from H1Z1 but the high stakes matches are fun. The problem is that in the end it alwyas comes down to who has the better sniper rifle.Net code and hit detection is terrible as servers run at an inconsistently low update rate (about half that of Fortnite's which itself is a very casual game). Melee weapons simply don't work. Parachuting frequently bugs out and throws you off buildings.Visually the game belongs in 2011. Crysis had better graphics than this and ran better and that was 11 years ago. It doesn't help that the art style is inconsistent and bland with no real identity not helped by their overuse of store assets (almost all the default weapons are from asset packs)I recently got caught in the 16th June ban wave which was 'hastily' reversed. And by hastily I mean it took them 15 hours. No real apology or explanation was forthcoming and I only got a stock response from their support team written in broken English.Bluehole are a terrible development company and no one should be supporting them by buying this game it's loot boxes or cosmetics. Their attitude to microtransactions hackers and suing other companies making better games than them is dispicable. Let it die.

review: With each of the last few updates the netcode has seriously suffered leading to major desync even at 60ms ping. I can't play this game with such a disadvantage to those in the east states that play near the server and have much lower pings... ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS considering how much MONEY this game MADE!!Please Please Please! Design a system that matchmakes/connects people up to others who will have the same or roughly equal pings as everyone else in the match so we all have the same gamble chance. Not this absolute rubbish replicating the capitalism in America!!

review: Began playing competitive FPS on M/KB over past 6 months. Stumbled upon this through friends . . . Best solo strategy skill game I've ever played. Duos and Squads are a blast too if you can find teammates able to concentrate and focus. The most unforgiving difficult yet rewarding experience to get that "Chicken Dinner". For this style of game its the best I've ever played in my 40 + years of playing video games.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: What a great breeze of fresh air this game is.I will admit that i am not overly fond of FPS games unless its Battlefield or Fallout.However i thought the idea they had for this game was interesting so i decided to get it and try it.And i was not dissapointed.Looking past some obvious flaws movement in the start flipping cars for no reason. small things that may annoy you from time to time but overall its not that big of a problem.then this game is by far the most fun i have had in 2 years.I like the suspense when you get past the first minute of grinding a gun from a room. the exhilirating feeling you get when you find a 8x scope and you already have a sniper rifle.That ecstazy feeling i got when i managed to loot a dropcrate and get myself a ghissle sniper dress.This game is highly addictive. it offers a new feeling of suspense into the game. you might be hurt and walk towards a house. is it empty ? is someone watching you from afar ?It has a system that closes the island in a smaller and smaller circle so one game will last 40 mins tops i think it is.It offers machine guns. pistols. sniperrifles. silencers. crowbars and machetes.Whatever your ideal weapon for killing is its likely PUBG has it.If you enjoy actually getting that tingling feeling back. or that scare when you play.Then this game is what you are looking for!

review: This game is like H1Z1 king of the kill but it feels smoother and the animations are better to.Two things i really missed from H1 that this game has is a stage where you're not dead but "knocked out" and can be revived if you have a teammate to help you.There is also a spectator mode when you're dead so that you can watch your teammates instead of just waiting/disconecting.I think this game is good not just because its fun but because now H1Z1 will get some competition so they are gonna try to work harder at the game if they want to keep their playerbase.Overall i'd say this game is much better than H1Z1 and im going to give it an 8/10 rating since it's still not very polished and has optimisation issues.Edit Updates have made the game smoother but it could still use some fine tuning to reach it's full potencial overall a really great game now that the 2nd map was added and i would strongly recomend it.

review: Its a waist of money. Its an crazy cool idea. Hunger games meets old school counter strike. Sadly the execution is poor. Bullets and hit box consistency issues and bugs. Also kind of a deal where its the best camper wins. The mechanics they built in to stop camping and move people together just favor those sitting in the right spot. You can get in to the top 10 every time if you just grab an 'ok' gun then drive to the center and hide in a bush shooting people running back 'in bounds'. No skill required. The last 10 is all luck depending on how they shrink the zone and where you happen to be sitting. The guns handle like poop. The random spawns are cool and all and I guess equal opertninty but there is nothing like landing checking 3 houses and having no guns only to have someone find you who has 3 guns and shoots you down. Not much fun there. Most matches are insanely slow and boring and end with someone hitting you one or two times before you can pick them out if you are moving. Or they are long and slow while you camp waiting for someone to walk by.. Boring.. . Basically its a game of who sees who first. Do NOT spend money on this trash. OMG SOOO TIRED OF RUNNING from the blue line!!!! EVERY TIME I GET IN A GOOD SHOOT OUT THE BLUE LINE COMES IN TO TAKE AWAY THE FUN.

review: update game still trash again no region lock and hackers are still destroying this game i really wish i could refund this garbage. do not fall for hype kids this game will go no where cause the devs already made their money and have no interest in making this an enjoyable gameand trust me that one good match you have will be thwarted by 50 bad ones following. i land on the ground fin the best weapons and armor to die with one hit. but when its the other way around i have to empty magazines of amunition to kill someone and i check my replays i am hitting my shots but my rounds are basically blanks compaired to anyone elses. sad to see such potential be ruined by a dev team of suckers.update game still trash no region lock hackers still just as bad. game is still broken garbage. wanna get a refund because this game is starting to me off and i think of all the fun i had verses all the times i die to some piece of sh!t hacker or cuck from china with a ping of 300+ who i shot over a dozen kills me with one hit. like i can go on but this game i really do not recomend.udate still garbage servers are garbage the comunity still has allot of hackers and mechanics still Need region locked servers to keep the asian of fna servers they are 99% of all the hackers i have encountered.Do not recommend buying this game development is too slow and the things they are working on are not as important as its current big issue and that is hackers like allot of them. I would say 1 out of every 5 matches will have a chinese hacker in it and you will die from a head shot from almost a kilometer away. Also desync is bad and performance although improved is still The game is allot of fun but i will not recomend until there is a better anti cheat system. i recorded several vids of getting wrecked by hackers at end game (sometimes whole squads of hackers) and it takes months for the admins to do anything about it but will eventually get done still doesnt change that there are thousands of hackers. another point is they should offer a region locked servers that also auto kick high pings

review: At the time of writing I can't say that I can recommend this game to anyone. While it has it's enjoyable moments there are a number of major flaws which just ruin the experience entirely. Unreliable weapon damage bizarre recoil lying grenade assistance the bloody circle of doom which you spend 90% of your time running from shotgun buckshot which once it meets an obsticle stops the rest of the pellets. The list goes on.I can see the potential in this game and I really do want it to become something I can enjoy but at this stage of development it's beginning to look like a simple cash grab. You can see the difference between a product which is being polished and a product which is being dragged along and this product has most certainly become the latter. The stories of "stream snipers" being banned is a comical and childish act by the devs. Streamers aren't going to bring in a solid playerbase Making a good game will.

review: My personal experience in all honesty these people saying they are getting banned by streamers are tting you 1.(SKIP THIS IF YOU DONT CARE ABOUT STREAMERS) Streamers played this game for 10 hours never even got banned or reported by a streamer. You know why? because i dont stream snipe people. all these kids trying to act innocent are full of i would bet money that theyve won countless games just waiting for streamers to queue up and ghosting them the entire match just to get top 10. its actually sad how as soon as they get reported for their t they come here to the reviews to "REEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE"2. The gameplay is adrenaline pumping every decision feels like it counts and the punishment for dying actually matters unlik most modern shooters.3. Advice Turn off voice chat completely all people do is abuse the game's unbalanced audio mixing and scream like in the pre game lobby and inside the plane. Play with friends the fun is damn near endless with friends while playing alone i can usually only handle about 2 4 matches depending on how well i'm performing.4. While the game definitely isnt bad it is starting to get to that point where it is overhyped. if you arent a fan of the battle royale genre dont feel pressured into buying it. It is definitely the best battle royale game but that doesnt make it the best game period.My rating based on personal experience mixed with some objective factors.8.15/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The developers only seem to care about making updates that make them money. There are so many common sense issues that need to be addressed and they're ignored in favor of premium content and ingame ads. This game had well it still has a lot of promise but I no longer have faith in the devs to bring it to its full potential. Hopefully this game will make the battle royale style more popular so better games will be made down the line. As is definitely not worth the money.

review: *UPDATE 10/25/17*Updating my review to add another reason to not recommend the game Terrible anti hack. Third Person Solo is unplayable at the moment especially during late hours. 70 people dead before the first circle closes 80% from the same person. Aimbot from across the map ESP locating items anywhere on the map not to mention you can disable grass rocks even trees from appearing simply by editing your ini files. Sloppy shameful coding. Wait until Blueballs gets their ing act together.No I can't recommend it while they push features over optimizations. The fog patch pushed it over the edge for me because it forced post processing on lowering framerates across the board from low end potatoes to supercomputers by about 20FPS. All so they could have their Silent Hill map that nobody in my playgroup enjoys anyways. Not like my review ing matters everybody's already bought the game anyways. I just hope my voice means something to someone.
